Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: Oliver H
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the W Barcelona a few times, and every time it doesn’t fail to impress me. Everything about this hotel is excellent. The rooms, the view, the service, the staff, the gym, the bar, and the restaurants. The only minor negative is the fact the hotel is not really near anything. You are on the far end of the beach, so going to town in the evening requires a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “the place to be”
Reviews.Author: Lilietcie
Reviews.Content: The first thing you notice is the buzz of people in the lobby. Arrivals/departures, guest requests, yet everything is under control and service is very efficient. Rooms are very comfortable and well equipped (particularly with alcohol - enough to knock you out for a couple of days). Views from the rooms are spectacular, thanks to floor to ceiling windows, although you might feel you are on view to the world, this is not the case during the day due to the tinted glass, but the lower floors are visible at night if the room is lit. The room was clean, but there were a couple of details that could be improved - a stray cloth left on a table and pistachio nut shells under the bed. A special word for the bar on the 26th floor which hosted an Easter party during our stay. Great cocktails, wonderful atmosphere (people were queuing in the lobby for quite some time) and the light food menu we sampled was quite delicious and great value for money. Breakfast was a little disappointing, the simple black coffee ordered arrived decaffinated with milk for some strange reason and getting a refill was a little arduous. Hot food required paying a supplement. However, at check-out when we indicated the cleaning problem, the breakfast was offered as a compensation gesture. Although a little too cold to sample the outdoor pool in April, the terrasse and loungers are a great way to laze through the day: good ambiance music, service is faultless and from time to time staff come around with extras (glasses of water, ice-creams...) - a nice touch. Definitely a destination for those who like to be where there is life and lots of it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful signature W hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sheri D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to start an anniversary trip and loved the area. Barcelona is an awesome city, but this hotel is just serene. The location is a little bit far away from everything, but the hotel sits by a great beach. The rooms are sleek, beautiful and modern. The restaurants are pricy but the service is excellent. Well done to the designers and the management at the W.

Reviews.Title: “The W Hotel of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Harold M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Barcelona's W franchise in early March. In a city of impressive architecture, this structure's sail-like shape stands out from almost any vantage point in the city. The room was spacious and hip-modern, if a little emtionally cool. The staff as well was young, well mannered and emotionally cool. Upon returning to the lobby one evening after a long day of sight seeing, we approached the elevators, which were being attended to by an attractive young lady. She mistakenly thought we were interested in taking a lift to the nightclub, some several floors aloft and told us that we could not go forward due to my, "Poor shoes." We corrected her, explaining that we wanted only to go to our room. Without apology, she directed us to the elevator we would have found without her assistance. It is a great hotel. Great room. Great shower. Stunning visuals. Cool, efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandrobat
Reviews.Content: I have been for one week at the W hotel for a business meeting. The hotel is really fantastic, the view from the room is outstanding and every detail is beautiful. The room is not very buig but very well designed. The fitness center is very well equipped. It miss only a nice swimminpool (also the outside one is not very big).Overall a great experience

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: holly n
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Barcelona on 4/12/2012 for the weekend and we loved it ! We stayed in room 1918 and the views are insane! Floor to ceiling windows, views of the city on one side and panoramic views of the ocean in the bedroom. The bathroom is really cool! The concierge was fantastic they gave us great recommendations for dinner that were not too touristy! My only complaint is that the room service was not worth the money or the breakfast buffet...it was our fault anyways...get out in the city and try the local food!! 100% recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just About Flawless!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorHank
Reviews.Content: Our stay for four nights was simply wonderful. When you can say a hotel added to the enjoyment of your vacation, you know that they are doing things right. The rooms are set up with the bed facing the Mediterranean. You pull the curtains back in the morning, and are treated to a wonderful view. Great way to start the day. The rooms have all the conveniences, and the bathrooms offer plenty of space. Housekeeping kept everything spotless. My only complaint is that it took me two days to figure out how to turn on/off all of the mood lighting. With a little effort, you can create a very romantic atmosphere once you get the lighting down. My wife and i especially liked the comfort of the bed and the unique "couch" that runs the length of the wall-to-wall picture window. We would come back from sightseeing, stretch out and relax on that couch while looking out at the sea. A great way to renew your energy for the evening activities. We two dinners and all breakfast in the restaurant. We thoroughly enjoyed the food. If you wanted eggs on the cold breakfast buffet, you had only to ask. The lobby bar was excellent with many groupings for seating; you can also have light meals there. Like all W properties the decor is modern and uncluttered throughout. The location of the hotel is a bit removed from the main sites, but is just a short cab ride away. There are also buses that run to the hotel area. Finally, the best part of our stay at the W Hotel Barcelona was our interaction with the staff. There was not a single moment when there was an absence of warmth, gracious hospitality, and quick response to a request. The staff were on par with any of the top rated hotels we have been lucky enough to stay in during our travels. We thoroughly enjoyed meeting and talking with many of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “My fave hotel in Barca!! *****”
Reviews.Author: LM_Freq_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay in Barcelona a lot. This has to be my fave hotel. I have stayed in quite a few over the last 4 years for work and leisure. The rooms are large and lush! Every need is catered for. All well thought through items are in your room. Situated right on the sandy beach, away from the hustle and bustle. The only thing I would say is walking by yourself back to the hotel when its late can be a little worrying but the strip down is usually filled with people until 2am ish. The breakfast is one of the best in Barca by far! Staff are friendly and knowledgeable, they all look like models!! the guys and the girls.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: itay517
Reviews.Content: the good- the rooms are amazing-very luxurious and very well aquiped. i took the corner suite, which had an amazing view of both the sea and the city. the gym is very well aquiped, and the bliss spa is great. but, above all, stands the staff and the best service i've ever had in a big hotel. the bad- the location- this beach front hotel is in the barceloneta neighborhood . if you wish to stay in the city center, you'd have to take it into consideration. breakfest is high standart, but the variety is average. the bottom line- one of the best hotels in barcelona, no doubt. and again, amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “A beach hotel - in a city”
Reviews.Author: Nordicmom81
Reviews.Content: Lovely location on the beach - with stunning views. However, inconvenient as not near mass transit and a long walk to anything , whether that be a tourist destination or good restaurants. Furthermore, little local flavor as to be expected from a chain. All that would have been tolerable except for the distinct smell of smoke in what was supposed to be a non smoking hotel. Hotel staff refused to deal with this and did not allow me to change rooms due to being oversold with a convention in town. Offered to send air freshener, which being a W might have been a Bliss product but now my clothes smell like smoke!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel Location Nice Rooms just poor food and average service”
Reviews.Author: AlinHauca
Reviews.Content: I stay totally 11 days in a Marvelous Suite Hotel is very good room is modern with nice sea view at 23 floor. Gym is top notch, Spa is very good and they have a disco bar at 26 floor where was Resident Pacha from Ibiza DJ. At the hotel entrance you can meet girls that want to get a fee entrance in the disco so you can socialize very fast with beautifull girls. The only downside at this hotel is poor breakfast, at maximum level of a 3 star hotel. For me breakfast is very important so next time I will choose another hotel. Just paying lots of money and not be able to get a good breakfast is not great

Reviews.Title: “No FREE WiFi in Rooms ... this is 2012 ?”
Reviews.Author: CCKMalibuCalifornia
Reviews.Content: No FREE WiFi in your room. Seriously, this is 2012. You would expect with the rates in this Hotel they could offer this service free. You can however purchase if you pay 5 Euro per hour, or 19 Euro per day OR you have the option to go down to the Lobby and deal with a very slow connection. Front desk staff was obnoxious and arrogant. Great views of Barcelona, but that's about all. I spent over 500 Euro for 1 night including a lunch time meal in the Wave Bar... would expect FREE WiFI in my room to check a few e-mails on my laptop. W Hotel is over rated and I feel like I was ripped off. Will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: CijN
Reviews.Content: Terribly smelly bedroom, dirt and empty bottle tops under the bed and chair. Nasty stained seating by large picture window, amazing view but did not want to spend too much time in room smelt of cigarettes. Atmosphere good in main lobby and bar area, and lovely pool if you could find somewhere to sit. Very expensive, sort of hotel for young lovers with loads of money and bling.

Reviews.Title: “Striking hotel at the beach”
Reviews.Author: Anne
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at the W in early April for 4 nights. It was our first visit to Barcelona. We had two rooms. We were on vacation with our youngest daughter who is studying in Seville for the Spring term, one of her friends from home, and our oldest daughter. Like many reviewers here, I had concerns prior to our arrival about the atmosphere, the location, and the bathrooms in the hotel. I suggest that future readers keep these things in mind. 1. This is a W hotel. It is similar to other W hotels we have stayed in, in the US. It is very modern. It attracts a young crowd. The lighting can be non-conventional (different colors in the bar, few overhead lights in the rooms etc.) But it is sleek and fun. 2. Barcelona has an excellent bus and subway system. There are three bus lines that begin their routes in front of the hotel; all of them will take you to the metro. You can also take the buses directly to many of the popular sites in the city. You can take the bus down the street and connect to the metro. If you buy a T-10 ticket at the metro you can use it on both the bus and the metro, and the price per ride is reduced. Because the W is NOT centrally located, you should plan some transit time to get places. It is a 20 minute walk from the metro to the hotel. But the trade off is that transportation options are good, and you are on the beach. We did not have good weather during our visit, but the beach and the ocean were always beautiful. We found it very easy to get around Barcelona. 3. The bathrooms. We were upgraded to two "Fabulous" category rooms which each included a jetted tub, a very large separate rain shower stall and a toilet. Both the shower and the toilet had tall frosted glass walls. Can you see inside? No. Does it take a little getting used to? Yes. BUT, the shower makes up for everything. It was the best one I have ever used. The shower space was large, the water was hot (we were on the 21st floor) and with the dark tile floor you had the sense that you were showering outside, after a sandy beach visit. Other reviewers have mentioned service issues. The rain shower option (you can opt for a hand held shower attachment) did not work in the first room my daughters were staying in. We asked the front desk for assistance twice. The first time an employee immediately came up to the room and looked at the shower. He got on his cell phone and dialed for help - we left for our sightseeing. When we returned there was no improvement. We asked for help a second time. Still no rain shower option. I asked if we could have another room. No problem. My daughters packed their bags and left them by the door in the morning. Their bags were moved to a new room by the time we returned to the hotel to change for dinner. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel spoke beautiful English, (I am a non-Spanish speaker), and was very helpful. We did not eat at the hotel because the prices were too high. We walked along the beach and ate at some of the little restaurants near the water, or took the bus back towards the nearest metro stop (Barceloneta) and wandered around the alleyways and squares nearby for some delicious meals that were well priced. We found the free internet in the lobby worked very well, as did the four terminals in the business center. The free and delicious coffee (maybe it was really espresso?) available at the end of the bar in the lobby each morning, gave us the energy to find a beachfront breakfast. And the cold water dispenser at the end of the whatever desk was refreshing when we returned to the hotel. One of my daughters said that the work out room (Sweat) had the best view ever. This hotel worked well for us. It really enhanced our visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona with a WOW at the W”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful with everything you could possibly need and even if there is something they will get it for you. All the staff were very friendly and very professional. Eclipse is a wow on the 26th floor. Bravo restaurant was excellent. Wave breakfast buffet was comprehensive and yummy. Special mention has to go to the Wave Bar team who were fantastic, especially the Columbian waitress who we fell in love with. We had come to the hotel to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary, the wave bar team and in room service team suprised us with champagne in our room on our final evening....WOW so nice. Will without doubt go back, we enjoyed every minute and didnt want to leave. Lastly the room was excellent with fantastic view. loved it and thank you W staff for such a memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views and that is all”
Reviews.Author: DBDu
Reviews.Content: Expensive, distant from the most interesting points in lovely Barcelona, wonderful views of the Mediterranean, the beach, the City. I experienced several issues in my room (the sink, the clock, iPod connection, etc) that took 2 days for the hotel to acknowledge and resolve just in part. Cordial team.

Reviews.Title: “Does W stand for "Whacky"”
Reviews.Author: torchyPyrford
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights a couple of weeks ago, our view overall was that the hotel is very good,however there were a few points that we were not happy about. First of all,the arrangement of the loo in our room being behind a glass screen that opened directly into the room was somewhat daunting and you need to share a room with someone that you know very well, I won't go into too much detail. We arranged for tea making facilities to be sent to the room, we initially had 2 tea bags and when we asked for some more we were told that there would be a charge of 4.5 euros PER BAG and they also wanted to charge 5 euros for a very small jug of milk.The other issue on cost was the fact that the hotel charges 5 euros for the 1st hour for using wi-fi in the room, not something that I would expect from a hotel of this quality. After a few phone calls to the management we were told that we would not be charged for the tea or the milk,I would think so too, bearing in mind that this is a 5 star hotel. The staff with one exception were very friendly and helpful, the exception being the guy on the Concierge Desk who was neither friendly or helpful, I got the distinct impression that he thought he was doing us a favour by just being there The room was great apart from the loo, the beds were superb and gave us great sleep quality, we also had a wonderful view of the harbour, with so much going on. One other point was that we found out that there is only one room per floor with a bath, which again is a bit strange for a quality hotel The breakfasts were ok but as we had recently stayed at The Cliff Bay Hotel in Madeira, they not as good as we had expected. I have to say that breakfast at The Cliff is probably the best that we have ever had anywhere. The hotel is in a good location, there is a bus stop just at the entrance. The no 37 bus takes you into the main part of the City for 2 euros, whereas a taxi is about 10 euros. We got a taxi from the airport to the hotel for 40 euros but on the way back got the Airport shuttle bus from the main square at the top of La Ramblas for only 6 euros each, they run every 7 minutes or so. Much better value. We both loved Barcelona, especially my wife who has never seen so many Zara's in one place,needless to say, several hours were spent buying clothes. My wife assured me that they are a lot cheaper than in the UK, which in fact they are. Sadly I am too old for the Zara mens section. Finally we also used the hop on and off tourist bus which was a great way to see this fantastic City.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and facilities, staff communication meltdown”
Reviews.Author: asykes1975
Reviews.Content: The hotel certainly a 5* modern hotel but would not say luxury. We were upgraded to a Fabulous room on checking in but would say for what we paid, this grade of room should have been allocated from the onset, standard size and sea view which is what we had specified in our booking. We had pre-booked the Bravo Restaurant but were told, by another guest, that there had been some sort of incident in the kitchen and the restaurant was closed. We were not told of this by the hotel upon check in. We were offered a table at Wave (by the Wave restaurant manager upon explaining our predicament). We were seated but not given menus for some 15 - 20 minutes after being seated. Saying this, the service and food was excellent in this restaurant, which also doubled up as the breakfast restaurant and which was also excellent. Bottled water is chargable in room which in a 5* hotel is usually complimentary. Also, Shower smelt a little foisty which should not be the case in a 5* hotel. Only other down side is that the hotel is very isolated and it is a 20 minute walk to the main site seeing/tour bus route pick up points.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in a beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: benandlau
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the WBarcelona from April 5th-April 9th. We decided to visit the city for our anniversary and his birthday. We chose the hotel due to the gorgeous pics on the internet and the amazing reviews. We weren't disapointed. We were on the 18th floor with a view of the med. Beds extremely comfy, shower lovely and overall a beautiful room. Breakfast was delicious and staff extremely attentive. The eclipse bar was fun and with stunning views of the city. On my boyfriends birthday when we returned back into the room we were left a birthday cake on the desk. We would like to thank the insiders for this lovely gesture. We would definately return to the hotel sometime. Next time we will book with the hotel rather than a travel company.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL ATTITUDE”
Reviews.Author: lidi A
Reviews.Content: Paul at reservations does not know his job. We had made a reservation for a marvelous suite for 2 nights and a wonderful room for 3 nights and we had informed him that on of us (we were 3 people taking the trip) would arrive first with no credit card. Paul assured us that he would arrange it so no problem would occur. I was the first to arrive. Paul was not working at that time. He had informed noone for the arrangement. Mrs Romina at the front desk as well all the rest of the staff treated me as I was a homeless entering the hotel! MOREOVER they demanded my credit card which they did not accept, but finally I found out that they CHARGED me with the cost of one night stay.... After a claim they finally gave the money back. I left and had to loose time and money, finding another place to stay which was excellent La Meridien.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it loved it loved it”
Reviews.Author: ATraveller01
Reviews.Content: There is nothing not to love about this hotel. Attentive staff, beautiful decor, comfortable rooms with excellent amenities and views. I will most definitely be back, business and pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some flaws”
Reviews.Author: Ascottowers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W as there was a conference I was attending at the hotel and actually I was excited that I was going to stay there, having heard rave reviews of their other properties. Arriving on Sunday afternoon for a four-night stay, check-in was swift and despite my request for a high floor room (there are 26 storeys in this hotel), the lady at reception could only give me one on the second floor. Still, the room itself was big, well appointed and had great views of the mediterranean (as do most of the rooms). I did have some trouble finding basic things like the safe and the hairdryer but the staff on the Whatever/Whenever hotline soon pointed me in the right direction. The bed was very comfortable and I couldn't drag myself out of it most days, plus the bathroom/wetroom was fun with the rainfall shower. There was no bathtub in my room, but I didn't miss it, and I loved the Bliss products that they give you (very lemony and zesty). Lovely. Plus, I checked out the gym (they call it Sweat - nice...) which was very good complete with water fountains, changing areas, lockers and all the apparatus you would expect. Be warned, you need your room key to access the E floor which is where Sweat is located. However, there were some flaws with my stay, simple things that the hotel management should work on. These are: 1. Internet access in the room. Wireless is provided by DoCoMo and it is a royal rip-off for the internet speeds you get. 19 Euros per 24 hours and the speed was so slow that I had to take my laptop and stand by my hotel door (other side of the room) to get any half-decent speed. Be warned. 2. The mini-bar. As I have said on other reviews, it never ceases to amaze me what hotels want to charge you for a drink in your room. While it was fun to have martini glasses and bottles of gin and vodka on show, there was no way I was going to help myself and be billed outrageous prices. And yet, when I did check out, a mini-bar bill showed up on the final account. Still, the guy at reception waived the 36 Euros that they wanted to bill me without hesitation. 3. The Eclipse bar on the 26th floor. When I checked in I was given a pass to bypass any lines to get into the express elevator up to the Eclipse bar, but to be honest I never needed it as I was there in the week. I imagine it gets busier at the weekend. While the bar itself affords wonderful views of the city of Barcelona (especially at night), there is absolutely zero atmosphere and the lighting system turns the entire bar either pink or purple. Hideous. I can think of better places to sup a 14 Euro cocktail. By all means, check it out, but I tell you that you won't stay for long. In fact, the first time I walked in the bar, it felt like a dirty student bar from my college days. Not what you would expect from the W. 4. Overcharging at the bar. On the first two nights, I went to the bar on the ground floor with a co-worker and no less that three occasions the bar staff tried to overcharge us for our drinks. When I queried why they had charged for doubles instead of singles or why they had charged for a 21 yr old malt when I was drinking a basic blended scotch, the staff merely smiled and made their excuses and then rectified the charge. One wonders how many people just sign off their bar bills without giving them a second glance. So, do check your bar bills before tipping and signing. Needless to say, I waived any tips when my bar bill was wrong. 5. Whatever/whenever line. While this is usually a good service (as mentioned before), when I rang to ask for help with my luggage, no-one picked up the phone. This happened again and again over a 30 minute period. When I called the concierge and explained that no-one was picking up the W/W phone calls, he apologized and sent up the porter. While this is not the worst thing in the world, if you are going to have a 24/7 phone line service, please be sure to man it at all times. Overall, the staff were very helpful (from the guy who welcomed me out of the cab, to the lady who checked me in, to the porter who helped me with my luggage to the guy who then checked me out), but there are some basic errors at this hotel that need fixing. When you are paying the sorts of room rates that the W commands, you expect the best.

Reviews.Title: “Elements of Luxury, but at a price”
Reviews.Author: joemichaelclarke
Reviews.Content: Let me start with a positive, the W Barcelona is beautiful from the outside in. The level of detail which has gone into the structure, the food, the staff, the rooms, the beds, the bathrooms (I could go on) is befitting it's 5 star recommendation. The staff are extremely friendly and are the core reason behind me not slating this hotel completely. Despite arriving at 5pm they still didn't have a room available when I arrived. On top of this the room they did find me (18th floor with stunning view) was taken away from me when a "more important" customer requested it. I quickly learnt you needn't get hung up on which floor you're on, above the 4rd you already have stunning vistas of the beach and the sea and Barceloneta region, unless you're on the full half of the hotel with a view of the docks, not too pretty! The rooms .....while luxurious still have no free wi-fi, you need to pay €5 per hour for snail slow connections (3 minutes to load gmail). The food ......while delicious is overpriced, as are the cocktails in the stunning and exclusive eclipse bar on the roof (34th floor with a view). The pool ....was not heated and therefore ont one person used it and once again, they're let down by the fact they charge you to use their underground Jacuzzi and Steam facilities (€20 per day!!) The staff ..... undoubtably the saving grace who, despite setbacks in broken amenities and room facilities (air con not working, no iron then replacement didn't work, hammering at 9am from the room below, Jacuzzi broken down, pool not heated, wi-fi broken). They great you with a smile and though no compensation is offered for these setbacks you are met with an apology and they always followed up to see if the issue had been resolved. In closing this place is beautiful, it has great staff, the food is great and the rooms are luxurious but they need to stop charging for everything they possibly can. At €300 per night you'd expect some free wi-fi and far superior amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever/Whenever....more like Whatever/Never”
Reviews.Author: thevunit
Reviews.Content: The physical appearance of the hotel is stunning. The room was very sleek and comfortable. The view was among the best I have ever seen - clear sight lines to the city and the sea. However, this was the worst service we have ever experienced at any hotel. The right hand had no idea what the left hand was doing....upon arrival, we were told that our children would be able to eat at the rooftop restaurant until 9PM, however, we were later told that was for ages above 12 years old. When I asked the "Whatever Whenever" line, they said it was "probably because I didn't tell them the ages of my kids up front." At the WAVE restaurant, we were twice told to go to the other restaurant for breakfast without any mention of how long the wait would be. The concierge gave us information for the bus to Park Guell, not mentioning that a taxi would be shorter and cheaper. The concierge told us "they didn't recommend going to the furnicular" but could not answer our question about whether it was open while it was raining. The "Whatever Whenever" staff told us that the football game was not carried on television in the hotel....it was. The poolside staff, although very nice, had no idea whether or not there was a kids menu. To their credit, they did ask until they were able to answer our questions. On our last night, we wanted to go the WAVE restaurant, left a message with the restaurant to make reservations, asked the "Whatever Whenever" staff to get back to us about reservations....they never got back to us.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Barcelona?”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_OFarrell
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic long weekend here for my husbands 30th birthday. I had booked a flight / accomodation package with BA and found this good value. However I hadn't appreciated that a 'wonderful' room was in fact entry level, so I was a bit worried we were going to end up with a shoe box. In fact the room was great. The only problem I had was that although the floor to ceiling windows afforded us great views, there was no fresh air and I suspect if you upgrade to one of the few suites for the privilage of a balcony it would cost a small fortune. Also I would point out the bathroom layout, the sink was in the room itself and the shower and toilet only behind frosted glass. I wouldn't fancy this layout for a romantic first break away! Fine if you are toally comfortable with whoever you're sharing the room with. The staff were literally falling over themselves to help you out, even remembering your name for your entire stay. On finding it was my husbands birthday our check in girl sent a cake to the room! I bet the W in London don't have staff this good. The only other point to note was the slight distance between the hotel and the city center, but to the center of town a cab was only 5 Euro or a 20 min walk, so I really wouldn't let that put you off - this is definately the best hotel in Barcelona. We would definately return here......

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views”
Reviews.Author: peaches032
Reviews.Content: Great location, awesome views, clean. Odd room set out, as sink was in room. Lighting whilst very funky was impractical. Remote control curtains, cool ,but didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Really a great Hotel and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: wilreynolds
Reviews.Content: So if you are looking to stay near the beach this is about as close as its going to get. The staff are amazing at helping you with whatever you need. The rooms were some of the swankiest rooms I'v ever stayed in. Its definitely pricey, but if you've ever wanted to treat yourself, this is the place to save up and do it. They kind of have a little area on the beach with is very nice, it gives you a little privacy if you like that kind of thing. The multiple levels of outdoor lounging are also great - the outdoor club & DJ are great with the beds and cabanas. I couldn't recommend this place any more. Some rooms can be a little smokey, but just go ask for a new one, and they'll accommodate. The brunch is kinda bleh, if I had to find one thing that was not excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place .. good location”
Reviews.Author: shamus67
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, polite staff, clean spacious rooms. Good breakfast buffet. Eclipse bar fun but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: i2sky
Reviews.Content: We had the "basic" wonderful room on the 14th floor. Not really basic with mood lighting, automatic curtains and a chaise lounge by the window to enjoy the view. The wet room with the rain shower was amazing, the best shower I've ever had. The bed is way too soft for my liking, but that's a personal preference. The toilet situation is intimate! Breakfast was included in our booking and it was very good quality. Lovely bread, meats, cheeses, pastries, nice coffee and fresh juices. If it's not included in your booking it will cost you 18 euros per person. The prices in the hotel were very high. If you want to pay 4 euros for a small bottle of water in your room you can, or you can grab a massive bottle at the spar and pay under a euro. The location suited us well, it's a little bit out of the town but the views are worth it. It's a nice stroll in the evening to la Barceloneta area for bars and eating. There are 3 main bus routes that terminate outside the hotel, no need to take taxi's unless you want to. The buses are modern and travel in Barcelona is cheap compared to London. A T10 ticket will give you ten journeys for under ten euros. The bus routes 17, 39 and 64 all terminate and start just outside the hotel and all pass Barceloneta Metro station if you don't want to walk to it. The staff were professional and polite, check in was quick, option availabe of being able to leave your luggage at the hotel on the last day if you have a late flight. Barcelona is an amazing city and we will stay at the W Hotel when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: happytravelermom
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I stayed here for over a week on a girll's getaway trip and loved every second of it! We originally planned on staying 3 nights but extended our stay in barcelona to over a week because we loved this hotel. The staff is helpful and friendly. The rooms are spacious, well equipped and beautiful. Beds are comfy and the view spectacular. The only drawback to the room is a bit of a lack of privacy due to the way the bath area is set up. We loved the pool area and the private section of beach in front of the hotel. The scene a little further up the beach is interesting to say the least, but we felt like we were in our own little world on our beach chairs in front of the hotel. An added plus is the beach recliners are complimentary, unlike many European hotels, so we didn't feel like we needed to make a full or half day commitment to sitting on the beach. At night, the pool area is a trendy spot to grab a drink before heading out for dinner and the clubs. What I like about this hotel is that it's trendy and chic without being silly and pretentious. It is like staying in a resort in the middle of a lovely, historical city. It's a bit of a walk to get to the sightseeing area, but we enjoyed the exercise and we either walked a short distance to the Metro or took a cab if we didn't feel like walking. We are planning a trip back next July.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice near the beach, amazing view”
Reviews.Author: beatrix1017
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the fantastic room, the curtain is automatic which allows you to see the beach and the ocean without leaving your bed. The shower sets are really nice offered by Bliss. They have a lounge bar on the top of the glamourous building

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great room, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: msfashionbiz
Reviews.Content: From the moment we got out of the taxi to the moment we left in a taxi the service was great. Valentina and the front desk agent, I forget her name, and Frank our bellman were very helpful, courteous and professional. The ocean view room was simply amazing. My family and I only stayed one night before our cruise, but the service and room certainly blew us away. We definitely will return for a longer stay on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: liketospend
Reviews.Content: My room was very quiet and the bed was comfortable - both big plusses for me when I'm travelling and dealing with jet lag. I stayed for 3 nights, and found room service to be pretty reliable, and the service overall in the hotel to be excellent. The location is a bit out of the way, and you couldn't easily walk to Las Ramblas, but the hotel was large enough that I didn't feel isolated, and there were plenty of helpful staff members and plenty of taxis if i needed to go anywhere. I was amazed that all of the staff spoke english!

Reviews.Title: “A really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: deborahstott
Reviews.Content: We have had a lovely stay at the W hotel - great service and lovely facilities - we had a great view from our 11th floor room. Concierge didn't give the best advise but all other staff were brilliant. Well situated for Barcelona sites but need to rely on taxis on public transport. Views of the beach and people watching fab. This is the only hotel I have stayed in that I couldn't hear the sounds of other guests whilst in the room - great insulation!.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty spectacular architecture. Really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: eliane_22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W during a trip to Barcelona as there are many flights from my current location and my friend came from Canada for a visit. We were both a little trepidatious about the place given the location - warning it is rather far from the center. However if you are prone to walking and enjoy a good stroll, then it's the perfect place, as it's located right on the sea. The place itself is majestic, incredible architecture, the rooms are roomy, airy, the modern design, and placement of everything within the actual room is rather impressive, never have I seen a hotel room so well laid out. A plus is the size of the shower, and the toiletries supplied by the hotel is simply awesome. The concierge is also very helpful and nice. Yes there is a rather long wait when checking in, but it's worth every minute. The lobby is also wonderful, large, spacious and design something to look at. Don't forget to visit the skybar upstairs one evening, while it's small, the drinks and views are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Hot place !”
Reviews.Author: StefanVP
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with much light and pace in the rooms. There are incredible loby bar beach bar and night club ! The rooms are clean and quiet with all the necceserry inside.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service while providing great feeling”
Reviews.Author: throtgobler
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the W Barcelona on our tour around europe and we can say that the last stop at the W was the best. From the moment we stepped in we were recieved with friendliness and helpfull but professional staff that made our stay memorable. Mathew at reception gave us a gorgeous room with breathtaking views. The breakfast in wave was a little bit overpriced for what they offer, but the staff and enviroment made it special. Only two glitches throughout our stay: 1 The bar at the top floor (26) made some noise the first night we stayed in (we were on the 15th floor) 2 Having received my bill to my room i noticed that i was mistakenly charged for some drinks at the W bar, which upon check out sofia helped to fix. She was the most kind professional that gave us the feeling of returning to this lovely hotel. Tips: Avoid the mini bar, way to overpriced, Find yourself time to go to the gym, the machines there are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cofal
Reviews.Content: 10 of us went there and we had the best time in W Barcelona. We were in fabulous rooms with a fantastic view over the Barceloneta beach. Seriously the best view I had so far ! Once you wake up you can't stop looking at the beach. Eclipse bar on the 26th floor was also great. Good dj and great fun ! Generally staff was very nice and helpful. We had a great time in Barcelona. The weather was fantastic for March (+23). Couldn't be better. Highly recommend !

Reviews.Title: “good breakfast and lunch venue with waterfront and beach views”
Reviews.Author: Gato188
Reviews.Content: We can't comment on the accommodation of this hotel, not having been room guests, but we enjoyed a good breakfast there during our four-day stay in Barcelona (in an apartment) in February 2012. The sail shape of the building is a prominent landmark on the Barcelona waterfront. The lobby, restaurant, poolside and terrace areas are spacious, stylish and modern, with sweeping views of the coastline, the old fort above Barcelona, and black neoprene-clad surfers who were numerous even in late winter. Our buffet breakfast (€46 for two) was excellent, enjoyed at a table with fine views of hardy surfers riding waves along the beaches stretching to the north. The several hotel staff we met were pleasant and efficient. Our overall impression of the hotel was positive. It is certainly a place we would consider if we were seeking hotel accommodation on a future visit to Barcelona - although the location on the end of a long malecón is not convenient for walking access to the central city area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico !”
Reviews.Author: worlddivingtraveller
Reviews.Content: I cant write enough here, a truly amazing hotel. (negatives) the check in was very slow, and the location whilst exceptional for the beach, is quite a taxi ride away (you have to circumvent the whole of the marina/ port zone) or a long walk. The roof top bar was worth the visit, but be warned the drinks are Very expensive, and the service slow. The only pool was outside, so not usable unless it is hot and sunny, a great shame for such a new hotel. (also see tip below) the toilet was 'integral' to the room, just behind a frosted glass panel; this may not be to everyone's taste. (Positives) The rooms were fantastic, modern, quirky, spacious and full of high tech and very nice touches... the huge wet shower room, the lighting, the space.... the ground floor bar was well laid out among the comfy sofa style chairs, and great access to the outdoors. Breakfast was good quality, and well laid out. This hotel is an amazing modern design and that is its great selling point.

Reviews.Title: “America in Barcelona - if that is what you want”
Reviews.Author: KdJd2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July 2011 and the the hotel was great. Our room was very nice, the view was gorgeous although I would have preferred to look towards the beach as opposed the ship canal side. Everything was nice, clean, pleasant service although over zealous on trying to get in the room to clean. Great pool, unfortunately dominated by kids - and for some reason W hotels seem to me as they should be more adult oriented. But maybe just our thing as we are past the kid rearing stage. Here is the drawback and why I will not go back. This hotel prevents you from having a real Barcelona experience. It is like dragging the USA with you on vacation. When we switched hotels to the Casa Fuster - I really enjoyed Barcelona and felt like I was in a new city. The W insulates you from the experience in my view. No judgement. If you have tons of Starwood points, use them in Miami and spend the $$ on your European vacation and enjoy the full ride.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular - but a bit quirky”
Reviews.Author: Divaphoto
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of the W chain since my experience in Washington DC, but my usual hotel in Barcelona (Arts) was full, so I opted for the new W. Well, it is a spectacular building and has the usual W style about it - friendly staff and nice open plan style lounge/reception. My room had great views and was big enough for me, but I'm not sure that I'd be entirely happy with frosted glass in the bathroom if I had company! Great breakfast buffet and a good bar. Are there downsides? Well it doesn't have the style of the Arts and it is just as expensive(!), but it does have a relaxed atmosphere and is possibly a little closer to the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad, not so great either!!”
Reviews.Author: Atlantis85
Reviews.Content: We checked in a the W Barcelona early with no problem. Our private transfer from the airport was fantastic. The desk receptionist was very nice and friendly. The hallway to our room on the 17th floor had a slight unpleasant odor. The room was very modern with nice touches and a great view. However the bird poop all over the window was a little of a buzz kill. The shower and toilet offered no privacy but this was not a problem for us but it could be for some. The bed was very nice and comfortable. The concierge was HORRIBLE!!! We wanted to go to Mountjuic for the fountain show and music which plays on Sunday nights. After being told there was a show @ 9:30pm and told to take a taxi we found out after arriving that it was shut down for construction. When I returned to the hotel after paying 35 EURO round trip I let him know very kindly about his mistake. I wasnt really seeking any compensation, which I probably should have, he had a very unaplogetic apaology, you know you have heard them before. No turn down service. I can see how some travelers would be turned off by the sexy enviroment of the hotel however this did not bother us. When we were checking out the same lovely lady that checked us in (Sarah) was just as gracious and pleasent as when we checked in. She provided information that would gernerally be provided by a concerige and she was tipped accordingly We explained to her about the concierge and she kindly provided us with free drinks at the bar for someone elses mistake. I expect way more out of a 5 star hotel. The hotel was also a very long walk from anything. The hop-on, hop-off bus is a ways however we knew this before we checked in and it wasnt a problem for us. This hotel would never receive a five star reting in the US or AAA five diamonds. Of course AAA does not rate hotels outside the US.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: Vorlina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with three girl friends last weekend (early March). We were lucky enough to get a super deal on last minute, as otherwise it might have been a little bit out of our price range. We thought the service was very good: - arrived at 1/2pm, rooms were ready. We had a disabled member with us and the friendly and welcoming receptionist quickly put us into appropriate accommodations. These were extremely well designed - dropped beds, lowered sink and roll in wet room shower. - the gentleman who took our bags up to our room gave us some good local tips (bus locations etc) and made sure he greeted us each time we bumped into him, - the conceirge was superb. We gave her a few tricky things to locate, not to mention the importance of accessibility and she rose to each challenge with aplomb. - we did a mixology class with Patrick and he could not have been more friendly to four totally incompetent barkeeps. The beds were very comfortable and we are seriously considering buying the bed toppers they use! The hotel is a little out of town, but there is a bus for 2 EUR from right outside the hotel which goes to Playa de Catalunya. We were on floor 5 and we had a lovely view of the sea and the pedestrianised area which was very popular with segway enthusiasts. We visited the bar, which did some great cocktails - yes, not cheap, but what hotel bar is? Some minor points for the future: - like other reviewers, we wanted to book at table at Eclipse (not least due to our disabled member). We arrived at 2am - Spanish style - and were asked to buy a bottle for the table. With so many empty tables, it didn't really seem required. Perhaps a little more discretion is in order. - various facilities were mentioned to us by other staff members (indoor pool, ipod charger in room) which we struggled to locate - we weren't sure if we were blind or the information was behind the times. Thanks to all the staff for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for a relaxing weekend in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LS_uit_O
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend staid at the W for 3 nights during a long weekend in February. We had a fabulous stay and would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a trendy, classy but also down to earth place to stay. Our favorite features were: - quality of the rooms: We were upgraded to a corner suite with magnificent views over the Mediterranean. The bed slept great, and the design of the room has the typical modern W feel. - Friendliness of the staff: Very welcoming and helpful, provided us with restaurant recommendations that all turned out great - Amenities: fabulous gym deserves special mentioning, as we found this better than 95% of all hotel gyms we had seen before. The only downside of the hotel is its location vis-a-vis the city. It is a bit remote so you depend on cabs or the city bus to get you to the city itself.

Reviews.Title: “no comparing”
Reviews.Author: Spoow
Reviews.Content: to be honest i have no words to describe the hotel i love it soo much!! from A to Z , and will go back this summer again!!

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: Trufflehoney
Reviews.Content: Sexy men on the door, totally red corridors, incredible views, an APP where you can order room service, a bar that looks like its melting (in a cool way) and a bed that feels like it is hugging you. This was a unique experience. Warning to Brits, you might think they'd do a decent cup of tea, they don't. Get a glass of Alberino instead!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Betttsss
Reviews.Content: Brilliant property.. On the sea, the view from any room just breathtaking. Both the sea view rooms and the harbour view...Very well connected - u alwaya have a city bus right outside the hotel..easy access to the beach for a nice walk and a bar with a spectacular view of the city at night.. Oustanding service .. One of the best hotel stays on our 3 week trip to italy and spain

Reviews.Title: “Cool Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Christianos_66
Reviews.Content: We thought the Hotel had an amazing setting and was one of the best W Hotels we have stayed in. The combined views of the Mediterranean and the City from our room were spectacular! As was our room. The staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly the Platinum concierge staff who went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable and assist us in planning our days in Barcelona. The elevators were a challenge as it seemed only half of them worked at any one time. We look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for its design and rooms but unfortunately poor service and Eclipse Bar has a better reputation as it actually is.”
Reviews.Author: Meylo151
Reviews.Content: As we arrived the first day by midday we decided to eat at wave ( a restaurant of the hotel). The service there was very bad it took really long to have our meals and there were some mistakes done by the personal like asking only one of both of us for having a drink. Afterward we've got a spanish menu although we spoke english during the whole lunch. We were not asked if we liked our meal and that after waiting half an our to have our plates moved off ( only 3 tables were occupied at the restaurant and they were 4 people working). But I have to say that the meals were really nice an I would recommand the risotto. I was also disappointed by the Eclipse Bar. We were tol by the concierge that we had to take drink for a value of 180€ if we want a table. We did this and stayed at the bar until 2 a.m.and there were only 5 of the 14 tables of the bar having a bottle for that prices other tables were occupied with people who drank a beer. After our visit at the bar I went to the reception( there was no concierge there) to complain about what happened but I didn t get a clear answer and the receptionist didn t seem to be ready to react instead he tried to finish the discussion as fast as possible. This was really a shame for a 5 star hotel. An other negative point of the hotel is its location. The hotel is located 25 minutes from city centre by walk and 5-10 minutes by taxi. But I repeat that the hotel is an astonishing building with really nice rooms and has really low prices for its category.

Reviews.Title: “Your room is ready Whenever & the price is Whatever...”
Reviews.Author: nolatravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W hotel for 1 night just prior to our departure from Barcelona. We had stayed in two other hotels during our stay but wanted to use this one for the last night as it was kind of out of the way for this time of year, but looked interesting. My big beef with this hotel is that their computers were down when we arrived, as well as when we left - they never presented an agreement of what I was paying, nor provided me with an invoice at departure or EVEN after charging my credit card - yet I gave them my email and asked them to do so but have never received it. My interaction with front desk staff and watching others interact with concierge staff (Whenever / Whatever Desk as they call it) was that the Whenever / Whatever is supposed to describe the guests feeling while staying at this hotel, yet I think that perhaps it has gotten into the staffs head as to how they interact with clients instead. The service level was not up to what I expected - no one was rude, but I might call it short - or semi attentive as one might be when they have too many things to do and are trying to move things along. Arrival: Room not ready - 3pm check in - it was pushing 5pm when we got our room. Given 2 drinks (wine or beer) and thats it - described as welcome drinks not drinks for not having the room ready. The design of the hotel was magnificent - stunning. From the entrance, to the "Living Room" interfacing with the beach, to the corridors of hotel rooms above. This is the place to stay in the summer when going to the warm beach (as opposed to our cool winter visit) with lots of free cash to spend for drinks and food. We had a Fabulous room - we had an SPG Gold card but it was never aknowledged nor any benefit derived from having it during our entire stay. (Perhaps the computers, but should computers be that necessary?!) The Faubulous room was on the 17th floor and faced the city / beach view to the northeast. It has not bathtup, which I would expect at this level of hotel - but it was nice none the less. The corridor end of the room had three frosted/etched glass compartments, one for entry, one for wc, and one for shower. There was a sink / makup area on the side of the room near the shower, then a desk facing the window but behind the bed, then the bed, then a nice lounge seat at the window with TV nearby. Nice lighting effects as well as a color changing by remote control RGB led light. One NEGATIVE here is that you could not hear the ocean as none of the windows were operable (why stay at the beach?) - I would have expected perhaps horizontal slit venting windows so one could at least hear the ocean. We had a snack in the Living Room - a burger - which was good. Had some glasses of wine here and one mojito - cost of drinks seemed high for what you got - staff was attentive. Some of the Living Room was roped off for an event - there was a shortage of places to sit - this was annoying at this level of hotel - if they need to close an area they should have adequate meeting space to use for that purpose. Tried the bar at the top level - again an area was closed off. DId not readily see a way to gain any sort of balcony access anywhere at the hotel - was expecting some kind of outdoor space at the top. We had sushi here (which we paid for directly as they had issues with billing to our room due to the computers) and some glasses of wine. It was good and not too loud or clubish so you could hold a conversation. Beds / bedding were nice, toiletries nice from the Bliss Spa in the hotel, Woke up at 06:30 to a morning glow - the sun seem to rise near 7:45 as we left our room. At check out we were unable to pay our bill, nor review it. They took our credit card numbers which they have since charged as well as our email address which they indicated they would send a copy of the bill to. Have not yet received a copy of the bill. The surronds of this hotel are failry sparce - the beach is the attraction. It is likely a 20 to 30 minute walk to get to the main drags of the city (we took cabs) - but walking along the beach would not be so bad in warm weather. There is a overhead cable car nearby with limited winter hours that you can take over to Montjuic Hill. The cable car is about 1/2 way to the nearest metro stop Barceloneta This hotel is a very nice facility, I might try it again in the summertime, but I would expect a higher level of service being a guest here than I got for the price. I felt more like I was in a bar with an attitude than a hotel - though again everyone was very nice - just seemed to be semi attentive and did not feel like a hotel catering to all of its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Service is good not great, worst elevator system I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: stregis_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great but the service isn't polished yet, I called the bellman 2 times to move my luggage to my room because my room wasn't ready yet, 45 minutes later I decided to make 3 trips up to my room. 2nd possible improvement is their elevator system, it's programmed to open for like 2 seconds and there are four of them across the hall from each other so if you miss it and each of us (3) staying in different rooms all had the same problem. In addition between the 3 of us in separate rooms we had to get new keys 6 different times. This review is more for the hotel management to make improvements not as a dig. This hotel has everything to be perfect and I'm sure it will be soon, Bravo restaurant is the best place I've eaten at In Spain Ever. Last but not least thank you for my platinum upgrade to the cool corner suite, unreal room. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Oh I almost forgot, Oscar the hotel driver is amazing. best guide for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great views but far from the center”
Reviews.Author: Jsgm
Reviews.Content: Great views from the room, great gym open 24 hours, service really nice, great disco very lively on the top floor. Nice place for been with your loved one.

Reviews.Title: “One word... AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Chanel3018
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 2 night stay (booked the Fabulous room). On arrival we had an extremely prompt check in (by the very helpful Jacopo) and although we were 3 hours ahead of our actual check-in time, we were very kindly allowed to go straight to our room. The room itself lived up to its 'Fabulous' name tag, with stunning views of the beach, city and sea. The chaise lounge style seating area under the window was a great touch, along with the electric curtains (nice if you don’t want to leave your bed), mood lighting, work station, and cocktail making kit. The wet room was great, very spacious with a rain style shower head, 2 dressing gowns, slippers and plenty of fresh, fluffy towels. All the toiletries are courtesy of the Bliss range (Bliss Spa downstairs) and restocked on a daily basis. We had breakfast in the Wave restaurant which had a good variety of continental style breakfast (fresh croissants, cheeses, hams, jams, fruit etc) and also well presented traditional, Spanish style omlettes with fresh coffee, tea, smoothies and juice - needless to say we didn’t go hungry. We loved the hotel so much that we were reluctant to go out on the first evening so we booked (by recommendation) to eat at the hotel restaurant, Bravo. The decor was beautiful and we had a table overlooking the terrace and sea. The food and service was amazing along and we were spoilt for choice with an extensive wine and champagne list. I would definitely recommend eating here. After that we decided it would be rude not to hang out in the lounge (opposite the wave restaurant), to have a few cocktails. We picked a comfy sofa right next to the rather funky looking fireplace. The DJ was playing chilled house music (if you like that sort of thing) and we had an attentive waiter who kept us topped up with many Polish Madame’s (a highly recommended cocktail!) After this we took the dedicated lift up to the Eclipse Bar on the 26 floor and again we were not disappointed! The view over the beach, city and sea is amazing, music was great and we even got a seat in the VIP area! I don't have a bad word to say about this hotel, I actually quite liked the fact that we were not right in the middle of La Rambla (which was only a short €5/6 cab ride away). Those with good legs could probably walk there in about 20/25 mins which on a good day isn’t that bad at all! I am looking to come back here for my Birthday and if you are looking at this hotel I would definitely recommend coming here. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect from a five star hotel....but you pay for it! I have stayed in the same quality hotels for less !”
Reviews.Author: sunstreamer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with lastminute.com - it was one of their mystery hotels so I didnt know what I was getting but I knew i was paying the top end for a 5 star hotel as I live in the Middle East and like to have comfort for my first few days on holiday, knowing that everything is going to be easy and taken care of - .I paid £500 for 4 nights; the going rate was £300 per night - I am glad I didnt pay the full price! First of all we have to take into account that it was February and an unusually cold February at that, so venturing out of the hotel consisted of wooly scarfs, gloves and hat....hence this made it a little more difficult as we couldnt use the beach etc. Good points Lovely room overlooking the sea Helpful staff Clean Free WIFI in comfortable lobby/bar callled the 'Living Room'. TV in room Full room service ordered and delivered quickly and presented well at 03.30am. Good food in 'Wave' cafe - average 5* prices for Spain Good food in 'Bravo' restaurant but v. expensive - try the 'piglet' absoutely gorgeous...but go easy on the starter!!!! Valet Parking...at a cost of 22Euros per day...which we didnt know about until we checked out! Bad Points No bath - apparently the more expensive rooms had baths! No WIFI in room Glass doors to toilet and shower room - little privacy A short walk to the local restaurants which werent really open in the day time therefore the hotel had the monopoly on dining...esp as we didnt want to travel far in the cold just to eat. Bravo restaurant when entering the restaurant the receptonist asked if we had looked at the menu downstairs....not sure why but got the feeling that we werent very welcome, and that the staff felt that we werent good enough to be there....we waited a very long time for our food order to be taken and the service was quite robotic, not at all friendly. Valet parking was an extra 22 Euro's per day. Glad that we werent paying the full price as the bill at the end of our stay was over double what we had paid for the rooms - for those prices I would expect courtesy parking and a bath I'm afraid!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay!”
Reviews.Author: MrsLokita
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W Barcelona for 2 nights during our vacation in Europe on September 2011. We stayed at three different hotels in Barcelona (all great) but this was definitely the best. We booked a wonderful room and during check in we got upgraded to a fabulous room. The guy at the front desk (I'm sorry I forgot his name) was very nice and once he noticed we were Gold members he gave us the best room available at a top floor! The views are amazing...breathtaking. The room was spacious, very modern, clean and who doesn't love the W bed?? The staff was very attentive at all times. We didn't try the sky bar but it looked like a fun place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller4047
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a long weekend in Barcelona and stayed at the W hotel. When we checked in there was a slight problem as the pc was being very slow for checking in. Our room was also not ready but before we could say anything, we were offered free drinks in the bar and they said they would come and get us when the room was ready....which is exactly what they did about 15 minutes later. All the staff we came across during our stay were extremetly friendly and attentive. Our room was on the 22nd floor and I cannot fault it. It was so nice to sit at the window and just check out the view. The shower was also wonderful. We ate dinner in the Wave Restuarant which was delicious and we had breakfast 3 times in the Bravo restaurant. Breakfast was included in our room rate and was very good but I have heard that if it is not included it is 30 Euro's per person..which it is probably not worth. Then again I only ever take a croissant anyway. We had room service one night which arrived promptly and the food was still nice and warm. All in all a wonderful experience. A couple of things I would point out though. The hotel is about 20-30 minute walk from Barcelona town. We are quite fit but after walking around Barcelona all day and walking back to the hotel, we could not be bothered to walk back into town for dinner as we were too tired. The hotel is very trendy and I enjoyed it...however we sometimes take my parents on holiday with us and I think that in this case they would not have enjoyed it as they are in their late 70's. I would also not really take kids here. The hotel is geared to a younger crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty / Worn Down Suites / Lost Couch - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Peter K
Reviews.Content: As a CAT 6 SPG property, I expected a clean room. But the studio suite was dirty and run-down. The carpet was stained and dirty. The bathroom tub cover was made out of plastic and the sides were not sealed properly. Best yet was the wiring conduits that were visible above the mirror in the bathroom. When I ask for another room, they told me that there were no more suites left Friday night and Saturday night and I could get a room on a higher floor if I don’t mind giving up the upgrade. After emailing back and forth with the W-Insider, she was able to secure a cool corner suite on the 18th floor for the last night, and personally review the suite before I checked in. She felt concern about the condition and tried her best to make my stay better. Since I am a SPG Platinum it did help. The Corner Suite on the last night was the saving grace for me from my wife. She was complaining about the dirty carpets the first 2 nights. The view from the 18th floor on the Corner Suite was nice. Waking up to the Mediterranean Sea sun rise was an unique view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Stockeronholiday
Reviews.Content: Booked a 'wonderful' room for my husbands 50th birthday and got upgraded to a 'fabulous' room on the 21st floor! We had an awesome view and an awesome stay at the hotel, and the birthday cake left in the room for our return on his birthday was a very nice and delicious touch. The eclipse bar on the 26th floor with its amazing views and atmosphere was certainly worth a visit. This iconic hotel is great for a memorable stay in the great city of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel of my Trip to Spain”
Reviews.Author: Brett P
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to Spain to celebrate her 80th birthday. The W Barcelona was the worst part of the trip. Upon arriving we were shown to our rooms which were many doors apart despite my request that they be next to each other. This made my mother very uncomfortable and it was completely inexcusable because we were travelling in the low season and I made reservations several months in advance through the platinum guest concierage, No other hotel had trouble with this simple request during my two week trip Both rooms had mechanical problems. In my mother's room the sink and remote controlled curtains didn't work and in my room the shower didn't work and leaked rusty water. The windows were dirty and there was a dead pigeon, bird crap and annoying bright beacon outside my window. Please take a look at these pictures if you find this hard to believe--I would. http://s1154.photobucket.com/albums/p533/bspugh/?action=view&current=WBarcelonalRoomViewNight.jpg There are 5 pictures you can click to view. The rooms have min-bars but everything in them is barely below room temperature. If you need ice, you have to call room service and have them bring it up. There was no upgrade per platinum standards as indicated in one of the other reviews--hopefully the pictures prove this. I can't imagine they have a worse room. I've stayed in W hotels in the U.S. and I thought they were all suites. My rooms were definitely not suites. I gave them my debit card for incidental charges and they withdrew and held 1800 euros (over $2300) from my checking account without telling me in advance (this was to reserve two rooms for 3 nights each). The money wasn't returned to my account until 3 days after my stay. I actually could go on but I won't other than to say the manager woudn't even talk to me when I complained at the front desk. The desk did offer me a free breakfast (which costs about $40 a person in this hotel). Otherwise they didn't address my needs. Advice; 1) Do not stay in Starwood hotels with recommend rates below 70% like this one. But if you must: 2) Do not stay below the 10th floor in this hotel. 3) Stay in rooms far from the elevator (numbers above XX6) 4) Do not reserve rooms with points or they will treat you like a freeloader. 5) The hotel and bar caters to the under 30 crowd, If you like nicer bars and restaurants, you will not want to eat or drink in the hotel. 6) Visit Madrid instead of Barcelona and stay at the Westin Palace--a far superior hotel.

Reviews.Title: “W Barcelona is Wonderful indeed!”
Reviews.Author: DJtravels
Reviews.Content: I had the Pleasure of staying at the W Barcelona from Feb. 10 - Feb. 13, 2012. We were a group of six consisting of 3 couples of varying travel experiences. Every single person in the group fell Absolutely in LOVE with both the City of Barcelona and the W! Staff: I must start this review by complimenting the Wonderful, Fabulous staff at the W. Every person that we came into contact with was friendly and efficient. I thought it was absolutely fascinating that very few of the W's employees were actually FROM Spain, so I took the time to ask about their journeys to Barcelona, and we were always treated to interesting, fun conversations. Truly, everyone was great, but My personal favorites were Moses (France/Senegal), Francilia (Argentina), Wan (China), Alex (Brazil), Yusef (Spain, actually LOL). I was also very impressed by the Wonderful woman at the Concierge desk who took special care to explain where to go, where to eat, and took care of our every need. (I'm so sorry that I didn't get her name, but she is the lady at the WHATEVER desk with the beautiful curly hair!). We also Really loved Joey, the Lobby DJ (from Chicago). Each of these people made our trip Very special and I THANK THEM for making us feel at home! Atmosphere: We traveled in the middle of winter, so we didn't get to experience the pool/beach, etc. But, the entire hotel's cool vibe and trendy atmosphere made us want to come back in warmer weather. During the day, our group split up to explore on our own, but we all came back together in the evening for "Happy Hour". After long days of walking and exploring, it was Wonderful to come back "home" to the W, have some drinks and relax. Location: Absolutely stunning location on the beach/boardwalk. It is a bit of a walk into the main sections of Barcelona, but the walk is well worth it. Barcelona itself is a beautiful city and it was lovely to explore on foot. We did take occasional taxis back to the W at night and the cost was never more 9 euro. Room: We had a Fabulous Room on the seventh floor and the name is quite Appropriate! From the moment that I walked in and saw the stunning view of the boardwalk, the city and the beach, I knew I was in love! The hardest part of the first night was tearing ourselves away from the window seats and actually leaving the room. The bed and the shower, like in all W hotels, are Simply Heavenly also! Although I did enjoy the ultra modern furnishing of the room, I will admit that the all glass doors on the bathrooms may be a bit disconcerting for friends traveling together. Food: 1. The only meal that we didn't absolutely love was the Continental Breakfast at the Wave restaurant. The price of the meal did not reflect the true value. After the first meal at the Wave Restaurant, we discovered that the Wave Bar has a light breakfast menu and we ate every other morning meal there. The food was MUCH cheaper and much heartier. I Highly recommend the Egg sandwich served with bacon and cheese! They also offer omelettes, pastries and other selections. Dinner at the Wave restaurant made up for ANY disappointment felt at breakfast. Every meal was beautifully prepared, wonderfully seasoned and served to perfection. My favorites were the Chilean Sea Bass and the Lamb Shank. In fact, these were so good that we ordered them twice in 2 days! Another exceptional part of the W Barcelona experience were the lovely drinks served at the hotel. There I had the Best caiprihana that I've had since I visited Brazil, Wonderful mojitos, Fabulous Rioja and the greatest Cava ever! In fact, I am now going through Cava withdrawal.... Eclipse Bar: We visited the Eclipse bar one night and were a bit disappointed. As I said, Joey, the Lobby DJ was Wonderful and made us feel like dancing. So, we were a bit surprised that the DJ spinning at Eclipse was not nearly as good. Additionally, the bar had a lack of ventilation that gave the place a musty, sweaty smell. Additionally, at least 1/3 of the bar was blocked off for "VIPs", however, it was mostly empty while the rest of the bar was standing room only. We stayed about 15 minutes, then went back to the lobby to chill with Joey again. Tips: Book your tours early and remember that they do not run on Sundays. Ask the Concierge desk about a great wine store in the area and purchase your Cava, Rioja, etc. there. The prices to import Spanish wines to the U.S. are Extremely high! Relax and Enjoy every Minute spent in Beautiful Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Timleon
Reviews.Content: I booked the W Barcelona as a surprise trip for my parents birthday (my fathers 60th) - their first time in Barcelona. I was a little concerned that the hotel may be a little too hip and trendy for them however I couldn't have been more wrong. From the minute we arrived we were taken care of by the cool and friendly staff. Valentina Gomez is the girl to know - she is the sweetest thing and was amazing with my parents, explaining all there is to see and do in the amazing city - she alone is a reason to return - talk about WOW! The walk to the hotel aling the beach is the perfect way to start and end each day - you really feel like a local as they run past you on the boardwalk and play bowles by the beach. The view from our room was INCREDIBLE!!!! Cocktails in Eclipse were fabulous and all in all the W is a super hotel in a super city - my only regret was that we visited in Winter and it was too cold to take advantage of the fabulous pool and deck.... there is always next time - maybe without the parents!!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: hlzurich
Reviews.Content: Our trip is a while ago, but I still would like to share the experience which we had with the W Barcelona. We chose W Barcelona because we stayed in many W worldwide and had good experiences. Well, not with W Barcelona. Our trip was planned on a short notice, April 21 to April 24 2011. We have booked two rooms through a booking agency site and our flight was early in the morning. With the confirmation in our hands we have arrived early in the morning to the reception. We just wanted to leave our luggage there and heading to the city. When we wanted to check in we were told that the hotel was fully booked and that this supposed to be not their fault, but the fault of the agency. We have told the person on the reception, that we have a confirmation and we would like to have a room, or they should rebook us to an equal hotel. They said no and just left us standing there. We tried to talk to several persons, respectively asked for the responsible manager, but we were just left standing there. Next in line. Who cares whether you have a room or not, we are fully booked. We had a kid with us, so the whole situation was a bit difficult. We then called up our agency and they were already aware of the whole situation and trying to figure it out. Apparently W has not closed their booking system for agency although they were already fully booked. So who’s fault was it now? After more than 30 minutes our agency called us saying W is not willing to help at all. Also, Barcelona seemed to be booked out at that day so we couldn’t find any other hotel to stay. I then decided to call up American Express Centurion Card, as I am a member and owner of the card there. And suddenly (after almost 2 hours) something happened. I got introduced to a lady who took care of the whole situation. She asked us to come back in a few hours and she will see what she could do. When we arrived back in the hotel we had our rooms. We are still wondering how a fully booked hotel could (after a few hours) managed to have 2 rooms. We were very disappointed about the whole situation. A 5 star hotel, but no services at all. Staff just rude, until the responsible lady came. We are planning another trip to Barcelona….and we loved the view of the W Barcelona and the service of other Ws. But with our experience we really are not sure whether to return or not.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: Amazing. You must stay at this hotel. My girlfriend and I have just landed back in the UK with huge smiles on our faces and some special memories. W Barcelona is stunning. I booked 2 nights to celebrate my girlfriends 30th birthday and the hotel did not disappoint. Don’t get me wrong, the lovely city of Barcelona helped with the celebrations, but W Barcelona was the icing on the cake. Could I write anymore words that reflect our happiness? I could, but I’m sure you catch my drift by now. We arrived to a huge smile on the face of ‘Chavvy’ behind the reception desk who made is feel at ease within the first few minutes of our arrival. We were escorted to our room and the promise of breathtaking views didn’t disappoint, we would have been happy enough to lie on the bed and watch the sea crashing against the beach, the views of the city spectacular. The complimentary birthday cake the only thing to take us away from watching the world go by from the huge floor to ceiling window. My only complaint is that everyone is just so good looking. Visit this hotel, it is worth every penny. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ricardrb
