Reviews.Content: This Barcelona hotel offers a unique service and views in the city. In the first offer friendly service, fresh and modern without forgetting the luxury of Starwood. And the views, seeing the photos of the hotel there is nothing to say. Hotel rooms are not very big but very comfortable, nice and modern. The hotel has several restaurants, bars, swimming pool, even a club on the 25th floor. If you like the new type of luxury without excess of date, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & a fantastic view from the bar!”
Reviews.Author: celticgirlLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 4 nights when Barca was in the middle of a cold snap - everyone kept telling us it was never that cold. You have to check out the Eclipse bar on the 26th floor, the cocktails are great to go with the view, coming from London the prices were very reasonable. Have a meal in the Bravo restaurant as well, it's well worth the prices with a great welcome platter, I can recommend the crispy pork main as well. All the staff we came across and interacted with were friendly and helpful with even the smallest question or request. The view from the room was stunning - the only downside was the bathroom set up - there isn't a lot of privacy which wasn't ideal when travelling with a friend rather than a partner. One surprise was the lack of free wifi - I have stayed in many hotels in less developed countries which include this throughout the hotel (with or without a password) and expected a hotel like this to have such a simple service.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me!”
Reviews.Author: Franktravelstheworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. I can see why some people may like it. Striking architecture, very modern. It wasn't however for me. The staff had no class. And the whole feel of the place was that it was too trendy, when in fact most of the guests were merely vulgar

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- good service and lovely food”
Reviews.Author: upperdeckplease
Reviews.Content: Cocktails in the Eclipse bar/nightclub are 12 Euros each- mixed with such panache they are great value; every room, and I am here with a conference of over 200 people, each with their own room, is lovely, with a view of the Med and/or the harbour. The food is superb and the staff friendly. Don't expect Ritz Carlton style service (there are 473 rooms after all) but at our dinner tonight (a conference) the waiter introduced herself by name, the food was good, and the service seamless and swift. Good conference hotel but I will come back on my own money as I found the service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: AndreyK3
Reviews.Content: Great hotel , friendly staff ( from front desk to all other depts. ) Its little bit far from transportation ( about 10-15 min by walk) but each room have fantastic view. I had one with cruise ships going in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: HopesandDreams
Reviews.Content: Full of contemporary design, this W says WOW. Yes, the ambience is young, fresh and hip. Is not that the brand? This was our 4th 5 star Starwood property during our trip, and is was a refreshing contrast to the usual “luxury” experience. Unlike what others have reported, our check-in was quick, greeted immediately, showed to our room with professionalism, and had a small glitch in the room corrected within minutes of our arrival. We stayed in a Mega room, which is a corner room, and had the additional of a tub with a slightly different layout and a partial port/city view. The difference between the Wonderful room and Fabulous room is the view, not the layout. Wonderful rooms are on one side of the hotel, odd numbered, and face the port, and Fabulous rooms are one the other side, even numbered and face the city/beach. I viewed several different room types, from Wonderful rooms to Marvelous Suite, and they were all great. The higher up, the better the view, but all views are mesmerizing. And the beds . . . . .ummmm, I am looking for that pillow top for my bed! Great rain shower but, ok, the smoky glass toilet situation is a bit “intimate”. We had two drinks in the Eclipse bar, enjoyed the view and 35 Euros later were back in our rooms. Yes to get to the bar, they monitor the elevator entrance, which I believe is more to monitor the # of patrons, than to exclude people, as the bar is small. The gym is one of the best I have seen in a hotel. We used the Concierge to buy tickets for an event, and to help us with our planning, with no problems. Yes, everything cost in this hotel, be prepared (but if you are thrifty, there is a grocery store right up the beach). Yes, the location is not in the middle of Barcelona, which is a good thing. It is actually a landmark seen from many locations throughout the city. But that is what makes it special. It is an oasis - that can easily be reached by taxi, or a 20 - 30 minute walk to central. Or the 17 Bus, right in front of the hotel, which is a 10-15 minute ride up Via Laietana, to City Central, (Placa Calaluya) continuing on up Passeig de Gracia, placing most major sites within (jump on and off ) walking distance. As a first time visitor, we used the bus to get everywhere, not the metro and saw all the major sites. It is also nice that the Bus originates in front of the Hotel, so you can get yourself "situated" on the bus without the concern of the notorious metro Barcelona pickpockets watching your moves. We also used the bus to take us to City Center to catch the airport bus, saving ourselves a few pennies. We checked out the Le Meridien, and the atmosphere was totally different, more the typical "quiet and reserved" feel. The W was buzzing with energy everywhere, is well noted, (when we arrived in the City, the Taxi driver said we were staying in the best hotel in the city) and is a beachfront escape - first time to Barcelona or last time to Barcelona, this is the right choice! Refreshing!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hayley H
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed hgere for a night before we set off on our cruise. The hotel and rooms are gorgeous especially the rooms over looking the beach. they are very spacious and comfortable. Beware the mini bar and hotel drinks are on the pricey side but i suppose thats the premium you pay for staying in such a superb location. Would most definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Jeff f
Reviews.Content: First time in town, luckily booked the W. Great place with decor location and ambience.Great staff very helpfull and always smiling. Pamela was great helping us in all our plannings. Thank you to all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: yesbutno
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W hotel for 3 nights in jan...lovely lovely lovely, cant fault it really, the rooms were fab with fab views. within walking distance to the old town but recommend good walking shoes! Restaurant food lovely but not a lot and expensive! overall great weekend but pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Best 2 nights of my life so far...”
Reviews.Author: donhush
Reviews.Content: I proposed to my girlfriend at the W hotel in Barcelona and it was the best decision I ever made. First I got a complimentary upgrade to a corner suite. The staff and I were able to plan a surprise dinner for 2 in my room for my girlfriend with a dinning table and candle light, it was awesome. Later that night, we got a complimentary table reservation at their rooftop bar with complimentary drinks to congratulate. Now can you fault that, it was magnificent The service was the best, the rooms are unique just like other W hotels I have stayed. Its in a perfect location. The beds are very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “OMG, the View!”
Reviews.Author: mdpoet
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel, newly built just last year (or the year before), owns the peninsula it sits upon. And because it's a peninsula, you have a sea-worthy view from every room. But my recommendation is to get a room that faces the beach. You can use the automatic shade openers to let in the amount of light you want, the in-room binoculars to get a closer look at the beach action, or just sit back and be enveloped in a very blue sky. It's a bit of a walk down the peninsula into town, but you're walking on the boardwalk, so who cares! W Hotels, true to its Starwood ownership, always has good workout facilities. But the W Barcelona has stunning workout facilities. Truly stunning, in both equipment, size of room and views! One could actually never leave the hotel, and its slick, contemporary spaces.. but alas, Bari Gothic and the Mercado call.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon heaven”
Reviews.Author: Jnacb427
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all of our expectations from the moment we saw the "W" standing tall, getting off the subway. The location is amazing!!! Right on the beach and just a short bus ride to anywhere you would want to go in Barcelona. The staff was incredibly friendly & helpful and made you feel like royalty. We were given complimentary chocolates and a note congratulating us on our marriage and an upgraded room with an incredible view. If you can afford it, even just for one night...stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Nights”
Reviews.Author: Malaryan
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels ever. Had an amazing unforgettable nights, i highly recommend it, and if ever go again i would definitely choose the same hotel! - The Rooms: very simple, modern and cozy. - The Spa (Bliss): is definitely a must, very cozy and friendly staff. - Their conceirge services were amazing, and exteremly helpful during my trip specially for non-spanish speakrs. - Location, specially for summer season and beach activities. - Mamarosa: a restaurant right beside the W Hotel. Delicious food, Light pizza, and very-well decorated place.

Reviews.Title: “The view is amazing”
Reviews.Author: jinw4672rx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure to stay at this amazing location when we were in barcelona. the view of this hotel is amazing when you first walk into your room but it looks even better the next morning when you wake up. the location of the hotel is great because it has its own private beach but is filled with other guests. It is close to the tourist boardwalk where people get to try different sea foods and gelatos. There are also bike to rent, it looked like a lot of fun but I did not figure out how to rent one since the instructions are in spanish. The most amazing dinner of my life was at Passadis del Pep, which is located 10 mins walk away from the hotel. The restaurant is just fantastic...I will not say more but only that it made my decision to retire in Spain...my wife also agrees.

Reviews.Title: “"W"ow what a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CBM1969
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is amazing the service, the friendly staff, the rooms, the breakfast, the food wow! We were taking a cruise from Barcelona and decided to stay in the W the night before parking our car there for the duration. Upon arrival our car was parked for us and our luggage taken to our room. We booked a wonderful room which had floor to ceiling glass looking out to sea the room was extremely spacious and the sofa situated in front of the window was a wonderful place to sit and read or just enjoy the view. The hotel is situated on Barcelona's seafront and in easy walking distance of restaurants and bars. We ate in the Wave restaurant having looked at the other option and found them to be ridiculously priced but we were not disappointed. We ordered breakfast in our room which was amazing if a little expensive but if you can afford it, it is definitely worth the treat we even took a picture of our teabags as they were so amazing! However, I must say the light show in the room was a disappointment as it consisted of a light tower in the corner of the room with a piece of plastic hanging above it. You needed to change the colour using the control and the weird piece of plastic did nothing to reflect the light and was almost comical! On returning to the hotel after our cruise to collect our car they brought the car to the main entrance and even removed our rubbish (cans etc) before handing us the keys. Now that's what I call service. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A_M_A_Z_I_N_G stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: prescriptiondog
Reviews.Content: We went for a long weekend to catch up on some sun in January and decided to treat ourselves to some luxury at the W. The stay was flawless from start till end. The check in quick and efficient. We were allocated a room on the 22nd floor with the city and sea view, just jawdropping and it made it difficult for us to leave the room to actually explore the town! The room was huge with an amazingly comfortable bed in the middle facing the view. The window also had a continuous sofa all along to lounge and enjoy the view. The bathroom is open to the room and can be seen by some visitors as not very intimate, but we had no issue with it. Also always great as usual in the W are the bliss toiletries. The breakfast at the Bravo restaurant was plentiful with anything you can wish for. Eggs and other hot food made to order. Great yoghurts, fruit juices, tomato juice, milkshakes, pastries, cereals ... want to go back for breakfast now! Service also commendable. The other public areas of the hotel were also great, lounge and living room with free wi-fi and a DJ in the living room in the evenings. Great club also on he 26th floor with parties almost every night. The gym is also probably the best I have ever experienced in a 5-star hotel, great views across the beach while running on the treadmill and a sauna afterwards. The business centre also has Wired, PCs with free internet and for business customers/groups a huge array of meeting rooms. Location, yes it is not right next to the bustle of Las Rambla, but I do see that as a bonus as after a full day of Barcelona life, you can return to the hotel and relax. The walk is only a good 15minutes or just take a cab. All in all, best hotel stay ever for me and I wish I could return tomorrow! Hope the review helps other customers and they enjoy the hotel as much as I did!

Reviews.Title: “waow”
Reviews.Author: juan g
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights after the end of a cruise. The hotel was reasonably priced and in a great location, within walking distance to many restaurants, casino, beaches. we found a nice little cafe just outside next to the hotel where coffee, water and breakfast was a lot cheaper. We got on the hop on - hop off bus right there. They have an amazing roof top pool that we spent a couple of afternoons on. There is a bar up there and you have a great view of the ocean. They don't know how to make a dirty martini there so don't order one of those. We had a great time in Barcelona - lots to do there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, views, service”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorTriple
Reviews.Content: The biggest concern I had before visiting Barcelona was the location of the W Hotel. The location is great. Taxis are readily available, there are local buses that terminate service in front the hotel, and the beach boardwalk right out the front door. My typical taxi rides to/from the hotel to the immediate area averaged around 10 Euro. I have read previous reviews where people indicated that the service was not great. I did not experience any bad service during my visit. My check in took less than 5 minutes, and I had staff from the Whatever/Whenever team stop by my room daily to see if I had any request. My only con is that when my wife I ate breakfast in Wave once during our visit, the price was high. Our tab was over $60 Euro for the two of us. There are plenty of restaurants in the surrounding area, so try the local restaurants. All the views are from the hotel are great, but my preference would be to have a room that faces the beach.

Reviews.Title: “When Barcelona has take all your energy, Let W bring it all back!”
Reviews.Author: Nickerns
Reviews.Content: At the end of the beach, lies a hotel that looks like a sail. Its majestic appearance remind you more of a futuristic boat that is permanent docked. At the entrées you will be greeted by futuristic FBI agents, the lobby and the interior is some of the most cutting edge I have ever seen in a hotel. Sleek, clean and open. But not sterile like a doctors office, warm and inviting, it feels like you have stepped in to the front page of Wallpaper magazine. This is what the W hotel is aiming for, a “futuristic safe haven” in a busy and sometimes dangerous city. After sampling Barcelona you can sometime feel that you need a extra break just to come back to the real world. The late night dinning, nightclubs that never close, shop’s that will leave you spent and more tourists and posers then most places. After you have sampled all of this the antidote is right in front of you, shining at the end of Barcelonetta Beach with it glass sail. Take the last couple of your days there, check in to a Wow room and let the staff and the chefs pamper you with some luxury, lets face it, we all need to get away every now and then and the W will let you hide away. I am not going to lie and say that it is a cheap hotel because it is not. But it doesn't cost more then the average hotel in any metropolitan city, if you compare what you get for your money the W Hotel delivers ten times what you would get from any other metropolitan hotel. I decided I needed some rest when I came there. My last nights in Barcelona. I feet that I had deserved something special. It felt more like sleeping on a luxury cruse liner then at a hotel. The bed rocked me in to a tranquil sleep. The view from my room at the 17th floor was probably the best view you can get anywhere in Barcelona unless you go up to Tibodabo and look down at the city. The sun was shining in my window all day, the sunsets where there to make romantic dinners in the room. The food was fantastic, I can recommend a burger, something simple, and the ham. For me aesthetics and interior counts for a lot, as a photographer there was a picture in every corner of the hotel and with the light, even the simplest of photos taken with a iPhone looks professional. So what is my conclusion: If you are going to Barcelona for a weekend I would definitely save up the money to stay at the W, it might not be the place to spend two weeks (unless you come from money) But if you are looking for a place for the last days of your holiday or a long weekend I can with my “hand on my heart” say that you will have a challenge finding a better value for your money then the W Hotel. Like I say with my photography: It is all in the details! And that is exactly what they deliver in the W hotel. Enjoy:-) Nicholas Anthony Martin

Reviews.Title: “If you like to party, this is the place. If you´re not...”
Reviews.Author: Alexandralves
Reviews.Content: I said to one of the employees that W Hotel it´s 24hrs party time. And he answered: This is W Barcelona. It defines properly what this hotel is: music, young people, and beach (even in the winter). I didn´t even see families or children (actually, I thought a little inappropriate for children. The hallways, for instance, is surrounded by glass). The staff was kind in every situation (when I asked for sheets, room service, transportation, check in, check out). The rooms were huge and with a great view, even you stay in lower levels. The beds were amazing. I didn´t like the bathroom, though. I don´t like this new way to project them, with no separation from the bedroom. Knowing that the hotel can be a little loud, I asked for rooms in a silent position. I could hear a little noise during the night, coming from the lounge (where there´s a dj and a bar), but nothing that kept me awake. There are two spaces to serve breakfast, one by the lobby, cheaper (25 euros) but not with many options. There is other, in the first level that costs 32 and it´s much more complete. If you don´t like to have breakfast in the hotel, you can always go somewhere else (there are Starbucks in every corner in Barcelona), but there aren´t many options around the hotel, since it´s a recent and new area (Barceloneta it´s the nearest place with restaurants, and it´s a 15min walk, by the beach). The business center it´s too small for a hotel this big and it´s always busy. But you can use the free wi-fi in the lobby (in the room it´s 5 euros/hour). I didn´t go the Eclipse disco, but I could see a lot of people going (young and also old), very nice dressed. But I don´t know, it seemed a very touristic and expensive nightclub. There´s a beach by the hotel, and a few meters away there´s a nudity point. It was nice to stay in this hotel and know why it´s so trendy, but I don´t know if I would stay there again... Well, I´m not a party girl!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Sublime, Great views, and service.”
Reviews.Author: Epfeagles
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is pristine, The Staff very helpful and curtious. Very attentive to the guests at all times. The lobby is amazing and the decor modern and chic. Is a great place to go with friends. The hotal has the option of a hoping nightlife with the Bar/ nightclub on the 26 floor. From the Hotel great views of the coast, as well as the old city center of Barcelona. THe one downside is it is a 15 -20 minute walk to the city center. Hotel is right on the water so a stay here can be very relaxing with the resort atmosphere in place. In my view it is the best hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice concept, good looking but.....”
Reviews.Author: Sophie D
Reviews.Content: We spend few days in Barcelona to celebrate new years' eve. Hotel is very impressive, i loved the style. Contemporary, abercrombie and fitch generation. Personnel was extremely friendly and helpfull, our room was splendid, nice view on the sea. Firework superb. Minus (big one for that categorie of price): room was dirty, after roomservice there were still dirty glasses in rooms and empty bottles, couch in front of window was not cleaned and litter not empty. Sorry not acceptable for that kind of hotel. I don't think it's a clever strategy to only take care of the looks. I also missed a bath, only shower in room. So room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, awesome views”
Reviews.Author: Calker71
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay here with my partner on a work trip - a treat not business, the room was beautifully done with killer views The pool area was delightful, staff were efficient, food fab...all at a price of course! I'm not sure I'd have chosen to stay here based on their standard room rates if I was paying but it is a lovely place We were in a large group and everyone enjoyed their stay, some did have a bit of trouble walking home one night but that's not the hotel's issue it's Barcelona! I'd definitely stay again-awesome beds

Reviews.Title: “Great view & room!”
Reviews.Author: shawbee99
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in a Wonderful Room on 11th floor facing the sea wall. The layout of the room was great, very well thought out. I especially liked how the different lighting themes as well as the curtains could be controlled by the bedside switch panels. Good quality Bliss amenities as well as a decently stocked mini bar and of course the fantastic bed and linens. The large walk in rain shower with moveable seating bench was also a great feature. The main issue with this hotel surrounded the staffing levels. In the evenings, it regularly took over 30 minutes of repeatedly calling to get anyone (Operator, front desk, Whatever Whenever, Room Service) to answer. Their excuse was that it was peak time for room service so everyone was busy. I have never experienced such a hassle in getting someone on the phone to place an order or make another request. However, once the order was received the food was delivered quick and was of high quality. There was also an issue with getting clean glassware in the room on a daily basis. They would always take away the dirty glasses but forgot to return with clean ones. The location was peaceful, a pleasant walk during the day to the metro (20 minutes) or Las Ramblas (30 minutes). Taxis also are always up front and are affordable to most parts of city. It might be worthwhile to carry a note-card or other indicator of the hotel location as more than one taxi driver in the City did not know the location of the hotel when we were trying to get home, and if you are not able to give directions it could be a problem. There are a number of ongoing construction projects underway nearby the hotel, it will be interesting to return in a couple of years to see what has been developed in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay!”
Reviews.Author: friaz
Reviews.Content: I would like to comment how pleased I was with the service provided to me by your team members, Alfredo, Lisandro, Yan Ting and Ernesto and of course everyone in the Business Center. During my recent trip I was fortunate enough to stay at Palace Hotel. Even being a Starwood rate customer, Alfredo made sure everything was good at the time of check in helped us with acomodations at the hotel. Lisandro and Ernesto in Concierge always sugested great places to visit and restaurant and very fluent in English to help us understand and guide us through. This hotel was good, but a little off to a side from the center city. It clean and well-maintained hotel - it actually has a lovely interior, however, we had plumbing issues and the hotel has been open for only a year or so... Shower had less pressure and sink drain was becoming a pool. Really friendly staff member Saif-ul who guided us through the area and since we are vegetarians, he was very helpful on the places to eat and visit. He went above and beyond to help us have a good stay at the W Hotel. He truly is an asset to the hotel. My husband and I wanted to make sure that Hotel's senior management is aware of his dedication. Meeting Saif-ul was the best thing that happened to us in W Hotel Barcelona. Definetly ask for him for guidance and assistance!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danstrai
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. Pool area is perfect, beautiful location / setting and right beside the each. staff are attentive and service s excellent. Rooms are designed to a high standard and always ask for a sea view / city view room. The bar on the top floor can get lively and is always busy. Overall you need deep pockets to stay here but this hotel does cater for it's client well.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: aepple_01
Reviews.Content: I love this city and hotel you get a big city and the beach all in one. The hotel is modern with a great shower and great serice. My wife and I made a whole day just laying out at the pool drinking estrella damm and food. DA GRECO is the best place to eat in barcelona. We checked out the picasso museum and gaudi park and the church we took the train from madrid which was nice

Reviews.Title: “Xmas week @W BCN”
Reviews.Author: Vladislav_Shulga
Reviews.Content: We have spent 1 week after Xmas @ W BCN. Good points are: - fabulous views (esp. from "fabulous" rooms) - an excellent point to enjoy sunsets and sun rising from a comfortable sofa next to large windows overlooking the port, Montjuic, the seaside. - nice decor of the rooms, and overall of the hotel - a fantastic experience @ Bliss spa (massage and facial for my wife) - friendly management of the Hotel Still would like to mention some things that could be better or might be improved: - we have ordered a baby crib in advance, however we have had to remind twice untill it was delivered late in the evening (1st time the housekeeping has brought an additional bed for an adult). Moreover, the crib was just empty, and the housekeeping did not provide us with the bed sheets for the crib. - the rooms doors are extremely difficult to open (esp when you are with the baby trolley) - no shoe polish in the room, no tea / coffee machine either - a day before our departure @ 10 pm we received a call from the reception desk, asking us to come down and place additional money to our deposit. The lady was very persistent, telling us that she was trying to reach us for 2 days (however we have not got any text message, nor telephone calls the day before, when we even did not leave the room). - the choice of the inroom dining menu is rather poor, not so many "healthy" items to order - one day we ordered a black tea and rice water to the room (my wife got poisoned), and they have charged 15 euros, which is too much to my mind for such kind of service, especially if a guest orders 1-2 times a day with an average bill of 70-100 euros. - a door in the lobby toilet (male) was broken, and could not be open from inside. The management was aware, but nobody even printed a message on the door to prevent the hotel guests

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: jacqvan
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel with amazing view. Good service, nice staff, good coktails, very good breakfast. Far form the town center but taxi are cheaper in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: docrick
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Amazing location and the views are breathtaking. Pool small but adequate, decent pool side service. Gym is fabulous. The breakfast is huge and is on till late. We always miss breakfast as we wake up late on our holidays but not here. The waitress would make lovely smoothies for my young daughter. It's feels a bit away from the city centre but it is walkable or a short taxi ride away. The beach is amazing but beware of the nudity. Takes far too long to check in and there was a lot of confusion Concierge was very helpful in booking a cooking class for the wife. We are already planning our next trip. Plenty

Reviews.Title: “Bad aircondition killed the mood”
Reviews.Author: Pieguz
Reviews.Content: I have staied in the W hotel for 1 week. I must say that the first impression is great: fantastic location, nice rooms, glass walls in the toilet are not something that you want to se in a shared room on a busienss trip, but oh well... adventure, food was nice, everything was promissing. After 3 days my skin got red and I started to have a bad cough... as well as other people from my company who had staied there for longer than 3 days... really, in this type of otels it should not happen... Service was denecnt, but not fantastic. The most frustrating thing was to discover one day that during cleaning room service dropped my collegue and mine cosmetics into one basket... they were standing separately on to sides of the sink...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous trendy design hotel !”
Reviews.Author: JulienF
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the W Barcelona. WoW experience ! I loved it ! *Nice big room /// Nice lobby /// Nice wonderbar in the lobby *Free unlimited wifi in the lobby *10 minutes walk to reach La Barceloneta /// 15 minutes walk to reach La Barceloneta subway *In La Barceloneta neighborhood, you have many restos, bars and convenience stores *Bus #17 is stopping on Moll Oriental street in front of the hotel to reach La Barceloneta subway within 5 minutes or 10 minutes to Urquinaona‎ subway If you want a nice trendy hotel in Barcelona, it's the place for you ! Only negative point it's a bit far from everything, so you have to take a taxi or walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous.....”
Reviews.Author: bobbyzj2
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, modern, edgy, sophisticated, everything you expect in W.(and we have been to many of them) And all without any of the attitude found in many other hip-chic hotels. This hotel with striking architecture has a great view overlooking the ocean,beach next door,great pool,very attentive service, bar and gym, fantastic location close to many restaurants and bars and not far from the city center. Not to mention some of the Barcelona's most attractive men and women to be found.Will for sure be back in the summer for pool and beach time.

Reviews.Title: “What a view and top notch service”
Reviews.Author: Dale C
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th visit to this wonderful city and my 1st stay at the W. I was a little nervous about staying over on the newly redeveloped La Barceloneta area on the beach. My reservations were dispelled even before I got there as this area is lovely with many restaurants, bars and the beach for being right in the city is wonderful. I would love to spend a few days here in summer when everything must be full swing. The design of the hotel is so captivating, the room was very larger and the view amazing over the beach and city. The service level was 5 star and friendly, if you have stayed at W hotels you will not be dissappionted.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax by the pool”
Reviews.Author: Kimalt
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to just relax by the pool or the ocean this is your hotel. Great food and drinks by the pool. Service was 5 star all the way. Loved this place and will stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic and very good”
Reviews.Author: George_Lodge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W during a long weekend in November and were very impressed with the entire experience from check-in to check-out. The room (a corner suite with marvellous views overlooking the ocean on one side and the beach on the other) was an excellent example of modern chic, although having a (large) bath-tub taking up one wall of the bedroom part was a bit surprising. The restaurants were both excellent, although the "Wave" on the ground floor was rather noisy as the entire bar area (most of the floor) was utterly swamped with elegant young people out on the town, many of whom seemed to be there for the discothèque whose entrance is via the ground floor. Service was impeccable in the "Bravo" restaurant, but housekeeping left a lot to be desired - we found an empty can of RedBull in the mini-bar upon arrival, the champagne was not replaced after our use of it, and a very insistent chap three times interrupted our bath with the news that he was there at our request to repair the television (we had made no such request). By contrast, the front desks were both quite excellent, and the spa sublime. Assuming our housekeeping experience was a one-off, highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: John J
Reviews.Content: From check in to departure, the room the service everything was incredible! Room service especially Carlos was so attentive and helpful definitely a star in tht team. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Super swank if you're feeling super hip”
Reviews.Author: HouTexTravel
Reviews.Content: No doubt this is a very nice place. Super nice. Rooms are a little odd (even very-nice rooms have showers (no bath) whose shower doors open directly into the main part of the room, for example). Location is unbeatable -- it's near the main Barcelona beach. The pool is a super-chic looking area -- so chic that you can't move your lounge chair (it'd spoil the look). It's the kind of place where you feel like you ought to dress nice and look good just to walk through the lobby, get breakfast or go to the pool. I'd go back, even at the expensive price level, but only as a couple and only assuming my 'date' was okay with the W-hipster style.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Barcelona (thought expensive)”
Reviews.Author: kazikss
Reviews.Content: I was staying in W hotel cause my company had a EMEA summit there (I couldn't afford it on my own obviously), and I'd recomend it to anybody having enogh cash (and will to spend it on hotel). The view from rooms (try to be on top floors) is astonishing. Everything is new and best quality, breakfasts are top quality too. The service is nice and helpfull. There's nothing I acctualy can complain about the hotel (the orgnanizational side of the summit was also well prepared from my point of view). Hotel is not so close to the main area as possible (you can find closer hotels which has its prons and cons) but the La'Rambla Square (the one with Cristopher Columbus) is like 20 to 30 minutes of walk away only, on the other hand beach is right at your feet (and so is the fenicular to hills over Barcelona).

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not great!”
Reviews.Author: Geni1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed there before our cruise and it was wonderful and they gave us an amazing room! Then when we stayed there after our cruise they treated us terribly! I was so disappointed, we were so tired and needed to eat and they refused to seat us at the main restaurant. We asked for assistance an no one would help us! I was in shock by the disrespect they had for dedicated guests. We have stayed at the W hotels all over America and trusted the one in Barcelona, Spain would be as wonderful. It apparently was not. We were so upset and would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Anoniem888
Reviews.Content: Everything was really nice! I'm just fall in love with the sea view of our room. Thanks Valentina and Claudia for the suprise and your help! It was an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe just a tad too cool”
Reviews.Author: Will E
Reviews.Content: Incredible building in an incredible location - and the rooms are quite amazing. Floor to ceiling glass with an amazing view of the ocean. Electric curtains - woot! Very comfy and luxurious Egyptian cotton too. Fabulous gym and very good reception staff who could not do enough. That's the good stuff. Food in the Wave restaurant was a big let down. Poor quality, unseasoned and uber expensive for what it was. Jamón ibérico was tough and tasteless - for 28 Euros. Halls are dark and the piped music is so loud it comes into your room. Small unexplained charges have appeared on my credit card statement which is a big turn off. Air con was ineffective (as usual in glass towers). Worth a trip - and definitely worth going back tt for the room and location. But i'd only stay the one night and i'd eat out another time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fabian53
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8:00 am on November 15th after a long 8 hr flight from the us. We took a taxi to the W Barcelona and were immediately allowed to check in. I asked if we could get upgraded to an ocean view on a higher floor and they immediately granted our request. The room had a great ocean view of the surfers and the pool area. Unfortunately it was raining was we just stayed at the hotel and ended up eating at the bar for dinner. We had booked this room on price line.com and we were very pleased with this hotel. We got a great price and the staff went out of their way to make our syat very enjoyable. They even leant us a converter which I greatly appreciated. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The front staff were very pleasant, the bellboys were great and the bar staff and servers were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, room, bar, and design with a small ‘but’”
Reviews.Author: ClientServiceExpert
Reviews.Content: Fantastic view from high floors. Beautiful lobby. Great bar on top floor. Wifi in the room. Room: spacious, huge windows, great modern and very cool design BUT: air-conditioning in the room just did not work. It kept changing from +30 (Celsius) to very cold and eventually had to be switched on manually by the maintenance department, with significant delay. Sweating, I demanded half the room price back (demand was satisfied). I hope the hotel managed to fix the AC issue – provided that, I would gladly recommend it to anyone for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Modern chic hotel with great touches and maybe too much American thinking!”
Reviews.Author: montemb14
Reviews.Content: Lovely room but confusing overly 'clever' hotel guide that failed to tell us much about the hotel and zero about the area. Very modern styling which almost worked - but has a US feel to the room and general information. Eg nowhere any reference to restaurants or prices

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at W Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: 2worldtravelersnj
Reviews.Content: 4 Nights on partial points and cash with wife while in Barcelona on vacation. Given corner room on 14th floor with partial city and water views which were stunning! We scheduled a pick up through the hotel in a Mercedes S Class which was nice to start off the trip. Check in was a breeze although they did not have separate lines for SPG Members, just "Q" up with the everyone and wait your turn. They recognized my status and thanked me for being a valued member. Room was a king corner room on 14th floor, 2 flat panel TV"s which we didn't even turn on, stunning views of city and Mediterranean Sea, separate water closet and shower area with rainfall shower head, double vanity, workspace, tub in bedroom against a full mirrored wall.......hum :) Lighting takes a lot of getting used to, we are still trying to figure out all th buttons and we are home a week already. Nice mood lighting, subtle but ample. Mini refrigerator and bar, plenty of closet space. Gym was really nice, large great views, plenty of top notch gear and fairly empty. Nice dry saunas in men's and women's room as well BLISS SPa on property which we used for reflexology. The BLISS Spa as always is top notch and we really enjoyed using those facilities but be prepared to pay as it is not cheap. Ordered up room service once for 2 Caesar salads with chicken and they were outstanding but not cheap. Again, be prepared to pay here. The location is a bit of a walk from anything but we liked that. We liked the remoteness of it. There is bus transport just outside the hotel so getting into the city for the sights is a breeze and plenty of taxi's if you so choose. We walked a lot so never needed a taxi but did use the bus which was easy and affordable. Had cocktails in the lounge downstairs one night, very chic and modern, plenty of pretty people here for sure. All in all, great stay and would not only recommend but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a capital "L"”
Reviews.Author: Lyndon B
Reviews.Content: On booking our first ever trip to Spain this past weekend. We reserched heavily ( thanks TripAdvisor ) in where to go Madrid or Barcelona. It finally came down to a flip of a coin and Barcelona came up heads. Where to stay? the Old style or the New. I was told the W Barcelona is seen as the Burj of Europe and we were not disappionted. There central booking system was easy and our booking was hazzle free. One thing, their website does not do them justice, if only they could create the atmosphere we enjoyed. They arranged a wonderful guy to pick us up (although we would of loved the guy to speak a few more words of English as my Spanish is a bit textbook). The welcome was a little corporate and there was an intial mix up with our booking at the desk (they thought we were with a conference). We had chosen a Spectacular Suite on the 21st floor and it was.. the outside terrace was perfect and we slept with the window open (70 degrees even in Novemeber). We never ventured outside the room on the first night and just enjoyed the view and the vast variety of food on the room service menu..the W chicken Salad is a must..acompained by dinky bottles of olive oil. Concierge were so informative and we managed to pack in all the sites and some off beat areas aswell and boy did i"ll feet hurt.. but it was worth it. The Bar on the ground floor was always bussing with the beautiful people of Barcelona and Bravo restaurant served some seriously fresh fish and some interesting wines. Such a stunning hotel.. but hate to think what it will be like in the height of Summer..try it in the off peak season ..Will we return? a definite YES

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: mebooandbeags
Reviews.Content: A very cool hotel with a great location, we stayed in the cool corner suite which was amazing. The only problem with this place is that it is very expensive, nothing is included in the room so the costs mount up. It is however definitely worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Luxur hotel right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: traveller_constant
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights as part of a large business conference in May 2011. The hotel a very eye-catching skyscraper and is right on the beach on the Barceloneta boardwalk. I had a great room on the 16th floor which had a window couch with an amazing view of the harbour. Conference facilities were very good and the hotel has an inviting outside pool and bar area with attentive staff. Overall I could not fault the hotel as a conference venue.

Reviews.Title: “Occasional attention to detail deficit”
Reviews.Author: silvercl0ud
Reviews.Content: Really stylish bar and dining area though lobby was suffering a little with chipped surfaces etc. Room was amazing on first sight but not on first smell. After a quick scout around - we found toys behind cushions, shoes under the bed and scattered bottle tops. Housekeeping was clearly not up to scratch that day. Although it was a non-smoking room – the previous guest obviously had quite a bad habit. As they were fully booked that weekend, all the hotel were able to do was spray our room on several occasions with some kind of chemical mist to try & rid the nicotine fug. It eventually worked after the second day. Despite the Do Not Disturb sign, housekeeping rapped our door several times at 7am on Sunday morning. When we didn't answer - we got the phone call telling up to open up. I was brusquely handed a small extra shower gel clearly meant for someone else's room. The bathroom facilities were a bit of a let down. Call me a hopeless romantic – but a frosted glass cubicle does not a bathroom make. Well, each to their own I suppose. That said – the bath products were far superior to the average hotel guest amenities. It's a bit far from town but he view from the room was absolutely incredible – facing up the beach and over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: alessandropado
Reviews.Content: A really nice stay. A large five stars hotel by the sea, at the end of Barceloneta's beach. Close to the city center and to the services. Large rooms but a small swimming pool. A stunning roof bar open by night!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bella”
Reviews.Author: abc025
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in W Barcelona for 3nights. My first impression was very good. The greeting at the door by concierge was great, check in went smoothly, they took my luggage into my room and i was shown how everything works in the room (eg. tv, shower, etc.) and i also got few great tips where to go for party or dinner. I was really impressed with the WHENEVER WHATEVER attitude by the staff, they could do no more for me. The hotel is located right on the beach which was a right thing for me as i didnt really want to stay in the hustle and bustle. I never used the public transport so i cant comment on this but the taxis are easily accessible and they get you to Ramlas in 10 mins for about 10 euros. I also used the facilities like spa which was great. The downstairs bar was very good, great cocktails and even better barmen. Once i ordered food in the restaurant that was lovely but second time i got my food delivered to my room i was not happy. It was very expensive and dissapointing for 5 star hotel. The room was beautiful and view was awsome even though i requested a beach view i got a view of harbour which was not so pretty. My bed was super comfy and remote switches next to the bed were very handy for closing and opening curtains and for the mood of the lights. All round the room and everything was great but shower is not great and really hard to work and if you are not a night bird you better bring ear plugs because you can hear the noise from eclipse club for whole night. Would i come back? Yes i would and im going to come back in summer because the pool area and bar look so great.

Reviews.Title: “Best W in the world”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel right on the beach . Exceptional views , great decor , fantastic service . Best W ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Take the smooth with the rough”
Reviews.Author: holidaytracker
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - comfy cozy beds - young, vibrant and edgy - friendly staff on the whole. Expensive, quite a walk from the centre (although public transport and taxis right outside) and we were surprised that a 5 star GL hotel does not include a cooked breakfast in the price for bed and breakfast - only continental - if you wanted cooked, an additional 7 Euros per person. Some other guests complained that breakfast was breakfast in most hotels except the W. The prices were well over the top - the Spar supermarket - a five minute walk was the best place to get water - 4 Euros for 500 mls in the room - 0.90 cents for a litre of the same water in the shop. We would have spent money there had the prices been more reasonable but as it was we ate out. Could not fault the view or the room - strange having a bathroom in the room sitting in an opaque toilet cubicle - good shower, plenty of hot water - some towels were very ropey and ripped on use due to being past their sell by dates really - not what would be expected at a hotel of that standard. Would we go back? No - would want to be more in the centre of Barcelona with everything close by. Top tip: Use the tour buses (get two day card) before you go anywhere, book the Sagrada Familia before you go - this means no queueing if you really want to go in which you should it's amazing, buy a multi transport ticket for the remaining days of your stay for 10 journeys. A great city to visit but you can't see it all in 4 days. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “first stay at W Barcelona....hoping to return soon!”
Reviews.Author: claudia_m17
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful and busy week of tourism in Madrid and Barcelona, all I wanted was some quality down-time in a sea-side location before returning to the London winter! I came across a special offer for the W and decided to go for it, as I had never before stayed at a W. After a quick and courteous check-in, we headed up to our room on the 18th floor and the first thing I did was run to the expansive window to take in the ocean view....absolutely breath-taking! Pure bliss. Even my young son took a moment to sit by the window and take it all in....just heavenly. Precisely what the doctor ordered! Other reviewers have commented on sub-par service and "attitude" from the staff. The only glitch I experienced was having to walk down to ask for an extra bed for my son, as my initial request (via phone) to the "whatever / whenever" desk went ignored. The guys at the reception were very friendly and we all had a good laugh when I encountered issues with my iPad & the hotel's wi-fi, which had all of us amusingly confused. (issue was resolved quickly) The food at "The Wave" was very good, despite the inflated prices-- but that's to be expected at a 5-star hotel. I'd like to point out that our server was very friendly and truly determined to provide the best service possible...a lovely Hungarian girl- apologies that I can't recall her name, but she was a delight! Thanks for a fantastic stay, W team-- here's hoping we meet again!

Reviews.Title: “One of my fav Ws !!!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic stay at this hotel. Because of my platinum membership, I was upgraded to a huge room facing the water!!! The room was absolutely amazing. I didn't even want to go out! The service/breakfast/gym/pool were outstanding! The only downside is the location which is not that central. But I will definitely stay there next time in Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: fj74582
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights in early November. The hotel is about two years old, so it's very modern. You have two restaurants to choose from and a wonderful lobby/bar area to hang out at. In addition there is a nice bar on the top floor that has an incredible view. It is located basically right in front of the beach, and the if you get a room facing the beach you will not be disappointed. Large comfortable rooms, with great service. If you don't mind walking to La Rambla which is about 15 minutes away on foot then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: jobo176
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! Everything was soooo perfect, from food to proximity of the beach. The service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms but standards have slipped”
Reviews.Author: AHI_234
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel W Barcelona on more than one occasion and in the past have really enjoyed my stay. However, my last trip was disappointing and I don’t know if I would book there again. The rooms are beautifully designed and furnished but a few things detracted from my stay and were definitely not what I would expect from a hotel of this standard and price. The room wasn’t cleaned properly on arrival; there were dirty marks on the mirror and documents left in the room from the previous occupier (a Management consult staying in the hotel for a conference). It was expensive to get wireless internet in the room and it didn’t work very well. The hairdryer in the room was of poor quality (low heat and power) and other things like the soaps and toiletries not being refreshed at all during my 3 night stay was also annoying given how expensive the room was. Next time I go to Barcelona I will try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing view with an horrible service”
Reviews.Author: jenesaispasqui
Reviews.Content: Well I've just spent a week in the W hotel in barcelona. The hotel itself is high-tech, with nice design and a dream view. The beds are really comfortable.. like sleeping on a cloud what breaks the charm is the service. in short: - I could get in my room only at 17h (I arrived at 14h). - I could not walk bear foot in my room, the carpet was too sticky - Room service was over cooked - laundry misplaced my pants I had big hopes, I left disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Came Highly Recommended..did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Michael E
Reviews.Content: Was referred to the W Barcelona via Jim the GM of the W Hollywood (I think he called and spoke to the GM in Barcelona ahead of me :)...was told i would be warmly recieved...car was right on time with w great driver who spoke perfect english (Oscar)...was a very informative drive to the hotel including what clubs i should visit during my trip... Was an early ck in so my room was not ready @ 730am but i completely understood....since they have a HUGE lobby and lobby bar/ restaurant i found plenty to do while i waitied....they are located next to the Marina and they had a boat exhibition going on so i went to visit the sights and had breakfast at a great little reastaurant accoss from the Marina...went back to the W and did some emails while waiting in the lobby... (god if i have one more person ask if they can help me...lol) My room was ready around 1030am and went up...was a bit small BUT had an amazing view which is what they thought i would prefer...made a quik call to Javier the Frt desk Mgr and within 5 mins i had a valet knocking on my door with new keys for a corner suite...all i can say is WOW...view was sick...room was spacious and living room was VERY comfy...i actually fell asleep on the 15ft couch my 1st night there....great amenities...internet was a breeze and maid service was quik and very thourough.... Room service was quik and very good...try the chicken wrap.. the hotel has several restaurants available to guests "under" the pool by the ocean...didnt have time to try them all..:( was a very quik trip..only 2 days...but i will be back in a month or so and will definately try again....the hotel is in a very casual area...not alot of high end shopping but that is a good thing for me as i can be very impulsive...lol have fun when you visit as i will again very soon Regarsd Mike

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, smart, trendy and chic (just a little rough on the small detail)”
Reviews.Author: loveluxurioushotels
Reviews.Content: If there was a 4.5* rating, I would have gone for it. Not because this hotel is not beautiful, nor uncomfortable because it was both of these things and more, but for the little niggles which I'll come to in due course. But first I'll start with the pro's... It's brand new and gleaming. The whole design of the hotel is super modern with the artistic feel that Barcelona is famous for. I particularly like the 'whatever whenever' concierge, who advised on everything from lending European phone adapters, to recommending the trendiest restaurants in town, and they dealt with all the bookings gracefully no matter how much we chopped and changed our minds. The spa was gorgeous (typically 5* pricey) shame no indoor pool for the winter months, but we enjoyed the lap-style jacuzzi and steam / sauna rooms to hang out and relax in, and couldn't fault the treatments, with the cool new york 'bliss' products.. and they didn't try to 'hard-sell' me anything at the end. Just try the infamous 'bliss brownie'! There were a number of bars and restaurants dotted in and around the hotel; the wet-deck being closed as we were out of the summer season, but from the rest the food was consistently good. The breakfast was lovely; typical buffet style with options to choose from for more specific dishes. I particularly liked that it was open until 11.30am on the weekends, so we could lie-in (an 11am during the week). The in-room dining was very nice, and we were permitted to eat restaurant food in the bar area at 11.40pm which was perfectly chilled. There is a top floor bar called Eclipse which appeared to be the place to be in Barcelona on a Friday and Saturday night. Hotel patrons get to skip the queue which is a nice touch, and there are loads of cocktails to choose from. The panoramic view of beaches, mountains and marina was only blighted by the abundance of middle-aged groping couples who cluttered the low sofas around the circumference of the bar. Had I been slightly older or perhaps just drunker, I may not have found this offensive at all. The most important point I've not referenced so far is the rooms, and in terms of design, they're first rate. Shiny opaque glass and soft cream curtains spanning areas where neither curtains nor glass are required (often just adding texture to bland walls). The bathtubs were conveniently located right next to the bed. Who needs a bathroom anyway? And there was a handy switch for 'wow' lighting which knocked out any conventional spotlights and replaced them with coloured mood lighting oozing from various parts of the furniture. NOTE: the light switch arrangement was not idiot proof and it was much a case of trial and error rather than intending to turn on specific lights. Only four switches to choose from and some of them did different things when pressed at different angles, while others needed to be in the 'on' position for the bathroom light switches to become responsive. Although enormously time consuming, it would have been useful for a member of staff to have shown us how to navigate the super hi-tech system upon arrival. That brings me to staffing; we waited TWENTY minutes in a queue to be checked in, where the bolshy European urbanista's pushed past us 'unsuspecting and far too British' tourists. There was no queue structure and it took an inordinate amount of time to process each person. When I asked if our room had a sea-view like we'd booked, the check-in guy merely said it was spacious like that was a bonus. We'd booked a suite, that was a given. So, we booked a 'Sea Facing' Studio Suite which I must say was luxurious for a couple, with separate lounge / office area, and totally open bathroom (bath next to bed). Based on the internals alone, we would have been very happy with this. However, the outlook of our particular room - (Suite 228) directly overlooked the adjacent building site. Builders were less than 5 metres away from me - on the same level. Not much good to have a bath right next to the window then?! Given 90% of the hotel has been built in a iconic 25 storey tall glass nautical shaped tower, it seemed that we had been abandoned on the second floor in the leftover space between the impressive six storey high lobby and the fire exit, in a totally separate block to the rest of the rooms. While the space and layout were impressive, the view was not. NOTE: If you go for this room type then ensure it truly is a sea-view, if it is even available. The staff were not helpful on this point, and certainly not quick to move us, but after a great deal of shouting we were promised an upgrade to a Cool Corner Suite the following day. This was worth waiting for. There are only two corners to this hotel (given the rear where we originally were is just for the lifts) and both have spectacular views across the harbour and out to sea. Ask for Suite 818 or in fact any Cool Corner Suite ending in '18' as they run all the way up to the 24th floor on the left hand side of the building. Spectacular views. The Cool Corner Suites are large, with walk through bathroom, enclosed wetroom style showers, lounge area and of course the feature bath next to the bed, which personally I love; no good if you're holidaying with your grandma though. This room faced directly out to sea and onto the beaches from the lounge. Of the notable differences in this room to the Studio Suite were the electronic blinds (just the curtains were electronic in the Studio Suite), more flatscreen televisions, a bigger bathtub, and an iphone charger. There may well have been more subtle touches too that we didn't notice. The signature 'W' beds are sumptuous. A note on the small detail. The sink drain in our first room smelt of sewage (just need a good flush out I'm told) and the mood lights had a tendency to flicker. Some of the sink and indeed bath plugs didn't lift / drain when we pulled at the lever, and the edging on some of the mirrors had blobs of glue all over them. Not a deal breaker, but if you look for it, there are signs of a little rough round the edges that shouldn't be prevalent in a hotel of the W's stature. Plus we couldn't hear room service knocking on the door because it wasn't that close to the bedroom area of the suite. Perhaps door bells would be useful? The only other negative is the location. It's not on the main shopping strip like the Majestic, in the touristy Ramblas, or by the bars / restaurants on the front like the Art Hotel, but out on a secluded man-made strip by the commercial docks. This is NOT a problem as 90% of the hotel rooms turn their back on the commercial stuff and the rest is very attractive to look at. If, like us, you fully intend to get taxi's everywhere, or stay by the pool / beach / hotel / restaurants on site, then no problemo. If, however you strive to walk everywhere and make full use of the city's public transport network, then perhaps bring your walking boots or think again. My views only. All in all a great hotel, and for me, I'd certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: PHR67
Reviews.Content: This five star hotel offers very well appointed rooms, with superbly comfortable beds, and an absolutely breathtaking view over the beaches of Barcaloneta. I was there as part of a rather big conference, and there were some capacity issues with elevators and long lines at breakfast, but other than that, I was very pleased with the stay. The beach location is great, and downtown is only an easy 10 minute taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: aquagirl101
Reviews.Content: Always stayed at the Meridien for my previous visits, but decided to give the W a try. We absolutely loved it! Our room on the 20th floor was large and modern with great views. Staff at the desk, pool and restaurants was friendly and polite. Loved the night club on the top floor and food/drinks thoughout the hotel were high quality. Pool area and beach set-up were great. My only gripe is that the water in the pool was cold, but we spent most of the time on the beach anyway. Loved the Bliss spa as well and our treatments were well worth the money. I highly recommend it for a little pampering. The W is a bit further away from the central buzz, but I actually liked it that way. There are plenty of taxis if you want to go into town or you can even walk in 20-25 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic building with wonderful views - Jane E”
Reviews.Author: PinkladySouthWest
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the W hotel in Barcelona and thought the hotel was fantastic in design. The staff were really good. I wouldnt go overboard on the food but it was good. Room services very reliable. Only one thing was that we saw hotel on TV with Kirsty Alsopp and really wanted to go as thought the shape was brilliant and she had said rooms all had views, which is true but were just slightly dissappointed that although you see the sail shape when we had our room it was in the square bit at front which you dont see really on photos but there are 6 floors in it, you kind of think you should be in sail bit and high. Having said that the room on 3rd floor had brilliant views and the actual room was great everything you could possibly want so I would defo recommend this hotel, very trendy with its wonderful 26th floor cocktail bar with great views. I would definately go back one day and this time ask for the room further up in sail, I know its expensive in the W but it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful design”
Reviews.Author: Steppi
Reviews.Content: Absolutely stunning hotel on the beach. Check-in was handled great (as we arrived early). Seems like virtually all staff members are multi-lingual. Our room was spacious, well laid out, with a nice, unobstructed view of the city and harbor. We were at the tail-end of a 2 week transatlantic cruise, so the location was perfect for us (though it's a bit of a hike - albeit a very nice one! - into the city). Excellent pool with DJ in the afternoon. Nice bar bites. Rooms service was of restaurant quality. Our dining requests were handled beautifully by the concierges. Only drawback - pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property With No Service”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: Staff at this property clearly feel that this hotel is so beautiful, they need add no service. We have stayed at several W Hotels in the past, 3 in Spain, and we have always been warmly welcomed and given extra perks as Starwood preferred guests. Here our perk was a bottle of water - no kidding! Internet service which should be included in a tech-savvy hotel such as this, is expensive and totally dysfunctional. At least 3 times, we were told by front desk staff that they would look into an issue, and nothing happened. If you'd like coffee with your breakfast, you can expect to remind servers 3 - 6 times. We reserved our room for 7 nights. A mistake was made in the arrival date, giving a booking total of 8 nights. The hotel refused to delete the night which we did not stay from our bill. 350E extra for nothing - really makes us want to return!

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous view”
Reviews.Author: raindr0p82
Reviews.Content: Very expensive but worth it for the view and the beach access. Very far from town but easy to get around if you get familiar with the bus lines.

Reviews.Title: “the big W over Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: asmigi
Reviews.Content: This is a true 5 star hotel with magnificent view, etc. Just a few points you should know about it: If your room is on a floor 7th or higher, your view gets better, but there will be only 3 (three!) lifts that can get you there, so be prepared for exchanging your precious time into queueing any time you want to go to your room or back... Another thing is the "how can I help you" button on your phone - it's not precisely that, but generally it promisses to address any request you might have while in the room. They never answer that, so you must take the wretched lift down to see 3 nice emlployees being busy talking to each other and ignoring your calls. I wanted to borrow a Blackberry charger, they promissed to deliver it to my room and this never happened. So not only they neglect people when they call, but also they don't bother helping guests when they take the effort to come to their desk.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki A
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at W Barcelona this summer and it was amazing. We got a beautiful room on the 21st floor with the ocean view and city view. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. Literally, anything you want, they will do their best to make it happen for you. I have to say, Alberto at the front desk definitely deserves to be recognized as he was so helpful and professional. I hope W knows how lucky they are to have him. Also another employee, Alex Talaveras went above and beyond to accommodate us and for that he should be recognized. Overall, we had a great experience and hope to be lucky enough to come back and visit again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at a club”
Reviews.Author: cballarino
Reviews.Content: Good - Decor, room size, coolness factor, location Bad - No hot tub, pool area is a club at night, and quite frankly for most of the day

Reviews.Title: “I just love W!!”
Reviews.Author: chipchop_1
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th W we have stayed in so far and have to say love the hotels. This W is brilliant and unique. Friendly staff that were really helpfull. Spend nearly an hour helping me out trying to install my Ipad. The hotel has an unique shape, like the famous hotel in Dubai and is situated on a small peninsuala, close to Barceloneta. Hotel was buzzing, vibrant and trendy. Rooms were very spacious and had a great view overlooking the harbour. A shame our room was on the first floor, but the views were stunning regardless. Just a little tip, the locals (or taxi drivers) might only know the hotel as hotel bella, as the W is non-existant in spanish.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: rmendell7244
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the heart of Barcelona then I wouldn't stay here but it's amazing how you can see ALL of Barcelona from your room. It really isn't that far from all the main attractions. Very clean and modern design. I would defiantly stay here again. I love BARCELONA! The food is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “I would like to live here please”
Reviews.Author: megtheminx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here briefly following our cruise, and loved every minute - the difference in the standard of service between the sadly mass-market cruiseliner we'd just left and the W was so noticeable! Our Wonderful room was on the 18th floor with a stunning view of the sea. the port (and the ship we'd just left) and part of the city, and being able to lie in bed or on the comfortable window seat and appreciate it was amazing. As for the remote controls built into the headboard, I could hardly blame my husband for reverting to his childhood - I was sorely tempted too! Even after we very reluctantly checked out, the hotel looked after us, we left our luggage with them while we enjoyed a drink on the terrace, then strolled along the beach before taking a taxi from the hotel to the airport. All in all a perfect way to end our holiday - just wish I could have stayed much much longer! Next time ...

Reviews.Title: “Another pefect stay at W Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: koenbl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Barcelona last weekend. I had been here before, for my wife this was a first. We had something to celebrate - and tis hotel turned out to be THE perfect location! And the staff did all they could to make us feel comfortable and welcome every second of our stay. The location of the hotel makes everything in Barcelona very close, while maintaining a quiet and relaxing environment. The Talent at this hotel is - unlike other 5star hotels I stayed in Spain - very helpfull and extremely friendly. The W Insider team is among the best in the W chain! If I must give one less positive point, it would be the price/value comparison of the breakfast. 22 Euro for a rather limited buffet, or almost 30 Euro for a buffet and some eggs is a little over the top, even of the items on the buffet seem in OK condition. The drinks and food at the bar (worth a visit!) are in line with other hotels in Barcelona. We had a room with a view: as SPG Platinum guest, I was upgraded to one of the great cornersuites. Super accomodation, living the architecture of this very well designed hotel to its max. When in Barcelona: no doubt, this is where you would like to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best "Room" in the world”
Reviews.Author: RickyJulia
Reviews.Content: We've been in the Presidential Suite of the W in Barcelona. The room it's just amazing. 360º of vision: Right in front the bed the sea and all around the great city, Barcelona. The breakfast was amazing. We did in the restaurant but we strongly recommend you to do it in the room. Problems: The music of the disco in the floor below. It's not too much but you can hear it. The jacuzzi in the balcony didn't work and we call several times to solve it and no one know how to solve it.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Room”
Reviews.Author: jrq
Reviews.Content: The W Barcelona is amazing in so many ways. The location is convenient. We used the local buses to get around and the bus stop is just a few minutes walk from the hotel. Our room was incredible with a million dollar view. The concierge desk, which helped us on a few occasions, was excellent. The staff are all young and enthusiastic. Mr. A. Costa at reception stood out as someone who made us feel very special. Our stay at the W was a highlight of our visit to Barcelona. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Engagement Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Bryan W
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving into Barcelona, British Airways had lost our luggage. The W Hotel staff was very accommodating and understanding of trying to help us get our luggage delivered to the hotel as soon as possible. The W Insider team was the most helpful throughout our trip to Barcelona. In particular, Pamela and Sarah treated us with exceptional service and helping to arrange the special requests I had for planning my engagement. They went over and above to arrange our reservations at the restaurant and upon our return from dinner they decorated the room. Our room was spectacular with a view of the coastline. The rooms amenities were also exceptional. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family!!

Reviews.Title: “definitely Wonderful with a few Weaknesses”
Reviews.Author: minkmeister
Reviews.Content: Simply stunning architecture and decorating if the modern style is your thing, and it definitely is mine. Really a 4+ star hotel with a couple of rough edges to keep it interesting. On the way to the hotel, you can see it forever and and while your anticipation builds at the sight of actually entering the glorious building, you may be forgiven for thinking you'll never get there. This hotel is off the beaten path across from the cruise ship dock and there is construction both along the circuitous route and adjacent to the hotel. You may also be forgiven the look of horror as you step out of the cab only to realize that a veritable sea of hot pavement separates your position at the curb from the actual entrance to the hotel. Maybe they could invest in some of those resort golf carts with the yellow and white striped canopies to ferry people to and from the curb - OK it's hyperbole, but it really is an unexpectedly wide promenade for such a high-end hotel! We arrived early in the afternoon, and there were no bellmen curbside to assist with the forementioned obstacle either. The single gentleman outside seems only to be there to direct taxis (and he has his hands full as this is a very busy hotel.) They really need a couple more full time bellmen hanging around *outside* and schlepping bags from the curb to reception. Once inside, we were greeted with a sea of people. There are 4 or 5 checkin stations, fully manned, but the lines move slowly. Once you get face to face with a human though, the experience is courteous and friendly. Our room wasn't available due to our early arrival so they took our cell number and offered to call us when the room was ready. Never did receive the call, but when I went back to inquire about the room, it was ready by their standard checkin time of 15:00. Arrival pains aside, once you're in the cocoon, this is a truly striking hotel. Visually impressive and full of helpful staff. Drinks are expectedly pricey, but not out of line with other hotels in this category. The views from the higher floors are worth the cost of admission, assuming you are on the left (north) side of the hotel facing the beach, not the harbor side. We had one of the Fabulous rooms on the 21st floor facing the beach/boardwalk and were impressed by both the size of the room and the view. Modern and clean with all the amenities you'd expect including an iPod player. The bath area (I hesitate to say "bathroom" because it wasn't a room) was a little funky, with the sink in the main room and the shower and toilet both in their own glass-enclosed roomettes with doors opening into the main room. Not complaining, it is a W after all, and style is what they do best. I personally found it fascinating, but others may be put off by it. The shower was spacious with good water pressure and plenty of hot water. Due to its location, there are not a lot of things to do adjacent to the hotel other than the beach, so we wandered down the boardwalk in search of dinner. There are some beachy and reasonably priced restaurants a 10 min walk up the boardwalk. While you're there, stake out a spot on the beach and enjoy the "lounge chair" service. No better place to relax with your beverage of choice. Also, the pool bar is a beautiful spot for enjoying the ocean breeze if not a dip. Checkout was unfortunately a mess. Long lines, long waits, slow computers. Reception is something they really need to address. Took me 10 min in line, 10 min checking out, and another 10 when I finally got the bill and realized they forgot to add the breakfast charge. The guy at the desk had a heck of a time getting the restaurant to answer the phone so he could update the bill! Really, this should have been handled automagically by the computer. Overall, the hotel was stunning as to be expected, and once inside lived up to my expectations for a hotel of this class. Dearth of bellmen and checkin/out aside, everything else was, as they say, Fabulous. I'll definitely be back my next trip through Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Night Club review at the top of 'W' Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: GenandLauren
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel and exclusively escorted by staff to the private elevators taking my friends and I up to the night club/lounge on the top floor, we made our way through the chique interior and delved into some bubbly and dancing. The place is filled with lots of pretty people and great to engage in meeting some fun ones. Eye candy abundant too for the ladies! Service was supreme and a table was cleared for my friends and I when we entered and ordered the champagne. Give it a try. Views are sweet,, in every aspect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: JustinHubb
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel screamed luxury! Being SPG members we were immediately upgraded to a high floor room...with a view that is amazing!
