From the food, to the pool, to the beach, to the service, this is one of the bet hotels I have ever stayed in. Bravo W! Thanks for making our European trip even more incredible

Reviews.Title: “'W Hotel embraces the Word Hospitality-Inside and Out-Outstanding'”
Reviews.Author: BeverleyH-Smith
Reviews.Content: A Wonderful hotel in every sense of the word,with outstanding staff-We loved every aspect of this hotel.The care and quality of the fabric of this property are overWhelming,and frequent travellers will recognise this as soon as they cross the threshold.Superb food offered at breakfast and deliciously matched at suppertime...This company takes guest care very seriously,and my goodness it shows-Strapline of Whatever/Whenever says it all-Thank you for a lovely weekend xx

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, not convenient unless you are "beaching"”
Reviews.Author: gabrielsmom
Reviews.Content: New hotel with everything you could imagine, and great views. Hip and trendy, its for the younger or party people. If you are like us and are looking for more sophisticated/less beach-y oriented (its very much like Muscle Beach or South Beach), then this is not the place to stay. IF you are looking for the mediterranean version of any of the aforementioned - then location is great.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Brad M
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend break in Barcelona and stayed at the W Barcelona.The hotel is a impressive building. As we arrived in the morning there was a queue at the check in which was not very well organised. Must admit the check in process was quite slow.When we were eventually seen to by the receptionist we were informed that the check out times were 3.00pm and that they will call us when the room was ready. We then decided to have a look at the pool area and sea which was really nice and we decided to have coffee before we explore Barcelona. The receptionist was very kind and offered us a voucher for our coffees which was a nice touch.While we were seated we were approached by one of the hotel customer services staff called Jeremy. Jeremy welcomed us to the hotel and sat down with us and explained the best places to visit in Barcelona.We really had no plan and his advice was absolutely invaluable. We have the highest praise for Jeremy, he was professional and guided us on exactly what to visit and where, and how to travel around the city. Jeremy acted on his own, was polite and our weekend break was wonderfull because of his advice. We feel he is a fantastic asset to the hotel.We feel this was wonderfull customer service from the hotel.We intend to write a special letter to the management ensuring that Jeremy passed our compliments. When we got back from a great day in Barcelona, we were noticed that teh hotel had already left a call on our mobile earlier to let us know our room was ready.We went up to our room (215) which was wonderfull.Very clean and maintained. The highlight off course is the fact that you overlook the sea.We had a great minbar in the room, which more than made up for having no coffee making facility. Overall great room. There are several restaurants within the hotel which are lovely and serve great food but can be quite pricey which is acceptable as you have the best location overlooking the beach. The clean the beach everymorning and this is fantastic.The only issue we had was with breakfast where we felt the dining hall is understaffed.We were served quite cold tea which was a negative. We did visit the Eclipse bar which gives you wonderfull views of Barcelona at night worth the vist to see the view. Drinks are not that expensive. In fact we found the prices of the drinks in the hotel quite reasonable compared with the bars in the city.We felt the lobby bar and the bar by the pool were great and service was good. Overall a nice hotel with staff who are very frendly and make sure they show that the apprciate you staying with them. We had a lovely time at the W Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to start a tour of Spain!”
Reviews.Author: Bill F
Reviews.Content: We started our two week visit to Spain with a few nights at this wonderful hotel. Best location in Barcelona with very attentive and professional staff. Nearby Barcelonetta neighborhood was a few minute walk with several great restaurants including a few lierally, right on the beach. A quick five minute taxi ride to most of the key sites in the city. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BusinessShipTrav
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in October 2011. Nice rooms, some interesting details, amazing vue especially over floor 10, non professional staff, neither reception nor concierge, and nothing around by walk. Breakfast is 6/10; No free Internet or water or coffee.. Top roof Bar with great vue and good food but again they need to train their team except one or two perfect. I tried almost all 5 stars in BCN and W is not my favorite. I won't come back unless my top 3 are full. I'm not a fan about this lobby looking like a train station and clothes shop just in front the main acces!! Rooms corridors reminded me "Shining" with Jack Nicholson..

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel Barcelona was perfect”
Reviews.Author: export11
Reviews.Content: Such a perfect location right on the beach. Beautiful hotel. Very nice guest rooms, excellent service. Such attractive staff, so cute. Enjoyed my stay. Concierge so accommodating and helpful. Eclipse bar on top floor very nice but poor service but best watermelon martinis.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: chattercubes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in September 2011. Met with good service, from concierge to the check-in staff. As we were first time visitors to Spain, the staff patiently recommended us sights to see & eateries to eat. The view we had was simply magnificent, had a overview of the city and the sea. A very trendy and modern hotel with everything named W.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God I am beautiful...I guess!!”
Reviews.Author: getcookie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights at the start of our trip to Spain and Portugal.On arrival the great staff were there to meet us at our car outside and help with the luggage.They then vallet the car for us.We had a great room facing the city(highly recommended to make the most of the room) #1902.I ended up being charged an extra 100 € for the view even though I was a Starwoods member. The staff were VERY helpful with anything you ever need. LOCATION:Right at the farthest point of the boardwalk,great for a nice 20 min walk into the bottom of the city,you almost have to go around the marina to get to the metro,easy if you are fit. STAFF\SERVICE:Top notch,anything you need VALUE:Even making 6 figures I can't fathom that 700Can is good value.But you only get one chance at this crazy life and our motto is "It,s not the years in a life,it,s the life in the years" So book this thing already!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayne52
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the week of September 22 for 5 days. We arrived early in the day, but they graciously checked us into a wonderful top floor room. We met the restaurant manager Jose Blanco, who took us under his wing, gave us hand drawn maps, sight seeing recommendations, etc. It was like having a friend to guide us. Every night we watched fireworks from the Barcelona "birthday festival" from our room. I can't say enough about the staff and how nice and helpful they were.They have a beautiful beach/ pool area, and contemporary rooms. Free Internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hip Hotel but Service is lacking for a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: alwaysflyin41
Reviews.Content: Unique property with positives and negatives. Positives: Excellent view of Mediterranean from room, room service was very good, nice gym, clean hotel, nice lounges around pool, very upbeat hip atmosphere created through decor and ambiance. Negatives: Service at concierge was absolutely terrible...in fact almost non existent. One night cruise ship passengers clog up lobby, with check in and check outs. Buffet breakfast and service/seating was awful and crowded with cruise passengers. Outside locals are encouraged to attend the "hip" bar atmosphere in the evening. Location is on a pier, out of the way of sightseeing but right on the beach. The staff spend too much time trying to good looking and not enough focus on what really counts........service...... Be prepared to be kicked out of your lounge chair around the poor around 5:30pm as the staff are preparing the area for the non hotel guests that are attending the bar in the evening........ The W is focused on "Image" rather than service and comfort of guests who have paid for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel out of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: jerchung
Reviews.Content: W Barcelona is gorgeous to look at close and from afar. It stands at the very end of the Barceloneta Beach so be prepared to pay for the taxi rides checking in and out. The metro is at least 20 mins walk away though there are a couple of nice restaurants in the neighbourhood of Barceloneta the majority of the other restaurants are for the tourists only, okay food woth exorbitant prices. Perhaps they expect W goers are prepared to get the taxi but truth is right outside the hotel there is the terminus for bus no.17 which takes you to Plaza Catalunya, Passig de Garcia, etc. So forget about metro and try this bus no.17!! The rooms on the high floors looking out to the Mediterranean have got the views definitely. Having compared the two, I however personally love the corner room on the 6th floor of the lower block even better (can't remember if it's 625 or 629?). This room on the 6th floor has two L-shaped glass walls, much wider, closer and better look over the sea. This room is bigger in size and has, in my opinion, better layout and also better equipped with a normal sized working desk. W Barcelona won't disappoint, but may not suit everybody's taste.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Stay... A+ Room, B+ Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelathon
Reviews.Content: Never stayed in a room with a more beautiful view than this "Fabulous Room." Thought the price was fair and we truly enjoyed our stay here. ROOMS: It had floor to ceiling windows throughout the suite looking at the sparkling Mediterranean and out across the city. Very cool mood lighting that created a hipster feeling to this already swanky, groovy Starwood line. LOCATION: There is an issue with location in that the property sits out at a jutted point at the very shore. This is spectacular for views, hanging out by the pool and beach, creating a true resort feeling in the city. The downside is that you have to take a taxi or a 15 minute walk to get to the edge of the city for sightseeing, restauranting, etc. FOOD: Do not expect to enjoy your room service meal-- bad food and expensive. Pool bar was fine, busy setting, hip music. STAFF: The W Hotels all have a night club sort of feel, know that, get that. However, here I have to say the Front Desk and Concierge staff actually got on our nerves-- a little too cool for school. Would prefer a little more traditional, refined hospitality. The other staff (room service, maids) were terrific. OTHER: We made a big mistake in ordering a car service (vs a cab) through the hotel staff to go to the cruise terminal (3 min ride) and payed $150 via the hotel vs a $15 cab ride. Felt that the concierge (20 something year old) could have helped us out by suggesting we take 2 cabs (had 4 big luggages, wouldn't fit in 1 cab) instead of getting gouged.

Reviews.Title: “Caring proffesional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellenbluebell
Reviews.Content: Corprate Weekend stay in june for turned out for my huband and I rather upsetting, as I suffered a miscarriage. What I can not stress enough how kind all the staff were to us. The hotel were quiet and caring in such a professional manner, I think in the first few hours helped for me now to be able to write this review (as I dont normally). One of the ladies behind front desk was with me all the way in hospital holding my hand. So on that note I will end saying of course its a five star hotel through and through, but also rest ashore you will be in safe hands. Thankyou W Hotel x

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Greg4289
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with excellent service. I stay at numerous W Hotels and this is one of th best. Even the "standard" room was terrific. Service may have outshown the hotel, especially Jeremy at the pool and Santiago at concierge. Hotel seems a bit out of the way but great locations are an easy and beautiful walk away. Best hotel gym I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mardi36
Reviews.Content: Great Location close to Resturants and easy walking distance to Ramblas and buses. Service was great especially around the pool which had all the amenities that you could need. Room had a lovely view of the ocean and city. Only criticism was lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the room which was remedied after we enquired if they could be made available. Would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Minute of It!!”
Reviews.Author: lovept
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to get to stay at the W Barcelona and it lived up to its expectations. The hotel is so beautiful. We were staying here the night before our anniversary for a cruise. United Airlines lost our luggage so the concierge at the W was so helpful in helping us retrieve our bags. Giulia, you are a lifesaver, THANK YOU!! And Thank You to Luis Pontes as well for our requests being granted. We ate lunch at the bar and it was to die for. I had a cesar salad and my husband a hamburger and they were both excellent. The free internet in the Living Room helped us out a lot as well with trying to find our bags. The room was beautiful and I could even see our ship pull into port at 3:30 am which was very exciting. Maybe it was the lack of sleep due to the flights but the bed seemed to be amazing!! So comfy! I loved all the Bliss products and the W brand lived up to its name like it has at the many W hotels we have stayed at in the past. Thank you for a great night W Barcelona. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Chic. I'd love to go back again”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkSpaBunny
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel, Very "W" tres chic. Lovely accomodations. I dont think there was anything I didnt like about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tylernolan2
Reviews.Content: My groups of 5 women stayed at the W for one night precruise. The location on the beach was wonderful and we enjoyed the lively pool area. We ate in the hotel and later went to Eclipse on the 26th floor. Our room was spacious and had a lovely view of the water. Everyone in the group loved the hotel and would stay again. The only negative we could think of would be the distance of the hotel to most of the sights in Barcelona. Great destination hotel for those who like the beach and a good party!

Reviews.Title: “Praetorian Marketing Abroad”
Reviews.Author: peterrudge
Reviews.Content: Managing Director of Praetorian Marketing Ltd comments - we recentley had a business trip to Barcelona on whihc i was fortunate enough to stay in W Hotel. The hotel had excellent faciliites and views of the ocean. fabtastic service and quality. Mr Rudge was also fortunate enough to spend time both hotels bar and restaurants facilities as well as outside dining area.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 6”
Reviews.Author: Twreck
Reviews.Content: The service was perfect , hotel looks and feels great . I have four young children ,never once did they look down on this . Currently traveling most of Europe , this is the best . The door staff incredible service , checking felt relaxing . Room service for breakfast one day , we all it . The view was amazing over the sea , boats, planes ....wow. ( booked a bad place in Spain relocated to this hotel safer place to be, turned a nightmare into a dream )

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mandy L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in September and it was amazing! The views from the rooms are gorgeous, overlooking the beach and city. The pool has such a cool vibe, with great music playing and even better cocktails :) The W Insider, Pamela, was the best. She is so friendly and helpful and gave us awesome recommendations for restaurants and things to do in the city. I will definitely stay at the W whenever I visit Barcelona. It is top notch and they haven't missed a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Eclipse Bar”
Reviews.Author: rawtalent
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay but took my mother for a cocktail. As we walked into the hotel lobby we were approached by "security", who asked if he could help, when told we wanted to visit the bar, he just said come back at 7pm.The implication being leave the building until then. He did seem rather off hand and not terribly friendly. So we sat on the steps at the side for an hour, going back in at 7pm to be greeted with a queue of maybe 20 people in front. The queue steadily got longer, with a couple of families with young children also joining, we remarked to each other that we didn't think a cocktail bar was the place for children, but then in Spain who knows? After the families had been queueing for around 15mins they were approached and obviously told children were not allowed, Although we were glad we wern't going to have kids running around in the bar it did seem bad on the hotels part that no one informed these people earlier. I'm suprised thst the adults seemed to take their refusal so well! After waiting approx. 30 mins we were shown into the lift. A smoothe qiuick ride up, we just got there in time to photograph the sun setting over Montjuic. Suprisingly no one greets you as you alight from the lift. We found our way to the bar and grapped a seat against the window, we were handing a cocktail list soon after and our order was taken within a couple of minutes, we both had the "Pink Floyd". Whilst I don't think any cocktail is worth 14 euros ( actually 27.99 for the 2). You are paying for the view and the experience....rather like going to Raffles Long Bar and throwing peanut shells on the floor. So was it worth it? Of vourse it was!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel....”
Reviews.Author: tsw1966
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W for 4 nights in september with my wife. We stayed on the 21st floor so had amazing views out to the sea and over barcelona. Rooms are fantastic with all the usual W extras and of course the amazing W bed, you will sleep like a baby! The pool area is very nice and the staff are always on hand to answer any questions you have or to get you a much deserved cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ned87
Reviews.Content: Stayed at W back in April with a group of 9 girls for a hen do... truely a fabulous hotel all round. great hotel staff, amazing Bliss spa. and views to die for. the hotel restaurant very good and reasonably priced, the pool is beautiful and very well maintained. Def staying again.

Reviews.Title: “W is for WOW!”
Reviews.Author: MariaNicole84
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Barcelona for the last part of my honeymoon and it was absolutely fantastic!!!. The hotel is gorgeous and there is a very spacious lobby/living room area. Plenty of space to lounge and relax. Our room had views of the port and ocean. Pool area is great and at night they have a DJ outside...very swanky! Food is fantastic, even my room service was tasty. The staff is very friendly and always ready to help you. The "whatever, whenever" desk will suggest restaurants in town and make reservations for you. I had a massage at the Bliss Spa and everything was professional and the spa is clean and relaxing. Although the hotel is not in the middle of the city its only a few minutes cab ride to most tourist attractions. I would go back again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: Agotux
Reviews.Content: It was totally fanatstic hotel. Everything was so cute and modern. And music of salsa in the halls.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: kirnat848
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for one night after a cruise, yes it is not in town but we were looking to relax and thats just what we got. The staff was super friendly and the area of the hotel is great. We walked down the beach, went to the pool which is so nice with the bar right there and the rooms were huge with a beautiful water view. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “W for wannabe ?”
Reviews.Author: Gastronauta
Reviews.Content: Had never stayed here in my trips to Barcelona so I thought I would give it a try. My personal highlights: Rooms - are indeed very nice, large and with huge windows with views (not great views as I was facing the industrial side) but interesting nonetheless. Everything worked, mood lights and all. Fabulous showers and comfy bed so 5* there. Breakfast - went early in the morning so very quiet and I found it first class with fresh pastries, smoothies and juices. Excellent. Location - not great if you want to travel into town but it's what you pay for scenic location. Plenty of taxis so just a 10-15 minute cab ride. What is not so good ? Wi-Fi - terrible. Works OK in the lobby where it's actually free but pathetic in the room such that I had to stand outside the elevators where the antenna is for a signal. Staff (courteous throughout it should be said) told me it was indeed a problem. At least they did not charge me for it - frankly, for a hotel that wants to attract hip clientele to charge for wi-fi in 2011 is really a no-no. Wait - get ready to have your patience tested at check-in and check-out...far too many people and too few desks. Took over 10 mins to check out. Pool - OK pool, not huge, with comfy chairs all round. But who put it to the side so it's in the shade half the time ? Also, I am no fan of big impersonal hotel lobbies and W is no real exception...better at night with the lights on but overall a bit dull. Personally I thought it tried hard to be cool but does not quite cut it. Coachloads of sartorially challenged overweight tourists also do not help probably. Worth a try to impress your boyfriend/girlfriend if they are young enough maybe, but better places in Barcelona. Will not return.

Reviews.Title: “hotel with looks but not much substance”
Reviews.Author: mejulie0
Reviews.Content: me and my husband recently stayed at the W ,we booked in with no delays whatsoever,our 'Fabulous' room was fabulous the views over the beach and coast line were to die for,i guess this is what you were paying for,towels and bed linen were of the highest quality,bed was huge and so comfortable.they say whatever whenever is there motto,but we had to ask if we could have tea and coffee making facilities in our room,they said if we requested it they will sort it,we had to ask for it.it appeared you would have to ask for anything you wanted nothing was offered like local maps safe in room,dining reservations.when they brought the tea coffee making facilities they made us pay an 80 euro deposit for a KETTLE.we got no tea or coffe or milk provided just sugar?.i had some coffee i had brought with me luckily.the hotel pool is quite small at one side of the hotel and is in the shadow of the hotel for most of the day but this didnt stop the beautiful people laying out all day long.we didnt use the spa facilities but we used there bliss toiletries which are really good.we went to the eclipse bar on the 26th floor,they make the best cocktails try the black and blue was so good.breakfast was excellent.overall we enjoyed our stay at the W,cannot fault the hotel but feel it is rather impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Jeanluc1
Reviews.Content: Very unique building, Great service Rooms very comfortable Friendly staff Book your room through a travel agent or website. The hotel will charge you around 450 Euros I called a travel agency and got the room for 230

Reviews.Title: “Eclipse bar”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth s
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at the W but went for drinks at Eclipse on the 27th floor to take in the view which we were told was amazing. The bar does have an amazing view and that was all that was amazing. We were not greeted by anyone even though the bar was not at all crowded. We waited a full 15 minutes before anyone asked us for a drink order. Drinks were good but at 15 euro each they should be. We sat for another 10 minutes with empty glasses without assistance while watching three waitstaff wash and dry dishes. We finally had to get up and go the the (empty) bar and ask for another. The bardtender acted offended, sent us back to our seats and sent a waiter. The waiter brought the drink and demanded rudely that we pay immediately. There are so many other wonderful places in the city with a great view and a wonderful experience.. don't waste your time or cab fare getting there.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest place in BCN!”
Reviews.Author: DavyVermeire
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the W Barcelona. Everything was perfect! The design of the hotel, the lobby, bars, pool and rooms are really nice and fancy. The pool and it's scene is superb. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room (a fabulous one) was great with the best views you can get in Barcelona. We could see the sea, beaches, Sagrada Familia, and entire BCN-skyline from our bedroom! Breakfast was pricy but very good, fresh and plenty of choice. If you plan a trip to Barcelona, and you love to have a relaxing time, hang out with cool people and have a laidback time in a sophisticated sphere: W is what you need! Oh, try the passion fruit mojito's at WET: you can't get them better!

Reviews.Title: “World Class - You need to Go!!!”
Reviews.Author: AndyM35
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel in Barcelona is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in... we arrived just after midnight and the place was busing.... a real city hotel.. with atmosphere... the Fabulous Room was fantastic.. overlooking the beach / sea / city ... all staff are exceptional... the resturants in the hotel... provide 1st class food... best ever Sea Bass and many more...

Reviews.Title: “Wow Experience”
Reviews.Author: ela2311
Reviews.Content: The W Barcelona is an experiencence on it's own. The hotel looks amazing from the outside and the WOW factor is only increased when you step inside. The rooms are large and our room had a glass wall which overlooked the beach. Will definitely be returning to this hotel very soon!!!!!! Wonderful !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “W for Wow & Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: surreygirl67
Reviews.Content: Superb room with amazing views. Great service from all in the hotel and all food to a very high standard. W Barcelona is truly wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller30
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the W Hotel for 5 days between Sept 11 and Sept 16, 2011. I enjoyed every minute of my time at this beautiful hotel. Rooms I had a "Wonderful Room" which truly was the very definition of the word "Wonderful". Walking in to the room, I was greeted by a beautiful view of the Mediterranean Ocean through windows that seemed to wrap around the entire room. The desk was ample and well-designed, the bed was a King-bed facing the windows and the energy efficiency of the room required that your card be inserted into a panel in the wall in order for the lights to work. The shower with its amazing rain showerhead was absolutely heavenly, as was the first-rate air-conditioning which you needed after a day in the Spanish heat. However, the BEST part of the entire room was the bed. Oh. My. Gosh. I can't even begin to describe in mere words how comfortable that bed was. I have never slept on a bed that just seemed to envelope your entire body and whisk you off to a fast and fulfilling sleep. Truly, one night I was there I think I crawled in to bed around 930/10pm just so I could sleep about 11 hours in that amazing amazing bed. Service From the concierge staff to the doormen to the endless number of W employees standing at the ready, this is a top-notch operation and they go above and beyond in order to cater to your every need. Food Food quality was good -- breakfasts were ample, the fruit was always fresh, the dinners were solid. No complaints here. Terrace Unbelievable. I enjoyed many a cocktail and cigarette on that terrace overlooking the Mediterranean, not to mention some very good food. Again, no complaints. Location Location is a bit of a downer -- it takes a solid 15 to 20 minutes to walk to a metro stop or, if you are so inclined, about 30-40 minutes to walk up to Las Ramblas. It's a bit too removed for those individuals who may want to be in the centre of things. That said, it's a gorgeous hotel and if you can afford to stay here, you shouldn't worry about taking the Metro or walking anywhere. Staying at the hotel is a wonderful experience. Hallways I highlight the hallways as an area of improvement. I stayed on one of the lower-level floors, but had occasion to see other hallways on other floors. They all looked a little worn, a little dirty and - in some cases - could go for a touch-up or two. Overall, I loved - LOVED - my stay at the W. Should I ever come back to Barcelona, I would most gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever, whenever - an amazing stay at W Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: KikiDhollywood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Barcelona in the middle of August and had a fabulous time. The hotel is slightly outside of the city centre, but right on the beach which is ideal during the summer. There's a small section of the beach reserved for guests, with loungers and towels. The service at the hotel is impeccable. The rooms are great, with wonderful bliss products. As a guest you also receive a pass for the bar/club on the top floor which gets quite busy. If you stay at the W, you must try the spa - I had an amazing massage in a clinical, but very lush setting. The beds are the most comfortable I've ever slept on. The pool area is great (although it can get busy with children), and turns into a bit of a lounge for cocktails towards the end of the day. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “92% perfect”
Reviews.Author: MauriceBakker
Reviews.Content: A very chillounge hotel with a trendy bar on the 26th overlooking the bay. Has its own pool, very good sauna (also chillounge) and lazy beach access. Could easily be 94% perfect if WiFi would be freely available in the rooms, only free WiFi is now on the ground floor. WiFi rates are much higher than buying a dataroaming card. 100% perfect if lines at reception/whatever desk are decreased...

Reviews.Title: “Ripoff - Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: SCenturion
Reviews.Content: Does one bad experience define a hotel? Absolutely. Paid Eur600 for a "fabulous" room. Had to lug my luggage as only a cart with no valet at drop zone. No worries! Checkin to room 1916 that was fabulously stinking of cigarettes. Complained as I am allergic. Reassigned room 105 perched fabulously above the empty bar blaring worst house music. Soundproofing non existent & jet lag turning me into hulk. Complain again...unresolved! Numerous issues with bathroom as well. Upon checkout manager insists he will ask bar manager to contact me....why? My contract is with W. Why would I discuss this with an independent bar? It's W hotel's responsibility to add soundproofing to this room. I was comped a Eur20 dinner...the manager fabulously missed the point & chose to retain revenue rather than a customer. NEVER AGAIN! I'm at the Alma now - it's absolutely fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “W is for Wow”
Reviews.Author: Traveler138KR
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. We had a room on the 21st floor with a killer floor to ceiling view of the city and beach. The rooms are outstanding (huge shower "room"), great bed and fine extra touches. The pool area and bar is fun, the vibe is hip and the service was all great. Looking forward to the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful W!!!”
Reviews.Author: N8BasementCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Barcelona for 3 nights as a part of our 2 week Honeymoon on the Med. Everything about our stay exceeded our expectations.. the room was stunning, service exceptional and food great value (compared to the rest of the med!). We loved hanging by the pool side, enjoying the food and servic... everything about the hotel was just so cool.. hanging out in the 'lounge' (not a lobby!) really did feel like a cool lounge... we felt so relaxed and pampered! Top floor of the W is the Eclipse bar where we had a huge night.. amazing views and great cocktails and music. Note: The hotel is a taxi ride from the centre of town and about 15min walk from closest metro station.. But for a fun, funky and relaxing stylish break would definitely recommend the W in Barcelona!! For even a short weekend from London, would love to go back next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view , great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: djibrilliant
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for 4 nights and had great experience. First the city is amazing, can combine fun and sightseeing. We had a room on the 12th floor with great ocean view, hotel design is great and location is quite good. Top floor club is a must and staff, especially at reception and restaurant is attentive.Only setback we have missed a T-shirt during turndown service but never got any feedback about it after reporting to housekeeping. Overall very good experienceand will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Vistas, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: stjusvi
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews of this hotel, we expected the "best" and it did not disappoint! Great rooms, fantastic views and wonderful service. A short walk down the beach takes you to small, intimate coffee shops , narrowing alleys with beautiful baconies and a bit further is the marina and port area with upscale shopping, unique restaurants and pretty good gelato, too! The beach boardwalk is filled with runners, beach goers and the like. One word of caution ... parts of the beach are "clothing optional" and many Barcelonians take full advantage! We actually stayed here for two nights and at Le Meridien off La Rambla for two which gave us totally different views of this amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “Million Dollar Views with Attitude”
Reviews.Author: luv2travl003
Reviews.Content: Any time you have an all-glass hotel situated at the end of the spit of land sticking into the Mediterranean, you expect great things. From the standpoint of the views from the room, the W does not disappoint. We were on the side away from the beach, with absolutely stunning views of the port and sea. Room was very comfortable, and surprisingly quiet. (There is an inner door in the room that helps to seal out the hotel noise, resulting in an exceptionally quiet sleeping area - not sure if the same would be true on the beach side.) So far, so good. If that were the only criterion, the W would get 5 stars hands down. Unfortunately, we like to eat, too, and that is where the property fell short for us. Our first night we visited Eclipse, the top-floor nightclub. We arrived relatively early (8:00 or 8:30 pm) and found the room sparsely populated, as we would expect for a city that comes alive after 11 pm. What we did not expect was that we would need earplugs. We were assured that the reason the room was so quiet (Not!) was that the DJ didn't start until 9 pm. The staff said the volume would go up significantly then. We left. If that were the only area where you had to risk hearing loss to eat and drink, we wouldn't mind. Hey, we were that age once, too, and enjoyed blasting our ears. But everywhere we went in the common areas, restaurants, bars, etc., it was the same thing. Relentless, pounding music. Add to that the fact that BraVo restaurant doesn't even open until 9 pm, and the beach-level restaurants (which I think simply lease space from the hotel, rather than being part of the W) were a bit on the rude side, and you could starve to death trying to eat there. We ended up walking to Port Vell (the old port a half mile away) for dinner. One final little annoyance - I am a Starwood elite member, while my wife is currently a non-elite Starwood member. When I told the front desk that we wanted to put her number on the reservation, so that she can get the points and hit gold status, they promptly took away the elite perks that I would have gotten. Pretty cheesy, if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Onlythebestman
Reviews.Content: Anything you think of in this hotels was perfect! From the rooms and the view to the lovely staff! Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irish964
Reviews.Content: The "W" is a wonderful hotel. We were cordially greeted when we arrived and were given an upgraded room becaue of our Platinum Status with Starwood. The room was a corner suite and had views of the SEA and the Beach. It was a great room and I would request the same room again.The top floor bar, ECLIPSE, makes some of the best if not the best cocktails my wife and I have ever tasted. Just incredible. They are all made with "FRESH" ingredients. They are not cheap but the taste is so good that to splurge once in a while is ok. My only complaint that I had was when we tried to get a taxi one evening the 2 staff members outside the "W" were not that interested in helping us. There was some outside gathering where approximately 20 or so beautiful women, all dressed the same, were doing some event at the "W". SO, I had to go inside to the conceirge desk and they assisted me. They were not happy to hear how we were treated when I told them what had happened. Other than that it was a fun time.

Reviews.Title: “Missed opportunity”
Reviews.Author: ThomasFS
Reviews.Content: Let's say it was a missed opportunity. W brands everything as fabulous, fantastic, or otherwise bombastic. The building itself can life up to this wording - the quality of service definitely not. This made me waste my time by writing this review. We stayed for 4 nights (starting 28 July 2011). Check-in was good. Well trained staff, wait time around 20 minutes, although there were only two other guests in front of us. That's not outstanding for $400 a night, but ok. We arrived at the room and wanted to turn on the music to unpack. Our reservation included an "iPod dock" for this (this is actually part of the room description!). We didn't see a dock during the whole stay. However after calling the front desk they sent someone up who then went away again to get a power plug (!!!) for the radio in the room as it wasn't even connected and a connection cable to plug the headphone connections of the iPod into the radio. No dock, no power for your device. So hopefully you didn't trust the room description and brought your own power plug. We did and so it was no big issue. On the second day somebody showed up at our room to give us our requested extra-keycard. Bad that we didn't request an extra keycard. And not very reassuring that anybody can simply request a keycard for our room. The excuse from the staff was, that someone must have written down the wrong room number for the request. We didn't give it another thought till the next day, when suddenly all our key cards didn't work any more. After the usual "did you put it near your cell phone" they issued us new cards - again no explanation why 4 keycards stopped working at the same time. The same "professionalism" was shown by the room service. On the second evening we had some small items as in room dining. According to the menu the W Burger should come with fries. In reality it didn't. So another call and after we finished eating we received the fries. No excuse, no comment, just fries. The next day we left our room at 9am to have a sightseeing trip through barcelona. When we came back in the late afternoon the room was still a mess, wet towels had not been changed, the mini bar hasn't been refilled during the whole time we were there up to this time. So we called again and requested the room to be cleaned and the mini-bar to be refilled. We left and came back in the evening to find everything in (almost) perfect order - mini-bar was refilled, used glasses were gone. However the empty plates and fork from the in-room-dining the day before were still there. And to make sure we don't take anything from the mini-bar again they also didn't replace the used glasses. So now we had a refilled mini-bar without glasses, used plates and forks (that stayed with us till the end of our stay). But - on the bright side - at least we had dry towels. At this point we just laughed - and went somewhere else to get some drinks. Somewhere where they even offered us a glas for our drink :) That the "Show Bill" option on the TV only displayed a cryptic error message was no big surprise after everything we experienced at the W. During our stay the whole management simply looked like it was the hobby of somebody - great idea, mediocre execution, no dedication to the basics. To cut it short: W Barcelona brands everything as outstanding, fabulous and so on. They don't mention that this is only true for the building, not for the delivered service quality. If you like good design, a nice view and lower your expectations on basic service quality, the hotel is good. Is it worth the price? I don't think so. There are a lot of design hotels out there that have the same pricing - and well trained staff. After all it's not rocket science we expected - just a clean room, dry towels and a regular refill for the mini-bar. We sent exactly this message to the W management before posting it here. Only reaction: a lame excuse and an offer for some bonus points.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: DianeKarlTiago
Reviews.Content: Hotel is amazing along with it's location! Food very good and staff helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: steilkurve
Reviews.Content: Stayed in two connecting rooms for a couple of nights in August before a cruise around Italy. It was simply perfect. The staff is friendly and service efficient, the rooms extremely comfortable, the design breathtaking and views equally impressive. We truly enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate going back. Guests should know that while the location on the beach is quite convenient, it does mean a bit of a hike to the central of Barcelona. And while we felt quite comfortable with our kids there, it did feel like more a found adult destination.

Reviews.Title: “All style and no substance”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend as a family as my husband was located at the hotel as part of a 2 week conference. Very funky hotel but what planet was the designer on when he/she decided on having an open plan bathroom ! This only works for single people or frankly wierdos who want to share their every 'movement' with their partner. The bed was comfortable tho and we had a room overlooking the Cruise ship terminal, which my son loved ! Now for the bad stuff. Queues at reception were horrific. Forget trying to sit outside as it's full of the 'beautiful people'. Service in the Bravo restaurant for breakfast was terrible, 3 times we had to ask for coffee. Forget Eclipse stay at the ground floor bar and watch non residents try to get access to the outside bar. It is hilarious, ladies have to be under 35 with legs up to their ears. Gents have to know the girls 'on the door' or have managed to get on the guest list. It was great entertainment. Also watch out for the wet bar when it rains. The stone is very slippery and has bad lighting at night, no warning signs = nasty accident involving broken glass and blood.

Reviews.Title: “W as in Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SCOTTYK57
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our two teenagers spent several days at the W preceeding a Mediterranean cruise. The hotel is beautiful and is reminisant of the Jumeirah "sail" hotel in Dubai. Our room had views of the city and coastline. The room was large, clean and modern; the beds devine. A comfortable window seat sat along the entire length of the floor to ceiling windows. The toilet and shower area were very unique and framed in frosted glass. The shower was very large with both rain shower head from the ceiling and hand held wand. The food in the hotel restaurant was excellent. The pool area was quite the party scene both day and night with an upbeat atmosphere and friendly, exceptional service . The top floor club is vibrant and offers excellent drinks with the already outstanding view. The hotel has a private beach which offers hotel guests chaises, umbrellas, towels, and food and cocktail service ,over which hotel security keeps a watchful eye. There is an excellent choice of restaurants just a short stroll down the boardwalk. Beautiful hotel, beautiful city, friendly locals.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sicarolina
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room, nice staff, great place and they were sooooo nice to us! We were there to take a cruise on the next day to celebrate our wedding anniversary. They knew that because I talked about it when we were checking in. And then, at night, they gave us a box full os chocolates and - even better! - a suitcase tag of the W hotels! Soooo beautiful! I am totally sure that whenever I go back to Barcelona I am going to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “UNFORGETABLE”
Reviews.Author: OLGAGreece
Reviews.Content: This is the best city hotel i have ever visit!!!!!What a view!!!what a design!!!what a hotel!!! In a very difficult momment of my life i decided to visit with my boyfriend Barcelona.We wanted to stay near the sea and W was the perfect choise.The staff was friendly,the fabulous room was perfect (especially the view)the breakfast was nice...My stay at W made me feel more relaxed....I wiil never forget it... thank you for everythig W(Wella in Catalan)

Reviews.Title: “Stunning property with amazing views, one of the best we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: SasLouB
Reviews.Content: We booked into the W as a pre and post cruise hotel and it was the perfect way to begin and end our holiday. We were collected at the airport by the hotel car service, who provided an excellent, if pricey (E90) transfer, but with husband, children and tons of luggage was well worth it. The hotel upgraded us to a "lovely" room on the 26th floor which had a bath, wetroom and a seating/desk area. The kids went mad with the array of overloaded electronic devices in the room - think curtains, lighting, mood lighting, tv's, music! The rooms are modern, bright with a clever use of light and mirrors to create a feeling of space. The beds - well they are the best I have ever slept in. Truly amazing, almost like floating without being on a water bed! The Bliss freebies are very nice... The downstairs restaurant, Wave, I thought a tad disappointing, both for dinner and breakfast. The hot breakfast options were very limited, and travelling with a husband that loves a "full english" he found it limited. I had a Tortilla for breakfast which was dry and uninspiring. The service in the restaurant was also slow and haphazard. The outside pool area is clearly a place to hang out. White sofas, ambient music, beautiful staff...we had lunch there on our last stay and again, we were let down on the catering front, my husband's burger was inedible and looked like a frozen pattie from a bad day at McDonalds. Again, menu choice was very limited and could only get my children portions of fries as nothing else suitable was on offer. But the location, ambience and whole "W" ethic makes this property very special. The concierge remembered us from our first visit, even the kids names too and went out of his way to help us. We also appreciated the early check in at 9am with no fuss after being turfed off the boat at 8.30am. The beach in front of the hotel is pleasant, and the walkway connects to some great restaurants. There was nothing better than to watch the world go by from a beach bar under the shadow of the huge sail design of the W. The bar "Eclipse" on the top floor if well worth a visit for the views and sunset, and I guess can justify the drinks charges for the location. My husband particularly enjoyed going to the bathroom for the view! The hotel arranged at short notice (2 hours), a babysitter who was excellent and I then escaped for a visit to the Bliss! spa. I had two excellent therapists for a facial and massage, the spa is definitely worth a visit if you have time. Overall a very memorable stay and one place we'll hopefully visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and rooms, poor sleep”
Reviews.Author: spacecadet78
Reviews.Content: Our Fabulous room on the 9th floor had stunning views and the room was the epitomy of modern luxury (the one exception being the semi-transparent door to the toilet...). One could (and did) spend hours sitting by the window looking out over Barcelona. Continental breakfast in-room was lovely. Gym was ok but missing some key equipment (e.g. preacher bar, ropes). Spa was excellent. Mostly a good stay but not value for money considering the "ok" service and most importantly the noise from the Wet Bar (open til 2 am). Staff seemed to be impossible to get hold of after an initial drink in the beach area (despite a decent tip). Reception staff did not even acknowledge my complaint about noise from the Wet Bar (they didn't even seem to notice I'd spoken when I mentioned it on checking out). That put a downer on the end of the experience. Eclipse bar was a let down. Would I consider staying here again? Erm... possibly; if I had a room on the other side (away from the noise). Unfortunately that means less fantastic views. Definitely a hotel that caters for the young and nouveau riche, not for those who want a night's sleep. I wonder if that marketing strategy will work for them long term. Turn the volume down Wet Bar!!! There are plenty of nightclubs nearby for those who want them, save the sleeping environment for just that!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing staff...”
Reviews.Author: giorgio100
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel... Spacious lobby, beautiful well-appointed room, excellent breakfast selection, great gym space, which we took full advantage of, and didn't want to leave the great pool and loungers... We literally had to drag ourselves away to the airport....! However, the thing that made the stay so so special was the amazing staff. Special thanks to Pamela, Valentina, and Pedro (Hotel Insiders) for their assistance - could not do enough to help. Santiago on Concierge was super friendly and gave spectacular recommendations (one is my new favourite restaurant in Barcelona... no I am not revealing...), and Tonia and Lynn treated us like royalty by the pool.. Stopped to chat, great drinks service. Everyone else was truly amazing, but these guys stood out and made us feel part of the family. Thankyou so much again. Can't wait to return to feel that special again. Ed Parkes.x

Reviews.Title: “absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: neha a
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 times in the last year & there is virtually nothing I can complain about. The rooms are beautiful, views spectacular, restaurants and bars are excellent. However, the biggest strength of this hotel is definitely the staff who are just incredibly friendly and helpful. I couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “God help you if you are not extremely attractive.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin W
Reviews.Content: Hotel W, great if you are very pretty, like poor quality service, a swimming pool the size of an average house, and no sun loungers, also perfectly situated near a beach you can't use. Nearly 500 rooms, with a pool that is approx 15 x 3 meteres? half of it is a terrace so you can't swim in, the upper sun deck has no pool? god knows why? and the exclusive nightclub on the 26th floor, not worth getting past the dooman and enjoying the lift ride. The bar staff greet you with a friendly, what is your room number? I said what is your room number? The disco in the main lobby is great because staff can pretend not to hear you, instead of just being disinterested. To queue daily for breakfast help to create those special holiday memories, and god help you if theyy send you up to Bravo for your breakfast, where the satff take cannot be bothered to an olympic gold medal standard. The catchy "whatever you want", needs to be renamed and extended to include "dont bother asking us, we are too busy being beautiful to do anything for you" and reception should be renamed "Q" because that is all you will ever do there. Poncy pretentious and not very good, it seems they like to believe the W represents WOW, I personally think it represents WTF???

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Dan A
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Barcelona W, and it reconfirmed this as one of my favourite hotels, anywhere. The location is spectacular - the only real beach hotel in Barcelona, which is just a 20 minute walk or 5 minute cab ride to the heart of this magnificent, eclectic city. Service at the check-in and the front desk is superb - polite, helpful, and enthusiastic. As SPG Platinum I was "triple upgraded" to a large suite looking out directly over the Mediterranean. I love the bells & whistles in these rooms, like the immense shower, the ambient lighting, the automated blinds, the high quality sheets, etc.. This is the W brand at its best - whimsy and quality in perfect harmony. The common areas are fun & sexy, like the huge poolside area that turns into a nightly pool party with live DJ and a fabulous crowd, and the enormous, first-rate gym (perhaps the best equipped hotel gym I've ever seen). And they have now developed the beach level exterior of the hotel to include several fun, quality bars and restaurants, so you have a large selection of venues without leaving the hotel. So you can go from the Bilss Spa to the quasi-private W beach club, to tapas and cocktails at one of the beachside restos (one with live Samba music during my stay), to the rocking poolside party, to the penthouse Eclipse bar / club with one of the best views of the city, then down to your fabulous and tranquil room. My only complaint is that I have had consistently poor and inattentive service in the default Wave restaurant and lobby W Bar. But, on the plus side, the high-end in house restaurant, Bravo, serves world-class Catalan / Mediterranean cuisine with competent service. If you're looking for a fun, relaxed stay in a spectacular setting in Barcelona, you cannot do better than the W.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, a definite return visit on the cards”
Reviews.Author: Patrick Y
Reviews.Content: Very little can be said other than what a fantastic stay we all had. Our party was two couples in two fabulous rooms with beach and city views, located next door to each other. It's a very stylish hotel and I'm pretty sure people just go to be seen there, not all guests of the hotel. You have to be quick to get a sunbed around the pool bar area, but the private(ish) beach area makes up for that. Definitely going back to visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mervenadir
Reviews.Content: definitely the best place in Barcelona! I have stayed in few other major hotels in Barcelona but none compared to this stay! the room was great; very spacious with modern amenities, and breathtaking views. The service was excellent, special thanks to great W Insiders & concierge who were very friendly and helpful at all times, and also the whatever/whenever team who has made our stay so comfortable. Would definitely recommend it to anyone, I can't wait to return back to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent DesignHotel + perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: 5-star-lover22
Reviews.Content: The W Barcelona is a amazing Hotel with a great Architecture and a totally friendly and helpful staff. +we arrived and the porters came and helped us directly with the luggage + check In fast and friendly (thanks to sara!) +OUR ROOMS WERE AMAZING: Design top, beds were sooooo good and the view awesome!!! + FOOD: We always went to the WAVE Restaurant: It was sooooo glorious!!!! + POOL & BEACH: The staff always gave us new towels and if we sleep, the boy always keep the umbrella to gave us shadow. TOP SERVICE!!! Jeremie, the wet deck insider, really took care of us and asked always if we feel good and if he can do anything for us to make our stay even better!!! thanks jeremie for your very good service and showing us some nice places in the hotel!=) + the partys: the music is great iin this hotel: if you relax you hear cool chill music and in the evening there are some pool partys with great DJs and very good drinks at the WET bar + + +.... it was a very great stay and the staff really makes the diffrent! thanks to all - i tried to find something negative but there's nothing special, maybe that the way to the next metro is a distance of 10-15 walking minutes, but thats all W Barcelona i will definitve come back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice view”
Reviews.Author: helsinki_finland2008
Reviews.Content: * Good location on the beach * Nice view to the see and city * Un-friendly staff * Good pool

Reviews.Title: “Modern cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vacationtime79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the W Barcelona for a weekend with my fiancé. We celebrated my birthday in Barcelona and wanted to stay at a nice place near the water. The W was perfect! It was full of Americans and the occupancy rate was high. We arrived in the morning but we had to wait till the afternoon for a room to be ready. The pool was very nice and pretty busy. We noticed a lot of groups on a bachelor/bachelorette weekends. There were lots of young people but also families with young kids. The room had a very modern and cool design. I had a chocolate cake deivered in the room for my birthday - we didn't order or say anything but it must have atomatically registered in their records when I checked in from the date of bitrh in my passport. That showed how attentive they are and was a nice surprise. The hotel is right next to the beach and W provides lounge chairs and towels at the very busy beach. There are a couple of restaurants underneath the hotel. The city center is a cab ride away (about 10 min) and the airport was about 30-40 min away. The hotel has a night club (top floor) and a spa. We visited the club but did not have time for the Bliss spa. Will definitely try out the spa on our next visit. Overall, had a great time and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: jbz11
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Starwood hotels for the past 6 years for business as well as when I go on holiday. I have stayed at every brand that Starwood represents and my past experience with W hotels (Mexico City, Westwood California, New York, San Francisco, etc....)has not been very pleasant. The common theme I have felt in the past is the staff at the W's are very arrogant and portray a sense of power like they are better than the guest. I want to make it very clear that my stay at the W Barcelona has changed my view on the way I feel about the W brand hotels. My experience at the W Barcelona is top 2 maybe 1st on my list of best experiences which translates into best hotels I have ever stayed at. I am saying it tops most of the St. Regis hotels I have stayed in as well as Four Seasons. I am sure it helped being a Platinum member as I received an upgrade to a beautiful suite. My little sisters birthday being the main reason for my visit to Barcelona, I wanted our experience to be a memorable one. It started out as I walked in the door after a 15 hr flight, tired and grumpy and saw the line of people waiting to check in. Immediately glanced over and noticed a Platinum check in desk which Valentina immediately checked me in. My sister and I felt very welcome and comfortable from the second we arrived at the hotel. Valentina spent a lot of time going through the maps recommending great places to eat, sights to see and excellent clubs to go out at night. All your recommendations were magnificent! I especially loved the restaurant Cervecea Catelana. Thanks again for making my sisters birthday such a memorable birthday as well as my visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: lbo80
Reviews.Content: This is a trendy modern hotel in Barcelona with some really nice design ideas. Room was large and spacious, and generally well thought out. Only quibbles would be the lack of power sockets which would be really useful on the desk console for charging all the gadgets one needs these days! Some of the room gadgets also seemed a bit pointless eg the philips lightbox and the dodgy iPod dock which looked a bit tacky and out of place. The guest folder was also all worn and falling apart. on a positive note, the rooms had great views, comfy bed and good bathroom. Despite the rooms, it is the service and value which lets this hotel down. Big queues for check in welcome desk and the concierge seem to be the norm. Food and drink is expensive but not terribly tasty. A falafel sharing plate was a particularly disppointing experience with some very sad looking salad. Free wifi in the lobby is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dave S
Reviews.Content: We recommend this as a very good option for your Barcelona accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “it was what it said on the can”
Reviews.Author: crawfie
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room, with the ideal view and floor that I requested. Staff were more than helpful, but when will these hotel chains learn that customers paying 200 euros a night resent paying for internet.. The hotel is a bit out on a limb past Barcelonetta, but some people might find that a plus point. The bar is nice, but over priced, and 4Euros for a small bottle of water in the room is a ripoff. The friendly staff and the view make it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...can't fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunworshiper67
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for my wife's 40th birthday surprise. The website photo's looked stunning & once we arrived we were not disappointed. The hotel exterior is certainly a statement on the Barcelona skyline. We stayed in a suite on the 19th floor & the views were impressive with our bed facing out toward the Med. The staff were really helpful & friendly. Everything we experienced was 5 star & would certainly visit again

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel but be prepared for lots of kids”
Reviews.Author: PhilNTed
Reviews.Content: Just about everything you'd expect from The W brand - wonderful staff, gorgeous rooms, cool lobby and stunning views. Just be prepared for lots of small children at the pool. It's not a romantic couples getaway. We booked with points so I can't attest to the value. Only minor complaints: bad wi-fi access issues in our room and really limited food menu at the pool bar. It's a great location, too. It looks far from town but it's an easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Nice, but at a price”
Reviews.Author: chadkatoff
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel in Barcelona is exactly what a W should be. It’s hip, stylish and very cool. The building is an instantly recognizable part of the barceloneta skyline. This one time industrial area was rehabbed and converted to a beach for the Olympics in 92. Now, it’s pretty nice, although the site for the W is at the far end of the beach, bordering the cruise ship harber. The Hotel itself was built recently and is very nice in that trendy/styley way that only a W can be. Sometimes I love it, other times, I yearn for something a bit more traditional. We got upgraded and were staying in a suite, which was spacious and very, very nice: floor to ceiling windows, heavenly bed and a huge soaking tub. Luxury living at its finest. The service was also excellent. Just go to the concierge desk and they will attend to your every need from booking dinners, planning excursions or just directions around town. The food in the hotel was also quite good, but certainly pricey. Fortunately, our room plan included internet and breakfast—and that was a tasty breakfast—fresh pastry, salmon and all the Iberico ham I could eat. I miss that Iberico ham. Room service was priced reasonably, all things considered. The clientele was very, very W. Chic European stylistas in trendy clothing with smooth tanned bodies. I almost felt out of place as a pale pasty American. Oh well. I have one gripe. There is a club in the penthouse. There is a club by the pool. Falling asleep in my room at 2 in the morning, I could hear the music blaring through my double pane floor to ceiling windows and black out curtains. I know that 2AM is early in Barcelona time, but I like to have a little peace and quite in my room. Otherwise, this place was fantastic. If you can get a rate, go and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WilliamGall
Reviews.Content: I have read varying reviews on TA about this hotel although mostly good. I went with my husband (we are mid 40's) for a short break. The hotel is in a great spot right on the beach and within easy walking distance of restaurants, cafes etc. The rooms are lovely with good views - yes the beds are comfy. I usually find breakfast in hotels to be arduous with long waits for coffee, tea etc and this proved no different with a huge price tag! We had breakfast included but had we not we would have taken a 5 min stroll down the beach and had a simple breakfast at a beach cafe. The pool area is split level. The bottom level has the bar with sun beds and cabanas around it. The area was really really busy, but nicely so with music playing and a great bar. The first level obviously did not have the pool but it was less than 30 seconds away and I guess because we are a bit older we found the area upstairs to be much more tranquil and really was very very lovely. You could pop downstairs to the bar anytime for a drink or have drinks/lunch brought to you. We found the pool/bar staff to be extremely helpful, they really did seem to go out of there way to make everyone comfortable and happy and they should be rewarded - it is hard work in very hot sun. One tip! It was the norm for the sunbeds to be reserved with towels, books etc and although I was uncomfortable with this we were assured by the staff this was the norm so do this - but go early! Even by 9.30 am all the beds down by the pool were reserved and even the best spots upstairs. Of course the usual situation happens when people don't actually turn up until midday. I think this made things difficult for the staff but they really handled it well and always found somewhere for people to sit. In the evening the bar around the pool transforms itself to an evening bar and its really great to sit around, have a cocktail and be by the sea. The hotel has an area on the beach also. The hotel definitely errs on the young side but there are people of all ages and we would stay here again because it is very hard to find a hotel on the beach in a city like this. We will be back to Barcelona and the only other hotel I would look at is The Arts which is at the other end of the bay. One last thing! They are building a hospital right next door to the hotel and before we went we saw pictures from other travellers. This had no impact at all on my enjoyment and unless you really really object to some small noise some of the day do not let it put you off.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe, cool & super sexy!”
Reviews.Author: MissFish_11
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Barcelona since 1999 & have stayed at most of the hotels, always keen to to try new additions so 1st time at the W Barcelona. Booked a Wow Suite & yes it lived up to it's name WOW with a capital W!! Fantastic suite, with private balcony/terrace, stunning views, very comfy bed! Great service & sexy ambiance. Cool Eclispse bar (rooftop lounge)/ Wetbar/poolbar Spent a few hours in the amazing Bliss spa! Great choice for couples/romance.

Reviews.Title: “an over all good experience...”
Reviews.Author: Alex A
Reviews.Content: I often visit Barcelona for business and usually stay somewhere central, near town – usually the Meridian. This time, I went with my wife and spent 3 nights. We celebrated a special occasion and wanted to be near the beach. I have stayed in many 5 star resorts in Europe, Asia, USA, and the South Pacific so I think I can objectively judge the overall experience. The check-in experience was cold and impersonal when we arrived with an employee who was not particularly polite and flexible, in spite the fact that he knew I was celebrating a special occasion with my wife. We had to wait for a couple of hours until our room was ready. However, my further liaison with the W reception staff with Pasquale and Romina in the front desk was good and they were particularly understanding, efficient and polite. Just some useful general comments in note form: 1. The W is not located near town. It is a good 10 to 15 min walk from Barceloneta and a 25 minute walk from the Ramblas. Taxis are fairly cheap however and can save you time. 2. The hotel is much more impressive at night. Some of the infrastructure is run down and this is exposed in day light. For example chipped off corners in the corridors, are very common, paint that has faded away in many parts etc. The corridors and elevators are particularly dark during the night to create an ambiance and hide certain flaws I guess… 3. Impressive views from the higher floors (15 to 25) from both sides. The north facing side that overlooks the beach has a slightly more interesting view at night, but I would not pay the premium of around Euro 50 plus, on top of the 300 per day we paid. We stayed on the 20th floor and all the high floors from any side are amazing. 4. I do not think this hotel is appropriate for families with small children, primarily because of the large number of couples (straight and gay) and their behavior in the pool and the adjacent bar area (I am not conservative but the staff was reluctant to enforce any decency code of conduct in public areas). In addition, the beach features a lot of nudists 50 plus men…Not my cup of tea… 5. Breakfast (if not included in the price) is at 29 Euro per person +VAT and is definitely not worth the money. I believe the selection is very poor for a 5 star hotel of this reputation. I have stayed at Starwood hotels in Greece, Asia and the South Pacific and the breakfast was simply amazing. Not at the W Barcelona. 6. The rooms are overall very nice with lots of amenities and of course excellent views. Our room had a blocked basin when we arrived, and was missing a light bulb from the light near the window. The shower had a few issues with the flow. The basin was immediately fixed after I reported it to the reception. Amenities are above average, with Bliss products, nice plush bath robes, a Tivoli sound system with an ipod docking station The radio didn’t work but connected our mobile phones and solved the music issue… 7. The mineral water in the room costs 4 Euros. I think this is a rip off 8. The pool bar cocktails are excellent and all the sun beds and seats are very comfortable. 9. The pool’s size is a joke for the size of the hotel and always far too crowded on a nice day. The beach is quite decent, clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. The water quality is far from the Aegean sea, but quite nice for Spanish beach standards with very nice sand that has been artificially brought in. It can get quite wavy in East or South east wind conditions. Verdict: An overall decent experience, yet rather overpriced for what it offers. Many alternative options for a ~ 300 Euro per night accommodation budget, that does not including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “If only this hotel was as good as the weather ........”
Reviews.Author: 374jane
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in some wonderful hotels around the world in the Starwood group I assumed that the W Barcelona would fulfil all the promises made on the website. A stunning design from the outside and lovely location but inside, many rude unhelpful staff, the room (although wonderful views) was full of rusty fittings, not very clean and not at all child friendly with many sharp corners on tables and doors. To The Manager at the Westin Melbourne Australia, this hotel needs you now!!

Reviews.Title: “Extreme WOW for narcissists”
Reviews.Author: Rooinek
Reviews.Content: OK, the thing to know about this hotel is that the toilet is in the bedroom. It’s not in the bathroom. It’s in the bedroom. It’s quite the thing these days to have the toilet in the bedroom. But why? There is no bathroom. The loo is a frosted glass cubicle (once more with feeling) in the bedroom - it is neither soundproofed nor odour-proofed. So there you are, doing as Nature intended, perched on the throne like a figurine in a snow dome. Only it’s not such a pretty sight. The cubicle is decked out with floor-level spotlights in such a way that, seen from the bedroom, you are artfully back-lit and highlighted, as you squat, like the famous Rodin sculpture, contemplating. I don’t know, maybe everything is in public these days and maybe I’m just a has-been – I mean, after Rikki Lake, Big Brother, Facebook, Jerry Springer, everyone opening up their innermost secrets to the world maybe what Starwood Hotels is telling us is “hey, just take the final step and let’s live your EVERY MOMENT in public”. Maybe they’re so ahead of the curve that their next venture will have the showers in the lobby. Maybe you’ll soon be able to pay extra to have glass walls between rooms so your neighbours can watch. And it’ll be extra for one-way glass. I’ll bet they are testing that somewhere. What the hell, maybe someone gets off on that kind of thing. Who am I to judge? The whole vibe of the hotel is “see and be seen”. If you’re after privacy, forget it. This is a goldfish bowl for gawkers. Don’t eat in the Bravo 24 Restaurant. It’s 24 euros for soup and 8 Euros for bread (Bravo, we got them to pay 24 Euros for soup – geddit?). When we asked, stunned, how soup could cost so much they told us that the vegetables had been hand-reared. For that price I expect my carrots to read the news to me, not just lie there. And the waiters have been trained to translate “tap water” in their heads as “bottled water” for another 6 Euros please. The vegetables may have PhD’s but I’m not so sure about the serving staff. In fairness to Starwood, I think the hotel doesn’t own the restaurant, they just lease the space. In short – a self-conscious hotel with lots of enforced wow cool stuff. The top-priced room is called an Extreme Wow Suite. Expect an Extreme Wow Shock when Nature calls.

Reviews.Title: “Awful design , great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donna B
Reviews.Content: When arrived I did not like at all the idea of the hotel being a bad copy of Burj Al Arab in Dubai. Barcelona is so famous about its architecture that the hotel owners should NEVER approve the design of the hotel. On the other hand I must say that the hotel is great. Rooms , restaurant , bars, the pools, the service was great and we definitely recommend this hotel to everyone reading.

Reviews.Title: “stylish hotel poor waiter”
Reviews.Author: harry l
Reviews.Content: We are a professional couple in our early 30's. We stayed for two nights and were impressed by the design and views from the hotel. The reception staff were pleasant and informative, however, the waiter we had on the 8th of august was both inattentive and rude. When asked what wine i would like, i inquired what pinot noirs he had, he said there were only spanish wines available and THAT I WOULD NOT UNDERSTAND !! What a presumptuous and rude comment to make to a guest. I was frankly disgusted both by his attitude and the air of indifference which he displayed. I have received much better service at hotels that cost a fraction of the W. I would expect that the hotel would place customer service formost and unfortunately this was not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: tommy303030
Reviews.Content: Thanks for a great hotel!!! Stayed here for 3nights and everything was perfect...service(they fixed soccerticket 2days before the game barcelona-real madrid....just pay it at the concierge and picked them up at the same time at the concierge) and they were so srviceminded all of them(we had contact with santiago miraglia..great guy)...and the room with the view over the beach and city...the beds are unbelivieble......the food also great....and the location perfect on the beach..and a smart thing was that they had shower with private both downstairs so when we had a late flight back we just showered at 4pm and then left the hotel....A nice restaurant downtown is catalana(tapas) on mallorcastreet i think 236 or something...15min taxi from the hotel....the hotel is 15min walk from la rambla....we are definitely coming back...thanks again...tommy&jempa

Reviews.Title: “Ibiza arrived in town”
Reviews.Author: KeesE
Reviews.Content: The W is an impressive building. Together with the beach location the main reasons for us to choose this hotel for a 5 night stay. It was clear upon arrival that we did not 'belong'. So we asked for a great room to compensate for our mistake. Ans we got it. We booked a wonderful room. All wonderful rooms look out over sea/harbour and all fabulous rooms look out over sea/beach/Barcelona. Barcelona is a vibrant city. The view over the quit sea watching ferries and cruiseliners sail by was really calming. So I preferred the wonderful part of the hotel. But not all rooms are that wonderful. Avoid rooms floor 1-5 (disappointing view). Do not accept a room with a view on the building construction of the new Desigual HQ (bad view, lot of noise all day already at the pool). Floors 6-15 are fine. Floors 16-21 are perfect. Floors 22-25 look perfect, but you can hear the beat of the music at the Eclipse bar till late in the night. Our room on floor 23 was spacious with 40 square metres. The bed is soft and was one of the best we ever had in any hotel. No bath but a great shower. Less impressive is the glass walled toilet. It's just indiscrete. Roomservice, laundry and minibar are over expensive. It is a shame there is not even a complementary bottle of water. No turndown service either. So I asked reception. She asked: 'what is a turndown service?' Get a course in hotel business dear! New towels and some amenities came right away. So that is ok. And the Bliss products are just great. Our shower was broken. It was repaired immediatly. Staff even called to ask if we were satisfied. Having a full iron board in the room is pleasant. Getting a bed on the pooldeck or sundeck is not easy. There are not always enough beds. Unacceptable for such an expensive hotel. The pool furniture is the same as at the hotel Urban in Madrid. Comfortable but quality a bit poor. So some beds were already broken, just like at the Urban. Generally the staff is very helpfull. But watch out for some staff members at the pool with a big attitude. Two did not want to help us at all.
