Only when a bunch of perfect people with money entered the scene, they were happy to arrange beds right away. I was really happy to see guys like José. He seemed to work twice as hard as most. The staff should follow a more active bed policy (allow only one bed per person and accept no claims by people leaving for hours for breakfast or lunch). What would certainly help is refusing non-residents to use the beds. A lot of 'friends from the city' came over for a visit to the pool and the beach. Having a party. It's easy to access the facilities without a key (doors are kept open, key is not required to use the elevators). Sometimes an unpleasant smell of food covers the pool deck. Construction failure? Swimming is impossible. The pool is small for this size of hotel. But not too small for Barcelona standards. Problem is that there is no kids pool. So the little ones make it their territory. If you don't have two pair of sunglasses and four pair of swimshorts, you might feel a bit out of place. For you, there is the beach. It's public, but well controlled and secured by the hotel. And you will immediatly see some nice beach restaurants right under the hotel serving great food at reasonable prices. The corridor to the Bliss Spa is impressive. Only there is a crossing from storage/kitchen to restaurant. Several times this crossing was covered with spilled food. When it is clean, you can see the intensive use of the carpet at this crossing. Not the thing you want to see if you enter or leave the spa. Security was watching the property intensively. An incident with a small local anarchy group was solved cool, professional and immediatly. Still you do not feel the presence of security. That is the way it should be. One day we had a problem with the elevator. The door showed unpredictable behavior, the elevator did not move anymore. We decided to use the SOS phone which you will find on each floor. No response, dead line. After reporting this, they took it extremely serious. Some stupid guest used the fire alarm in the hotel lobby one night. I can tell: it works, also in your room. Wifi is for free at the lobby (hotel service), but also on parts of the beach (Barcelona service). We liked the Anyway Anywhere service at the lobby. We liked the Dutch lady serving us even more. Eager to help, eager to give you a great experience. Sharing many options. Big smile. Some might find the location a bit out of centre. But it is right on the beach, it does attract all kinds of new activities and three bus lines make it right to the hotel. Line 17 brings you in 15-20 minutes to the Gracia (luxury shopping / 3 subway lines / tranfer to bus 24 for Parc Güell). And it even is not too far to walk to the nearest cheap breakfast place, pharmacy, supermarket and ATM. A lot of remarks can be made. I can go on a few more pages. But in essence, this place is a very well run 24 hour night club for a certain type of people. We now knoe for sure, we are Westin people. So we will not return to the W. But the experience was fun to observe for a few days. Many will love it. Ibiza is in town!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Wow and ... Wow!”
Reviews.Author: dinkadog
Reviews.Content: We had, my wife and our 3 kids, an unforgettable time at the W Barcelona – our stay was perfect. The service was flawless, from the check-in, to the staff at the restaurants, from the housekeepers, to those at the pool (special note for those surprising treats... fruits or ice cream...). Very often luxury hotels are associated with gold decorations and thick red carpets - you'll find none of these at the W but a very modern and audacious definition of 5 star experience. There is no doubt we would warmly recommend the W Barcelona to our friends, and we are sure to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Haven of peace during the Circuit”
Reviews.Author: AJRUK1
Reviews.Content: Chilled and stylish as you would expect from any W. Plus points + Great views (SPG Gold did the trick for the room) + Pool area was classy, good views all round and plenty of cocktails and thankfully not so many kids... + Decent gym which no-one seemed to use + Friendly staff Room for improvement - Check-in was a bit chaotic, reception has a strange not so user friendly lay out - Breakfast area bit cramped... its the best meal of the day! - Dumbells only go up to 18kg... Top-tip Dont think about the cost.. have a mojito.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury property, but still a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: CedricΠerre
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Barcelona, we went there both for sightseeing & relaxation. So beach location was great. Taxis are very cheap compared to Paris, and you can go easily anywhere in the city (not much traffic in August) for less than 10 Euros. We were staying in one of the two Spectacular Suites located on #21 floor with a huge terrace. The suite definitely has the Woaw factor. It was airy, with lots of light, a nice lay-out. Ours was #2115, with a view over the sea & port. The second one #2114 has the famous view over Barcelona beach. On floor #21 all rooms with even number were facing the beach actually. Enjoying the terrace was fantastic, but privacy can be an issue as Marvelous, Wow & Extreme Wow Suites are just above. Internet is not cheap (5€/hour, about 20/25€ for one day) and parking is 25€/day. Service is better than what I expected. Check-in / check-out was quick and efficient, we had in room breakfast (excellent), staff at the bar is nice, all the young guys in the lobby were really helpful. The only negative point is that despite the hotel is almost new, some equipments / furniture show their age. Carpets are stained and lights were not working properly. It's a shame and it can ruin the overall impression. Maintenance is a real challenge for this hotel. W is trendy / hype, it's a solid 4-star, but it's not a luxury property, probably because service cannot be personalised when there are 473 rooms & suites. It still was a great experience, and we would go back with no hesitation. However be sure to book a high category.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel to combine a relaxing beach holiday with a sight-seeing, active adventure.”
Reviews.Author: Shnorrer
Reviews.Content: Staying at the W in Barcelona was a pleasure. The location was perfect. It was the only luxury hotel situated on the beach, with a magnificent pool area (although I wouldn't recommend the pool for children as it was quite small). It was near enough to town however that you could take a quick taxi and arrive at any number of bars, clubs and tourist destinations (there is also a bus stop directly outside). The rooms were lovely, especially with the spectacular view from the upper floors. The service was also excellent, in particular the "guide" employed by the hotel who advises you on places to visit, whether you're looking for a local bar, or a vintage sunglasses shop. Food and drink are expensive, but it's worth it for the luxury and exclusivity.

Reviews.Title: “Both Style and Substance”
Reviews.Author: FoodJunkie66
Reviews.Content: Overall Comments: Trendy hotel that is also well functioning and doesn’t fall into the trap of form over substance. Room: Excellent…large rainwater shower, very modern with cool mood lighting, Ipod dock, great view down the beach. Above all, a supremely comfortable bed. Location: A little out of town….7 Euro taxi ride to main city area, but right on Barcelonetta beach. There are a few restaurants and bars close to the hotel. Facilities: Nice pool with a very funky atmosphere, private beach area a number of restaurants and bars. All in all a very well equipped hotel. Food: Didn’t eat there other than breakfast and by the pool, that was good. Service: Excellent Parking: On site and secure valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best experiences”
Reviews.Author: PSL3000
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is simply the best you can find in Barcelona: located on the beach. It offers you the possibility to visit Barcelona city, and when you want to relax later in the day, return to the hotel and relax at the pool or on the beach. The personnell is extremely friendly and helpful. There are spectacular views on the sea and on Barcelona when you are on a higher floor. There is so much to see in Barcelona that we will need to go back there, and returning to this hotel is one of the things we're looking forward to. Meals offered in the restaurants were delicious, with lots of variety to choose from. There was only one glitch: the extra child bed we ordered, took till late night before arriving. As an apology, the hotel manager offered free breakfast for the whole family for the entire stay (5 persons, 4 nights). We have really appreciated this compensation.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't quite deliver the promise”
Reviews.Author: Hargothian
Reviews.Content: A fabulous looking hotel with luxurious rooms, in a wonderful city. But... our view (9th floor) was over a concrete flat area behind which there is an oil terminal (I have no doubt that a city view would have been extraordinary but ours certainly wasn't). The vaunted lighting system didn't work. The internet didn't work in the room. And it is expensive - a fairly modest dinner for four came to €250. If you want to lounge by the pool in the shade of a pool bed, being brought drinks by very attentive waitresses then this is a good choice. If you want something more from your trip then it probably isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for the great service”
Reviews.Author: littleplant
Reviews.Content: Few days before the trip to Barcelona I sent an e-mail to this beautiful hotel (WhateverWhenever.WBarcelona@whotels.com) to try to make a reservation for 36 people to spend some time of the last night before the departure from Barcelona in the great Eclipse bar at the top of W hotel. I got an response from Paul who was very kind and provided me with all the information needed and in the end he made the reservation for us. We didn't sleep in the hotel (i hope i will one day), so i can't say much about the rooms, but the part we did see is just amazing, the hotel is great, from the outside and inside. And the quick responding staff and the service we had when we arrived was exelent. Thanks W!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dakaramy
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, very well located right on the beach. Clean spacious rooms with magnificent views, especially on top floors. However the ocean is not so clean as the hotel is near sea port, and also you sometime may see a minor traffic jam on the way to the city in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Why do I bother?”
Reviews.Author: kawainekko7
Reviews.Content: I booked a fabulous room where, according to the website, "you'll soar over full beach and sea views in the hotel's HIGHER floors." Upon checking in, we were told that the only fabulous room available was on the first floor. I explained that we had booked a fabulous room which is supposed to be on a higher floor. The person at the desk stated that she could put us on a higher floor but in a lower class room and then the next day she would move us in a even better room on a high floor. Fine, we said. We were exhausted from traveling and all we wanted was to go to sleep. The next day, we were moved into a "fabulous" room on the 8th floor. While the view was great, this was still not the room that we were promised. I would not be quite so upset had it not have been our honeymoon and that we were paying for a better room. They did send us a bottle of cava and a fruit plate in apology but what we really wanted was the room that booked. This is not the first time that the W has failed to deliver. The last time I stayed at a W, they were overbooked and did not have a room for me. If this is how they treat a Gold member, I'd hate to see what they do to someone with no status at the hotel. Maybe status means nothing and we'd be better off spending our money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 stars youth hostel....”
Reviews.Author: X M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W hotel togheter with my son ( 8y.o.) for 2 nights and as we got there the building looked astonishing. So far so good. First thing that destroyed our staying was a bunch of old teenagers, way to drunk for the time ( it was around midnight) that literally jumped on the front of the taxi we were on, the entrance itself was full of suspecious individuals strolling around ....no security or staff members around, it seemed to be a Super Mario Bros. live game: " TO REACH THE ENTRANCE, AVOID THE DANGER!!". Once in, I inmediatly realised that it was not getting any better: at the front of house there was just a person trying to attend a queue of 20, probably 25 people.....I knew that it would have taken quite a bit before we could check in. After nearly 20 minutes waiting we got to the desk and the guy after apologising for the waiting he was not responsable for, checked us in quckly and profesionally. I felt a bit sorry for him... he looked kinda desperate for help........The room we got assigned, despite the fact that was on the 2nd floor was nicely decorated, confy and with a spectacular view! As we went to PortAventura the day after, got back to the hotela bit late in the evening happy for the fantastic day spent with my child and quite tired. Decided to get some room service food: asked for a couple of cheeseburgers with fries... More disappointment..... the meat was that raw that i thought it would start to move and the chips were soggy and tasted like they had been fried hours before....that joke cost us around 50 euros.....The morning after, as our flight was early in the morning, left the room around 5am to check out. At the reception was the same guy that checked us in who bearing the time offered us coffee and water.... that was the first nice thing since we arrived! Grabbed a couple of bottles of water and replied back to the guy that I wouldn t dislike a cup of coffee to take away. He promplty made a phone call asking for coffee. Few minutes later the coffee arrived..... served in a 2 plastic water glasses .... the ones every water dispenser has.......with a serviette on top instead of lead......Left the coffee behind... that was not the safest way to get a hot drink away...... The only people I would recommend this hotel to are rich-party-animal-backpackers........

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: VIATORES_55
Reviews.Content: Top location, beautiful view, nice ambience, but really REALLY poor on service. I do NOT recommend working with this hotel, unless you have "nerves of steel". Employees are proceeding very inefficient, not at all having the sense of “how to treat guests” or “how to treat problems EFFICIENT and QUICK”. It’s just quiet normal to keep paying guests waiting and wating … and wating. They just completely ignore additional requests and do not put attention to errors. NOT expecting from a hotel like W!! All in all lots of difficulties, which could have been avoid very well. If you are looking for a stylish hotel and your focus is on location and design this might be a good choice for you. But if you are expecting a five star service, including the generous amount you are paying - I dearly discourage you from booking this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: bobbytwin
Reviews.Content: We liked stayiong at this hotel, although our stay was breif. The beach is right there, couldn't be better for relaxing. Hotel is very comfortable although the staff service wasn't wht we are used to at home, it could have been better. Overall a good hotel, and with a fun disco also!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Impressive apart from the Naked men on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: ilana613
Reviews.Content: Even though the W is a cab ride to anywhere in Barcelona I booked it as it looked great. On arrival the staff were very helpful and courteous. Our room was contemporary with fantastic views. A free bottle of water on each side of the bed was a nice touch but the mini bar was extremely expensive. The bathroom area was not as clever as it first seemed. The glass door to the toilet did not give enough privacy. I wasn't bothered as I was with my family but I would not have been happy if I was staying with a friend. All the food we had in the hotel was good and the staff even arranged a Kosher meal for us without any fuss at all. One thing to be aware of was when I visited the beach with my 11 year old daughter, two naked men decided to lie down close by in a position which we both found inappropriate as it was just too close. Even stranger was when another naked man asked if he could use my phone as his wasn't working. I had visions of chasing a naked man down the beach running off with my mobile so I politely declined. The hotel was great, but if I go back I will stick to the pool area which is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views. As for view of the city if you are new to Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Jsullymc
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel on the water, a bit of a distance from Barcelona city center. Excellent service and staff.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel on beach”
Reviews.Author: IONACARR
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because , primarily because of its location on the beach, as I know how hot Barcelona is in July. From the moment we arrived service was outstanding, we had a very complicated booking due to paying part with points, we went to the check in desk said our name and a manager appeared from nowhere and upgraded us to fabulous suite. The rooms are amazing with fantastic views, the outside area better than the Arts. The only fly in the ointment was the hotel restaurant which was worse than appalling, and horrendously overpriced, my daughter and I ordered Sea bass, two different type of fish arrived , mine looked and tasted like very watery cod, and hers not sure of origin but definately not sea bass. asked waiter he didn't know either, a steak looked like a mcdonalds burger, and for this culinary delight of four main courses , bottle of wine and a couple of soft drinks 300 euro . As I said you can avoid restaurant, hotel is fab!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE W!!”
Reviews.Author: countryclubber
Reviews.Content: Great hotel on the beach in Barcelona. Fantastic places to eat close by. The room was amazing and the views gorgeous!!!!!! Loved the bed floating in the room and the automatic curtains! Great walk in shower and heavenly bed! Check in was my only gripe. Arriving at 9am from the USA, I requested an early check in. No rooms were available until after 4! I was lucky enough to get a spa appt. at Bliss Spa (which was divine). We would have been okay sleeping by the pool, but it was raining!! I'd suggest booking the spa for the day prior to your arrival!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: bahnsoul
Reviews.Content: We visited on our honeymoon and had a wonderful time. I wanted a hotel with a combination of beach location yet also close to great art (Picasso Museum) and architecture (Gaudi) and this was perfect. It did feel a little like a club atmosphere and it's a pretty young crowd, which we didn't mind. Peerless beds--we had amazing sleep here. Staff was helpful and friendly, and W Insider Isabel was incredibly helpful with recommendations for our 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced and bad service”
Reviews.Author: SophieScragg
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review on trip advisor but my recent stay at the W hotel in barcelona made me really want to. We were staying one night for mine and my boyfriends one year anniversary. The prices were so expensive and the service did not match it. I do not mind spending a lot of money on hotels and drinks and food but I expect the service to match. One waiter was so rude to me he actaully made me cry. I felt as though I was just a customer who was giving them money, they did not make us feel special and they hardly seemed interested.Our view from our room was of huge cranes which obscured our entire view of barcelona which was totally unacceptable considering the amount we were spending. When I complained about the room they were unable to do anything as the hotel was fully booked..... they could have offered something complimentary like a bottle of wine but nothing. The service is in my opinion was pretty bad for a 5 star hotel, everyone is fairly polite but they do not take any pride in their job and they do not increase your experience. If you want to see the real barcelona then dont stay here, it is far from all the amazing places such as las ramblas and the gothic quarter. If you like nice hotels then stay in a nice boutique hotel near passieg de gracia or the gothic quarter, there you will find the REAL barcelona. The bar on the 26th floor was fantastic and I would really recommend going there but not staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: michaelq92
Reviews.Content: This is THE hotel for the perfect weekend trip with your love. You wake up in bed viewing Barcelona skyline and this is the view your falling asleep with ...

Reviews.Title: “Loved.”
Reviews.Author: TravelEatPrayLove
Reviews.Content: First, a rant: My partner and I travel a lot and are big W fans. If we're staying in a city with a W Hotel, you bet we'll be checking in at one. I am SO tired of hearing W Hotels get bad reviews because it was "too clubby", "too loud" or "it wasn't kid friendly". W Hotels are mostly geared towards the internet generation, or people young at heart who appreciate a lively environment (this includes grand opening parties and busy lounges). Yes, you pay a little more than, say, a Motel 6 and you're not always going to get a really "cultural experience" at a W, but they are what they are: modern and hip - and I hope this never changes. You're at W Bali and realize you'd prefer to be surrounded by trees and have an open concept suite with no walls? That's great - so a W Hotel simply is not for you. But please....don't rate it 1 out of 5 for that reason. Also not a very kid friendly chain...so book accordingly : ) About W Barcelona: We were there for 5 nights. Stayed in a Cool Corner Suite on the 7th floor. I arrived very early at 7 am and my partner arrived in the afternoon. As our room wasn't ready yet, I was allowed to check my big luggage at the front desk and was shown to the change-rooms on the gym level so that I could shower and change after my long flight, which was great. Our room was ready by 10 am, also a plus. Breakfast food was great, buffet style with a small menu selection, but you won't need to order off of the menu as there is so much to choose from in the buffet. Eclipse bar on the 26th floor has great views and delish little snacks, as does the W Bar Living Room on the main floor. We were at W Barcelona for the Wet Deck Grand Opening Party, which was, yes, very loud...but we were fine with it as we were there enjoying the view, live DJ and dancing until late. The hotel is about a 15-20 minute walk into the main part of town, but it is beautiful, as it's along the beach on a boardwalk. If you're not up for it, grab a taxi for $5. The only thing that wasn't amazing was our service at dinner...our server was inattentive, but we felt bad for him, as he had too many tables. One more thing: We love kids...but not when we are on vacation. So what was nice about W Barcelona is that there weren't many kids at all. Overall, we had a very enjoyable stay and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Far from attractions”
Reviews.Author: memch
Reviews.Content: This was a very good W overall. Our rooms was spacious with a wonderful view. If you dont mind taking a cab or bus ride to other locations it is a great hotel to stay in. Walking anywhere other than the marina is a bit difficult from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: h0nestyfirst
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. It is situated on the beach, far away from metro etc, so you have to walk/take a cab. Theres a long line of taxies outside the the hotel at any time, night and day. We got a room on the 5th floor, and it was great. The bed is one of the best i´ve ever slept in, and the rooms are big and comfortable. Some things you need to be aware of though: - The bathrom: It is not really 1 bathroom. The sleeping room is seperated from the the toilet with a glassdoor, so you NEED to be close to one youre sharing your room with. Its not possible to go to the loo without being "noticed". You hear everything. I shared my room with my bestfriend, and we just played loud music to solve this. Worked OK. That being said - the bathroom was very nice and clean, so nothing there to complain about. Big and luxurious shower. - They play very loud music specially in the weekends at night. We stayed from sunday to tuesday, and could hear music from the pool in our rooms at 2 oclock on the sunday. They also play music early in the morning. Didnt bother me that much, but noticed it, and thought it was a bit weird that the hotel (where people come to sleep...) play music that late. - The breakfast is expensive compared to what you get in Barceloneta (5 min. walk). It doesnt include hot meals, just cold. They did not have vegetables, such as cucumber and salad etc, and not things you would expect from a 5star hotel. They had smoothies and fresh fruit though. Around 20 euro I think. - One last thing: Book this hotel through sites such as hotels.com - its much cheaper than calling them directly. We paid 410 for one night in the cheapest room, but would have gotten it for about 310 if we had used hotels.com If you can afford it, I strongly recommend it. The pool area is great, the service is great, the surroundings are lovely, and Barcelona is beautiful! Had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wantastic view, staff, art experience and stay.”
Reviews.Author: beinhart
Reviews.Content: Everything is wonderful with this hotel. A friendly reception at the arrival, we got a room with a terrific panoramic view over the beach, good beds, nice restaurant and a relaxing drink in the couches outside the patio bar. Before we returned to our room, we experienced a brethtaking light-show in the lobby. My wife did not like the toilet with glass walls and door, but I didn't mind. The breakfast-area was great, too Next time I hope guets are granted with free Wifi, but be sure - We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best views in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: KIMBO777
Reviews.Content: Late review.... Busy with international relocation. We stayed 4 days at W at Barcelona in March 2011 as part of a 8 day trip to Spain before moving to Madrid. W is a landmark building and boasts amazing views over the coast. We stayed on 23rd floor facing Barceloneta beach and the view was spectacular, day and night. Check-in was efficient. However, getting to the hotel from the airport took a while to explain as many cab drivers didn't understand "W Hotel" in English. They have their own name - either they say "W" in Spanish or appear to call it by a localised nick name of sorts. Staff were typical W, relaxed and chic. Cleaning was good and the staff were generally very friendly and happy to help - typical W. We only had breakfast within the hotel, choosing to go to various tapas bars around town for other meals. Concierge recommendations for bars, restaurants were spot on for us. Breakfast was good but the restaurant was always very crowded and noisy - there was an IT-related conference on at the hotel when we were there so lots of business men, probably more than usual - all with the usual IT professional looks (pens in pockets, short sleeve shirts and those name tags around their necks all the time)! No offense to IT professionals.... Location was good - walking distance to the beach, marina and old town area. Would happily stay there again and would recommend strongly if the price isn't too burdensome. I'm sure there are many other good hotels in Barcelona but if those who don't mind not being in the thick of the action all the time, then highly recommended. We saw some nice hotels in the city area as well but decided that it was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle given it's only a 10 minute taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “It is what you would expect from the W in Barcelona - amazing.”
Reviews.Author: CHF83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Barcelona then Madrid for our honeymoon. We had a great time staying at the W Barcelona. Our room overlooked the busy beach and city, and the hotel bars were great. The concierge sent us to the best restaurants, and everyone was very helpful. We will only stay here when we go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, for a young crowd”
Reviews.Author: Bally76
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a beautiful location,spotlessly clean, excellent staff. It does require a good walk to get to other local places, which we did not mind but just note it.. Food is pricey at hotel, simple breakfast is reasonable. Weekends are definitely for the young, beautiful crowd, 20 something. We are an older couple than that and were definitely out of place on a Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sören
Reviews.Content: We came to Barcelona for the start of a cruise with Costa and we just had to try the W for one night. It's an impressive hotel, very modern, nice atmosphere, great restaurants, and as you would expect, pretty expensive. The location is nice right by the sea, but it's a fair walk into the city center. If you want to treat yourseves with a bit of luxury, we can recommend W, be prepared to pay!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite and impeccable!”
Reviews.Author: Quadzzilla
Reviews.Content: From every point of view, the experience was exquisite. I initially was not satisfied of the floor I was given I room since I had requested high rise. Within minutes, I was relocated to my satisfaction. The staffs were impeccably professional and cordial. Room was spotless and representative of the W reputation. Food was great and the terrace’s official opening party a night to remember.

Reviews.Title: “There are not enough WOW words to describe how fantastic the W Barca is!”
Reviews.Author: STHart_03
Reviews.Content: It is rare that a weekend break has such an effect, but almost a year later I have come good on the promise to myself, that I must write a review after such a staggeringly fantastic W experience. I had encountered a minor problem during the booking procedure, and was well reassured by Montse Ontiveros (reservations manager), that all our concerns would be taken care of. We hadn't even arrived, and already they were taking care of us! Our check in was late, (due to the air traffic controllers strike-we were lucky to arrive at all!!), but managed swiftly when we arrived. Our room was on the 22nd floor, and once we opened the door, it didn't take long to realise what a sublime view of the coastline and the city we had. Lucky us! We didn't waste much time before we went to the W (main) bar on the ground floor, where we were well taken care of.The cocktails recommended by the very friendly and professional bar staff were fabulous. Our wake up the next morning was to a rather enviable view, although I imagine with ceiling to floor windows most views are pretty spectacular.We treated ourselves to a room service breakfast- when the sweet sleeper beds are this comfy, why would anyone be daft enough to get up 20 minutes earlier. Christian (if memory serves me correctly), was the waitperson who promptly delivered breakfast, and was so pleasant, informative and totally charming, we almost invited him to stay for breakfast! The food was amazing and we loved the selection of pastries and fruits-there is plenty to suit everyone's taste. Sadly we had to leave the hotel to do some obligatory sightseeing (this was not my idea!), I would have been happily amused for the entire duration of our stay, to lounge about the hotel in one area or another. Later in the evening we took a trip to the Eclipse bar, recommended by just about everyone, and yes, it is as fabulous as it has been described..the sax player was brilliant and entertained the uber trendy crowd for the duration. During our stay,our only disappointment was that we had to leave at all! I know some of the friends were hoping we would be stranded in Barcelona because of the strikes by the air traffic controllers, but sadly, it was not to be. There are not enough superlatives to describe the true fabulousness of the W hotel and it's service and staff. Pricewise it may be a little more expensive than your average, but it's worth every penny! We can't wait to plan our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “All you'd expect from the W + a long, chilled out beach walk”
Reviews.Author: AshleyPollak
Reviews.Content: Work trip to film in the conference centre. Had enough time to sit out on the lovely pool area and swim a few lengths. Fabulous room with a great view. Big comfy bed and all mod cons at your disposal. Big shower area. The building is a vision from a distance and being that it is right at the end of the beach you've got some time if you walk to have a look at it! If you're getting a taxi then that's not much of a problem, but they do add up.

Reviews.Title: “W....ow!”
Reviews.Author: vwatts32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a break in the city centre to give us chance to unwind. The experience was truly wonderful. No relaxing though! Who would want to close their eyes? I have never seen so many beautiful, well-dressed, stylish people amassed in one place. The rooms are gorgeous. I have stayed in some fantastic hotels and rooms but this was by far my favourite. The staff are hand-picked clearly to match the stunning hotel. Both in aesthetics and service they were unbeatable. Thank you for a lovely stay. Also to mention, despite the fact that we had a child the uber-cool atmosphere is not at all exclusive of families and we sat happily in the bar together with our nine year old and she loved watching the fabulous dresses and shoes waft by.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful souvenir”
Reviews.Author: SoTheTil
Reviews.Content: It was a gift for my birthday and I liked it very very much. We had a suite with sea view. It was wonderful. The hotel architecture is amazing and the atmosphere so W!

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Jippy
Reviews.Content: The W was exactly what we expected - super modern, super cool, and in a great location. We had one of the cheap rooms on the first floor, but the view was still great and I love that the bed was facing out to sea. The beds are also amazingly comfortable!! The staff were great on the whole, except for one lady who seemed to be some kind of host for the Eclipse Bar. She escorted us up in the lift and didn't make any conversation at all, zero. Then, when we were waiting for a lift for the return journey down, ourselves and another couple were understandably enjoying the view and before we had realised a lift had finally arrived, the same woman (who had also been waiting) promptly disappeared into it and took off, when she could clearly see we had also been waiting! We were gobsmacked quite frankly and would expect better from a hotel like this - perhaps a lesson in manners wouldn't go amiss!! Apart from this one incident, we had a great stay and would definitely return, as you get the best of both worlds being by the beach, but yet only 10 minutes walk into the Old Town. One tip - we booked via Expedia, which was considerably cheaper than had we gone direct. We stayed for four nights and even with the 4-for-3 offer the hotel has, it was still much less on Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DirkClaussen
Reviews.Content: I thought the W's in the US were spectacular. W Barcelona was all that and more. The entire experience was fantastic. The place had a great energy to it, that matched with the vibe of Barcelona. The attentiveness of the staff was top notch. I especially want to thank the W Insiders that made our stay perfect in every way. Can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: Qazwsxedcrf
Reviews.Content: The W is the only Barcelona hotel on the beach. It is a 15-20 minute walk into town and little bit removed. For us it was the best of both worlds- we spent time on the beach and walked or took a short cab ride into the city every day. The staff is very helpful and professional. The rooms are modern. We were upgraded to a suite on the 17th floor. The views are amazing. Floor to ceiling windows looking out on the ocean. Four restaurants recently opened on the beach, directly below the hotel. They are not owned by the W and more affordable than the hotel's restaurants. We ate in 2 of them and the food was excellent. The hotel pool is great. Drinks by the pool bar are expensive...$15 for a cocktail. There is a dj by the pool all day and night. All in all, the W is the perfect choice in Barcelona if you want to spend some time on the beach or by the pool and be close enough to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy chic and glamorous”
Reviews.Author: Coodie830
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights...and it was a little on the expensive side but totally worth the price! The ambience of the hotel is perfect for the beach and you're constantly surrounded by beautiful people! There are multiple bars, restaurants and a club all on property. It's definitely the hot place to be. The beach area is perfect, tho public, it is still catered by the W hotel! We had a wonderful stay and great service! Definitely would stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, OK Service, Form over Function”
Reviews.Author: czaffa
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a very enjoyable stay at the W Barcelona. As a young, stylish couple the hotel seemed catered to us. Pros: - Room: The room was beautiful. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The view was amazing. Motorized blackout curtains. Need I say more? -Ambiance & Location: Outdoor beds, cabanas and lounge chairs (both at beach and pool area) free to guests. Absolutely incredible location right on the beach. Very liberal culture-- expect 50% of the women to be topless while tanning. Don't miss dining at the Bravo restaurant (quite expensive but worth it-- make sure to try the world's best Jamon Iberico de Bellota). Cons: -Room: After spending a night at the hotel some (metaphorical) cracks began to show in it's perfection. It became apparent that the designers and furnishers valued form over function. Some examples include the weak water pressure in the shower, the glass walls separating the shower and toilet from the rest of the room (forget privacy), most of the lamps didn't seem to serve any function other than to throw some dim colors onto the wall. This theme of form over function carried into the hallway, which was poorly lit and dank. At the end of the hallway there was a large glass door that opened out onto a metal stairway with a beautiful view of the sea-- but it was designated as an emergency exit only and was linked to an alarm. -Ambiance and Location: More families with young children and older couples than I expected, given the nature of the hotel. I imagine all the music and lights must have given them a headache. It is a 3-4 km walk to La Rambla, which is the main drag through Barcelona. If you don't want to spend half an hour walking into town, your only options are expensive cabs or city busses (which are quite nice). The Eclipse club/bar at the top of the hotel is rather small, didn't have much comfortable seating and smelled a bit like vomit during our stay. Service: The service was decent overall, and I suppose on the whole a little more friendly and attentive than what you'd expect in Spain, but that's not saying much... Below my personal standards. Continuing the overall theme of form over function the hotel seems to employ models whose sole purpose is to open certain doors-- but usually are too busy chatting with their friends to be bothered to do so. Almost everything (including the internet) comes at a price, and expect a load of laundry to cost almost as much as your room itself. This being said, I have very high standards and did enjoy my stay overall. I would recommend this hotel to any young (or at least young-at-heart) couple or individual looking for a great spot to enjoy the beach in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: ChiGirl76_11
Reviews.Content: Kicked off a 2 1/2 week trip through Spain with 5 days at the W Barcelona, and may have set the bar too high! All other hotels were a disappointment after this... the W was gorgeous, inside & out, and service was impeccable. As a platinum member of the SPG program, we were upgraded to a suite so our room was enormous, even by American standards. The private beach just steps away from the hotel was too good to be true, and tempted us back from the heart of Barcelona each & every day for our "siestas". Must try: the W Burger from room service - bacon & egg, total burger heaven!! An honorable mention goes to the cava sangria that was our go-to drink on the beach. Deliciously refreshing! Only words of caution are that taxis are hard to come by in the early hours- we had a morning flight and waited more than 30 minutes for a cab (despite calling the night before to put in a request). Plan extra time for this to be on the safe side. I hope that I'm able to come back to Barcelona someday, and if I do I will not even consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JB60TRAVELS
Reviews.Content: We have been to Barcelona several times, and this was our second stay at the W. Overall it is a very nice hotel, very clean with friendly and helpful staff. We were in a room on a higher floor that overlooked the cruise ship harbor. The poo, area is beautiful and the beach area, while not the best is adequate. Chairs at both the pool and beach are free. Since our stay last year they have added express checkout, which avoids the logjam at reception on checkout day. The hotel is a bit out of the way, but a short cab ride from the bottom of the Ramblas. It was a perfect place to stay, doing touring during the day with some time at the pool/beach in the late afternoon. The only problem that we had was a limo that was charged to our room that was not ours. Reception told us that they could not remove the charge , as it had been added by the concirege and that we had to go through them. We spoke to the concirege who initially insisted that the charge was ours. She told us that it was a pickup at the airport for a flight from JFK on Delta. We did not arrive on Delta and did not fly through JFK, and offered to show her our eticket itinerary.. Instead of just deleting the charge the concierge spent the next 35 minutes trying to find the email to justify the charge or figure out why the limo was sent or who it was properly chargeable to. Not a pleasant way to spend time on your last morning in Barcelona, and clearly not the level of service that I expect from the W.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for looking at beautiful people and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: hbahl
Reviews.Content: My friends and I came from Chicago, NYC, LA, and San Francisco for a bachelor party in Spain that I planned as the best man. We went to Ibiza first then to Barcelona. My cousin came a few days before a stayed at hotel 1898 in Playa Catalunya and it's nice, great shopping, but I have to say, the W Barcelona blows it away (at least if you're a hip jet set crowd). I'll tell you the positives and the negatives. The positives, well it's an amazing looking hotel on the beach with the view of the ocean. You will see lots of beautiful people walking around. It seemed like you were in some high end lounge with guests that stayed there. But there were families also. The pool and the bar was amazing. The pool area and the pool itself could have been bigger as the hotel is massive and they could have made it a bit bigger, however you walk outside and you have the ocean so they probably build it that size based on that. The room itself is beautiful. Nicely kept amenities, the shower, the toilet and toiletries. The bar at night is really happening and they have a DJ in the evenings playing some good tunes. There is a club on the 26th floor, which is overcrowded but is fun to see the ocean and the city from high up, but I still preferred the pool. The downside, well the staff was overall very attentive and great, however I wish the food was the same caliber (which I felt about other restaurants there also like Opium and the place next door). Checking in and checking out was painful... it took forever! We were running late to the airport and the lines were really long on Sunday when we wanted to check out. The one lamp in our room didn't work and the ipod dock for the iphone didn't work directly, you had to pull the wire out and plug it directly into the iphone to make it work (minor things that could happen in any hotel, but thought I'd mention it). You also have to take taxi's to get to downtown area and the shopping. Overall however, it was a fantastic stay. I miss it everyday since I left! When I go back to Barcelona again, I will definitely stay here either for a family vacation or for a friends trip. It's definitely fun and well worth the cost!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Stunning Views, beautiful rooms, and great service”
Reviews.Author: dsdavis
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and am a SPG & Marriott Platinum guest. This is by far one of my favorite hotels ever. Loved the rooms & view from the rooms. The Pool was very relaxing and the poolside service was great. I tried to get into the SPA but there were no openings....make sure you book in advance if you want to get in. I really liked their specialty cocktails & food around the pool & bar areas. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: Lovell-Smiths
Reviews.Content: The Lovell-Smith family vacation at W Hotel was as near perfect as you can get we were made welcome as soon as we arrived, which was 10 am and check in is at 2, luggage stored and we were invited to enjoy all the amenities until our rooms were ready so off to the pool we went. Staff by the pool couldn't do enough from moving the heavy sun umbrellas just where we wanted them to topping up the ice in our drinks. The rooms and views were well there's that word again - wonderful - as for the beds - w - and rooms cleaned and lotions and potions topped up daily. Reception helped regarding sightseeing and shopping info and the 17 bus right outside hotel gets you to the city centre in minutes but taxis were good value and we used them from the city centre to get back at night - we'll be back that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, funky but not really for families.”
Reviews.Author: JeanAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4nights. Rooms v comfortable with 2 double beds. Hated the sink being in the room and it dosent drain well ( but looks trendy!)View not so great on the harbor side. Food v average at breakfast. Pool v small and v cold. lots of people round pool trying hard to look cool. Didn't appreciate the couple having sex at 7am-10am one morning which could be viewed for all to see from our window. (had to shield the kids eyes!) we did enjoy the hotel but have an open mind about the nudity and don't take the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby and room, but that is it”
Reviews.Author: Lag11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and had to change rooms in the middle of our stay because they needed to clean the windows and do some repairs. After waiting in the lobby to get the keys to the new room, we go up to the new room to walk into another couple still in the room dressing. I walked back down and was ready to check out, but the manager came and apologized for the mistake. They give us another room on a higher floor (this is after they said they were full) and meantime the couple from the other room came down also to complain. They apparently has revised their stay for one more night, but this was not registered, so I'm not sure who is to blame. The hotel is pricey for the room, food, drinks, lobby, Internet, etc. The bar on the top floor has a nice view, but not really good music so difficult to stay long. The VIP area was empty and they would stay not let us sit there. The only good thing is the hotel is on the beach. Nice short walk to e beach and nearby restaurants on the beach. We will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: BarrieDunnLondon
Reviews.Content: From the moment you see this Hotel you can tell it’s a truly stunning building. We stayed 4 nights in a room that had stunning views of the beach & city. On the 21st floor we must have had the best view anywhere in the city! The room was to the high standard we were expecting. (The photos on the Hotel website give a very good idea of what to expect). There have been a number of reviews commenting on the location of the Hotel. Located near one of the main ports its not right in the centre of the city but we found the location perfect as we could walk to the beach & restaurants close to the Hotel. As with most cities we normally get a cab to more central locations - 10 min. taxi trip. This Hotel was no exception and we found taxis easy to get late at night. The Hotels facilities are very popular with non Hotels guests however the Hotel restricts access to the pool area & roof top bar for non residents. The Hotel has two lively areas in the evening - the pool area is very comfortable coming alive with a stylish crowd until 2.30am each night. During the day its also a great area to chill out. The Hotel also has a Bar & Nightclub on the top floor of the Hotel. Again another great place to spend time with great views of the city. Overall a Hotel that really has a WOW factor. We will be back!! Barcelona is a city that offers something for everyone. One small comment for improvement - the Concierge did not really know or recommend the best restaurants & late night venues. However we found the doorman very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms - but no pool....”
Reviews.Author: DokEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: While it's on the outskirts of Barcelona (very near the working harbour and the cruise liner port) you can still walk into the city. The hotel itself is sparkling and modern. Our room looked over the beach to the city and wad stunning. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in! The food in the restaurants was great with even our daughters eating the veal and steak. Only downside was the pool - pretty small to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location but very slow and bad services (2 Star Rating)”
Reviews.Author: Georg1970
Reviews.Content: we stayed in 2 rooms including breakfast from June 26 - June 30, 2011 . The breakfast buffet is not worth it and the services are very slow . But before that , when we checked in at 6:30 P.M. on June 26, our rooms were not ready although they confirmed before that they will be ready . The receptionist at the check-in desk was rude . We were going to chnage the gotel to the Ritz Carlton (Hotel Arts), but the manager came and provided us with 2 interconnecting rooms . But was a horrible experience . After that we did not use any of the hotel facilities or resturants other than breakfast because it was with the room . The breakfast was terrible experience compared to 5star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with problems”
Reviews.Author: raarstol
Reviews.Content: We took a day in Barcelona to go to the beach with the kids and stayed at the W for a night. the staff at the front desk were exceptionally friendly and professional. The room was very nice, although quite expensive. View was amazing, although in the morning we had sheild the kids from 6 naked drunks on the beach right outside the hotel. Not a big deal except they were doing a little more than sunbathing. The thing that really bothered us at this hotel was the pool staff. Our kids were playing politely in what we thought was a wadding pool, not really making a bunch of noise. We noticed that they were skipping service to us for about an hour. Tried to make eye contact as the six or so servers bustled around, but no luck. Eventually one of the ladies came up and told us that our kids could not play where they were playing as it was not a pool. I wish I had a picture of it. Anyways I don't think they handled it properly. this hotel is not really kid friendly from my experience. The beach is nice, but topless so harder with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Bee2836
Reviews.Content: Amazing views, best in class design, lovely location, disappointing service. Arrived at 10 am , told room ready by 3pm and they took our number to call, no one did, did not get room until after 4 pm. Shampoos , soap and towels not replenished, Wish Team advised us we needed to ask for shampoo and soap ...ok first hotel I've had to ask. 2 dinner reservations not made and the finale..bills paid for by cash in the hotel showed up on final room bill and still not sorted out , no one has followed up. that all said, it is a very lovely hotel but service is better elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for couples, just ok for families”
Reviews.Author: Monarchy
Reviews.Content: W is chic and trendy. A wonderful place with great service that would prefer you didn't bring the family. The service was great, the food was great, the view was great (we had a corner room and had two windows full of ocean view. Everybody goes out of their way to take care of you. The beds are magnificent. I love the W when it's just me and the wifey. It's not cheap but worth the price to me. But, it isn't a family oriented hotel (although many folks bring kids, including me...last time, though...shame on me). The pool area is intimate. The bathrooms are behind smoked glass and the showers leak if you let water go everywhere (a bit odd). The kids (7,9) have excellent manners and don't run wild. That made it much easier but we still couldn't give them the room kiddos need.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and would definitely recommend it to others”
Reviews.Author: Jay_GLeeds
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by the fantastic location of this hotel. Yes, it is outside of the city but it is set in a fantastic spot on the beach, within a short stroll of the wonderful harbour restaurants (from there it wasnt too much further to the Ramblas). The hotel itself, was hip and modern with a fabulous pool area. The room we had was spacious,well appointed with an extremely comfortable bed but the highlight was waking up to the most perfect view of the city/beach from our bed. The food in the bar and restaurant was fantastic and the buffet breakfast had everything you could wish for. There was only one very minor flaw (in my view), which was that if you wished turndown service and a change of towels in the evening you have to request it. This wasn't made clear to us and we had to ring to ask them to do it. However, someone was there immediately so no big deal but worth knowing for any future return trips.

Reviews.Title: “more style than substance”
Reviews.Author: lovecyprus
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed. Hotel very stylish, and a few of the staff were fantastic, but its too big to carry of "chic" properly. Pool itself was too small. Upper terrace lovely, but if you sat too close to the restaurant there was a distinct smell of fish. Beach was fab - special mention for the delightful ricardo who was ultra charming. The Wave restaurant intruded on the lounge (or vice versa) so we were sitting in the lounge/bar area listening to the waiter taking orders from the restaurant behind a flimsy curtain. On a positive, view from bedroom was unbeatable and the electric curtains were perfect for a lazy way to wake up and appreciate the amazing view. On a negative - why on earth have a frosted glass cublcle for the toilet in the room, same for the shower. Sink in the room. Even if I were away with my true love for a romantic weekend (or my lover for a dirty weekend) there are certain things that require at least the option of privacy. Tried to hard to be cool, without considering practicality. Felt so uncomfortable, didnt really relax at all. Sorry!

Reviews.Title: “5-star hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: lgoncalves
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W in Barcelona in June 2011 and hotel is simply fantastic. The staff (Andre, pool bar waiter, THANK YOU for the caipirinhas! ), the rooms, the pool, the food, everything is excellent. My only suggestion to management: add more staff to do the check in / check out. Lines are VERY long in the mornings. I had the option of express check out, but when I arrived I had to wait in line 20 minutes. My stay at the hotel was so positive that I still give it a 5-star rating in spite of the long lines at check in /out. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tanny81
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The hotel is big for its boutique concept and it felt a bit impersonal and wasn't near of the main attractions but overall we had a great stay! The room was very comfortable, had a fabulous view of the beach and well designed. It reminded of Park Hyatt in Shanghai but I wished the toilet were more separated from the room. The concierge got us tickets to the sold out Barcelona soccer game and was very kind to give us a scarf as a gift and we were treated with a bottle of cava. But I preferred the hotel Omm location right next to the Passeig de Gracia.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel on the beach, solid 5 star!!!”
Reviews.Author: zolzen
Reviews.Content: The most spectacular rooms I've seen, and our room was only on the 1st floor. The most comfortable bed ever, spacious room, great views, and the shower is divine. Spa is over the top, with glorious ocean views. The new restaurant below the hotel on the beach side was incredible. This hotel has impeccable service; my wife left her journal in the room, they found it right away, and was sent to us very quickly via express mail. We can't thank them enough! This property is an incredible addition to Barcelona, it's absolutely stunning! BTW, free internet near the lobby restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Eh. I was kinda let down”
Reviews.Author: marielle26
Reviews.Content: i spent the last 5 days on my honeymoon at the W Barcelona. We used the last of our Starwood Points to stay in the studio suite on the fifth floor room 528 We were so excited to stay here hearing only good things about it and there were so many things that went wrong i can actually say i will never ever go back to this hotel. we will be staying at the Arts the next time we go to Barcelona. first of all the website says that the room has port and sea views if you take a look at my pictures that ive posted you can see the wonderful views i had the privilege of looking at when i opened my shades. and if i wanted to see the water i had to smash my face against the window and turn my head all the way to the right. the actual hotel is beautiful. but of course we weren't even staying in the fin. we were on the 5th floor in a separate square in front of the fin which was kinda of a bummer being that we were on our honeymoon and they did nothing to make us feel a little extra special. of course they were "fully booked" and couldn't change our room. so now we finally get to our room. what a disaster. there was an open bar of soap on the sink, a shower cap hanging from the faucet, the complimentary water by the bed had been opened and pretty much empty. the slippers were opened, the breakfast menu filled out, the soap and shampoo half used and best of all there was a letter written to the previous couple who has stayed in the room before us on the side of the bed. so basically the room hadn't been cleaned. mind you we had a very late check in of 9 pm they had alllllll day to clean our room. when we called to complain all they did was send us up new soaps and shampoos.. woopdeedoo. that really just killed the hotel stay for me and my husband we told them it was our honeymoon they didn't go anything extra for us not even a bottle of champagne. nothing. and to top it all off the housekeeper walked into my room TWICE without knocking. once at 1230 pm and once at 830pm!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! like how dare you just walk into my room without knocking. im sitting naked on my bed and the housekeeper decides to just walk into my room at 830 pm. i was livid and called the manager right away. at the end of all this we got 120$ off of our bill. wasnt enough. we will not be back again it was the last stop on our honeymoon and the 5th hotel we were staying in on our honeymoon. it was one of the top hotels on our whole trip and it was the biggest let down. not a fan

Reviews.Title: “It would be a miss not to even take a picture of it.”
Reviews.Author: precious_angels
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a WOW Room Category in the 19th floor. Not many words left for an experience like this. This hotel is a piece of art lying at the beach of Barceloneta. Perfect rooms. Exquisite Views. Do not miss to visit Bliss Spa! The only drawback would be that it is not close to any of the sights except for the Barceloneta. During summer time, you are right next to the most cool place for strolls and romantic beach views. The rest are far from the Hotel but if you are keen on using means of transport...you may do so! Nice time. p.a.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Wonderful Location on Beach”
Reviews.Author: mel_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here one night pre-cruise, so this is not a comprehensive review. However, we think that the location is exceptional, right on the beach but with easy access to the city. Google Maps and, even the hotel's web site, don't do justice to its fabulous location. We had a room initially in the lower 'extension', but because of the music from a private pool party on the Sunday evening, the hotel upgraded us without any hesitation to another room - a 'Wonderful' Room - in the main building and on the opposite side to the pool. Both rooms seemed the same to me - 'upgrade' seems to be a euphemism for 'swap'! That was our only issue, and that was dealt with very professionally. Lunch in the downstairs restaurant was exceptional, high quality ingredients prepared by a Spanish chef with flair - heading for the Michelin star! Breakfast was slightly disappointing for the price - nothing hot, unless ordered and at an extra charge per item. Overall, the minor points were greatly outweighed by the fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!! young and chick...GO THERE!!”
Reviews.Author: elavie
Reviews.Content: went there with a good friend of mine for 4 nights weekend in barcelona. very good hotel. GO THERE!! staff very very helpfull and friendly. very chic hotel. very young (most of the staff is young). lovely and clean rooms. made good clubbing recommendations (go to Opium Mar..very nice place) 2 faults: 1. the bathroom has glass doors and walls....so you hear and see alot...so you can only go with a good friend...or spouse. 2.they didnt call our room for a wakeup call we asked....ON THE MORNING OF THE FLIGHT!...luckely we had our own alarm clock...this could have been a serious problem. besides that, everything was perfect (also the eclipse bar was very nice...if you want a calm clubbing night - to rest the night after the opium mar:)).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a 50th Anniversary Celebration”
Reviews.Author: tobycosta
Reviews.Content: Don't wait until you are celebrating 50 years, so now!! The hotel, staff, location , food and weather - all Perfect!! We couldn't have chosen a better place to visit - a wonderful city to explore and all with a great beach to enjoy. Five Stars are not enough for our experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, hip resort, on the beach and close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Mperls
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on Trip Advisor, we didn't know what to expect. We arrived with our 4 1/2 year old and was really impressed. Gorgeous hotel, positioned right on the beach, with a beautiful pool and beach chairs for use on the beach. Our view from our room was spectacular (definitely try to get rooms toward the higher levels- 5 and above). The service was excellent and the breakfast and food by the pool were very good. Prices are on the pricey side but you are at the W and with the hotel, views, pool, and beach to us it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, overcrowded and over there.”
Reviews.Author: MikeRSF
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W with my family at the end of our cruise for two days to unwind before heading back. The check in process/ desks were crowded lacked coordination. Checked in early and left the bags with the bellman to return at 3 for the normal check in time. Rooms were not ready and they had no idea when they would be ready. I complained it was no way to treat a Gold member customer, still the staff was clueless. Finally got to my room but there was mold in the shower stall and the bathroom mirror has started to peel at the bottom. The view from the room was nice, but you can't live in a view. The wait staff at the pool was friendly, but the prices for food and drink were high even for a W. great and prompt room service and the waiters were fine at the Wave restaurant but the food was just so so.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views and a distinct vibe”
Reviews.Author: adlibitum1
Reviews.Content: Striking design and rooms with view of the sea, this hotel projects a hip vibe that I found both fun and a bit ridiculous at the same time. Constant "cool" music in the lobby and mod lighting effects grew a bit tiresome for me, but the large standard rooms with floor to ceiling windows and sleek decor hit the mark. Free wi-fi and iPod docks are a plus, the location either a plus for quiet out-of-the-way or rather inconvenient for the traditional Barcelona sights. Nice pool and beach access.

Reviews.Title: “This is the life!”
Reviews.Author: nehapremjee
Reviews.Content: The W was one of the best hotels I have stayed in. There was absolutely nothing missing- the beach was right there, La Rambla was 5 minutes away by taxi and the overall look, feel and service in the hotel was fantastic. Absolutely 7 star, I would stay nowhere else in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - a real dream”
Reviews.Author: Roberto-Alemania
Reviews.Content: I was on a business journey and unfortunately only just one night at W Hotel in Barcelona. It was also a very pleasent stay in this wonderful "Wow" Hotel ! The service is great. A great young team. All very friendly, authentic. Very cool - but still very warm and very professional. The room and view was unbelievable amazing. The interior is very well designed, but not overloaded. And form still follows function. No "overdressing" of rooms etc., and everything easy and perfect to use, allthough lots of High Tech. Restaurant and Bar also of very good quality. If I would have had a bit more time, I would have loved to use this wonderfull pool and relaxing area. This Hotel is very difficult to explain with words. Best is to go, see and "dream" yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever- what a party!”
Reviews.Author: tabsmum
Reviews.Content: If you like a really good time, partying all night, good food and fabulous, friendly service then go here. I personally won't be going with my young daughter but for a friends weekend away I dont see how it could have been any better. Well, apart from an upgrade but some you win, some you lose. Beds are ridiculously comfortable and the whole hotel is a feast for the eyes. Was a bit concerned about being out of town but actually wasn't a big deal, and afterp the sightseeing box had been ticked we didn't want to leave the hotel again. Dj klaus made the eclipse club the best I've ever been to! You should know it's next to a lot of construction -but it's not going on at the weekend, I still am not hesitating to give it full marks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, expensive and sub-optimal location.”
Reviews.Author: ski-fanatic-73
Reviews.Content: The most important facts about the W: It is expensive: in everything. Down to the 4 euro 0.5L water or the 7 euro beers (in the room, or the bar). The location is nice: at the end of a peer in the harbor of Barcelona. There is a beach in front of the door and that part of Barcelona is way cleaner than the rest. If you don't mind hopping in a taxi all the time, it is a good location. If you want to walk home / to the city: it is really far. (Taxi's in Barcelona are cheap; taxi-drivers hardly speak English, but are on average pretty kind (and drive like idiots :) ) Then there is the staff: young and friendly. The people in the bars or breakfast can be very very slow, but they are very kind. The rooms are good. Lovely soft beds and plenty of space. Also the view is good from almost all the rooms. At last: the people. Where some 5 star hotels attract the more decent people, this is more the 'rich kids' and 'new rich' people. If you can disturb yourself by this, the W is probably not your place/

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a summer trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Irishguest
Reviews.Content: Our initial impression of the hotel was not good. We arrived at 11 pm on a Sunday night of a holiday weekend in Barcelona and the noise in the lobby as we checked in was intense. There was loud clubbing music and a huge queue for the lift to the 24th floor nightclub. But, notwithstanding the initial sense of noise and chaos we weer checked into our room in minutes and the room was well soundproofed. In any event, the noise level tapered off by the time we finished dinner at about 12.30 am. And next day, in the sunshine, we really began to appreciate the hotel. I was apprehensive about staying in a property with more than 400 rooms, but the hotel is more than capable of handling the numbers. The restaurant at breakfast was never overcrowded; the pool area (which is gorgeous) always had plenty of beds available and there are aslo beds on the adjoining beach; and best of all, there were always plenty of very helpful staff at hand to cater for anthing you might need. The only dissappointing features were the room - we had a so-called "fabulous room" which had a great view but was otherwise very run of the mill - and the other drawback was the lack of enough maids to service the rooms. On one of the days we were there, we had to call reception at 4.30 pm to complain that the room had not been serviced. And for the three nights we were there, there was no sign of an evening turn down service which was surprising in a 5 star GL property. But these quibbles did not spoil what was in every other way a wonderful 3 days in this hotel. It is the perfect place to stay in summer - right by the beach and with one of the nicest hotel pools I have ever seen where you are expertly looked after by the large pool/bar staff. The pool area turns into a very elegant outdoor bar in the evening which is ideal for pre and post dinner drinks. While we ate out most days , we founf the food at the hotel to be excellent too; I would particularly recommend the Bravo restaurant which has superb food with tables on a shaded terrace overlooking the sea. We want to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Gypsys, tramps and thieves”
Reviews.Author: Pamplonarun
Reviews.Content: I do love Barcelona but in the four days I was there was an older gentleman and his wife were robbed on the Rambla by Hotel 1898 and two days later while I was on the subway (L3) I stopped a gypsy woman from pick pocketing a Belgian man with his family. They work in pairs. One distracts you and the other comes up from behind and takes your camera, back pack or whatever they can get away with in a split second. The lady I caught had a sweater over her hand and bumped into the man while her female accomplice stalled at the subway door exiting. She was reaching down into his front pant pocket as she was exciting the subway to make a quick get away. I was seated nearest to the door and the man was standing with his family near the exit door. I saw what she was doing and I shoved her as hard as I could and she jumped off at the stopped with her partner then she turned around a spat in my direction. I love Barcelona but the thieves are RAMPANT!!! The Rambla is horrible and they stalk you until you relax and get a gelato and they make their move. They are all in on it- The Mimes the riff-raff all of them. They live there day in and day out and all know who's who. One can actually sit in one spot long enough and eventually see them at work. The Police enforce nothing and know all the local characters. If the thieves don't get you the bar keepers will. Just hold on to everything and love the beauty of what once was.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Beach on the Edge of the City”
Reviews.Author: awj_parker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for two nights in June. We had read ahead of time that the W is not centrally located, so we were content to spend two days walking along the beach and exploring the Barcelonetta and Port Vell area. I'm very happy that we did. The hotel is a stunning modern building on the very edge of the beach. It looks like a giant silver sail coming out of the ocean. Our room was one of the basic W rooms, but the view was breathtaking, and they set it up in such a way that your floor to ceiling windows are the focal point. While there, we took advantage of the pool deck, the beach, the gym, the W Store and the Eclipse Bar. All of these were done well - the attention to detail and service excellent. The Eclipse Bar was incredibly cool, and the large cocktail list made for a fun cocktail hour near sunset looking out over Barcelona and the ocean. I almost laughed out loud when I used the washroom in the bar to realize that its urinals are set up in such a way as to give you an unobstructed view of the ocean while you are doing your business! I think the W chain is known for its level of service. This was confirmed to me in a number of ways - the concierge making us a dinner reservation upon our arrival at a fish restaurant in town; one of the porters getting us a taxi and providing directions to the driver in Catalan so that we wouldn't get lost with the language barrier; pool staff being around and ready to bring us anything we might need in an instant; being able to hop the line to the bar as a paying guest; etc. The service definitely lived up to its reputation. Sure, this place is expensive. But I think that's to be expected with the quality of service and the overall experience. I managed to get a good deal on a discount website, making it even better. If you are willing to spend the extra, and also willing to be a little further from the action, this is a wonderful option which I would jump at the chance to go back to again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: NikNak586
Reviews.Content: Although a little out of the way, the W is well worth the short taxi ride from the town centre. Rooms are stunning, well equipped with some novel features. My room overlooked the beach and open sea so views were wonderful night and day. It’s not inexpensive but is an experience worth enjoying. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place with great views of the sea”
Reviews.Author: Satyu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one day.. great hotel especially if you get a room at one of the higher floors with a 2 side view of the sea. Its about 30-40 minutes from the international airport (about 30 Euros by taxi). The building is quite tall and impressive. Check-in was smooth. The room given to me was nice but a little strange since it was a twin bed. My room was at the end of the corridor which gave me a great view of the beach and the sea. The decor was simple and well laid out with a few mini bottles of alcohol arranged tastefully on the sitting area near the window. The best moment was to wake up at around 6 AM watchin the Sun rise on the horizon. The hotel has easy access to the beach. The washrooms were good though I did not understand how water from the shower area could come into the main room area even though the glass doors were closed. It was a very short stay but very comfortable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awful service”
Reviews.Author: stub0612
Reviews.Content: After a long business trip we decided to stay somewhere nice to relax for the weekend, an arrival at 6pm the room was not ready and then a catalogue of errors occured: bath in suite broke, laundry took more than 24 hours, breakfast order was all wrong, dinner reservation sent to wrong room, car I ordered for me and an important client was given to someone else, lunch by pool was poor. I have to say that the pool staff and other members were excellent, however the middle management thought they were guests rather than employees and needed to act less "cool" and more professional. Some teaing issues need to be addressed. Location and hotel excellent, smoggy staff let it down, this is the same in London, maybe it is a W brand. Seems more like whatever whatever then whatever whenever

Reviews.Title: “if you pay full price, not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotoanywhere
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights before a cruise in late May/early June. Booked via hotwire.com so paid a discount rate, if I had paid full rate would not have been happy. I booked this hotel because I thought it would be nice to have a relaxing beach or pool day, however, the weather did not cooperate. Location: You can walk to the Metro or the Las Ramblas, however, unless you plan on spending time at the beach I recommend staying somewhere else. Room: Room was nice and modern. Because we booked via hotwire we were on a low floor with a poor view, which didn't bother me as it was expected given the price we paid. The room was nice but I could see if you were travelling with a friend or someone you don't know well it may be less than comfortable. The bathroom is basically a frosted glass wall and there's a curtain you can pull to shut off the sink and bathroom area from the remainder of the room. If you want to spend time on the beach, this hotel would be great, if you are just sightseeing, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull experience and stunning views”
Reviews.Author: JLeupen
Reviews.Content: The location and view of this hotel are really wonderfull. The rooms are modern and well equiped. Although I was on a business trip, I did see much of the hotel and it all looked splendid. We had dinner with a great number of people at the hotel and the management of serving all these people was done perfectly, which is a really hard task, as I know from experience. There was a professional working here, that was clear. Only one thing went wrong and that was the checkin. We discussed that we would provide 1 credit card (from my colleague) at the checkin as a deposit for final payment. During the evening I was not able to enter my room and it seemed that my room had no deposit on it. Something had gone wrong with the credit card. They had probably forgot to link the credit card to both rooms and as a result they had cancelled the access to my room. My colleague was not around, so I needed to provide my own (non-company) credit card. That was the only negative comment I can make on this hotel. I did not see the prices of the room, but expect these to be very high and would personally on book this on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel to stay for a week end, but not easy to get to”
Reviews.Author: topkapitan
