Reviews.Content: We loved the guestroom ! Very spacious, nice layout and superb views. Lobby and corridors are strange. So are the restaurants. Breakfast wont satisfy Anglo saxons or Asians and is more continental type. Even that is a miss in my opinion as breads do rapidly get stale on the display. We found strange that there is no coffee/tea maker or water kettle in the rooms and one has to ring and wait for room service. This is a minus point considering most 5 star hotels do provide. Service was good and friendly overall. Although some rubbish was left in eh rooms from the previous occupant and there was a consistant bad smell in the shower. We had free high speed internet throughout as we were part of a conference. Location is superb is you want to go to the beach and explore the restaurants of Barceloneta. But, if you want to visit Barcelona's sights, it is 1.5km away from the metro station - not a biggie if you are an able walker and have the time.

Reviews.Title: “The W..ow effect”
Reviews.Author: FanThomas
Reviews.Content: Well, wow. That's the first thing you say when you get to stay at the W. Design, design, design. And views. That's what really makes this hotel stand out of the crowd. Especially, when you think of the standard, big city, kind of hotel: the W is nowhere like it. The glass-and-steel, enormous modern lobby already sets you at what to expect. The rooms are fantastic: modern design, inventive lighting, fresh ideas: I just loved the bathroom in the living room concept (there is no separate bath room!). And the views? The whole wall of the room is a glass pane with a sea view of the Mediterranean: how cool is that? With a comfy couch right close to that huge window which just seems to say: sit down, take a drink, slow down and relax looking out the window. I could go on and on, but you really need to experience this to understand what I mean. Just believe me: if you like design you will like it. There is no rose without thorns, unfortunately. The service is definitely not on par with the beauty of the building. Though the beginning was promising (I got a personal call right when entering the room, with somebody asking me if they can assist me in any way, nice touch), later got quite some problems in terms of service in the restaurant and bar: waited ages for fried eggs, couldn’t get a decent espresso, waited 25 minutes (with watch in hand!) for somebody to take my order at the pool... ugh. Since I was on a business trip I needed the internet: It was distressingly slow and damn expensive (come on, with these hotel prices, surely the hotel can afford to throw in free wi-fi?). So that's it: W is surely worth a visit, but needs some crevasses to be ironed out before can call it truly perfect.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD EXPECT MORE INCLUDED FACILITIES FOR 5 STAR”
Reviews.Author: TraveladdictDerby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W in May and although we really enjoyed our stay in Barcelona we were a little disappointed with the lack of included facilities at the hotel. For £1100 for 4 nights (without even breakfast) we would at least expect free WIFI for this standard of hotel. We would also expect tea & coffee making facilities as standard in the room. Although I did email prior to our arrival & a coffee maker was supplied but with no cups, spoons or tea/coffee. The rooms were quite small but very good quality and we got a high floor room that we requested. The leisure facilities were also only available at an additional cost. So compared to other 5 star hotels, we wouldn't say the W was good value for money. The location was good for us because it was very quiet and we didn't mind the 30 minute walk to Las Ramblas and about 25 minutes to Port Vell.

Reviews.Title: “The Devil Is In The Details”
Reviews.Author: FroggieParis
Reviews.Content: Ok, the architecture is impressive. Ok, rooms are huge, very modern and all have a very nice view. Ok, this place has all the amenities that you can expect from a five-star hotel... But, as soon as you go further into the details, this place is disappointing: my room was covered with unidentified red stains, on the "window bench" and on the desk. There are so many light switchers in the room that you never know what area is gonna be in the dark or not. There was no bathtub (ok the shower room is like 8 sq meters but I still like my bathtub!). And you have to pay for WiFi access: unbelievable! As for the rest: the main hall looks like very a busy airport lounge, filled with mostly businessmen, no special atmosphere. Food is basic, nothing to be remembered. Swimming-pool is tiny. Last but not least: this place is in a remote area, not at all in the centre of town, and you need to use a taxi to go anywhere. So, in all, I was glad to be invited here on a professional trip, because it's a nice experience, BUT I would never go back and pay the huge amount they ask for their rooms, because it is really not worth that much money!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTION at the W Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: rachel88888
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are extremely picky travelers - so when reading this review, take into consideration that I went to the W Barcelona expecting the absolute best. Thankfully, thats exactly what we received!!!! The W's "Whatever, Whenever" policy was in full effect over our 4 day stay. The staff have been expertly trained- from the bellboys to the front desk to the bartenders - everyone was smiling and on top of their game at all times. The staff seemed genuinely excited to be working. Not surprising, considering the energy of this hotel- the minute you walk in, you're greeted with a gorgeous lobby, amazing looking guests and staff, and just a positive air to the whole place. Pool: UNREAL. Plenty of loungers and the hotel was full. Unbelievable view of the ocean from the pool, great service, great drinks. The day after we arrived, they turned the whole pool area into a living room type feel- and threw a huge, FREE party for all the guests- including tasty, top shelf drinks! We couldnt believe it. Room: As others have stated, there is zero privacy in the bathroom- this isnt a huge issue, though. We just developed a system of saying "Dont you have to go get a cup of coffee??" , the other person would leave for 10 minutes, and that solved that. Rooms are typical W style- modern, amazing beds, and THE VIEW- pure magic. Staff: "Whatever, Whenever. What is your wish?". Need I say more???? Food: Great. Get a cheeseburger- if your American, you'll discover what REAL beef tastes like!!!!!! This is the most chic, trendy, glamourous hotel in Barcelona. STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel in BArcelona!!”
Reviews.Author: nikkanny
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect when staying at the W. Internet is additional, and everything in the room is super expensive! Just enjoy the wonderful room, pool, amenities, and atmosphere!! It's beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Slick, ultracool, chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: cooldudes1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days on business, excellent staff, fantastic food and amazing eclipse bar on the roof. Uber cool people everwhere...go now!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate luxury in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver_Girl82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W in May and I was nothing short of blown away by how beautiful this hotel was. The thing that made it even more special was that the staff were very nice, and NOT pushy (as other people indicated). Our room faced the beach and was breathtakingly beautiful. The beds were nothing short of sumptuous. Food in the hotel is excellent. We were treated like royalty when we were there. I highly recommend this hotel. Would stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views”
Reviews.Author: alexk50
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2days pre cruise, used room service and conceriage services. Excellent bed,not crazy about frosted glass on bathrooms. Room had wonderful view,

Reviews.Title: “No words...”
Reviews.Author: JaiJai30
Reviews.Content: A hotel that knows what its customers want and delivers!!! Style oozing from every pore! Summarised by the wet deck with beautiful people doing beautiful things, beautifully!! But with all bottles of wine €15-25!! Very rare a hotel 'gets it' and the W does in bucket loads!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the view from our room!”
Reviews.Author: lmartos
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the W Barcelona Hotel (5/20-5/24) and loved it. The hotel is right on the beach and has an amazing Spa. The full body massages are heavenly. The location of the hotel is perfect if you plan on staying at the beach. It is away from the city centre and too far to walk to any tourist attractions but there is a touristic bus nearby about a 15 min walk that will take you to all the must-see spots located in the city. The best part of this hotel is the breathtaking views. We had asked for a room on a high floor and were placed on the 18th floor with city and sea views. I woke up every morning to this beautiful scene from my bed pillow. The beds were heavenly and so comfy. Beware, if you stay here, room with someone you know very well. Bathroom and shower are enclosed in see-thru glass and have no privacy whatsoever and just a curtain separates the bed from bathroom. Good thing this didn't bother me as you can see (and hear) everything. You may want to ask for a room on a high floor unless you don't mind listening to the music which plays on the deck during weekends, if you are on a lower floor. Everyone was great and made us feel so welcomed. We had asked for a coffeemaker in our room and the staff made sure it was waiting for us in our room and even brought us freshly ground coffee. The breakfast buffet was delicious! The beach was wonderful and so relaxing. If you plan on strolling along the beach, you will see joggers, bikers, skaters, people walking their dog and so much more including a few people sunbathing in the nude, but everything was all in good fun. :) The entire staff at this hotel were great and everyone spoke excellent English & Spanish. I loved our wake-up calls every morning and hearing the voice on the other end apologize for taking me away from my dreams. One staffer in particular went above and beyond in making us feel so welcomed. I plan on writing a thank you letter to him soon. We really enjoyed our stay at the W Hotel in Barcelona and hope to be back soon. Whatever we wanted, whenever we wanted it, the W Hotel delivered!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Awesome, Rocking”
Reviews.Author: dharmeshmehta
Reviews.Content: Its one of the Best hotels I have stayed in. Bad Points : Normal Room Bathrooms not suited for a family with kids and open style so maybe uncomfortable n wrongly placed. Normal rooms lil small . Pool is not tht great nor big . They should have a heated pool n bigger one. Good Points : Amazing Service ! Never heard No ! Whenever Whtever was extraordinary . The Wet Deck Party was awesome and fabulous service for a party ! The staff is very friendly and always ready to help. We moved to a suite which had amazing view and room. Always take a city facing room as has city view n sea view which is much better than sea view. Its a fabulous hotel n value for money. It beats all W specially on service n staff friendliness as staff never look for tips and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: juizai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W from May 20th through 23rd. We are gold members and booked the hotel studio suite using points (22,500 a night). I requested early checkin but was unable to be accomodated since the room was not ready. We instead checked out bags into storage and walked around the hotel. The hotel is right on the beach and a nice walk along the pier. My husband and I traveled with our 2.5 year old son so the proximity to the beach was wonderful for my son. He loved playing in the sand. It looks like they clean the beach frequently so it was very clean and well maintained. They did have some construction going on at the outside of the hotel (pier area). Looks like some new stores are going in? There was a nice red climbing rope structure that was fun for kids too a short walk along the beach. We also loved that you can rent a bike, rollerblade and people watch. Even late at night, it seems safe with lots of couples and families walking around. We were out 11/12 pm with no issue. The hotel was wonderful and the studio suite was really great! We had a nice partial view of the ocean from the 6th floor and was able to see the people biking and rollerblading. Woke up to a wonderful view of sail boats and cruise ships. There weren't many picture of the studio suite but it was really nice. We had 1.5 bathrooms. and a curtain that separates the living and bedroom spaces. Great with the little one as we could hang out in the living room area while he slept inside. The bathroom was also wonderful. The rain shower, tub, and full sized bliss shower gels/shampoos were great! The suite also included free bottled water so that was a nice touch. We did try dinner at the Wave restaurant downstairs, it was just OK for me. Food was fine and pricing not cheap but since we didn't find a lot of dining options, we tried it out. T I walked by the gym and there was lots of nice equipment but can't say I used it. I instead took a walk by the beach instead! One thing to note about the beach, some parts of the beach have nude sunbathers. It didn't bother us too much and my son didn't really notice so it was fine with us. There are a few buses that can bring you into Port Vell area. I remember one is 17 but cannot remember the others. The nearest train station is about 15 minutes away so not a bad walk along either beach but not close either. Taxi ride from the airport was bout 29/30 Euros for us. Overall, it was a really good stay we had with a wonderful room and relaxing time by the beach. Very good for families in my opinion due to the proximity to the beach. We really enjoyed the part as it was more resort like. We spent the next part of our vacation after the cruise in the Le' Meridian. The room was not as nice, and atmosphere is not as relaxing but you were at the center of everything! You can walk to many places. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again! The extra 2500 points per night we paid for the studio suite was worth it in my opinion!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, we will come back!”
Reviews.Author: solo025
Reviews.Content: It's a modern hotel which is located right on the beach and from all rooms you have amazing view on the sea. Hotel has very nice pool area and nice beach area. Service there is fantastic, you don't have to look for personnel, they will always come to you and check if you need anything. Check in was very quick and pleasant. You have everything in the hotel: restaurants, bars, fitness centre, spa. Location is very good, you can walk along Barceloneta Beach and by taxi you can get anywhere you need. We were very happy with our stay and will go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: MrEPGB
Reviews.Content: W Barcelona is a bit of a compromise . First of all, the hotel looks great. Whether it is from the inside or the outside. Check in was a pain. Because (I suppose) of a Barcelona football match, there was a _lot_ of people checking in at the same time. It took us about an hour. When we were finally checked in, they let us know that our Standard rooms weren't available yet, even though it was an hour past they're official check in time. Disappointing. But this was the only minus point of our stay: the rooms were stunning, well designed and with a perfect view (try to get upper floors), and spacious for a standard room (called "Wonderful room" by marketing ;)) Not noisy at all. The beds was incredibly comfortable. Breakfast was all that you expected from a 5-star hotel. Plenty of choice, fresh pastries, etc. Try to get a table on the terrasse, with nice weather it's awesome. Location is special: it is the only hotel off the Barceloneta beach (nudist beach). Walking to the center takes a good 20 minutes / half hour, but it's a very pleasant walk and it's nice to be away rom the hustle and bustle. We tried out the "WET" pool, which was a great experience, good music, sunscreen available if you forgot yours, etc. Everywhere the service was good but not always professional, but they do always try their best. Check out was swift and effective. Overall, we had a very nice stay, but be aware that the W isn't placed in the city center but a bit offcenter. It can be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Brunoce
Reviews.Content: My wife decided to surprise me and invited me there for my birthday. What a deception… We had a suite with view over the harbour. When we arrived, the “guy” at the reception show inefficiency, lack of education (I was talking to him in Spanish he would answer in poor English). So far so good be patient except we were not informed the view of our suite was actually over a building in construction. I called reception to comment and after 15 minutes waiting to be contacted again I decided to go down to reception. It was a special event for us. In other occasion I would have placed an official complaint. Apparently it was my fault for not understanding this can happen… The suite was not properly cleaned: w found an ice buck full of water apparently from the previous guest in there. I was glad to see a welcome card but it was also from the previous guest. Mirror in the bathroom was broken… When settling my bill I decided to pay cash. My visa was charged for the same amount + 10%. It took them 48 hours to refund after claiming. At no stage was I informed they would do so. Overall a big deception. Service in not that of a five star hotel. Staff is not trained and poorly educated. There are many other places in Barcelona I would recommend but certainly not W. I have had the chance to stay in top of the range hotels (Leading of the worlds) in most of the European Capitals (Ritz Madrid, Raphael Paris, Imperial Vienna, Bristol Berlin etc…). If you expect to be treated like a guest, don’t make up your choice for W Barcelona. On a more positive side, the architecture is spectacular, the view extraordinary and the atmosphere around rather nice. Nothing to do with the Hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Anton_Pekkari
Reviews.Content: Good points: - fabulous design - spacious rooms with fantastic sea view - private beach - excellent swimming pool with DJ sets every week end - roof top bar with unforgettable view - very friendly hotel staff Bad points - quality of restaurant food is very poor

Reviews.Title: “International Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: hospitaliteach
Reviews.Content: Best hotel stay ever! Perfect for a couple from the United States that speaks very little Spanish. From the moment we stepped out of our taxi, we were greeted like movie stars. We didn't even tell them we were honeymooners, and we booked this hotel at a LOW rate of $89 a night and they still were at our every beck and call. They planned all of our site seeing stops and told us exactly what to do and where to go, how to dress, etc. etc. This should be a training hotel for every hotel in exsistence because they are that flawless!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Could Give Them 10 Stars !!!”
Reviews.Author: Itchyfeet024
Reviews.Content: This is just my second stay at a W because I usually stick to the Westin brand of Starwood Hotels. And this wouldn't be my last. Check-in was flawless. But what was impressive was a corner room on the third floor. You walk in to a very well appointed room with a view of the beach & pool on one side and the Mediterranean Sea on the other. I cannot do enough justice with the pictures that I took so I won't bother to post them. The gym is the best I've been to and very well equiped for a "hotel" gym with cardio machines facing the beach. The pool was rather small but then you've got the expansive beach & there's a private area of the beach for W guests. The hotel is strategically located within a leasurely walk to restaurants & a night club. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “W For WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo25
Reviews.Content: WOW! This hotel does it with style!! I stayed in one of the corner suites on the 10th floor and was completely impressed with everything about W. The rooms are just awesome - the views are fantastic and look out to the ocean or across to the beach/city. Huge bed, the best linen and sheets I have ever slept in, fab mini-bar and drinks (including cocktail set), wet room with complimentary Bliss Spa products, ipod dock, flat screen LCDs etc etc....but thats just the room. The hotel itself is like a resort and you'd never need to leave - the Sweat gym is fantastic, as is the Bliss Spa - check both out if you go. The pool area is super cool with stylish loungers and waiter service - think passion fruit mojitos in the sun whilst the DJ plays beach house music! Evening time I visited the hotels Michelin-starred Bravo 24 restaurant - unique Catalan food and very good service. The rooftop lounge is certainly not to be missed for after dinner drinks. The whole W experiance is fantastic - I couldnt fault the quality and service delivered by the staff right from check-in and throughout my stay - of course this is reflected in the price. I'll be staying at W hotels wherever I go from now on. Stay here....!

Reviews.Title: “More hip party spaceship than biz plush planet”
Reviews.Author: TrophyCollector
Reviews.Content: Absolutely unsuitable for business, but positively a party zone within the greater pleasure zone called Barcelona. The pool area is for party people. The lobby is for party people. The skybar is for party people. The crowds are young. The food has midlife crisis. The profession of some girls is the oldest. Go watch the curvature of the earth from the top: (only) the skyline is truly 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it was said to be!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hotella89
Reviews.Content: Before going here, I already heard a lot of good things about this hotel... and they were all true! The building and the decoration are absolutely stunning. From the living room to the restaurant, everything is well maintained and has all the finishing touches. The outside areas are spectacular, with views over the city and the beach and people there to help you with whatever you need. The small things they offer throughout the day give you an extra sense of luxury, like a complimentary ice cream or a mini cocktail to try out. As soon as you even try to stand up from your sun bed there is someone handing you a towel or adjusting the umbrella, it's incredible. The guest room was great. Ours was in the cube-shaped building, not the main tower, but it was very spacious and had a nice view over the sea. Beds are really comfortable and waking up is a pleasure when one can press the butten to have the curtains opened and reveal the sea and morning sun. Additionally, there are large showers fully stocked with towels and amenities close to the beach for guests to use, also after check-out. Security was visible all day long and made us feel very safe. The only thing that keeps the W from a full score is the gum wrapper found under the bed at check-in and the fact that the bathroom by the Wet area was not 100% clean. However, I woudl advise everyone from my boss to my best friend to visit this hotel. It has great rooms and public areas, the associates are very friendly and cater to your every need.. overall it's the best hotel I've stayed in so far! And I didn't even see the sky bar and the meeting rooms. Hoping to be back some day! I didn't catch all the names of the people I met, but the Welcome Desk talent at check-out was amazing, as were George and Festus at the pool and Jorge at the beach. Thank you so much W!

Reviews.Title: “Appeals to a certain crowd”
Reviews.Author: alkikirk
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in 'W' hotels before and this by far was the best! The building itself is a must see and the room was spacious, clean, and very modern. The people at the front desk areas were very helpful and polite. One concierge, however, wasn't up to speed on a festival in town and we had to help him find it on the internet. We were also there over Easter, and were told by three different concierges, three different sets of times for Easter masses at Santa Maria Del Mar. We lucked out with the last one, who actually attended church there. We did, however, get excellent recommendations for local dinner accomadations. Just be prepared to do a little research on your own instead of relying 100% on the concierge staff. The lobby bar area was a fun place to socialize with other travelers, as the furniture was placed to create interaction between different groups. The sky bar had a wonderful view of the city, but not as much interactive furniture placing. The appetizers in both bars were excellent. We actually visited the lobby bar three times during our stay. Just be prepared for the continually thumping of the bass from the music. It goes all day long and into the night. If you're looking for a quite time on the beach, this hotel isn't for you. But, if you're looking to socialize with other travelers in a fun atmosphere that is higher end than a local bar or stuffy hotel, this is the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - unprofessional service”
Reviews.Author: HONkiev
Reviews.Content: Yes, this Hotel is stunning! The pool, the music at the pool, the bar... If you like W you'll love this one. The location is plus and minus, plus if you want to be by the sea, minus for sightseeing because it's too far away from the center (you can't walk, need a taxi). The real negative side is the complete service. You're getting the feeling that this is a sensational hotel run by children. a) no turn-down service even we specially asked for it b) free water (SPG Platinum) not replaced , even you specially ask for it c) bill is wrong and you've to go down to correct it (e.g. free water and free internet as SPG Platinum charged) d) wrong info from the Concierge leads to 30 minutes phone call e) even we asked for check out at 14:30 (up to 16:00 guaranteed as SPG Platinum) key and internet doesn't work anymore because they checked us out The room was on the small side since we didn't get the regular upgrade. Attention: bathroom has an open layout (which I personally like). Toilet and shower have milk-glass doors. So in case you're travelling with someone who you don't like to see and HEAR everything you shouldn't stay at the W. I hope they'll settle their issues so next time I can enjoy the view and the fantastic pool again.

Reviews.Title: “A great improvement from previous stay!”
Reviews.Author: pelun
Reviews.Content: Stayed 20-24 May 2011 in a Cool Corner suite room #1908 About one year has passed since my first stay at this hotel. The revisit was a very pleasant surprise! My conclusion is the management has listened to the comments from their guests and the hotel had improved in all aspects beyond my expectations. The staff seems satisfied with their work and therefore service is not only quicker and smoother but also much friendlier! The suite was a heaven and spotless. Daily cleaning was impeccable. Bathroom amenities replenished regularly. Quick service at the pool area. Staff plus supervisors circulating and are being attentive all the time. Check-in/check-out procedures improved. Eclipse bar on the top floor is a very popular place (serving excellent cocktails) and will get crowded early. A special thanks to Valentina and Isabell who made our stay extra pleasant with their outstanding personal attention and assistance. In future I hope the management will make wifi free in the entire hotel (still only free in the “Living room”/lobby area) and offer free drinking water by the pool. Last year the hotel had a slack sail in the wind but this year La Vela is sailing on a run!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Just a wonderful hotel, right on the beach with simply brillant staff from the first welcome to the shuttle driver”
Reviews.Author: Adderburytraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, one of the best SPG hotels in Europe. We had a long weekend with two teenagers and the mix of city and beach was just wonderful. I can recommend this hotel and the resort.

Reviews.Title: “A chic, stylish urban oasis”
Reviews.Author: voyageur1980
Reviews.Content: Just like the image of other W hotels worldwide, this one did not disappoint. Stayed for six nights and we throughly enjoyed the experience. Guest room The tag line for the room will be intimate, as there's nothing that separate you between the shower/restroom area with the bedroom. One suggestion is, make sure that you're staying with someone you know really well :). The concept is modern and stylish and bed is comfortable. Ensure to stay on the high floor facing downtown, it's quite a view in both day and night time. Facilities W Bar is the place to be to unwind and relax. Be adventurous and sip the house specialties prepared by experienced mixologists. I had Sea Breeze (I think) and it was good. Breakfast was good with adequate spread. I had continental and it got me through late lunch. Had dinner at wave for a couple of nights and both were good. Gym is spacious! Probably one of the biggest hotel gyms I've ever been to, and with good workout range. Spa was full when we made enquiry, but I had some treatments at Bliss before so I'm sure it's great. We made a stop at Eclipse, where hotel guest will get priority. The view was stunning but! that night we smelled vomit so we're out of there in five minutes. Location Some people said that the location's a bit far from all the actions. True, but for us, the morning stroll by the beach from the hotel to near by La Barcelonetta (rows of seafood restaurant, a bit of tourist trap) and the marina was enjoyable. Suggestions Had a table reserved at Principal for NYE dinner and we had the worst (and the most expensive) dinner ever. The fish were raw and the service was poor. We were baffled by how the nonchalant response about the incident. Restaurant Barceloneta - Over priced and overrated. The restaurants down the street probably will get you better seafood with much less money. Catalana - The best! The best tapas we had in Spain (and we went to many). We were there past midnight and the place was packed! Great ambiance (more locals than tourists), great tapas and great sangria! We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice I could have made.”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_N28
Reviews.Content: Traveling alone with no command of the Spanish or Catalan language was intimidating to say the least. The staff at W helped me at every turn to feel welcome and safe in a new place. The view of the Mediterranean was spectacular, and although the walk into town was a bit longer than if I had stayed in the center, it was a treat to walk past the beautiful port every evening on the way home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views. Very cool. Pricey. --Far from town.”
Reviews.Author: mpolatin
Reviews.Content: This is a great, new modern hotel. Maybe one of the best W Hotels in the world. Two things go along with this -- attitude and price. But both of those are outweighed by the cool rooms and great views. As a SPG Plat, was upgraded to a cool corner suite. Just breathtaking...One other negative, they are a bit removed from city center and getting a taxi can be difficult -- and it is very far to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a good night sleep, but aggressive staff”
Reviews.Author: Ktrinka9
Reviews.Content: We changed hotels from Le Meridien to the W for the W beds, which are wonderful. We stayed in the Wow Suite, which had a beautiful view of the ocean from the bedroom and lounge area. As mentioned in other reviews, the bathroom area is separated only by a curtain you can pull shut. However, there are frosted glass partitions, which afford some privacy, which I found acceptable. There is a rain head shower, which I loved. The bathtub, however, is literally in the middle of the bedroom with a huge mirror next to it. I found this a little odd and creepy. The lounge area is very swanky...live DJ and bar filled with hip hotel guests. Service was good and the staff was polite (a rarity in Barcelona). When checking in, beware of the super aggressive hotel staff. We brought one small bag and were asked no less than 7 times if we needed help with out bag within a 5 minute span of time.b the staff does seem a bit pretentious and secret service agents, running around the hotel on missions. Ok, now for the part that was unpleasant. As we were waiting for our breakfast to arrive in our room, a man knocked on our door and insisted on coming in and checking the bar and our bedroom. As I was not dressed, we asked that he return later. He waited in the hall until our food arrived and then pushed his way into our room with clip board in hand. I was in the bedroom area getting ready, as my husband was getting the food. All of the sudden this strange staff member bursts into the bedroom area. When I asked him to leave he just continued inventorying our room, with clip board in hand. My husband came in and told the man to leave. He tried to open the closets n the hall to continue the inventory. By now even the woman who delivered our food was telling him to leave. Finally, he left. We were going to stay another night, but after that, we declined. It was a very unpleasant experience and a bit scary. We have always loved the W brand hotels and were shocked by this man's conduct, but will not return to the W in Barcelona. At any rate, the hotel is really far from the main attractions and there are plenty of other superior hotels closer to sites.

Reviews.Title: “Worldwide wow - definately at w barca!”
Reviews.Author: Ewout
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing hotel with very good staff! As I write this review I am at the pool deck. These attendants that work here are genuinly helpfull, attentive and funny, yet professional. Very good vibe! One future investment? A nespresso coffee machine in every room please?

Reviews.Title: “No other Barcelona hotel can compare to the W”
Reviews.Author: dean3818
Reviews.Content: I have to start with the location. The W Barcelona overlooks the Barcelona Beach on the Mediterranean. It's about a 10-15 minute bus ride to the center of the city but the bus stop is conveniently located across the street. The metro is a 20 minute walk (along the beach). Each room is equipped with wall-to-wall windows which show the unbelievable Mediterranean Sea view. Since the hotel is shaped like a sail, each room has a water view. The lobby bar is hopping around 6pm for happy hour. Make sure you try the salted almonds with a signature W cocktail. If the weather is permitting, take your drink outside and enjoy it poolside on the W day bed. The staff was super friendly and more than willing to help translate for us.

Reviews.Title: “For us it is destination in itself”
Reviews.Author: travelalot2
Reviews.Content: This is first time when a hotel itself completely changed our plans for a trip. Instead of planned sightseeing and knowing the city better we were so impressed by the property that we switched to a relaxing resort stay. Having a fabulous beach and city view from our bed we did have a whole BCN just in front of us anyway. It was so much said here about the room but nothing compares to experience it for yourself. What a difference to other luxury accommodations we had a chance to see. Stylish, comfortable, unique. From the other hotels features the most impressive was a pool area with its magnificent views to the beach, sea, palm trees. Pool area is so relaxing with perfect service (good looking too btw) with very well priced drinks, meals. You can easily spend a days there forgetting about time. At least we did. Morning and evening walks on Barceloneta beach just in front were a relaxing treat too. And the night city view magic. For the next trip we will propably have a hard task to decide, if we want to go to visit BCN or to experience W BCN again...

Reviews.Title: “trendy and über-Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: RodolfoLara
Reviews.Content: Stunning views from bar and some rooms... The sometimes amateurish staff can also be very friendly - and knowledgeable, but you've got to ask the right insider. Good dining at restaurant. Loud, (sometimes wanna be) fashionable clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - will return”
Reviews.Author: SamW_DC
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic W hotel. The rooms are great - as SPG platinum i was upgraded to a 'cool corner' room which was nothing short of spectacular. It had a view of the mediterranean + beach. Spacious. see photos. The staff are super friendly - this is one of the greatest W's on the planet. It was a pleasure to stay here - I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance? A business hotel not for a tourist.”
Reviews.Author: London19_19
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at W Barcelona staying on floor 15. I would suggest this is predominantly a business corporate training/hospitality/over night stay hotel. Lots of meetings over laptops going on in the bar lounge areas all day and into the evening. A great venue for a training course. However not so brilliant as a relaxed tourist hotel, you will be constantly reminded of work! Staff Service: Service was in our opinion either very good or very bad. Staff greeting was friendly and welcoming and room service was prompt and polite. However breakfast service on the ground floor was bad for us, we had to ask for a cup of tea 4 times before it finally arrived! Staff had a se la vie attitude when I politely complained. If you can, go for breakfast on floor E the service is much improved. Room: Room definitely had the wow factor in terms of the view which is the crowning glory of the hotel. Best to share the room with someone you know well. The toilet and shower are in separate frosted glass cubicals and they are not sound proof! The sink is in the open plan area of the room divided from the bed area by a curtain that pulls across half of the room, it does not divide the room. The window has a long window seat/couch which was stained in our room. There is a cocktail tray with glasses and booze on a small table over the couch, if you move this out of the way it will be returned to the same place each day which is annoying as it is easy to knock this over.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, in perfect conditions”
Reviews.Author: GOUPIL49
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the W Barcelona hotel, in a suite. Nice view on the sea on both sides, on third floor. The team takes really a good care of customers, and we appreciated the hospitality. The room was quite, with large windows, and was very clean. THe hotel is not directly downtown, but it is not really complicate to walk for 10/15 minutes to reach the center. Prices for room services are quite expansive.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HolidayAdvisorIndia
Reviews.Content: W is a very beautiful hotel with great views of the sea.It is beautifully located;just walking distance from the buzzing attractions of the city. Within the hotel there is a very nice pool and bar where you can spend a good part of the evening. The rooms are comfortable and clean. Breakfast can be better

Reviews.Title: “Absoloutly Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: bo55ash
Reviews.Content: Brilliant!! Hotel room was on the 24th floor and it was perfect. The anytime anywhere personnel were always on hand to provide advice and give the low down on activities. even booked us for a salsa dancing course directly from the hotel. food was amazing, the eclipse club on the 26th floor was classy, elegant and VERY stylish with reasonably priced drinks and cocktails. although the hotel is located next to a NUDIST beach,,, it was all good fun. the spa was amazing with professionals working and the lounge area with the deck chairs and pool was sublime. will definately go there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Last1
Reviews.Content: The W Barcelona is a stunning property, but not convenient to sight seeing in Barcelona, since it is really in what is called "Barceloneta" an area along the Mediterranean, not near most of the sights. Check-in was bedlam, which seems to be the way with W hotels in general, everyone is too cool to take care of you! It is a lovely place for a drink, we stayed the last night in Spain and that was fine, but i would not stay there for a visit to Barcelona. We had a sweet, used Starpoints to upgrade and it was stunning, so high tech we nearly had to sleep with the lights on because we could not figure out how to turn them off!! ( and we are tech savvy).

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay at a perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: keiki40
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W once again, but this time only for a very short overnight trip. Each time I'm deeply impressed by how professional, kind and caring the staff is, from the welcome when getting out of the taxi until leaving by taxi, from the Welcome Desk to the Bliss Spa to the Wave restaurant to the Eclipse Bar to ......... In one word: EXCELLENT ! The W Barcelona is really my home away from home. As a Platinum SPG-Member I was upgraded to a Cool Corner Suite which offers stunning views, great design and a hip ambiance and of course the very comfortable W-Bed. Whenever I have the choice I will stay at the W Barcelona again and highly recommend it. 5 Stars is not enough!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent cant fault it and an exellent spa. Stay in spring /summer though to avail fully of the location.”
Reviews.Author: PiFi
Reviews.Content: The most luxurious hotel ive stayed in in barcelona. Really worth it for a treat. The spa was excellent, the food also great and the staff very very friendly and accommodating. The views from the rooms (we had one of the highest floors cant remember the level but its only a couple down from the top) are stunning wall to wall windows and spacious. Would love to stay in summer and avail fully of the location on the beech as the outdoor pool and terrance was closed being winter.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic Hotel with a stunning view”
Reviews.Author: JackyYC
Reviews.Content: Being able to stay at this beautiful property is a privilige and lifetime experience. Rooms are very modern and the unobstructed view of the mediterranean is priceless. Despite booking this W hotel Barcelona through hotwire.com (with substantial saving), we were treated with utmost respect and friendliness and our request for Higher floors facing the sea was honored.. The Staffs are very outgoing yet very professional. We really enjoyed this hotel. Do take advantage of the 3 public bussess (17,39 and 64) outside the hotel; they make stops at most of the important street in Barcelona.Thank you W barcelona!! Its a dream come true

Reviews.Title: “Great views!”
Reviews.Author: flava419
Reviews.Content: The place is an icon in Barcelona. My only real complaint is the expensive internet costs. Plus it was very slow. One could rent a condo or a smaller boutique hotel with similar amenities for the same rate, but it is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel, great city!”
Reviews.Author: ANN189400
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for 3 nights while visiting Barcelona together with my friends. The hotel was amazing, on a unique location by the beach, at the end of the Barchelonetta, which is the part of the city by the sea. We were extremely lucky on the weather, enjoying a lovely sun which made the whole stay even better. Do take some time to walk along the beach and take photos, Locals use it for jogging and walking, and its worth seeing it. The W is a very modern hotel, with bright and lively decoration and colors. The room was just perfect, with a unique view at the beach and barcelona sea side. The staff was extremely polite, all fluent in English (something rare in Spain!) and very helpful. The concierge gave us tips on sightseeing & made restaurant reservations for both lunch and dinner at local tapas bars (Bar Mut & Serviceria Catalana were excellent! Cafe Mauri for dessert!) which were actually for locals and not tourists. The breakfast was very rich and delicious and so were the cocktails at both bars. (one next to the reception by the pool and one on the top floor called Eclipse- go there its worth seeing!). Barcelona is a lovely city, with loads to see and do. We took the hop on- hop off bus (package for 2 days cost only 24 euro- we had a 6 euro reduction from the hotel concierge) and visited most of the city. Do not forget seeing the Sacrada Famiglia and the Pedrere House of Gaudi. If the weather is nice, also stop at the Gael Parc, lovely view ! Also the Montjuic area is very nice! Combined with our great hotel experience, this trip was unforgettable! I will definately be coming back and recommend it to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Wow in every way. We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: WandaSlack
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful room overlooking the ocean. The room was extra comfortable with everything you need except tea and coffee making facilities. We brought our own and this was no problem. The bed is sublime and the best I have ever slept in. We have travelled widely all over the world and this was the best! Duvet and matress fantastic. Mood lighting fun and the breakfast was very good. Enjoyed being served our cooked breakfast and then bufet style for the rest. The selection was excellent. The pool area was really nice with lots of space for sunbathing. We never had difficulty finding somewhere comfortable to lie and enjoy the sunshine, pool and views over the beach and ocean. Barcelona is a wonderful city break with so much to see. We would go out and about to sightsee in the morning and realax by the pool in the afternoon. This was perfect. Each evening we would go out and used the staff at the hotel to suggest good places to eat. It really was a good idea and everywhere they suggested was good. We explained what we were looking for and they always came up with something special. We spent 5 night here and ate in some of the very popular and expensive places and some smaller places you would never find without a good recommendation. The hotel is a little out of town but this was a plus inthe summer when you want to enjoy the pool, beach and so on. It took a few minutes to get into town on the bus which is at the bottom of the drive up to the hotel. No problem at all and they run very regularly. We enjoyed this and it was a cheap way to get about. Many of the buses run to the tourist areas so it really is fine. We would often catch the bus back to the hotel too. Cabs are not too expensive so no problem either. Everything about this hotel is 5* from the wonderful staff, rooms, service, pools and so on. Don't hesitate just go. We are in our mid 50's and loved it. Modern, clean Wow. Perhaps not so good for a family holiday but if you a couple of any age, gay or straight its perfect.

Reviews.Title: “WOW....what a view!!!”
Reviews.Author: explorerKl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel towards the last leg of our europe tour...we glad that we have chosen this hotel. The two days we were there, felt really reluctant to leave the room. I could just laze and enjoy the view of beach and the city by the bay window. The staff were really friendly. The atmosphere was relaxed and everybody seemed to enjoy their stay/holiday, we DID!

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ProfessionalMusician
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! Have been to Barcelona three times and can say that the W Barcelona was astounding. Superb room, great facilities, overall a marvelous experience.

Reviews.Title: “wwwoooowww”
Reviews.Author: jadams076
Reviews.Content: I just left the hotel, after spending the weekend in barcelona. I was here back in may 2010 and I was quite disappointed with this hotel. Facilities were great, but service was simply non-existent, so I decided to continue staying at the Arts. This weekend I decided to give them a second chance after reading some of the latest reviews on TA, and I was shocked by the level of service achieved in such a short time. I am a big fan of design and music, but I dont think this compensate the lack of service in today´s trendy hotels. The W barcelona has finally managed to get the best of both worlds. I couldn´t find a single thing to complain about, staff is friendly, attentive, smart, handsome and efficient, the food got s much better, the skybar its probably the best club in barcelona. Whatever you are doing, please keep on doing it! All 5 star hotels in barcelona should learn from this guys. I will be back in june!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mjcampbell7
Reviews.Content: Great location on the beach, roomy, spacious and still has the boutique feel of W hotels worldwide. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. The friendliness of the multilingual staff was great and we will definitely be back. The only downside is the quality of the service in the restaurants and bars. They are woefully understaffed which was the one dent in their armor. When you pay this much for a hotel, you don't want to have to beg for a little attention. Likewise on the cost of Internet. Come on Starwood, we're paying big bucks. A little WiFi won't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Cool design, fantastic rooms, very good service”
Reviews.Author: dmasata
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for young(er) travelers. Fantastic views from the above average sized rooms. Service is very good which is a big plus since many of the other modern/hype hotels (Gansevoort etc) don't even know how to spell the word "service". Overall a very good choice for a hotel in Barcelona, however, having two small kids myself, I would say that this is rather a place for single travelers or couples or families with older kids.

Reviews.Title: “Divine W Hotel, Barcelona. Muy Caliente”
Reviews.Author: UtopiaUk
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing, finest of touches and details. Ambience and all staff fab. Great location. Magnificent. Even cool DJs. Luxurious. I love Barcelona anyway and the weather and this hotel ..well you must visit...

Reviews.Title: “Design in the commons spaces and nice views: nothing else left! No W experience!”
Reviews.Author: jnb03au
Reviews.Content: I've seen many hotels in the world and wasn't impressed with W experience! Service can absolutely be improved BAD COMMENTS: Location is some miles away from everything. Walking with a sunny day is fine until you reach Barceloneta… but at night, or as soon as it's dark especially in winter time, taxi is strongly recommended. You can forget privacy in the room - ok for couples but less for friends. you can see through the frosted glass in the shower and bathroom! Cleaning in the rooms have to be improved. Absolutely not 5 stars expectation: housekeeping has to perform better!we left wet robes on the bathroom floor because of the shower, and expecting the housekeeping will change it. Unfortunately, we found same robes hanging. NO BIDET in a 5 star hotel!!!!The toiletries have never been replaced - enough only for one person! Bed sheets were not clean - found hair an black spots! A lot of dust!! 2 lamps not working in the room, such a shame especially for the coloured lighting (philips i think) Not one complimentary bottle of water! you don't expect to pay 4 Euro for a bottle of water - it's simple and easy offering at least tea and coffee making facilities - in that case you are willing to spend 100 Euros or more at the restaurant or bar…otherwise you only want to eat outside! The bar on 26th floor which had to be a night hot spot, was closed 2 nights for private parties…Seemed more a VIP/escort type of party closed to hotel's guest. Guest were not advices! Spa area is not that big… disappointing - staff was not present, always away from reception. Such a shame that no hairdryer in the changing room - 5 star service? OK swimming pool is for summer season, but it could be cleaned and held in a different way. GOOD COMMENTS: Bar/lounge area was nice.. but very unfriendly. In the summer is fine - as close to beach View from bed are very nice - including automatic opening of curtains Building design is great and views are very beautiful W hotel in Barcelona is a hotel where you go once to experience but are not thrilled to go back. There are many hotels in Barcelona, I think if I ever returned I would stay elsewhere. Stayed at AC hotel last time and was much better.

Reviews.Title: “WOW Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: srbEngland
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was Wonderful, Marvellous and Fabulous. After I booked this hotel I went on tripadvisor and as most people would got drawn towards the worst reviews, so I was a little apprehensive. But I can tell you my daughter (20) and I had a wonderful time. The staff were so kind and very attentive, check in went very smoothly we had one person in front of us and a member of staff (a very attractive man and that really goes for all of staff) came and apologised for any delay (2 minutes to be exact) and took our bags. The receptionist was very friendly found our room, checked we had breakfast included. We then were taken to out room on the 12th floor which had a fabulous view and I thought was comfortable with a stylish design. This hotel is for people who appreciate interior design and as this is my job suited me right down to the ground. All fixtures and fitting are done with thought and impeccable taste. We went to the ground floor bar on a few occasions we were served immediately, their cocktails seem expensive at 12 euros each but at most restaurants we went to they were at least 8 Euros but the W cocktails are made from fresh ingredients and served with a lovely big bowl of nuts and they really didn't skimp on the alcohol, they were delicious. The breakfast was marvellous so if you can get a deal with it included its certainly worth it, it has a great selection of fruits, breads, cereals, cakes, ham, cheese, even meatballs and if that doesn't please you they will make you any type of eggs you want. The staff again a very handsome bunch were never far away with coffee and juice everything seemed to be of the highest quality. I love travelling and have been to many good hotels and I felt this was one I'd definitely revisit if I had the chance. Maybe its because I go with a good attitude and with a fun sense of humour people alway seem to react in a generous and positive way to me. Sandee Brown

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with a great sea view”
Reviews.Author: a_o_traveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel's biggest selling points are its seaside location and the modern design of its rooms. We had an unobstructed view of the sea (as do most rooms, I believe). The arrangement of the furnitures, with the bed in the middle of the room and seats along the window, makes the most of that view. However, 15 minutes' walk to the nearest metro station, it is a little far from the bustle of the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “i will only comment on the location”
Reviews.Author: avgold
Reviews.Content: This very cool and wonderful hotel is fully described by other trip advisors so i will only comment on the location. I am a walker. I especially love to walk in interesting locations. It will take you 30min to walk around the marina into the "touristic" area of town. It is a world class walk. There are places to stop for a coffee or refreshment. I was there in the winter, so the fantastic beach location was really not applicable. I would pee in my pants to stay here in beach weather!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “W-Onderful”
Reviews.Author: monpas
Reviews.Content: The "W" is a worldwide guarantee for travelers who seek a fashionable, friendly and at the same time elegant "resort" to lodge in major cities. Based on the experience insofar, the W Barcelona is even above this average status, with a truly impeccable customer service and the indisputably unique sensation of feeling at home, while lodging at a hotel. Courtesy, warmth, efficiency, friendliness, availability, flexibility...patience...are just some of the highlights I would attribute to the W Family. Simply W-Onderful, Whenever, Wherever.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, rooms are superb”
Reviews.Author: kamkjp
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was fantastic. I loved the rooms and the breakfasts were outstanding. The gym was nice, views amazing, and I just generally thought it was a great place to stay. You do have to walk a bit, but I didn't mind. 20 minutes to the born district and it was great exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and staff but was a bit far”
Reviews.Author: Tsenlike
Reviews.Content: Check in was a little slow with only one person manning the desk. However, once we got to check in our Gold membership got us an upgrade. The room was clean and the view was superb. Concierge and staff were generally quite helpful. Some were fairly friendly but I dont think this is generally the case in most W hotels that I have been to. it was slightly inconveniently located but makes for a peaceful location. We would definitely go back to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful but totally no personal service”
Reviews.Author: GLOaverbode
Reviews.Content: My mom, my sister and I stayed 3 nights at the W in Barcelona. Negative points: - our room was not ready only one hour after check-in time - we had to stand in line for over half an our before we even reached the check- in desk - unfriendly lady that did our check in - you can stay with 3people in a standard room BUT the rooms are not designed to be used by 3 people. They put the extra bed in the badroom!!! Positive points: - pool girls and boys are really friendly and helpful - pool area is wonderful - the views from our room over the beach is fantastic - food ( we tried breakfast and dinner and snacks at the pool) is great!!! Very friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “style over substance”
Reviews.Author: zeeraider
Reviews.Content: A large modern building but rather lacking in warmth. Pleasant and friendly staff. The rooms are large and well equipped with good views over the beach and harbour. But why did the designers think it necessary to place both the lights and their switches randomly around the room? Very confusing and a bit of a nuisance when trying to get to bed. Wi-fi charges outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but the strange vibration kept me awake”
Reviews.Author: chris_hoskins
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on business in early December, we were running a conference for one of my clients. First impressions of the hotel and room were high, the layout and style is ultra trendy, bed was very comfortable, although the lighting was tricky to work out. The bathroom arrangement didn't bother me as I was on my own but I can see it might bother couples who didn't know each other that well. The main issue I had was that the whole room had a strange vibration/humming which was especially noticeable when I was trying to get to sleep. Initially I thought this was a fan from the bathroom because I'd left a light on, however it wasn't this, then I thought it was the AirCon, nope. Eventually I removed the key card from the slot by the door but it still wouldn't stop. I finally tracked it down to the wall by the bed which was vibrating and humming (but not constantly, it kept slowing down, stopping and then starting again). It felt like it was some big extractor fan or something connected with the lifts or air con deep inside the hotel! I reported it to reception the next day, but nothing was done. As I was busy working doing 16 hour shifts I didn't spend much time in the room, except when I was trying to sleep. Luckily I was exhausted and dropped off quickly each night, if I'd been paying for the room myself I would have been asked to be moved. On the last day before I left my flight was cancelled so I checked back in for an additional night. I made sure I was put in a different room on a higher floor, however when I walked in I could tell that a previous guest had been smoking in there and I had to return to reception for another room. This was great, higher up and with a fantastic view. A few other pointers. Service was a bit hit and miss, check in was very slow, concierge was also weak (the hotel lost an important package during the event, which had been delivered but they couldn't find and insisted it hadn't). Free internet and water in your rooms would be an easy fix (€4 a bottle is not really on) Don't bother with the trendy nightclub bar at the top of the hotel, too noisy, poor cocktails, full of poseurs. The main bar on the ground floor however is excellent, they made great mojito's whilst we relaxed on the comfy sofa's.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Very Good Service”
Reviews.Author: MFAthens
Reviews.Content: I recommend the W Barcelona once it is a great hotel. It offers excellent rooms, friendly personnel, privacy and very good service. I was there for 5 nights and really enjoyed the two bars and especially the one on the top floor. Very good cocktails and very well presented. The restaurant that I have visited on the lobby area it is of great services and good food. If you like walking around the hotel is close to Barceloneta and La Rambla of course. It is not right next to the city center but I would say it close the more Catalan area (Barceloneta). Visit it and you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: citytrek
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona W offers a refreshingly difference from your standard hotels. The hotel lobby spaces are fun and the room we stayed in is cool. The location on the end of the beach provided a nice respite from hub bub of the city. At the same time the hotel is at the edge of Barcelonetta and has a convenient bus stop outsde the hotel. The staff were incredibly helpful and courteous. Highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: rlNetherlands5
Reviews.Content: It is a good enough hotel but overpriced for what it offers. The building and design are new and fun but the service closer to 4 stars than 5. The breakfast was average ans some of the3 fruit were off a little (smelled old and sour). There are many hotels in Barcelona, I think if I ever returned I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “2~3 stars service for 5 stars price”
Reviews.Author: GreenHuntingtonBeach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 5 days long stay with W Barcelona after our 4 days stay with ABAC hotel. Both hotels are rated 5 stars, but W has nothing to compare with ABAC. We've always stay with W whenever we travel, but W Barcelona is so far the worst one compares to other W. Starwood should start reviewing their hotels more carefully, otherwise, they will loss their customer base. It's our 3rd day here at W Barcelona, and here are a few things that just not up to 5 stars standard. 1) The glasses was never clean and the empty chips bag are still on the table after the room was serviced. 2) We left the robes on the bathroom floor because it was soaking wet from the shower, and expecting the housekeeping will change it. Unfortunately, we found our wet robes hang on the rack when we return, and it's still not completely dry. Are they expecting we will reuse the robes that was on the floor? 3) The toiletries have never been replaced during our stay so far.... 4) No turn down service for a 5 stars hotel? 5) Not even one bottle of complimentary water? 6) Sound barrier was horrible, we can hear next room's conversation. I can go on and on with the horrible experience I had so far, but just want to let you know a few points that I think W Barcelona should not consider as a 5 stars hotel. If you decide to book W Barcelona, don't expect the same service from other W hotels. This is our 3rd day here, and I just can't wait to check out from this hotel. Simply Horrible. The food at WAVE restaurant was great, we had our NYE dinner there. I will write an update if the experience improve during the last two days.

Reviews.Title: “Worryingly woeful with weird WC!”
Reviews.Author: ash_and_jai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a week long break at the W Barcelona but we decided to review the hotel whilst we are currently staying here. This is because we feel so strongly about informing anyone and everyone who is thinking about staying here at the W to think twice before booking. Firstly the bad points which is fair to say out shines the good: 1) The hotel is lacking the basics. The glasses which we used were never cleaned after the room was serviced. My wife's lip stick marks was still clearly visible on the glass. They just emptied the contents and placed it conveniently beside the bed. 2)The toiletries have never been replaced throughout the duration of the stay so far (four days have now passed) 3) There is no turn down service in the evening. A simple and standard service which is expected from high end hotels. 4) No complimentary water - surely when paying £200 / $250USD per night one should expect to have this and not be charged 4€ for a bottle from the mini bar. It made me laugh when I reached for the bottle, there was a label on the bottle neck saying " Who' thirsty? Whisk me away 4euros!" 5) No tea and coffee making facility in the room. Once again very basic 6) The in room dining menu is located in the room's welcome binder which when trying to locate the English version of the menu is only one page compared to the Spanish version. It takes a while to locate and by the time you find the menu you are no longer hungry. 7) The laundry service is very expensive. For a pair of jeans, a top, a pair of pyjamas and two undergarments - 80 euros! I could have hired someone local and they could have done our entire suit case! 8) No free WI FI - 19 euros per day. 9) The WC and bathroom is certainly quirky. They are both separated by frosted glass which you can still see through! Can be awkward if you are staying with someone who you are less familiar with! The sink is located in the bedroom instead of the bathroom or WC. There is no bath tub just a wet room. You have to come out in to the room to dry yourself as the shower head is located on the ceiling of the wet room and still drips after one has turned it off. 10) Service in general is slow. Good points: 1) Amazing views of the city and sea. 2) Good location as it's on the beach. 3) Good communal areas such as the lobby and lifts. To summarise, this is not for the faint hearted. Everything about this hotel is expensive. We don't mind paying for this so long as the service matches. We were expecting the "WOW" factor. The only "WOW" of this trip will be the bill at the end of the stay! Deeply disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: brooksie22
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, fantastic food, great conference facilities (although no windows as conference rooms in the cellar) reminds me a lot of Miami. In line with other W hotels in decor and little touches that I love. Very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Berni41
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for 1 night but enjoyed it immensely. Stayed in a Marvelous suite. The bed was unbelievably comfortable. Location-wise its a bit far away from the city centre but, believe me, its worth it. Room decoration was modern and classy. A disadvantage was that you can't open any window but the view is fantastic. Highlight: Eclipse bar on the 26th floor

Reviews.Title: “An island of luxury”
Reviews.Author: JaimeAD
Reviews.Content: Expensive and far away from the center, but... Amazing facilities, amazing views of the sea and the city, attentive service and great food and bars

Reviews.Title: “W-onderful!”
Reviews.Author: goodeboi
Reviews.Content: This W property lived up to my expectations. This uber trendy Starwood property on the waterfront is a prime location for vacationers. Location: On the beach of Barcelona...what more can I say? The hotel has a deck and pool overlooking the Baleric Sea. Very close to restaurants and the metro. Check-in: Seamless. The staff, appropriately attractive and personable, made checking in easy and painless. The Room: Very tastefully laid out with a jaw dropping view of the ocean and marina. Big enough for two adults to comfortably enjoy the room without annoying each other. The Hotel: Great restaurants on the premises. The Living Room offers great lounging, a fireplace and free wifi. The gym is perfect! Great views of the marina, ample machines, free weights, and sauna. Close to the metro (about a 10min walk) which allows you the freedom to see the rest of the city. One caveat is that this hotel is a hot spot and with that comes loud party guests and visitors attempting to access the rooftop club. HIGHLY recommend this hotel! Dont miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow for almost everything”
Reviews.Author: Milan1411
Reviews.Content: WOW...everything was amaizng,view from our suit was incredible,magnificnet bar on the 26th floor.The bed was amazing, like getting into a cloud.Whatever/whenever services was there for all our wishes.On the beach,all was outstanding And for bad things:First of all,the staff and hotel menager who did not deserve to work there.Location is far from city center but that not so important becous everything else is wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite with some small "buts"”
Reviews.Author: BeaHolanda
Reviews.Content: From a design perspective, an absolute topper from the entrance to the top floor. The location is unbeatable....and waking up to see the sea, while lying in bed through those impressive big windows is already by itself a reason to stay. The room is spaceful, with a big comfy bed in the middle...bathroom though is only recommendable for those not too worried about sharing it all with their partner. Big sort of aquarium with an splendid shower and less intimate wc...if that is not a problem, clear yes to book a few nights. The lounge area is superb, with a groovy dj entertaining the evenings and enough space to sit and relax prior to hitting the city at night. With good weather the pool area has to be a winner.....and I defy recommend the spa. The small buts I was referring to have to do with their policy of charging for wifi use in the rooms ( from such a hotel I would expect this to be an included standard), having to call to ask for basics like dental kits and charging a whooping 4 euros for a bottle of water....it is in the complimentary details that a hotel finishes off what the design and service starts, and I found the W lacking on that. Nonetheless, I certainly do recommend it if you are planning to stay in Barcelona for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “"W" is for: Wonderful hotel - wonderful service - wierd toilet”
Reviews.Author: UpscaleButRealistic
Reviews.Content: Staff: Very friendly! My husband and I speak High School level Spanish. And every staff member humored us as we attempted to use it. They were patient, and helped us learn new words. But, don’t worry, every staff member spoke flawless English! (And in most cases: French, Italian, and Catalan too!) The concierge always gave great recommendations. Spa: Manicure, still no chips, four days later! When you arrive at the spa they offer you brownies, tea, cava. (FYI, the brownies are YUMMY but have nuts if you are allergic.) Gym: Fully loaded - elliptical machines, treadmills, stationary bikes, weights, complimentary towels, and water - all overlooking the beach! (Each machine has a TV if the view of the beach doesn’t do it for you.) Room: GREAT VIEW! We had corner room 420, so we had one window facing the water – with sail boats and cruise ships going by – and the other window facing the beach and the city. A great view to start and end a day with! The room was big, and efficient. The one GIANT CON: the bathroom. Very little privacy! Toilet essentially in the middle of the room! Travel with CLOSE friends, especially if you have a queasy stomach. Restaurants: BraVo and Wave were great! The breakfast buffets were wonderful at both, we also had dinner at Wave which was also great. Both restaurants have wonderful views of the city and beach. We had drinks at the cute bar in the lobby – dj spinning nice house music. We never made it to the upstairs club. Location: It is a good walk to the subway. But it is a beautiful walk along the beach! I never felt in danger of pickpockets or anything, even when walking home late at night. Well lit. The hotel is not in the “center of it all” in terms of tourist destinations, but with that comes peace and quiet, and ample room! Hotels in the old town or downtown tend to be much older, smaller, and noisier. Another PRO: I did not smell any cigarette smoke, which you often find in European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “5 star rooms and amenities - 3 star service”
Reviews.Author: MarkWijman
Reviews.Content: W Hotel is a hotel you seem to either love or hate. We did go through the love/hate relationship over the course of our three night stay as well. The good: - splendid room with amazing views (17th floor), great bed, rainshower. - barfood and cocktails at the top floor bar - the gym - the style and design of the public areas The weird: - shower and toilet partially in the room, with "smoked" glass, this makes it weird to stay in the room with someone you don't know that well - or don't want to know THAT well... The so-so - the €27 per person breakfast - the clean, but tiny sauna in the locker room of the changing room - the unheated outdoor pool - a business center with 3 PC's - the hotel is on a peninsula in front of the coastline: a 45 minute walk to Ramblas, or a €5 taxi (a water shuttle from the hotel would be a good idea) The bad - Overall the staff is not up to par: handsome boys and pretty girls that lack all basics of hospitality: nobody asks how your day has been when you walk accross the lobby, the roommaids in the elevator don't talk - the restaurant manager doesn't say "thank you" on the way out but "the exit is here".... - the music in the bar is so loud, you cannot have a conversation - and nobody is dancing! - The lack of personal service upon check-in: no escort to your room, no explanation how everything works - just not 5-star Overall I would recommend if you have been to Barcelona before: otherwise it is too much out of the way to enjoy the city (and there is Hotel Gran Florida - which is far away as well, but has similar views, and asthonishing service and overall better food). Somehow it is more of a resort hotel, than a city hotel - they need more than a few bartenders to stir this place in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Design Hotel without a soul”
Reviews.Author: bernbe
Reviews.Content: Nice new building, large and light full. Rooms have fantastic views over the city and the sea. Lots of space but at this price level a welcome bottle of water for free seems not unusual hence advised to keep customers happy, not here... Breakfast is quite limited for the price. Service is friendly. Location is some miles away from everything. The bar which had to be a night hot spot wasn't very attractive. Finishings are very doubtful, I'm sure this hotel will look and feel "old" within some years. For me this is typically the kind of hotel where you go once but are not thrilled to go back. And swimming pool is not heated meaning very very cold...

Reviews.Title: “Woh.. first time at a W Hotel thats really convincing, a bit pricy however”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravellerMunich
Reviews.Content: First time I'm satisfied with W. The location is soso, right on the beach, far away from everything.SPG Platinum upgraded to a pretty nice suit. very comfortable.great bath! No in-room coffee machine. too many items for sale are place on basically every free space. Staff is nice and extremely good looking.sky bar is coming with a good name,excellent view. But don't expect locals. as soons as its 3am they treat you like trash.never experienced such unfriendly and hostile staff! In addition totally overpriced! - like everything in the hotel. the conference facilities are nice but not up to standard. The sound system is terrible-actually most-meeting rooms are in the basement.coffee is terrible.food is less than okay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: FamSteveHarris
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels we've ever stayed. Very new, well designed, good service, friendly people. The hotel fronting the Mediterranean has a lovely beach running all the way to another superb hotel "The Arts". The rooms are comfortable, very soundproof which is nice because of the great nightclub at the top of the hotel. The W is conveniently located with easy acces to the main shopping district and numerous good restaurants. We used it twice within 3 months and already it's our favorite spot in Barcelona..

Reviews.Title: “Its got it all!”
Reviews.Author: gissy1
Reviews.Content: The hotel really does think of everything, its the details that count and make a stay memorable. Our room was a corner room on the 3rd floor, which was great with wonderful views over the harbour and great atmospheric lighting. The decor is trendy. The bathoom is huge with a giant shower room and a separate bath, the bath products are large sized and from their Bliss range and they give you everything. They have a "whatever, whenever' room service which was great, if a little expensive. The Spa was wonderful, we had the steam room, sauna and heated jacuzzi to ourselves, so were really lucky and after a fab massage, slid out of there on a cloud of relaxation! The club/bar on the top floor has some great views. Only down side is its a walk away from the centre of town, but we found plenty of taxi's so no problem. I'm sure the surrounding area will be built up in time.

Reviews.Title: “Rock Legend in Our Elevator. Just another day at the W.”
Reviews.Author: KarinAndNick
Reviews.Content: We aren't beach people, or sightseers, or museum visitors, or adventurists when it comes to vacations. We want comfortable hotels in pretty places with good restaurants, great service and a few luxuries. We want to relax, eat, drink and be fussed over a bit. It’s just our preferred vacation style, The W Barcelona certainly fulfilled our every vacation desire on our late autumn trip to Spain this year. We chose a “Fabulous” room for the city/sea view: I love a poshy view with iPad in hand and a nice glass of wine by my side! Definitely worth the extra money. The room was lovely. Comfortable, modern elegant. The bed was extraordinarily comfortable and we loved that it was in the middle of the room. The room just demanded that you relax and enjoy yourself. The windows were spectacular. I spent hours on the window seat that extended the entire length of the room. We also both loved the rainfall showers. And my significant other, who cannot go more than a day without working, found the desk and workspaces to be more than adequate while still allowing him to feel like he was on vacation. My only small complaint is that I would have preferred that the lavatory/ dressing areas would have been more enclosed. I prefer a bit more privacy. The common areas, lobby, bars, restaurants; are just extremely well designed and executed. Nothing is left unconsidered. There are surprises and notable touches everywhere. Service is exceptional.
