We were taken upstairs by Frank, who spent a considerable amount of time with us, explaining important insider knowledge of the hotel and Barcelona, providing some useful tourist cautions as well as some good recommendations for dining and shopping. He could not have been more positive, upbeat, welcoming or generous with his time although we were just two average travelers on holiday from the States. The hotel is about a 10 minute taxi ride from the main part of the city, or an easy 15 bus trip(bus is frequent, cheap and easy as is the metro) and the Barceloneta(seashore village shops and dining)is a short beachside 10 minute walk. But you are not IN town if that concerns you. To be basically IN the water, you give up the closeness to town. It was no sacrifice for us. The Eclipse nightclub at the top of the W did not live up to the hype as far as we were concerned. Maybe we are too old, maybe we have been in New York too long, but it was just an average club: 5 guys to every girl and very weak drinks. The bar scene in the lobby was far more interesting. Others may completely disagree. We were there for 6 nights and the atmosphere during the week was much more low key than on the weekend when families with kids showed up, although it was never chaotic. We would not go during the high season though, I cannot imagine how wild it must be mid summer. Many others would find this Autumn time of year that we preferred far too tame for them, I would imagine. During our stay, we were surprised to suddenly find ourselves in the elevator with an extremely famous rock legend who happened to be performing in Barcelona during the time we were there. It happened that our floor also housed a couple of the large suites, one of which he was staying in. It was an unexpected and breathtaking highpoint to our trip that was pretty amazing already. As one final example of the hospitality we enjoyed at the W, we have a small Whatever/Whenever experience to share. On our last day, I got the idea that we should ask if we could see one of the suites at the end of our floor. Maybe the one the famous rock star had stayed in if it wasn’t occupied? So we called and asked if we could have a tour of one of the suites. The concierge said that she would check and call me back. It actually took about an hour and I did eventually ask a second time, but sure enough finally someone called us back. It turned out that the suites were nearly all occupied except… the very biggest and grandest Presidential Suite on another floor and would we like a tour? Well, yes we would! Within a few minutes a very lovely and friendly hotel intern came to our door and took us up to a magnificent suite for a private tour. It was rather fabulous, completely fun and very generous of the W to accommodate our little whim. We are diehard W fans, and also love the W little brother, Aloft, for business travel. We are just really impressed with the brand. They just seem to have the entire concept down with, not only great facilities, but also incredibly well selected and dedicated staff. And, rock legends in the elevators are pretty cool too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful WOW!”
Reviews.Author: travellilies
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. It can be seen from a distance and I was surprised by the cute beach we had access to. My sister and I stayed here for 3 nights and had a great time. The hotel rooms are quite spacious and our room had a beautiful view of the water and beach. I was not particularly keen on the open bathroom concept, but have found it in several W hotels. This was the only drawback I found for the room. We dined at all the restaurants and had a wonderful meal at BRAVO, the Michelin star restaurant. The staff was exceptional and very attentive. Our breakfast at WAVE was made exceptional by the staff and in particular a young lady named Natasha (Nattie). She was friendly and was always smiling. She made we had everything we needed and was attentive to get fresh juice and coffee for us. Numerous patrons commented on how she was so delightful to see each morning. The hotel is very lively and there are plenty of opportunities to enjoy Barcelona. Our trip was low key and we wanted to take in the tourist sites. The hotel is a bit more removed, but a quick 5 minute cab ride would take us to where we needed to be. We loved our stay and will come back to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “W Barcelona... so far, the better W.”
Reviews.Author: QCInspector
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the W Hotel at Lexington Avenue, NYC. I must say that the experience at W Barcelona far exceeeded the one in NYC. First of all, the staff were very friendly and helpful, from the receptionist to the porter to the staff at the Whatever Whenever desk. They even invited us to the bar for complimentary drinks when they were checking whether our room was ready. Unlike other travellers, my porter explained the complicated switches to us (even though we still needed some time on our own to figure it out later). The room has a great view overlooking the port and a cruise ship would arrive very now and then (unfortunately, the better view is the one facing the beach, not that we mind the port view). The Wonderful room is slightly bigger when compared to most European standard hotel rooms. The glass shower and toilet took a while of getting used to especially when you are not used to seeing someone's blurred shadow when he/she is seated on the toilet bowl). The bed is very comfy and the Bliss products are welcomed. Like the other travellers, the Wifi service is not reliable. I ended up not logging on to the internet for the 4 days when I was there (I can't be bother to use the common area PCs). The Eclipse Bar fell below expectations. I expected something even better and hippier for a W hotel since it's positioned as a very stylish hotel. The view was average (there's really nothing to see when it's dark... mind you, it's just a beach view in the dark) and the whole ambience was lacking. I've seen greater bars in Asia that come with stunning day and night scenes. The hotel staff didn't know the products well. We wanted to buy the decorative white gecko (which was for sale) in the bedroom. But none of the receptionists knew how to get a new piece for us! On the day that we were checking out, they called the house keeping and told us that the gecko would be delivered to our room but it never did. We gave up in the end. The gym is reasonable. I would consider it to be one of the better ones in Barcelona. It's equipped with the standard weight lifting and cardio equipments. And there is enough. If I recall correctly, there are 6 to 8 treadmills in the gym ( a luxury if you ask me). The food at the ground floor restaurant was mediocre. You can get better food outside the hotel. The pork which I've ordered was tough and my partner's fish was stale and rubbery (it was a pity considering they have access to the freshest fish in Barcelona). The waitress ended up offering us chocolates to help us, in her own words, "forget the bad experience". Go and try the Santa Caterina market in Barcelona’s trendy El Born neighbourhood. The restaurant at the corner of the market serves excellent food and it's really good value for money. But be prepared to wait if you go during the peak hours. It was not that bad when we were at W Barcelona. They gave my partner a birthday cake and a bottle of sparkling wine. The cake was really good! I don't know for sure whether I would stay at W Barcelona again especially when there are so many other nicer hotels in Barcelona. I might just give it another try if the rates are reasonable. Btw, most taxi drivers do not know W Barcelona. They know the hotel as Hotel Vela (Hotel Sail) as the design of the hotel looks like a sail.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Views, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Yogen26
Reviews.Content: The building itself is one of the landmarks of Barcelona and is visible and identifiable from most of the hills around Barcelona - as distinguishable as the Familia Sagrada - the most famous monument of Barcelona. It has an all glass exterior in the shape of the El Burj in Dubai - is on the waterfront with the aircraft landing approach to the Barcelona airport right in front of the hotel. Half the rooms face the sea and the harbour while the rest face the city and the sea. Each room is rather small - though modern and hi-tech with one glass wall. The rooms have the wash basins in the main room and a tiny WC and a small shower area separated from the main room by thin buffed glass partitions. Service was not great at all with rather long queues for check in and virtually everything else. Staff artificially polite and curt - no personal vibes. For a hotel that is so expensive everything is charged for including things one normally gets from housekeeping in most other hotels. Great though is the Sky Lounge on the top floor (26th i think) with great views once again. The lobby is also spectacular with a glass roof that you cna see right to the top of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great external look, average/standard internal service”
Reviews.Author: kcym
Reviews.Content: I stayed at W during out holiday in Barcelona with my family. The location of the hotel was centrally located which was what we wanted. First impression after arriving the hotel, it had a sense of emptiness, or perhaps it was purposely made "minimal". The staff at the desk was very friendly and helpful, and gave us the room despite arriving early. Arriving into the room, it was bright and spacious with an excellent view of the breathtaking endless Spanish ocean. The bed was large and comfortable, we have slept well during our stay at W Barcelona. Our room was tidied on the second day, however we found that later that it was not tidied for 2 out of 5 days during our stay here which was slightly bazaar considering we did not put any signs up on our doors to stop cleaners coming in - we have only put up a sign once during our stay. Things in the room were the typical standard of 5 star hotels, but nothing worthy of the "wow factor". I should mention that the bathroom had a nice shower though. Food at the bottom floor restaurant was excellent. The Eclipse bar had an excellent view overlooking almost 360 degrees around the hotel, nice drinks and cocktails, unfortunately the dj was not great and the music does not really get better until around 2am, when the bar shouts at 3am. The gym was simple and well-equipped with standard equipments, however it surprised me that they did not have a hairdryer in the gym shower. Not that I couldn't dry my hair in my room but it was just unexpected when I thought this would be one of the basic equipments in the bathroom, especially after hours of working out. The wifi internet in the public area was fine on my first day of stay, however it stopped working on my Mac from the second day onwards which was frustrating and I had to work on their public computers instead. The beach nearby is lovely, however personally I wouldn't recommend people to eat in the restaurants around the area because they are highly touristic which means that they are unreasonably expensive, and more importantly, NOT outstanding food. By that I mean BELOW AVERAGE. If you are serious about your food like I am, then please don't go anywhere near these restaurants. They are many more good restaurants in Barcelona that are priced at the same level and probably below too. I would recommend people to go for a drink around the beach though - the scenery is excellent and could be very romantic if you are with your partner. If you are a party person, do not miss out the 3 clubs on the beach - just keep walking along the beach (for about 15 minutes) until you see a tall glassy building (Hotel Arts that is) nearby and several continuous restaurants (don't eat there - overpriced and below standard), if you keep walking you will eventually see the 3 clubs. I think one of which was a restaurant and club in one. Overall I would stay at this hotel again for the stunning view and beautiful natural surroundings (ie. the beach), however just don't expect very much servicing. In my experience with 5 star hotels, my time at W was just very average. No overall wow factors, just your ordinary 5 star hotel. I'd say suitable for younger couples as the whole scene and atmosphere at W is very modern, unlike Four Seasons for example that are more traditional.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: EmilieDublin
Reviews.Content: What can I say that will accurately reflect my mood on leaving the W this morning? - Sad, that my stay was over that is. The W as a design hotel does not leave you wanting, the rooms with floor to ceiling windows and window seats that allow you to sit and contemplate life as you look out to sea or over the spectacular views of Barcelona itself that these windows afford. The rooms are very spacious and bright in comparison to other hotels I have stayed in while in Barcelona, (Hotel OMM and the Pullman) and in my opinion this is the best hotel by far. The Bliss bathroom products and Spa are an added bonus. The staff are extremely polite and friendly, I am surprised that a hotel of this calibre has such a low overall rating I would expect it to be so much higher. I am already looking forward to my next trip to W Barcelona as it is the only hotel that ticks all the boxes! Keep up the good work guys! Cheers from Dublin

Reviews.Title: “...with reservations”
Reviews.Author: PRR50
Reviews.Content: A very trendy and sleek hotel which has become a destination itself. I booked a “Fantastic Suite” for my wife, my daughter and myself. We were given an impressive but compact suite on the 25th floor. It took some time for my daughter’s bed and towels to be brought to the room but it fitted neatly into the sitting room. There was a large bath and shower in the open plan bathroom area. We were not shown to the room and so had to work out for ourselves the rather complicated lighting system. The views were spectacular. On returning to the room after dinner we quickly discovered that we were directly underneath the nightclub from which loud music could be heard. When complaining and was advised that this would be the case every night and that the music would not stop until 2am. I was advised that I would be called back but it was not until I called a second time that an offer was made to move to another suite. We stayed put for the first night but were moved to a spectacular corner suite for the remaining 3 nights of our visit – an accommodation of €200 was made to my final bill. Once again, the lighting system was not explained to us. Be warned, each switch operates on one circuit so when one switches the lights on in the bedroom, they come on in the sitting room; when opening the blinds and curtains in the bedroom, they opened in the sitting room…this did not endear me to my daughter who likes to sleep in! The room was impressive but not everyone likes a bath in the bedroom. The shower was large and satisfying. The Bliss products much appreciated. The “Whatever Whenever” staff were very helpful. Now for the gripes: • The hotel is a fair walk from the centre of Barcelona – 30 min brisk walk to Las Ramblas. There is a bus from the hotel and the a taxi will set you back about €8. • Turndown service is variable; one night at 10pm, another at 6pm…when the maid comes to the door she knocked and then walked straight into the room. • Bath towels are small and only one was provided, more can be requested. • We were on a package which gave us wine and cheese on arrival, 2 beach towels and milk and cookies with turndown. Only one towel was provided and no milk and cookies on any of the nights. • WiFi in the reception areas was intermittent. There are 4 PCs for guest use in the business centre. • Rarely was there anyone at the front of the hotel to hail a cab. • At 9am on the final morning we were woken by drilling coming from the floor above or below, it was difficult to tell…the hotel was supposedly completed a year ago. • Breakfast in the Bravo Restaurant was interesting: tea and coffee is left to stand and was never hot when served. Every morning we order fresh tea and coffee and on occasion the waiter was surly…“it’s the same coffee” – “no it isn’t, it’s hot!”; the buffet is extensive but eggs and bacon etc need to be ordered; there’s no menu and we were only asked once…on one occasion (at 9.30am) there was no bacon left, not that you would miss it as only one rasher is given! None of these “gripes” can detract from what is a very stylish hotel. When I pointed out that we only received one towel, my daughter was give a W T-shirt from the shop and when I advised of these other issues a further accommodation of €200 was made to the final bill (€400 total). Would I return to the W? Probably, although next time, having stayed there before, I might consider the Arts again which although is also a taxi ride way from the centre has the added advantage of a number of restaurants in close proximity. At this time, there is nothing close to the W…except the nudist beach!

Reviews.Title: “W O W !”
Reviews.Author: animalparty
Reviews.Content: The minute you arrive at the W you will be greeted and your bags will be taken inside the concierge are very welcoming and within 10 minutes of being there i felt like royalty . I was then taken to my room , the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in(shame most of the time i was too excited to sleep) the view of the sea is bliss , when you wake in the morning press the curtain button on your bedstand and theres the view ! amazing . My room had a shower , shame as i do love baths , this did'nt really matter the in room sink was very female friendly (everything a woman could need basically)+big mirrors on wall). First night when down for drinks , again service was of a very high standard . If like me you are'nt loaded but would love a taste of the life , this really is worth the stay. Theres a club on the top floor which you have priority of whilst staying at the W . The views great but i prefered the lounge bar. This hotel is extremely sexy , i would'nt recommend taking children here , although children friendly its not really the scene for it. Taxi's outside at all times and it costs 10 euros to Las Ramblas . The wet bar outside is great for daytime lounging the day away. THIS IS A MUST! This hotel has to be ticvked off the list . I will be saving my pennies to go again .

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly good with young kids”
Reviews.Author: JT14
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the best thing I can add to the rest of the reviews is what it is like to be here with kids. Was apprehensive. Design hotels can be hit and miss with kids in tow. However, we had an excellent time. Main points: - connecting rooms gave lots of space for 5 of us. - rate was excellent because (at the time) Starwood offered second room for 50% for familities - the hotel is right on the beach/bus routes. So even if it's not at all in the centre, it feels like the place you want to be - some of the touches around the hotel really appealed to the kids. O and X sets in the lounge, the mood lighting, the stepping stones over water features etc. - staff are really sensational. The attitude is completely warm and friendly to everyone - there is no "cool" factor in the way guests are treated - there were a surprising number of families, generally with younger rather than teenage kids reflecting the fact that the hotel tends to appear to the 20-40 age group. The rmixed eviews of the hotel surprised me having been here - and I also have a good friend who wasn't positive about the place. But we loved it. The only point I would say is that some of the extras are a bit excessive (especially the in room wifi). But others are reasonable - it certainly isn't the case that they are ripping people off. Just the balance of some of the pricing is off.

Reviews.Title: “W Barcelona-too cool”
Reviews.Author: luckylynn
Reviews.Content: The W Barcelona is a stunning building, locally referred to as the sail. It sits out in the Mediterranean, which is great for views, but very inconvenient for people who walk to and through cities, it is just not near anything but the beach. That being said we had a small suite, which was literally too cool. It took us half an hour to figure out how to turn off the lights. But it was gorgeous! The bed was perfect, large and cushy but firm, one of the most comfortable ever. 2 TVs, multi-colored, remote control, mood lighting (I kid you not). Soft lighting from under the bed, behind the walls, you get the picture, very cool, a little over the top. Room service was very timely, check in slow and annoying, like at other Ws I've stayed at, but the staff are always attractive. We used points for the room and left for the airport the next day, so it was perfect, but not a hotel to walk out the door and be in a neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “good location, excellent views...”
Reviews.Author: zoomendoscopist
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 4 nights in the hotel, as I was attending a congress. The hotel is located in Barcelonetta, on the beach, so it offers magnificent views but it is away from the centre [Ramblas, etc]. You need to take a bus to go to barcelonetta tube and then take the metro. [It is 20 minutes walk from the hotel to the tube station]. The hotel has an industrial modern design. The rooms is very nice and the wall opposite the bed is just a huge window facing the ocean...The bed is very comfortable...but there is no free wifi and you have to pa 19 euros per day for the internet which i consider expensive.. The breakfast was very nice but again the capuccino they serve was very bad. I have concluded that although in italy, you can drink everywhere a good capuccino [even in the smallest and most remote gas station] it is impossible to drink good capuccino even in luxurious hotels outside italy... The hotel has a small pool area...The beach next to the hotel is a typical beach you find in spain...long huge windy...not suitable to swim..just to look... The fitness room was excellent with state of the art equipment....No cooments about the very expensive spa since i did not visit it...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, GREAT views, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: US40
Reviews.Content: We selected the W for our weekend trip to Barcelona mostly because of our spg membership. It is a nice hotel with spectacular rooms but the services are not up to W standards. We arrived late, so check in was OK. All the gadgets, and there are many cool ones, in the room should have better explanations attached. The service at the bar is SUUUUPER slow and nobody would ever come over and ask; you always have to beg to get a drink!? The breakfast buffet was ok but also not as good as I would expect from W. The selection was average and the service was pretty slow but also very friendly. Together with the concierge and the IT department we tried to configure my iPad the next morning. I gave up after about an hour and I was not able to connect for the rest of our stay. I used the business center downstairs but it's just not what I expect from W. The internet fee is outrageous when considering what we paid for the room. The hotel itself feels very hip and cutting edge, but if you look for local flavor - this is not it. Would I go again? Probably not because it kind of feels like they are charging W prices and not deliver W superiority.

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: cologal23
Reviews.Content: This hotel has stunning views of the Mediterranean regardless of what level your room is on. It's uber modern feel, has beautiful rooms, with ample space and seating areas. Hotel has it's own private beach (right next to public one) great convenience so you don't have to worry about a sun chair. Excellent concierge desk that gave us great directions, maps and "must dos" while in Barcelona. Only 2 things I would forwarn people on - there's a club on the very top floor - if you're a light sleeper, I'd go for a lower floor. We were on floor 23, the club is on floor 27 and we could hear the base/music in our room. Also, the W is a bit off the main strip, so you will either need to be prepared to rent a car, a bike, take a lot of cabs, use the transit - or walk, a lot. We used the transit and walked and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Dime and Nickel!”
Reviews.Author: Nickers1
Reviews.Content: We just checked in about four hours ago. Our room is fantastic, the view is spectacular and the hotel is like being at a resort but with easy acess to tours and the old city. The beach is at our door. That's the positives so far. The negatives are - we spent over 20 minutes setting up our iPad for wifi withi a tech as their system doesnt recognize ipads at a cost of 19 E per 24 hours for each device. We have three devices, two ipads and an iPhone. We have been to Madrid, Granada, Seville, Cordoba,and Valencia on this trip and the wifi was complimentary at all our hotels. The fitness center is complimentary but the jacuzzi is 20E per day. Service in the bar area is non existent we waited over 25 minutes for an order of hummus - I will post more about that later. Finally, if you wishi to listen to music on the TV in your room it is at a cost of 5E per day

Reviews.Title: “Great Dining Experience!”
Reviews.Author: kate930
Reviews.Content: Although we did not stay at the hotel, we did make extra effort to dine in the restaurants here. The dining was a great experience, however not worth the price tag. The views are fabulous and atmosphere is very lively and friendly. All staffing was excellent. My only question is what is the name of the restaurant on the bottom flow of the hotel, outside, facing the Wetbar???

Reviews.Title: “W Barcelona, Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: soniavbuk
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 day weekend break to Barcelona. We stayed at the W. We had read various reviews before leaving the UK so we were aware that the location had been an issue for some previous guests, but for us it was not a problem. We stayed on the 21st floor on the dock side and had amazing views. It's not so good if you suffer from vertigo, but for us it was fabulous. As the W is on the beach its great if you want to go for a long morning jog along the promenade. We did this 2 of the 3 mornings we stayed at the hotel. The room felt very spacious but in part that is because the layout is a little unconventional. The bed is in the middle of the room so that you face the window. The curtains are operated by a control panel by the bed, so when you wake up you can electronically open the curtains and admire the ocean view. This is very spectacular and very memorable. The bathroom was my main concern as it was basically a separate wet room and separate toilet with frosted glass walls leaving the sink area open to the bedroom. Whilst OK for me and my husband it might not be to everyone's taste. Also, because its so open plan, space that would normally be walled off as the bathroom is open to the bedroom, making the room feel larger. The room was full of gadgetry, but try as we might we couldn't get the TV to work via the wireless keyboard, but our ipod was docked and we managed to fill the room with our own music. There is a mood light to change the colour of your room and great seats in front of the window so you can admire the ocean. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as we never got up early enough so we cant comment on that, but we did have lunch out on the deck by the pool. The food was very good but service very slow. We used the Bliss Spaaaaaaaaaaaaah and had great massages, but there is no relaxation area for post massage wind down, and the only area to sit in has uncomfortable chairs and is brightly lit with fluorescent lighting. I think the spa interior decor is all about design rather than comfort. This is definitely something they could improve on in the Spa. There is a well equipped gym, but we didn't use it as we were out running or walking alot. On Friday night we took the lift to the 25 floor where the Eclipse nightclub is located. From here you have spectacular vies over the city and beach. The hotel manages the entrance to the bar and a queue will form every evening in the lobby of the hotel, but as we were hotel residents we could jump to the head of the queue. The bar was OK, music OK, views amazing, so it's worth a visit if you are in the hotel. To visit the city centre we walked. This was not a problem for us, but could be if you are lazy and don't want a 30 - 60 min walk. With no agenda for the weekend its nice to walk along the sea front or by the harbour towards the city centre, that way you get to sample the city vibe, so for us it was not a problem. An improvement would be for the hotel to lay on a complementary shuttle, or to provide bikes that you could borrow for a day or weekend. Whilst you can always pay for a taxi, or rent your own bikes from various rental companies, the convenience of the hotel laying these on for you would be a definite improvement. All in all an iconic building in a great location on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel - a little out of the way, but ideal for New Year's”
Reviews.Author: jkriggs
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were able to share New Year's Eve at what I think was this hotel's first year. It's kind of controversial and well above the legally-allowed floors, but it was as gorgeous (and slightly-annoyingly) white with purple, as you come to expect from Westins & W's. It was a hike from the center of Barca, especially where public transit shuts down at midnight, but it was IDEAL for new year's eve. Since the hotel is $500 a night, we brought cheap wine and food back to our rooms and pre-gamed. Then, we went down to watch the unbelievable fireworks show on the water and toasted midnight with the swanky hotel party!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but restaurant service below standard”
Reviews.Author: carolemgt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 5 star in many respects but the service in the restaurant was poor on occasion. Specifically having ordered food and wine I was told they were out of the wine I had ordered. Therefore I chose another wine. The food arrived but no wine. The waiter failed to notice this. Upon request the wine arrived eventually but with no more than a cursory apology. The 2nd night we had planned to eat in the city so had not booked a table. However the weather was very bad with winds so strong the police and fire brigade arrived to cordon off a walkway due to the danger of trees coming down. So we decided it might be best to eat at the hotel.. We were told the restaurant was fully booked although at 9.30 there were a number of free, unset tables. On checking out the revolving door did not appear to have an automatic stop so my case got stuck but the door kept revolving so my arm became trapped, resulting in a bruise. However the reception and lobby staff were really great and the rooms were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel with incredible views of the sea”
Reviews.Author: SFjoe
Reviews.Content: We attended a wedding in Barcelona and decided to spurge by staying at the Hotel W in Barcelona since it was our anniversary as well. It was one of the best travel decisions I have made in a long time. We have a wonderful room overlooking the water and could watch the surfers from our bed. The breakfast was lovely and the hotel staff were super friendly. Most spoke pretty good english and had a great attiude. Young crowd that tried to please. By far the best W property I have stayed at. The only con is that it is a cab ride from the Ramblas. Or you could take the local bus or a healthy 30 minute walk. The bar facing the ocean was pretty amazing with the views and the outside lounge chairs next to the bar looked very inviting. Unfortuntely we did not have time to use due to the wedding. I really want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Welcoming, WoW.”
Reviews.Author: busjgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply Wonderful....the rooms, the service, the location, the staff, the view and again the view! It is modern, futuristic, funky and pretty expensive, but worth every penny in my eyes. It is located on the sea front beside Barceloneta beach and is a 5 Euro's taxi ride to the historic centre of Barcelona. We spent two nights in October and honestly would struggle to fault it. If you like the W brand, you most certainly won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but feels cold”
Reviews.Author: stinkykitty
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is beautiful, chic and well appointed, it feels cold, sterile and not quite welcoming. Room was large and view was breathtaking. No free wireless? At this rate per night, shouldn't wireless be free instead of paying by the hour? I rated the hotel at one star not based on room or location but based on the fiasco we experienced with the front desk. The front desk booked us into our room then proceeded to give our room to some other couple. Lucky we were still in the room. relaxing. 45 mins later we get a second knock on our door from someone from the front desk asking who we were and why were we in the room. We explained and thought the issue was resolved. 1 hour later, the phone rings and we get drilled again. We left the room believing the matter was resolved and went out for the evening only to get back and our keys would not work. We have to make the trek down to the front desk to get drilled on who we were and why were we in the room. Our keys were reactivated. No apologies were offered and the excuse was that when technology works it works well and when it doesn't- these things happen. What kind of excuse was that?

Reviews.Title: “High Style in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravelerpdx
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed on two separate occasions at the front and back ends of a two week trip to Spain and Mallorca in September and early October. As a member of the SPG Program, I wanted to use a combination of frequent stay points and dollars to cover a total of six nights in Barcelona, potentially an expensive proposition. The choices included the W, located on the Barceloneta beachfront, and Le Meridien, on La Rambla. We were ultimately very happy to have selected the W. While many criticize the W's location as being far removed from the Barcelona center, we found it refreshing to have a sense of open space given the beachfront location. We also really enjoyed the 15 minute walk from the W into central Barcelona. People watching is incredible! We will most likely stay there again on a future return trip. ADVANTAGES: 1) Spacious, very modern, and stylish public spaces and rooms. Loved the bath facilities and amenities (by BLISS). Mood lighting and day bed were wonderful, and the bed super comfortable. 2) Incredible views in any direction from virtually every floor. Our first set of days was in 1717 facing the port, and our second in 2306 facing the city and beachfront. 3) Very friendly and efficient service. Even though everyone seems to be style-conscious (and we're definitely not!), we always were treated well. During our first stay we had two queen beds rather than a single king (as we preferred). Even though the room (1717) was perfectly fine, the staff desperately tried to upgrade us to fulfill our original request. We ultimately stayed where we were. 4) Wonderful, spacious, and well equipped work out facility (called SWEAT). I actually cannot recall a hotel facility of this size anywhere else I've stayed. 5) Complimentary wi-fi access in the W Bar. Never pushed to order anything if I just wanted to sit and access the web. 6) The pool deck and Wet Bar takes advantage of the open space and very much creates a resort-like setting. DISADVANTAGES: 1) If you don't like to walk, the W will be a stretch given the 15 minute walking time to the nearest METRO stop in Barceloneta or the city center. 2) Not exactly an "old Barcelona" experience. We were fine with that since we had a lot of "that experience" in every other aspect of our time in the city. 3) In room internet access is very expensive. 4) Very expensive room rates, but not out of line compared to other high end Barcelona hotels (including Le Meridien and Hotel Art, a Ritz Carlton property at the opposite end of the beachfront). 5) For a large hotel creating a resort like setting, the pool is too small--and unheated! In early October with average temperatures in the mid-upper 70s, the water seemed frigid. It's possible to do laps (which I tried), but I couldn't stay in the water for more than about 5-10 minutes. Pool, of course, is seasonal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...”
Reviews.Author: verchaixbob
Reviews.Content: Not sure if I'd be so impressed with the value for money if I hadn't realised that this was one of lastminute.com's 'secret' hotels and got a room at a fraction of the usual rate but, even so, there's no escaping the fact that staying here is an unforgettable experience. All of the rooms have spectacular views across the sea and coast and are beautifully fitted out and I would imagine that EVERYONE who stays here spends a little time playing with the automatic curtains. Service is excellent (though they spend so long making sure that everyone is welcome when they check in that you can be help up unnecessarily when trying to check out). The hotel's not in the middle of the City and is a fair walk from the centre (c30 minutes, past the male nudist beach) but if you can afford to stay here, you can probably afford the 5 Euro taxi fare. If I can find a good rate (or persuade someone else to pay for me) I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer heaven...”
Reviews.Author: BWRIGHT59
Reviews.Content: The W Barcelona is an amazing property. It's luxury all the way. It feels like being in a Mediterranean heaven. With access to the beautiful, colourful city of Barcelona, it's a little oasis unto itself with the most breathtaking views I've seen in a hotel. The only improvement possible would be the service they offer in the restaurants and at the pool bar. The waiters were a bit slow and kind of had 'an attitude'. Maybe it was just that the rest was so perfect, I expected perfection in the restaurants as well. The food and snacks were great though. Other than that...a perfect place to feel relaxed and pampered. Awesome hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury from top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: love2goIdaho
Reviews.Content: Fabulous. Food, views, service, location, beds. Is only a ten minute walk to Las Ramblas. Best hotel fitness center Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “W Barcelona + El Bulli = One of the best holidays ever !”
Reviews.Author: dYquem
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights either side of a lunch at El Bulli. Hotel was excellent. I was upgraded to a corner suite (spg platinum... one of the best upgrades ever received). Room service was able to cater for an imprompu after-party for twenty people at 4am (including our rather eclectic requests for food and beverage!!) without batting an eyelid. Staff were consistently friendly (although the security guard did leave my bags unattended for a couple of minutes, although this was denied by one of them, saying there is a hidden security guard in the lobby - not sure if he was just spinning me a yarn, or telling the trust, but either way it didn't make me feel great given I'd specifically asked him to keep a close eye on them as my laptop was in there). Also I needed a doctor and the hotel was great in organising it. Definitely will stay there again. Make sure you book early as prices do increase nearer the time (but are cheaper in advance - very different to other hotel brands (e.g. Hilton).

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, HORRIBLE service (with attitude)”
Reviews.Author: ny2uk
Reviews.Content: As usual, the W is a very trendy destination, with a bar/club that has a long line every night, but it is absolutely not deserving of five stars. It is not in a central location (though it is on the beach), it is at the very end of the boardwalk, so one side of the hotel looks at the port with all of the cruise ships with filthy exhaust pouring out of them. When I arrived, the hotel had "lost" my reservation, and acted clueless (including the manager) when I pulled up the reservation on the Starwood Preferred Guest website at the check-in desk on my own laptop (I have Gold status with SPG). Once I finally got a room (not the room type I had booked and AFTER one of the front desk people had told me they had absolutely no available rooms, which was clearly a lie), I decided to head to the pool area to salvage what had started as a horrible trip. Had to ask for a waitress SIX times at the pool and no one ever came to take a drink order. There are plenty of waitstaff but they are all (literally) over by the DJ dancing and air kissing each others' cheeks. Went to the bar to get drinks and waited 15 minutes (it was not crowded at all), but both bartenders kept their backs to the bar and talked to each other and waved to people down on the beach. Never got that drink. Don't try to get through to the concierge or the front desk. The line is always busy, so the operators at "Whenever Whatever" tell you you'd better just go downstairs and wait in line to ask for what you need. I recommend a stay at the Hotel Arts just down the beach. Better located, with impeccable service (doormen, bellmen, and front desk staff remembered my name after one night staying there and said good morning/afternoon/evening to me by name for the remainder of the 5 days I stayed there). The pool staff bring you free water and chilled towels and fruit (without requesting it) and the food is outstanding. That is a hotel deserving of five stars.

Reviews.Title: “W Barcelona is the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: mat568
Reviews.Content: Spent in W six beatiful and long nights in summer. The hotel is extra class, on the beach with very special Mellow Bar with many beautiful girls.The room was very spacious, with big glassed bathroom in room, which is amazing, if you do not care about privacy :-) The restaurant was little bit expensive, but you have many other small buffets close to the hotel with very good price and food. Staff was excellent, they even tryed to speak german, which was so nice and funny. thank you W for fantastic holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the W Hotel, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: crobinson100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a truly wonderful trip to Barcelona and stayed at the W Hotel which was simply gorgeous. The service was faultless and our room was relaxing and luxurious. It made my Birthday very special indeed....champagne arrived at the pool with fresh fruit, and a cake and more champagne awaited us in our room. Perfect! The staff made us feel very special and we had heaps of fun soaking up the sun and enjoying the Bliss spa. The Eclipse Bar on the 26th floor was buzzy and the ground floor bar/restaurant area provided the ideal setting to enjoy a pre and post-dinner cocktail. We cannot wait to return and send a big thank you to all the staff who looked after us so well.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 0NETrip_AtA_Time
Reviews.Content: Despite the mixed reviews, my wife and I chose to stay at the W to celebrate anniversary. Admittedly, the room is very expensive, but the amenities, location, and service more than compensate. If you are looking to escape cruise ship tourists and relax in the intoxicating ambiance that comes from mixing W with Barcelona, then ask the cab driver to take you "Hotel Vela". You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: janineb01
Reviews.Content: romantic, hotel with a very cosy feel.....loved every day...so happy to have my wife with me on a business trip

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at an excellent, stylish W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: keiki40
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the whole team of the W Barcelona for the wonderful stay we had! The view from our very clean, modern and well decorated room on the 20th floor to the city and the beach was absolutely stunning. We loved the lounge atmosphere with the DJ at the Wet (swimmingpool area) at night. The whole ambiance at the W cannot be compared to other hotels. It's very stylish and different. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The Bliss Spa with the wonderful treatments is not to be missed. The therapists are great! Please make sure that you book your appointments in advance, so that your favorite appointment time is available. We visit Barcelona very regularly since at lot of years and used to stay at the Le Meridien or the Arts Barcelona before. Even though these hotels are very good we liked the W much better because of the different concept that fits our style. We highly recommend the W to all our friends planning a visit to Barcelona and we'll be back as well, of course.

Reviews.Title: “Total luxury”
Reviews.Author: RugbymumCumbria
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at W and we had the most amazing time. It was so relaxing lying by the fabulous pool and being waited on hand and foot. Good food in hotel and in Mellow BAr on beach below. If you are interested in design you will love the attention to detail of this beautiful hotel. Only thing I could fault (if pressed) is there isn't a jacuzzi and as the door and walls of the bedroom toilet and bathroom were made of glass there was zero privacy. But if you can get to W you will not be disappointed. Though you might be surprised by naked people on the beach below!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: lalawoman
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, excellent breakfast, great service. We had been traveling for 24 hours when we arrived with three young children at 10 a.m. We had two rooms reserved and they were kind enough to give us one of the rooms so we could get some sleep. That was compassionate since we don't know what we would've done if we had to wait for 6 hours. We did not use the pool but it seemed crowded. It would be helpful to have a small shop with water and some Tylenol, etc. when you're traveling with kids. The view was fantastic -- the kids wanted to sleep on the couch against the window with the shades open and I said, "what the heck" and took a great picture in the middle of the night with the city lights in the background. The service was extremely attentive and the people who worked there were very polite and eager.

Reviews.Title: “A badly organised hotel...(+ I am a Starwood PLATINUM member!)”
Reviews.Author: santosdiego
Reviews.Content: Gave this hotel a second chance after a botched first stay, resulting in me complaining to the manager. This time.....Check in: was told room would be ready in 2 hours. I waited SEVEN hours to get access to my room despite several complaints and assurances. Check out: was told I couldn't request a late check out and would need to check back on my departure date. I informed them I was entitled to this as a Platinum member + I had waited for the preceding guest to check out. Escalated to the management then told this was done, and keys were re-issued. Of course they didn't work past 12noon. Had to get them re-issued again. Nice hotel, badly organised, staff don't know what they are doing. You really have to escalate to management here to get anything resolved. This is no longer a new hotel; they should get sort themselves out. Stressful stay.

Reviews.Title: “W is for wow”
Reviews.Author: holidaychicLondon
Reviews.Content: The W is a stylish modern hotel situated by the beach. The view from the room is fabulous just picture laying in bed and opening the curtains electronically and looking directly out to sea from the luxury of your wonderfully comfortable bed. The hotel is exceptionally modern throughout. The concierge team are very helpful. They gave us a map and wrote names of vasrious tapas places to try and highlighted the best places to visit. The pool bar is great, very comfi, great service and as the evening sets in they bring out lights and cushions to transpose it into an evening bar. The bar at the top is also fantastic. We were only going to go up there for an hour for a night-cap, but ended up staying until 4am. The music was great and the guy playing the bongos whilst standing on the bar got the crowd going. The W has it's own little stretch of beach which was run by the Mellon beach club which had an efficient booking in system to reserve sun loungers. They were very comfortable and the beach service was very good. The W is as some have said a little way away from Las Ramblas, but we didn't mind as the walk was very pleasant around 20 mins. Barcelona is a fantastic city, lots to see. The cable car was good fun and gave you a good view of the city. The cathederal was worth seeing, but the Sagrada Familia was much better. I do agree with another reviewer that the price is excessive considering the inside is under constrcuction. The outside is the best bit and free. The magic fountain is ok, but don't look for anything other than quite a big fountain with a few lghts that change colour to music that you can barely hear. Try tapas 24, which was recommednded by the concierge, mmmm. Las Ramblas is similar to Covent Garden with many street performers and places to eat and drink, nice atmosphere. Do go to the indoor food market, wow that's what I call a market, all fresh food from sea food, hams, sweets and chocolate to fruit, dried fruit and more. Barcelona is not a cheap city though. You will pay around 50 euros for lunchtime tapas for 2 with a bottle of decent (not dead expensive) wine. A glass of beer nearly everywhere was 5 euros. Pros - well all of the above, a modern stylish hotel with good night life, by the beach with good views out to sea, excellent staff and lovely chic rooms. Cons - only ate 1 evening meal which was ok, but not great. The w is not a cheap hotel to eat and drink in. Havng said that if you want all of the above you have to expect to pay for it. You will pay 5 euros for an average size glass of coke on the beach. In the bar you will pay around 9 euros for a vodka and tonic. We are used to these prices as drinkining in hotels is London is quite costly, but if you are not they will seem a liitle steep. If you want a bit of luxury then you will not be disappointed with the W.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: stan123
Reviews.Content: There is not much to say - the hotel is excellent, one of the best we've ever stayed. a lot has already been written - beach, food etc. - everything great. The only small problem - for those who like to lie at the swimming pool - the chairs are occupied early in the morning. Some people (probably german tourists) put their towels on them and go away. One morning we found out that all the chairs were taken but there was no single soul at the pool. And the staff is helpless... It reminds a bit on a 2-star hotel somewhere in turkey. Apart of that - a fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely different”
Reviews.Author: JensenPalmSprings
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the W Hotel in Barcelona and the experience was very pleasant. Definitely a hotel for the club set but can be enjoyable for anyone. The hotel is full of surprises that you won't see in most if any hotels. The setting and ambiance of the hotel right on the beach overlooking the water can't be beat. Our standard room with the bed smack in the middle of the room seemed small at first. However, it didn't take long to adapt to the new very functional layout. The staff was friendly and helpful. It would be nice to have a small gift shop with water, books, etc rather than ridiculous clothes, and a couple of tubes of sunscreen. The spa was very nice and the staff very pleasant. Had two 105 min massages from Maria who was exceptional. Food was pricy but again the ambiance of the restaurant over looking the sea was worth it. The breakfasts in the Bravo were great however the dinners here (we had two) were acceptable but definitely not as awesome as they would lead one to believe. For us the quality nor the taste was exceptional, however what was served up, like roasted endives, was unusual like the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy rooms and terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraW75
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nightmare! When we arrived at 4:40 in the afternoon, we were told our room was not ready. They gave us coupons for drinks while we waited.The coupons were only good for a soda and water! And this for people paying the small fortune for a suite. After an hour and a half wait, we were ready to leave when they gave us the room. The shower had a soggy, bloody band aid in it and the toilet room had dried urine all over the wall. I agree with the other reviewer. The room smelled. They didn't even try the air freshener. The furniture is cheap crap made of plywood covered with formica.....cheap,cheap, cheap. And the service. I don't think its in their vocabulary. They have this I don't give a damn attitude. The wait staff downstairs were obviously shorthanded and stressed as well. Its another saga of big corporate saving big bucks. The only thing going for them was a nice view and a comfortable bed. No "W"'s for us ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, greatest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: Kathrin_73
Reviews.Content: After my stay at W Barcelona I have to say: What a great place! Staff is helpful, smart and very friendly - no matter who you are talking to. The food at the restaurants is delicious. The rooms are huge and have all amenities you might need. You will feel like in heaven while sleeping in their bed! There is NOTHING at all what was not just WOW - as they say! I can absolutely recommend the hotel, no matter if for a private or a business trip! ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly dirty for a new hotel”
Reviews.Author: rewecat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a resort facility, set on a beach near the industrial harbor, which means you must walk nearly 2 kms to the sights in old town Barcelona. Most guests are there to use the pool and day spa. Despite the building's stylish architecture, the rooms were disappointing. When we arrived there was a strong smell of stale urine on the bathroom floor. When we told housekeeping, they simply sprayed some air-freshener over it !!! - leaving the dirt and smell for us to deal with.... Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with typical Catalan service!”
Reviews.Author: VS2010
Reviews.Content: The cool corner suites at the W were amazing and the views were unbeliveable. The hotel was very trendy and lots of mod cons, particularly in the bedrooms. The location is slightly out of town but very near the beach (familes, gay and nudists all in harmony!). The walk into the City takes about 20 mins or a 7 euro cab. The only down side was the slightly non plus service we received which you wouldn't normally expect from this type of hotel. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes for a great w/end away”
Reviews.Author: Larry039
Reviews.Content: I went as part of a stag party for the Barcelona Grand Prix. As you can imagine the hotel was packed which can sometimes lead to a let down in service at hotel. Not at the W. We were a party of about 20 & all the rooms were ready on time & as ordered. The rooms are spacious & v modern with fantastic views across the ocean. Big bathrooms with walk in showers etc etc. All the gadgets you'd associate with W. The pool bar & lobby bar were both excellent as was the Sky bar where we went on both nights. As residents you can jump the queue. All in all a really fun hotel. Special mention for the staff. We required a couple of buses, nightclub table reservations, taxies, restaurant bookings & due to the Iceland ash cloud we needed help with alternative transport that included slepper train tickets & Eurostar tickets. The staff were EXCELLENT. They dealt with all the requests for the whole party & there were plenty of them! This was a nice surprise as sometimes at trendy hotels you can get a bit of the superior attitude from the staff. Not at the W. The whole group loved the hotel. If in Barcelona again with a partner or a group I would not hesitate to stay there again. Ps. Book early online for the best rates.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with a marvellous view - but not centrally located”
Reviews.Author: martandrews
Reviews.Content: My partner and me, we loved our 5-night stay at the W Barcelona which is very stylishly designed, the rooms are big, very relaxing and comfortable and the views over the beach and the city are simply spectacular. The only problem is, that the hotel is a bit far away from the city center, so whenever you go back you have to take a taxi (which is in Spain not that expensive). In total I would recommend the hotel for people, who are willing to pay a little extra money for style.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel But...”
Reviews.Author: LindaE_10
Reviews.Content: We booked a corner suite with ocean view which was not ready when we arrived after 2 PM. Two hours later, we demanded a room and were upgraded to a slightly larger suite - beautiful and spacious with phenomenal ocean view. Hotel is right on the beach. BUT - the extra bed in our suite was 50 euros per night and they tried to charge us for the upgrade. They also charged us for items incurred by prior guest - so read your bill carefully. Our room was never cleaned prior to 5 pm and on one evening they cleaned it while we were at dinner - after 7PM. Lunch in lobby restauraunt for 3 was over 125 euros and mediocre. However, breakfast was good. Hotel is distant from most sites and costs nearly 10 euros for each cab ride (Sagrada Familia was 9.5 euros, Ramblas 8 euros) - more if you use a cab after a certain hour. The pool was always packed and loungers were hard to get. If you're an active sightseer, I cannot recommend this hotel. But if you just want to chill on the beach/pool, hang at the bar, or use the gym - it is fine, though pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotels that I had been”
Reviews.Author: NatashaLitmanen
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona for 1 week with my husband to celebrate our wedding anniversary and it was great to can be in this Hotel.This Hotel is wonderful, the service, the decoration, the room, the view... all was perfect.The guy from the reception was so nice... they was so attentive with us, they recomend to visit the most important sites of the city (like Park Guell, Sagrada Familia, Barça Stadium, Gaudí...) and all that we ask they was so so so attentive. For example, they recomend to us to go to dinner to La Gavina, an amazing meal in a lovely site of Barcelona.The room had a lovely view to the sea, when I entered to the room I was petrified to see that view, was great...Thank you for give us the best wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: TheDebdenPope
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located on the beach, a little away from the hussle of the city centre but in a good way! The views from the rooms (if facing the sea) are breathtaking, very modern and minimalistic, rainfall shower room within the bedroom. Good Bliss Spa amenities. Dinner in the main restaurant Wave was excellent, however, if a weekend do book if you want peak dinner time, the host in the restaurant may not tell you to do this! The bar/pool area is great, very cool, comfortable loungers but you really do have to get down there early to get a lounger. The hotel seems to take a lot of business from pre cruise guests, particularly the Disney Cruise so in the summer there are a lot of kids and the pool is the only area they want to be!! Service is generally good, if a little manyana manyana, however the pool bar service is very slow and if on the upper deck you could go very hungry and thirsty!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Building but nobody is in control!”
Reviews.Author: Jasonfromtheblock
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights initially in 2503, a suite on the 25th floor, and then on 2001 on the 20th. There are a lot of great things at this hotel but our overall impression was that the General Manager has not been in the same country for around 6 months. Our suite was incredible with superb views out to sea and across to Montjuic. The decor is very stylish and the bed is so comfortable we are buting one for our new appartment. Our Welcome pack was not there and we had to call for it to come. The music from the 26th floor Eclipse bar kept us awake as did the very audible sound of toilets flushing above us - this is worse than poor in a top suite in a 5 star hotel. The hotel moved us to a room the next day but were unable to refund us the difference in price because we ``booked with an agency``! This is not 5 star service although we did receive a bunch of flowers and a bottle of champagne in our new room. Service in general was good by the pool but always slow.In the Bravo restaurant the service was so bad for a "name brand" restaurant that we ended up serving ourselves drinks. For breakfast we were asked by an unhappy female server if we knew where we were as "this is a private restaurant". Yes we do know we are staying at this hotel - "this is still a private restaurant" !! The Maitre D`enjoyed shouting at the staff that their orders were on a side table - Hey how about taking them to the tables yourself. Not once did he go to any table to check on the Guest experience! When we left we found an additional 191EUROS for accomodation on the bill that we had to fight to get removed. Overall this hotel needs a major management change. I would start with the following; -music from Eclipse should not disturb top paying Guests - Randomly closing fire screen doors seen on floors 25 and 20. - Staff should smile at Guests - it works! -Stained carpet, sink and windowsill in 2001 - Staff need name tags - signs of protein spill in pool August 20th in the morning and all day. -service on upper sun deck stops at 6.00pm without prior warning. - bar on upper sun deck was never open despite hotel being full. -corridor on floor E to Bliss Spa has badly scuffed walls -all doors and walls near service exits are scuffed and marked - Reservation & billing system needs com,plete overhaul. - Guest service recovery is going to be more effective and cheaper when taken care of right away. Train the team to do this. And Finally!!! General Manager - get back into your hotel, walk around and talk to your Guests, sort out the challenges!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic & wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: Minibanks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W-Hotel Barcelona in August 2010 for 5 nights. I have been in many hotels but the room I got in the W Barcelona was one of the best ever. The hotel is beautifull. The rooms are gigantic and the view from the hotels over the beach and sea is stunning. The hotel has great restaurants and bars as well as a large outside area with pool. The W hotel in Barcelona is the only hotel with a private beach area. The hotel is situated in the tourist area of the city. I definitely will go back to the W Hotel in Barcelona. I can recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location - dreadful overall service”
Reviews.Author: Chavi_Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: First, I'd like to point out a few things about the location of this hotel. Unlike some other reviews, I did like the location: It's at the port, fantastic overall views, and you can walk along the promenade to numerous beach-restaurants and bars. If you'd like to hire a bike, it's a 5-minute walk to the store and for 10€ a day, you can rent a great bike. It takes 20 minutes to walk to the nearest subway-station (Barceloneta); not a big deal, unless you like to sit and do nothing all day. Now, enough said about the location and the great materials they use in the hotel-lobby, restaurants and outside terraces ánd rooms. So: The GREAT things: - Location and view! (I was on the 17th floor, south side) - Outside and inside look & feel The BAD things: - Staff is in general (i did find a few staff-members who do know to treat a 5-star hotel guest!!) not well trained, noisy, very re-active in stead of pro-active and can be friendly only when asked for service. An exception for the reception-staff; they made me feel at home and were courteous. But: the lines at the desks are far too long and sometimes a receptionist just disappears. - Bar-staff is really unmotivated and only busy with themselves. - Breakfast-restaurant-staff is disorganized, noisy and have no idea what they are doing. Their main goal seems to be filling up coffee-cans and juicecans, but won't ask if you'd like (another) cup of coffee, unless called. - Terrace-staff is incredibly unaware of guest-needs. They just walk by, don't greet, don't ask if you'd like to drink or eat anything and some have the looks as if they work at the nearest chiringuito (beachbar). Absolutely terrible and what's worse for the hotel: They miss income. - Restaurant (dinner)-staff is curteous overall, do have a pro-active attitude, but some clearly were in a bad mood or were commenting other staff's behaviour in front of guests. Internet-conexions: - Room: €5 for 1 hr, €8 for 2 hrs, €19 for 24 hours. Wifi didn't work. I was charged -of course-, but found a pleasant surprise in the room the next day: A cable. Didn't work. - Lobby: Is for free, wifi works good; it will tell you it's for 24 hours, but after that it just starts again. Pity you have to look for plugs, cause those are not standard. Where the lamps are, there are the plugs! - Business-centre: 4 home pc's, very slow. Not good. So, overall: Beautiful place, you might run into celebs, but for the rest: Poor service. The food in the restaurant Wave was good by the way, but pricy. Feel free to contact me when you need more info.

Reviews.Title: “Good but expensive”
Reviews.Author: foiegras99
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a lot of Ws around the world, I know roughly what to expect. My last experience in Hollywood's W was poor, so it was great to have a good experience in Barcelona. Principally the staff attitude in LA was appalling, but here the staff were extremely friendly, the restaurants excellent, the design of the hotel top-notch. I received a room upgrade due to SPG gold status, and the room was superb. I'm not sure if the standard rooms would please as much. Make sure you eat the fish in the restaurants here - Barcelona has some great sea-food and the hotel restaurant is no exception. All in all a good hotel that isn't too pretentious (refreshing after my last W experience!) but yet is very "trendy" if you like that sort of thing. The problem is that it costs a fortune, so if I wasn't on expenses for business I would almost certainly stay elsewhere if on holiday. Internet is 19 euros for 24 hours - though that's not uncommon in these kinds of hotels.... Still a bit of a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Typical large design hotel with impersonal services far from city center”
Reviews.Author: OLV_P
Reviews.Content: For a city famed for its avantgarde architecture, I was expecting more from the W. While the exterior is impressive, the interior design is minimal, cold and lackluster. The reception and lobby area and the atrium look anything but luxurious. I found the W Barcelona almost identical to ME BY MELIA, another large design hotel I previously stayed at (also close to the beach, but far from city center). Rooms at the W Barcelona are airy, with a comfortable bed and the views over the city, beach and the sea are spectacular. However, the rooms also have some drawbacks such as: the bathroom sink is placed right in the room, without any separation, resulting in total lack of privacy. Also, from the shower, you are getting out right into the room. There are no bathtubs in any of the room categories. The outdoor pool area is pretty large with many sunbeds, however, the pool itself is quite small. Be sure you reserve a sun bed in the high season, as it can get very crowded. As for location, if you were seeking to spend your stay at the beach and pool, the W is the perfect choice. However, if you want to explore the city or you are on business, it is far from the center and business district. Service throughout the hotel especially front office, pool and restaurants is at a good level. However, do not expect to have a personalized service, or the attention you would get in a deluxe hotel. For instance, name recognition is inexistent. From reading the hotel web site, you have the impression, the hotel has a whole array of daily entertainment events. I seem to have missed that during my stay, except for the music at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not for holiday w children.”
Reviews.Author: Familyofwestcoast
Reviews.Content: Very posh, stylish hotel, best place to sleep in town, I'm sure, but kind of pricy if you stay a week w children. Very dedicated waiters in pool area ask every 10 minutes if everything is all right, and you start wondering if something is wrong... Softdrinks are 4€ for 20 cl and my children are used to all-inclusive, so I had to make some restrictions. Pool is tiny, and toys are not allowed, and children were bored after an hour. I felt very self-concious just swimming in the pool, as most women hung in the bar, dressed casual-smart and having coctails. In the hotel beach area (Mellow bar) we were told we were supposed to eat and drink for a minimum of 100€ to use the sunbeds. We ended up in the central Barceloneta beach most days, where the beach is at its best, and the charming chaotic atmosphere made us feel like we were actually in Barcelona. But then again, I never had a better room or view than W, staff was very friendly, cleaning staff in particular. A little worried how they are going to maintain room w shower leaks and moist, and all that white furniture, but not my problem. Would recommend better written info about hotel, such as prices for breakfast, business centre/internet access etc. Would come back for romantic weekend, but not w children. About Barcelona w children: Lots of interesting and fun stuff to do, easy to get around. I particularly recommend the interactive science centre CosmoCaixa by the Tibidabo mountain and biking along the beach.

Reviews.Title: “W is amazing in many different ways”
Reviews.Author: Chuck-Oshum
Reviews.Content: W lived up to the expections i had based on their website : cool corner suite has a great design and fantastic view over the city (and i did not hear a sound during the night which is exceptional in a 400 room hotel), the restaurants and bars have yummie things on the menu and staff is very helpfull. But the hotel goes beyond that when it comes to service and their slogan Whatever-Whenever is indeed well chosen : excellent room service , cleaning staff are the best and a special note should be given to the concierge team. Even when it is very busy they help and can make amazing things happen...they even managed to arrange VIP access to a DJ Tiesto club concert on very short notice which is not an easy thing to do in a city like Barcelona. In short : WoW

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel ---- but!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Theholidaymakers
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Barcelona as an after exam treat with my two teenagers in tow. First impressions were just amazing beautiful hotel, fabulous reception staff all handsome men kitted out in their grey suits and pale blue shirts. Music piping throughout the hotel my girls were very impressed. The room ( Wow room ) was just fabulous with the most amazing view out to sea. We rushed in to swimwear and headed to the pool. Problem... not a sun bed to be had. Plenty of sun beds but all with towels on them, sadly a lot of them without people on the towels just a magazine or two and a tube of sun cream. Not to be beaten a kind member of staff directed us to the beach club. If you want a double bed here that was all that was left, a hundred euros was the charge.. In that it was 4 30 in the afternoon i did not think we could possibly spend a hundred euros in drinks and food. Never mind the next day we will get a sun bed!!! Wrong this went on for three days until hating myself our last morning i too headed down to the pool at eight thirty to throw towels magazines and sun oil on three sunbeds knowing i would not be using them till after 2 pm. Management Please unless people are using the sun beds right away DONT let them hog them for the whole day.. It spoiled a wonderful experience for us when after a day in your wonderful city a lie in the sun and a swim would have been lovely. One of the main reasons we choose the hotel was the chance to do both. The hotel was fab, it was trendy, the bars are amazing , gym great, position great, 5 euro taxi to town. but the pool issue spoiled it a bit .

Reviews.Title: “W Barcelona stands out!!!”
Reviews.Author: sidhu2020
Reviews.Content: We were in this hotel with our two kids 12 and 5 from 2 aug to 7 aug. Had two connecting rooms; a wonderful room and a fantastic suite (an upgrade for platinum spg member). The location is on the beach away from the hustle and the views of the sea are breathtaking from the rooms. Had a lower floor, but it was no inconvenience. The showers are the best. A very good atmosphere around property. The in room dining was good, however did not get a chance to go to the hotel restaurants. It is certainly one of the best hotels in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Save your dosh don't go posh!!”
Reviews.Author: GrantH11
Reviews.Content: I could not agree with you more BarbaraB52! I've stayed in better camp sites and this hotel. I suprised my wife for our 4th wedding anniversary and thought I would treat her to a luxury hotel. we arrived at around 12 and our room was not ready understandable as check in is at 2, fine, we wondered around exploring and checking out the facilites. after an over priced beer and coke we went back to check in, guess what room not ready, 100 euros later and 4 o'clock we final got our room which was already wrong I requested a sea view and got a construcion site with 2 cranes, lovely! room 337 (fantastic suite). we got moved to the top floor 25th (room 2502), great. We were told that it is below the sky bar (more like night club if you like hard core rave) and on the managers promise was told it is not noisy, HA. We requested a move and nothing could be done, by the way it closes as 2.30am during the week and at 4 on weekends, in our three nights there we had about 10 hours sleep. 3 hours on our last night when we had to get up early for our flight, great way to prepare for an early flight and if you try to phone and complain they transfer you to a call centre in america and then charge you for the call, customer service at its best. Now to the hotel its self, to the naked eye it looks great but i work in the construction engineering industry and the hotel design is atroshish we had a toilet door that would not close because of the carpet, cracks and dirt on the walls, unfinished paint jobs and the lighting system is rubbish, it's just sheer poor workmanship. The pool is another matter, i've seen bigger baths! and don't get me started on some of the pompous guests who think they are above other guests and show no common descency. Some of the staff are kind and friendly and our final meal at Wave was nice (too little too late) however the pool staff and the mellow bar staff are crap! you wait 25 mins for a single bottled beer and pay 10 euros for a plate of chips which look like tooth picks and come cold. Make sure you take your life savings with you as this is an over priced bomb shell and I would not recommend this hotel to the devil himself.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service at rip-off prices”
Reviews.Author: barbarab52
Reviews.Content: We thought we'd endulge ourselves with a 2-night stay without kids and didn't mind spending quite a bit more than at other 5-star hotels for a luxureous time. We were very disappointed. What a rip off! Service at the pool (don't think swimming, it's standing-room only for it's size and this many hotel guests) was miserable. (Minimum wait is 30 mins."I can't help you anymore, my shift is over"). Same for the service at the bar with the great view ("Please don't sit on this sofa, it's reserved. Don't sit at the end of the bar, it's only for people who order a bottle of champagne. Please don't slide that little side table over for your drink. You'll just have to hold it." - All these rules quickly spoiled our mood, as specially as we were the only people there!) Lamps weren't working, trimmings were coming loose and the walls had some serious damage. The (back-ground) music follows you everywhere throughout the hotel and is rather loud, so forget having a phone-conversation in the hall. In the morning it will also wake you up. coming from the corrridors. Also, if you're staying for more than 1 day be sure to bring your own soaps and shampoos as you will not get any refills. And don't count on speaking with the reception or the whatever/whenever department as their lines are forever busy and the line downnstairs is at least 15 minutes. Be sure to keep an extra half hour for the check-out-line. Everywhere around us people were complaining. So, all this combined with high roomrates and expensive F&B prices, we will never come back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING , GORGEOUS BUILDING AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: CesSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I am not crazy about chain Hotels, but I was told this one would be different. Well, they were right. Its gorgeous the staff is gorgeous and efficient. They went out of their way to help me. Found a perfect room for me. The restaurants are amazing and the spa is to die for. I hope all you travelers have a wonderful time as I did. CAMSANDIEGO

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: ABfromNYC
Reviews.Content: We go to Barcelona every year but from now on this is where we will stay. Our room was super cool with an amazing view and the Wet (pool and outdoor bar) was very lively and the Wave restaurant served excellent food. The Sky Bar has the best view of the city you can get and they make great cocktails, definitely go for sunset, it also gets crowded late at night, it's quite a scene. Our experience was everything we expected from a W.

Reviews.Title: “Some good points, some bad points and some tips”
Reviews.Author: chasman1
Reviews.Content: I'm a 42 yr old American travelling with my family. We are 4. My demanding wife, my hyper 9 yr old son and my crazy 2 yr old son. Good points - Architecturally stunning, on the water near the beach, new rooms, fast elevators, groovy vibe, good service poolside. Bad points - many employees lack experience, 27 Euro breakfasts, they try and charge you 50 Euros for a small extra bed per night, when you dial zero from your room you are put on hold for along time, no one was there to help us with our bags upon pulling up in our cab at check-in, the front desk staff doesn't seem to care if you are an SPG member, all rooms seem to have just 1 king bed, good luck finding the switches to all the lights and drapes, one little pool - the pool hostess loves to bark and kids if they are not wearing shoes in the hotel lobby, good luck finding the gym too on level E. Tips - To save money try calling the maintenance staff and have them bring an extra bed AFTER checking in, refill your evian bottle in the gym and grab an apple instead of 4 Euros a bottle poolside, if you have kids eat breakfast on Floor E and kids eat for free, the gym showers are ice cold so head to your room instead, we had dinner one night at Barceloneta Restaurant - not bad but busy and frenetic.
