Hotels do not cater to families of 4 in Europe nor is there the outstanding service you are used to in the States so just lower your expectations. I would stay here again, but it could be awesome with some better management. The SW side of the hotel seems like a forgotten wasteland could have been an awesome 2nd kids infinity pool or tennis courts or something cool. I paid $200 on hotwire.com so wasn't complaining but if I had to book 2 rooms at $400 each I would not have thought it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card for unexpected charges after checkout”
Reviews.Author: bosgeek
Reviews.Content: My credit card was charged for the late checkout after we checked out on time and received the hotel bill without the late checkout charge. The hotel admitted this to be an error, but after 10 days they still have not processed the refund. It is very hard to get hold of their billing department (if it even exists). I am never coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Indulgence”
Reviews.Author: vickybrad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Barcelona at the beginning of July for our 10th wedding anniversary - a fantastic treat weekend without the kids! This hotel is fabulous for a few days of indulgence, the pool area is all grown up glamour (pack your designer bikini!) and the private beach gives you a choice of sea/pool. Our room was amazing, we had booked a 'fabulous' but the hotel upgraded us to a 'corner suite' when we arrived which was a lovely surprise. The rooms have everything you would need and having a two person bathtub in the middle of the room with views of the ocean was incredible. The beach bar was very cool, though I wouldn't bother with Eclipse on the top floor as it was soul less and not worth the hype! We found the location great, right on the beach with amazing views and the harbour and beach bars can all be easily walked to within 10-15 minutes. All in all a fantastic weekend. If I had one note of caution it would be that this is an 'adult' hotel, the pool is small and the poolside 'cool' rather than 'kiddy'! Kids would be bored here and out of place. However, the lack of kids was great for us as that is what we had come to get away from!

Reviews.Title: “"W"onderful indeed !”
Reviews.Author: cloink
Reviews.Content: Before going, we read a couple of alarming reviews, so we were a little reserved. Also, we were traveling with our 4-year old daughter and were unsure about the "child-friendlyness" of the hotel. Those reservations made place for sheer awe when we arrived... The hotel itself ("landmark" anyone?), the views (wow, just... wow...), the room (design, light, clean) and the staff (very, very good given the average age... bravo!): all were simply wonderful. I'll list the negatives, which is far less work than listing the positives: - the "Wave" restaurant wasn't up to par. Our waiter apparently had a bad day and seemed very distracted and couldn't smile. Furthermore: it's overpriced compared to other restaurants in the (wide) neighbourhood. Eat elsewhere. - the service at the pool could be quicker. Although I do understand, as there are a lot of people, probably ordering food all at once. Service is always (very) friendly though! - prices are high. Even if you book a room through an online price-breaker, spending time in the hotel, means spending (a lot) of money. 12€ for a (mediocre) cocktail? 20€+ for a tray of little fried snacks? Again: eat elsewhere! :) - parking a car is expensive. We paid close to 25€/day and there's not much of an alternative (seeing the pretty distant location of the hotel). - the location. It's perfect for the views, but quite distant to the centre of Barcelona. There's a bus which stops in front of the hotel though, so it's not that big of a problem. Be careful though: these busses don't run at night! (but we enjoyed our daily stroll back to the hotel at night ;) ) - the crowd. It's young & "hip". Possibly a bit too hip (read: snobbish). Probably not recommended for older people (50+). Having said that: we met some lovely people at the pool, from all over the globe. That's about it (and I'm being VERY critical now). The rest is simply amazing & well worth the money. Very, very recommended. When we return to Barcelona, we will return to the W!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel at exotic location”
Reviews.Author: Samjo24
Reviews.Content: The hotel photo from web with sea on three sides promised much... entry into hotel and I realised that it delivered what it promised..! The property is fabulous.. White Interior rooms talk of famous spanish architectural touch.. the room was innovative wth wash basin inside the room and out of bathroom..the view from room was of beach full of sunbathing people and boundless energy..! The room service was warm.. breakfast spread good.. Swimming pool fantastic with poolside bar.. The hotel is so constructed that you will always get view of sea from room...the shopping street La Rambla was 10 min walking distance about 2 km.. overall hotel bowled me over.. one of the best that I have stayed in my journeys abroad...

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: acd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was magnificent! The views from the room and the pool are stunning! staff was very attentive and madeour stay truly enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “"Whatever whenever": Do I look like I'm bothered?”
Reviews.Author: MLS99
Reviews.Content: Fabulous view of the sea from a comfortable room but the WOW (their words, not mine) features within the room didn't work, one could hear everything going on in the bathroom, and the service was absolutely abysmal and rude. When a hotel starts its services directory with a page called "Our terminology", so that you the customer must learn what it calls normal hotel features, it's clearly indicative of its approach to service. My favorite was the concierge service called "Whatever whenever" which reminded me of Catherine Tate's "Am I bothered? Do I look like I'm bothered? Whatever!" Despite having slept fabulously (the bed was extremely comfortable, and the room was quiet until the last morning when drilling/hammering within the hotel started at 8am), the terrible service throughout the hotel (check-in desk, concierge, pool area, bar, elevator-screener) was rude enough to put me off returning.

Reviews.Title: “What a room!”
Reviews.Author: CNielsen
Reviews.Content: Booked a Cool Corner Suite on the 20th. floor for four nights in July and it did not disappoint. We arrived early and only the third agreed time we returned to the reception our room was ready, but it was worth waiting for! Amazing views of the city and beach from the living room and the Mediterranean from our bedroom. Room was clean and with all the amenities you could have asked for, the bed was perfect. Would have liked turn down service at night including fresh towels. We had breakfast at both restaurants the Wave and Bravo as well as in our room, with Bravo as the best choice – calm and relaxing setting with a nice buffet. We had lunch in both the Wave restaurant and the W bar, no complaints. Dinner at Bravo, the restaurant run by the famous Carlos Abellán, was nothing special at all. If you want a great meal try his signature restaurant Comerc 24 a short ride from the hotel, this is superb! (another tip. is the “Dry Martini Bar” – awesome!). Pool is nice, great service as well. We stayed at the beach club one day, it does not belong to W but if you have a cocktail or lunch it is free including sunbeds and umbrellas. My wife had a massage in the spa and was very happy with the treatment and service. We also used the fitness-center, very large and with all new equipment. The hotel is (only) 10 minutes from the city centre by taxi, but during the hot summer months I would always prefer to stay on the beach near the ocean instead of downtown. This is the hotel to stay at in summer time. Is it 5 star? probably only if you have the perfect room as we did. The rest of the hotel is “W” style great, but not fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: JamesD101
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! A bit out of the city center but it has breathtaking views. If you lucky score a corner room it doesn't have to be on a high floor to feel like you're floating a million miles out at sea. So relaxing. Great shower too. Better for pleasure than business though.

Reviews.Title: “Cradle for infant was not installed until 0:45 a.m. despite 7 complaints since noon checkin”
Reviews.Author: rainerup
Reviews.Content: Wow, this hotel is a lost opportunity. Great setting, good rooms but really, reallly lousy service. Staff is friendly but unmanaged. Reserved cradle several days before arrival, checked in at noon and despite a call every 2 hours to that ridiculous whatever-whenever concierge service we did not get the cradle until close to 1 a.m. Many apologies and promises with every call, but nothing happened until that time. The little girl crying, her mother close to a nervous breakdown and my anniversary stay spoilt. BTW, there must have been many people with problems, as that infamous "whatever whenever" thing (certainly not a "service") had me waiting in the phone loop consistently for 10 minutes, sometime much more... Btw, check in line lasted 25 minutes!!! and nobody there to offer even a glass of water nor take care of special cases, such as families with baby childs... It is amazing to see how a great hotel can be spoilt by inept management... BTW, floors 1 to 6 are noisy at night because the room doors are in the huge lobby hall with music and occasionally noisy customers. Not even my SPG Gold status helped to get me a few floors higher.... In my previous trips to Barcelona I stayed at the Sansi hotels (a small "chain" of two) which are setting benchmarks for passionate and professional customer service. They really care...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, worth the extra Euros for taxis”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustDenver
Reviews.Content: If you've ever stayed at the W, you won't be disappointed here. Traditional W features, such as DJs downstairs, extremely stylish rooms and helpful staff. Food was great, but like anything else here, expect to pay top dollar for food & drink. The hotel also has a nice bar on the top floor with great views of the city at night. Use a taxi to get arrive and depart since the subway line is not nearby, but you can take a bus to get to the main areas if you have the time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Stunning”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghBren
Reviews.Content: The views from the bedroom were absolutely amazing - to wake up each day and see the odd cruiseliner in the distance. The room was sheer luxury with very comfortable King Size bed in the middle of the room looking over the wonderful views. Location was perfect for the beach and the port. Lovely seafood restuarants nearby. The one slightly disappointing area was the pool - it is smaller than it looks in the pictures. The terrace is lovely to sit on both during the day and in the evening. Hotel was so quiet and being 19 floors up we heard no noise at all. We found the concierge staff were really helpful . Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would love to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless Views & Beach Access - For us worth the walk to the Metro or additional costs spent on Taxis”
Reviews.Author: mld40
Reviews.Content: We (me and my 5 year old twins) visited Barcelona in January and really enjoyed staying in the heart of town, but this time decided to give the W a try. It was wonderful. Friendly and efficient staff welcomed us and let us check in at 11:30 (I had emailed ahead to let them know our early arrival and received a quick email reply). Room - We had the lowest priced room, but it did not disapoint. Lovely and comfortable room with amazing view (even from our low 3rd floor). I did have the same water-flowing-out-the-shower-door problem that I've read about here in other reviews, but otherwise, no complaints about the room (though the hallway leading to the rooms is an odd orangy color that I didn't find appealing). Loved the lounge in front of the windows and the automatic curtains. Our TV did not work at first, but engineering came fairly quickly and sorted it out by changing a cord. Pool/Beach - We enjoyed one of the large shaded beds near the pool. Ordered a drink for myself and lunch for the girls. All good and reasonably priced. The un-heated pool is not especially kid-friendly (small shallow area) but I didn't expect it to be (children are not allowed in the pool after 6:00 pm). The beach access is fantastic. The beach is clean and the boardwalk area is a fun walk with lots of choices for eating, plus a little grocery store. Also, a climbing structure for kids. I usually like to be able to walk everywhere in a city - especially one as spectacular as Barcelona, but the trade off for the fun beach location was worth it for us on this trip. We took cabs most places, and the metro is a nice straight walk about a mile. If we got a good deal again, I'd absolutely stay at the W on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience....but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: phoenixaz06
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona the second week in June at the W Hotel for 6 nights. When we arrived in the room, my first comment was "wow!" & we are not easily impressed. We had a room with a terrace & the views were absolutely gorgeous of the sea & the beach/cruise port. A few of the days the wind off the ocean made the terrace a bit chilly, but the weather warmed up & the wind died down the second half of our stay. The room wasn't cheap so our expectations were high, but it didn't dissapoint. Since it was my husband & I, we weren't put off by the close proximity of the bed to the tub, toilet & shower, but, can understand why some folks might. The room was basically white with white furniture & there were numerous marks/scuffs - did not seem like such a wise decorating choice for rooms that get daily wear & tear. The sofa didn't have any arms on so made relaxing a bit of a challenge. Our door keys worked without any difficulty. The amentities in the room were Bliss spa soaps & shampoos, so they were nice. No problems with shower leaks of any kind. The lighting system was a bit complex to work & clearly needs to be addressed as it causes more time/trouble than it's worth. The room was very clean, other than the scuffs. Our only dissapointment was the concierge staff /whatever/whenever approach. Each of them were very nice. But, with the exception of one staff member, they didn't seem to have a clue about where the good local places were that weren't "tourist traps." The first evening there we asked for their recommendation & they booked us at a restaurant about a 6 minute walk along the beach from the hotel & this restaurant was one of their "top recommendations." Talk about a "tourist trap" - the restaurant was filled with other folks from the hotel (we began talking between tables) & not one local. Our only thought was that they must have some relationship with this restaurant or maybe get some kind of kick-back for booking folks there. The seafood was average - nothing exceptional to say the least & we were very dissapointed. From there on, we decided to find our own restaurants & with one exception, did much better - found the places the locals went to with great food. For a hotel that is a major player in the market, it seemed that the conceirge staff weren't organized or trained very well for that matter for a hotel of that caliber. The other issue with the conceirge was that there was always a line-up. As one other reviewer noted, a line started, but then someone inevitably would walk up & start his/her own line & be served while the rest of us stood in lthe original ine. They need at least another two staff members there during the peak times. Also, if you called the "whatever/whenever" telephone line, you were always on hold for what seemed like days. We had breakfast each morning at the hotel buffet at Bravo & the food was very enjoyable. There was a strawberry/rubarb marmalade that was absolutely delicous & you could toast brioche for a real treat. Also, a hot chicken & meatball dish, numerous dried meats, tomato, breads, yogurts, fresh fruits, pastries, smoothies, cheeses & cereals. The wait staff members tried hard but seemed to be a bit disorganized with frequent confusion on who ordered which coffees & eggs (eggs were included in the buffet price but cooked to order) each & every day. But, after a while it became part of the charm of the place because they seemed to be trying so hard. Had dinner at Bravo one night & the food was very good, not great, but very good & reasonably priced. The service was excellent. Had drinks & tapas at the hotel main floor bar - the service was sketchy, so as long as you weren't in a hurry, the drinks were good as was the food. The almonds served with the drinks were delicious. One of our dishes came out cold, but as soon as we brought it to our server's attention, it was immediately addressed & we got a freshly prepared dish that was piping hot. We ordered a cheese plate one day & asked for some additional bread & got a large plateful - nothing shy about quantity. We went up to the Eclipse bar for drinks one night & found it to be nothing great but the views. but, we're over 40 so probably not their target audience. We didn't see "drunk kids" in the lobby or in the bars as one reviewer did. Service was always friendly & nice, but very relaxed so you just learned to relax too. We would definitely stay there again as the accommodation & views could not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Made our wonderful Barcelona trip perfect!”
Reviews.Author: prazzbo
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to Barcelona. When I went there last year, W just opened and I told myself I'd definitely stay there next time I visit. The room, the pool with WET bar is amazing. Makes your holiday complete by sipping a cocktail or a glass of vine just looking at the blue sky and sea. It is actually more convenient that what other reviews said. Ok, it is by the beach, and I think 99% of the room has a sea / beach view. Sure you'd expect there's not much road or traffic around! A bus stop is just outside the hotel and it takes you to La Rambla, Catalyuna, Jamue I... etc. or you can have a nice 15 min walk to the metro station. Rooms are huge and lovely, Eclispe Bar is on top floor but nothing really special. Cocktails are nice. I think it's because I just get a better view from my room. I will definitely stay at W again!

Reviews.Title: “New hotel that needs better organization...”
Reviews.Author: GAM2001
Reviews.Content: New hotel that needs better organization. Staff very pleasant..........if you can A. Find one B. Get their attention. Been to 8 different W's and this has potential, but stay away from signature restaurant. Breakfast a real treat. Spa is fantastic. PS. Have some coffee before venturing onto the beach.... It is full nude(read old guys naked).

Reviews.Title: “WOW Hotel, as promised...but a couple of hiccups...”
Reviews.Author: nycismyhomebase
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in early June and loved the hotel. The room was fantastic and the views of the sea were unbelievable. The W bed never disappoints and the room design was fun, offering "wow" lights behind the bed, automatic open and close buttons for the drapes, a personal martini station at the foot of the bed, etc. We used Whatever/Whenever for dinner reservations (thats the name of their concierge) and they were very helpful (Isabella, in particular). They do not have menu books but do show you the website of the restaurant and most of them did have english menus. They also set up a private Gaudi tour for us, and our tourguide was fantastic. We were also able to borrow some umbrellas and an extra outlet converter, free of charge. We loved Bliss spa. We went twice and both times the staff were friendly and professional. Prices were the same as home (NYC) and offered access to the steam room, sauna, and jacuzzi. These were co-ed so every guest was required to wear a bathing suit. The relaxation room was typical, with magazines, cheese, fruit, champagne, etc. The only thing that was a little strange was that sometimes staff members of the opposite sex entered the locker room. The gym is fantasic. They have gymsource equipment and a large selection of weight machines, stationary bikes, treadmills, and ellipiticals. They also have a large studio. Given the size, amount of equipment, and the studio I wonder if they will eventually hold classes and allow for paid memberships to non hotel guests. The hiccups: First, the restaurant, Bravo 24. This is the same chef as Comerc 24 (Michelin rated) and Tapas 24. We went on a Sunday night. We love seafood and were pleased with the extensive seafood selection. It was our anniversary and the concierge had recommended this restaurant. You can imagine our disappointment when the waiter explained that most of the seafood selections were unavailable that night since it was a Sunday. If we had known they would not have most of the selections available we would have eaten somewhere else. Imagine sitting down to eat at a nice restaurant and being told that a majority of the selections listed are not available. Given that this is the hotel's premier restaurant (and the chef associated with this restaurant) we were terribly disappointed in the meal. Second, the room cards. Every day, sometimes twice a day, our room cards did not work. The front desk would reactivate them, they would work once, and then not work again. Imagine almost every time you want to return to your room you have to go back on the elevator to the lobby and then wait for somoene to become available and reactivate your key. They did nothing to fix the situation despite repeated complaints. Room service. One day we had room service delivered about a half an hour late. My hot breakfast was cold. The fruit was the table scraps. There was something on our table that we did not recognize. What made this situation worse is that the person who delivered the breakfast didnt speak a word of english. We used the English menu on our door and we are gold preferred (5 star hotels should know their preferred guests) Clearly we are English speaking guests. What could have been resolved quickly turned into another 20 minute ordeal because this woman couldnt understand anything I was saying. In the end, our romantic breakfast was ruined because my husband had to eat his hot meal while room service fixed mine or his would have been cold. Finally, their service was fantastic when things went well. However, when there is a problem their service level drops dramatically. Granted it is a new hotel but it seemed like whenever there was a problem I was dealing with a deer in headlights. Apologies were nice but there was little effort beyond this. At one point I asked to speak to the manager and was told he would call my room later that night. Needless to say, he never called. Overall, we did love the hotel for our one week stay. The hiccups were unfortunate and I prefer to think its because its a new hotel. Aside from the keycard problem the other complaints were isolated incidents. The lobby was inviting and relaxing, the pool area was set up perfecly, and we truly felt relaxed and on vacation. The staff at the pool, the bars, Eclipse, etc were all wonderful, the rooms were great, and it was the perfect combination of beach and European city vacation. PS internet access is free.

Reviews.Title: “Dont bother! No management no idea!”
Reviews.Author: Preholi
Reviews.Content: Like a nightclub with no management this place goes off, klike a bad smell! Its 2.15 in the morning and I am writing this review from the W Hotel bedrrom as there is no chance of getting any sleep with the outdoor nightclub by the pool staying open all night. Putting aside the fact that this hotel is in a stunning position overlooking the sea its a joke! No managfement ever present, staff have no idea how to genuinely listen and handle real guest complaints, nightclubs all over the building streaming with drunk kids in the pool, lobby bar and top floor make it a noisy sleasy and distateful place to stay. I was in BCN on Business and being an avid W fan, thought I would try the new W by the sea, boy, was I taken for a ride with this place. I had thought about bringing my partner to barcelona for a long weekend in the future, so I wanted to try it out in advance and i am very glad I did. This hotel is a disgrace and it starts as soon as you walk in the door. Literally. What strikes me is that there appears to be no managment in the hotel, ever! I arrived by cab at the W and was happliy greeted by a doorman with a friendly smile and a trolley. he took me in through a door to the left of the main doors and as he pulled it open the bottom hit the inbuilt up light in the paving. What amazed me was that this place has been open 8 months and basic things like the light fittings and front door hitting still are not fixed. Over the course of my stay i watched that door and light get smashed over a dozen times, amazingly the brass light fitting casing seemed to be wearing better than the door! Checkin was interesting. 3 chest high desks for guest to go up to. However if they are all busy, a sort of line gets created, not behind any particular checkin counter but somewhere in front. So if you join the cue, with 6 people already waiting patiently you move to the 1st open desk. Thats fine unless some smart kid decides to jjump in and just walk up to a desk and start a new line. This was a regular occurance and the wait would sometimes be nearly 15 minutes. As frustrating and disorganised as it is, especially since I had to have my room keys re issued 4 times for no reason other than the door wouldnt unlock, the hotel doesnt seem to care, with no effort made to manage the cues of crowds. So after recieving the key, I made my way up to the 12th floor and my "Wonderful room!" Room was interesting with some nice mod design elements but some very basic and poor issues to address, like: Toilet roll hung beind the user not to the side. There are two phones in the room, but only one works. No complimentary water No turndown service Scuff marks and chipped paint throughout the room Shwioer leaks wwater out and onto the carpet. Toilet and shower face out and open onto the bed as far as overall services: Concierge has no clue even about the hotels own top restaurant and its menu. Concierge has no comprehension of a proper 5 star hotels guests expectatons. Nightclub by the pool makes horrendus noise late into the morning. Nightclub on the top floor has amazing views but is full of drunk tourists. Reception desk process is horrendous To find the Gym, a laberinth of tunnels, staircases and mystery doors will ebe=ventually lead to a well stocked and equipped gym Pool staff are living in fairy land, slow, dont listen, dont acknowledge guests when called and down right useless. the nthere is the wateverwhenver pohone service. Basically the operator on "0" The promise with whatever whenever is to deliver! The truth is a sharp contrast. Whatever whenever staff are inconsistent and dont understand a gests needs. in other words useless. I could go on and on and on, but its just depressing know that i have paid 240Euro a night to put up with this rubbish service and lack of managment. If in Barcelona, go down have a look at the W Barcelona's architecture, and public spaces and then run for your life, for a decent hotel, or at least a sleazy night, thats actually in barcelona city.

Reviews.Title: “Talk about modern!”
Reviews.Author: vbailey2
Reviews.Content: We began our honeymoon in Barcelona, the 7th of June, and stayed for 4 nights. This is one very modern hotel! It is absolutely gorgeous. We had a suite on the 11th floor, which had full ceiling to floor windows on 2 sides. The bedroom looked right out over the Mediterranean Sea. The bed was very comfortable, and the room had wonderful ammenities. We took advantage of the Bliss Spa and had a massage. This was the most amazing spa I have seen! The pool was beautiful, and there were plenty of chairs, cabanas and lounges not only by the pool but on the next level up if you wanted a more quiet place to sunbathe. The service was great, including room service. The view from everywhere was astounding! The only drawbacks were there was no direct beach access, but it appeared they were working to make this happen. The hotel is located on a peninsula away from everything else. This is good for promoting a quiet location, but if you aren't up to walking a lot you might not care for the location. It is really only a 10 or 15 minute walk, though, to scores of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel in A Most Spectacular City”
Reviews.Author: Michael_SD
Reviews.Content: I am a long time W Hotel fan, but have often found them to be annoyingly inconsistent. Some are great, others need some help. W Barcelona was my first international stay at a W property and I was completely blown away from check-in to check-out. As soon as we arrived on the first day, the reception staff greeted us with the biggest smiles and couldn't do enough for us. The hotel was full when we stayed, so they had a limited availability of rooms, but the one we got on the 3rd floor was more than I ever could have hoped for. We walked in to the room to find floor-to-ceiling windows with amazing views of the Mediterranean. The room was high-tech, high-end and the linens and bedding were great. There was a chaise lounge next to the window for a nap with amazing views. The bathroom was huge with a lovely rainforest shower. The lobby is gorgeous and leads out onto a pool deck area with views of the ocean. Yes, this hotel is slightly off the beaten path. It is near the port area where the cruise ships dock, but all you have to do is stroll along the lovely promenade to get to shops and restaurants. The walk is nice and follows the beach into the town area. We really enjoyed our ventures out of the hotel to dinners, shopping, etc. We did have breakfast in the hotel's restaurant. Service was friendly, food was fine. It was definitely better than your average hotel dining venue. We only stayed here one night and cannot wait to return to our new favorite hotel in our new favorite city! This is an amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed and pleased”
Reviews.Author: NYLadyblue
Reviews.Content: Many write to complain, not enough write to acknowledge great service. I'm writing to acknowledge great service. I only stayed in the W of Barcelona for (2) days, but those days I felt like "someone" The service, appearance and staff were excellent and very respectful. I highly recommend this location and in my future travels would make this hotel my temporary home. Location had a beach as well as a pool. The travel to the tourist area was approximately 15 to 20 mins by bus ride. The bus ride is the way to go, and easy from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a wonderful view. Very tasteful place!”
Reviews.Author: Zanziluel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel with my husband for 4 nights. Had a room on 19th floor with a great view over the beach and the city. He ttok me there as a bithday present and the hotel came with a lovely complimentary chocolate cake as well as a bottle of sparkling! Yummie! This is a very tasteful hotel with all the details you didn't even know you liked, wanted or needed! A fully design hotel. The beds are the best. So soft , luxury and comfortable. Feel like the bed embraces you. Couldn't sleep better. Now I need a new bed at home! The pool area was great and as weel had a a nice view. I couldn't find anything to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location - bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ervaan
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5-star hotel. I spent just one night there and the only thing I liked about this hotel is its great location by the harbour and beach of Barcelona. It is an spectacular building, totally wasted. A great lost opportunity. Several bad things, in order of importance: 1) the staff, full of attitude and lack of 5-star quality skills. 2) the lobby, small, noisy, full of people that for sure are not staying in the hotel, there's a hotel fashion shop right by the reception desk, it's very annoying. 3) lobby bar & restaurant, simply, avoid the lobby area, it is expensive and full of ugly looking people, lots of teenagers, cruise-people, etc. 4) prices, no need to tell you, the prices are high and totally overpriced for the kind of service you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, trendy, stylish”
Reviews.Author: Holly86London
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the W for 3 nights at the beginning of June after much deliberating over which hotel to stay in. We definitely made the right choice. The hotel was incredible, you could see it from quite a distance as it has a very distinctive silhouette, so it's hard to get lost! Our room was amazing, we had a gorgeous sea facing bed and a decent sized wet room- (we were in a 'wonderful' room.) My boyfriend and I both agreed it was the cosiest bed we'd ever stayed in away from home. The highlight for us was the pool during the day, and the eclipse bar in the evenings. The pool has a very 'Miami' feel, and there are lots of very glamourous people hanging around, some celebrities too! Drinks are typical London prices. The Eclipse Bar is on the highest floor with amazing views of the city. I was slightly concerned we were a bit too far away from 'La Ramblas', but it was nothing to worry about at all. I really don't understand why you'd get a bus or tube there- the 10 minute walk was lovely and there was lots to take in and see. Half the fun of it is working out how to get there and finding nice places to go back to for dinner! Overall, this place really made our holiday and we would love to go back. We almost chose The Arts Hotel but i think it's had it's heyday and the W is the new place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very cool place”
Reviews.Author: probinson09
Reviews.Content: We were on a short one night visit to Barcelona to catch a gig and stayed here. Checked in very early (10am) and they let us in the room. Floor to ceiling glazing, very modern, excellent view. Staff were very helpful, we ended up in the rooftop bar but beware there is no automatic right for guests to use this place and reservations still have to be made. Food in the hotel was good and we would like to return to make the most of the pool area in the Summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, best time of my life!”
Reviews.Author: MarkAlarie
Reviews.Content: Cant say a bad word about the hotel, magnificent staff and service! Enjoyed the location, beach and the city itself! Rooms were very beautiful and neat, room service highest class! Food and wine we were offered - inimitable and delicious! DEFINITELY will be BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: jcerullo
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the W Hotel in Barcelona for 5 nights in May. From the moment my cab pulled up put front and a gentleman opened the door with a smile to moment we left we experienced nothing but pure kindness from everyone on the staff. I could write about countless examples of their superior hospitality but there is not enough space. Sn example I would like to share is one day my friend and I were waiting in line to speak with the conceiger about our plans for the day and directions. There was a very long line, one of the gentleman who aids guests with their bags came over and expressed to us that he would be happy to help with what he could so we did not have to waste our day in line. Also the rooms were exceptional, beautiful views, plenty of space, and heavenly beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Personell”
Reviews.Author: RuediAbtwil_Schweiz
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until we left the friendliest, most helpful staff. Only downside were smudged windows in our corner suite due to tourists getting to close to the breathtaking view (either downtown or the Atlantic). A nice walk towards the old port guarantees some movement after the opulent available meals.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! WHAT A JOKE!”
Reviews.Author: meterman2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights post cruise. The service at check-in was awful. It was either very bad training or the girls first day on the job. The process of checking in should not be comparable to a "root canal". The room did provide the great view as advertized but the pretentious "lighting gimmicks" could not mask the many flaws in the room. Oh, by the way, does the W think it is cute to subject weary travelers, just getting to their room to have to waste a half hour figuring out the light switches? The toilet/shower stalls are just ridiculous.What were they thinking? The air conditioner was not working. The shower wand didn't work. The automatic window drapes only worked on one side and would not close all the way after you had to manually pull one side over (allowing the rising sun to splash into the room). Whereas it takes time to temper the shower water to ones liking, it is imposible with just the rainfall shower head without getting the initial "too cold" blast (not nice in the morning). FIVE STARS? We were laughing it was so bad. They corrected the A/C problem. I didn't complain about the drapes or broken wand because I really didn't want to deal with the staff anymore. The location is very bad. It is laughable to read reviewers speaking of using the metro or busses when their shelling out so much $$$ for a hotel. Of course, when checking out I was presented with a bill for the two nights (we pre-paid), a false mini bar charge and they had my name right but a completely wrong address (root canal part 2). But I'll digress. If you don't really care about good service, a poor location, watching your spouse/parter using the toilet, overpriced food, beverage and other amenities, this is just the place for you. Like Whatever/whenever Dude!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overhyped”
Reviews.Author: peteC-funtravel
Reviews.Content: This ia very deciocre 4 star hotel and has been overhyped and overpriced as a luxury 5 star hotel. The service is well below the standard of a five star hotel and there are problems with the food and the airconditioning that should not be there. Best thing was the view and the design in the lobby. Overall ok but not worh the price we paid .

Reviews.Title: “Fur Coat - No Knickers”
Reviews.Author: HolidaymanTenerife
Reviews.Content: I was bitterly dissapointed with my stay at W Barcelona overall. The hotel is in a stunning location on the beach, the rooms and public areas are WOW, and the views are amazing. But sadly... that is where the postives end. The service in this hotel simply atrocious, the staff are unfriendly and in some cases down right rude, there are no plus one's or extra touches that one would expect in a hotel of this standard, and I belive this hotel falls far short of the usual W service standard. Be prepared to have the hotels facilities besiged by non residents, party & function goers. There are not enough sun loungers by the pool. The security staff will ask to see your room key every time you try to enter the pool deck or hotel (very frustrating, especially after 5 nights at the hotel - I would expect them to recongnise me by then!!). Everything is charged for, and the prices are expensive even by 5 star BCN standards. Do yourselves a favour - if you a looking for a funky hotel experience, go and stay at the Me Barcelona instead. It might not have the location but it has a wonderful team of people dedicated to making your stay wonderful. Forget the W.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sankofa47
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W Barcelona for 2 nights post Cruise. Although hotel seems a bit far from the action of Las Ramblas, it is only a short bus ride from the center of town. The room was ultra modern with no real bathroom, but shower stall and toilet stall and sink within the room. Not for the bashful if you are sharing with girlfriends! Pool area overlooks the beach which is a spectacular view. Will like to return with my boyfriend for a romantic stay! View from Eclipse Bar spectacular and Asian Tapas wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Umski
Reviews.Content: Located on the Barcelona beach front; this is truly an amazing landmark hotel inside out. Right from check-in it wows you with the smart-casually uniformed friendly staff. Rooms are generously sized and can easily fit in a family of 2 adults and 2 children (under 12). One can actually size up most of Barcelona from the room views. Major attractions and shopping areas easily accessed by convenient public transport. The beach front has several eateries, bars, cafes and convenience stores. Fabulous food and drinks at the hotel's own restaurant and bar - and if one is thinking even better then the Bravo (restaurant) and Eclipse (Bar) should do the trick. By the way - the pricing is quite competitive considering the quality and portion sizing when measured with outside eateries. It was one hotel I did not want to check out of.

Reviews.Title: “Wow outstanding in all ways”
Reviews.Author: mexbarza
Reviews.Content: just loved this hotel, it's hip and trendy every single corner is meant to be a statement. The view from our room on the 21st floor is astonishing you get the sea on one hand and Barcelona city on the other. great touch putting a small telescope in the rooms! room service is great, fancy food elegantly set delivered within 20-25 minutes. The "Bravo" (Carles Abellan restaurant) is to die for! The bed is ridiculously comfortable and set to click a button that opens the drapes and see the mediterranean sea while still in bed. I would recommend anyone coming to Barcelona to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I assure you this will be rocketing to number 1 place to stay”
Reviews.Author: marksw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing short of amazing, it's brand new, so don't be put off by it's lowly ranking on trip advisor, after this summer i'm certain it'll be sat right up the top. Not one fault to make with this place, the hotel is beautiful, the staff are beautiful, the rooms are incredible, the beds are like clouds, remote control curtains, mood lighting air con, everything you can think of.. Location is great, it's on the beach and 10 mins from town.. you want to stay out of town in BCN as it's very rowdy at night.. this place is a haven Amazing pool area, and i mean amazing, it's straight off VIP beach club terraces in Maimi/LA etc.. This will be the place to mingle this summer.. We stayed over the GP weekend and by the abundance of Red Bull Racing and Vodafone Mclaren team cars flooding in every morning/evening it's obvious that high profile people will chose to stay here, it's out of the way, expensive and will cater for every whim. Bar on the 26th floor was excellent, a little dull on atmosphere on the Fri/Sat night we went in, against the assurances from the staff that it was the place to be.. I feel their policy of guests or table reservations only will hinder the fact that the bar was about a 9/1 male female ratio.. but it has potential to be epic.. Food and drink prices are not too outrageous, especially for barcelona.. but then they are by no means cheap... I will recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone who has the budget to stay there..

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly!”
Reviews.Author: bobbywarburton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of April 2010 The good: Pool area Standard of room Proximity to beach The bad: Bar service around the pool took 30 minutes on more than one occasion Experienced 30 minutes queues to check in/out The ugly: Being woke up at 3am with room service that should have arrived 8 hours prior! Nightclub - make sure you dont q - it's rubbish.... Would not have paid 250gbp a night for this - recommend the Majestic or Ritz

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Room”
Reviews.Author: jbnd007
Reviews.Content: We spent three weeks in Europe and this was by far our favorite hotel. A bit pricey but incredibly plush, modern and the views are amazing. The pool is awesome (as was the sangria) and the staff is probably the most friendly and happy staff of any place we stayed. Our room was huge and very cool. The restaurant was good too. The business center allows free printing and quick/easy access to the internet. There were several non-customers of the hotel trying to get to the pool area but the staff was doing a good job of keeping them out so those poolside were actual guests and, in light of the price of the hotel, acted accordingly. No drunken crazy people doing cannonballs. If you go to Barcelona you must splurge at least one night and stay at this hotel. If we ever return we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view!!”
Reviews.Author: mojohomer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel before the official grand opening. This hotel is typical W style, with a big trendy lobby and a nice pool area. The room we had was on the 16th floor, the room is standard size but the ocean view was absoultely amazing! As always, W hotel have super comfy beds. The hotel is a bit out of the way but it's right on the beach. Overall service was good, very friendly staff and made some very nice dinner recommendations. One problem I had was with water leaking out from the shower area because for some reason....there's nothing beneath the door into the shower that would stop the water from coming out into the room. The night club on the top floor is not worth visiting, I thought the view from my room was much better.. Other than that, I had a wonderful time and enjoyed my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Phantastic”
Reviews.Author: bearlondon70
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, absolutely terrific. A must do for everyone who loves pure aesthetics.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel, brilliant location, love to return one day”
Reviews.Author: Kerry1G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spectacular - I would recommend a stay here for a great holiday experience or even a wedding or big anniversary - its well worth it! You will spend some time just wandering around taking in the stunning decor which has to be a new benchmark in style at a worldwide level. We were really spoiled by being SPG upgraded to an amazing suite (I think it was a Fabulous room) high up on the 25th floor. (Even though the nightclub was one floor above us, there was actually very little noise from it at night, it was well soundproofed.) We had two large beautifully appointed rooms (see photos, one living, one bedroom) with 2 huge windows facing the beach and a huge bathroom with a bath you could scuba in, as well as an extra powder room with toilet and trendy round pedestal basin. It had so many extra gadgets - like iPhone docking station, sound system, 2 big flat screen TVs that doubled as computer screens, different coloured mood lighting that could be changed in each room (pink, green, turquoise) but oddly it was missing any inbuilt tea/coffee making facilities however on request they supplied a kettle, cups and milk on a tray, which came with a little shooter glass of coloured jellybeans! We managed to plug the kettle in the bathroom, which had an enormous vanity with lots of room for our toiletry bags, plenty of lovely quality Bliss products in big bottles and lots of enormous thick towels. As we were on a full round the world trip, we had tons of baggage but the closet was also really big so we could spread out and even managed find items we had lost in our cases. Staff were very friendly and helpful, in line with their signature W "anything/anytime" policy - restaurant recommendations, sightseeing, timing and distances. Free wifi internet in the ground floor breakfast restaurant and foyer/bar/coffee lounge, so take your laptop. (You pay for internet access in rooms, but plenty of room downstairs.) Pool area looked good but it was still a bit too cool when we were there in March. Beach also looked good for swimming in warmer weather. The location is good - a pleasant short walk along the marina towards town uncovered a multitude of little harbourside restaurants, selling everything from paella to pizza and steak at good prices, and the local wine was pretty reasonable too. If you are too tired to walk after a busy day you only are a very short cheap taxi ride - 5 or 6 euros - to or from the main Old City area and Las Ramblas - the taxi drivers understand "Vella" (sail) better than "W Hotel". We would love to return one day to spend more time exploring Barcelona and stay at this beautiful hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rep82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this fantastic hotel from 15-18 April. The hotel looks great on the web page but when you step inside it is quite amazing. We had a room on the 18th floor with the most fabulous view overlooking the beach and the city of Barcelona. Rooms are equipped to a very high standard and exrtremely quiet. Although the hotel is located in a quiet area near the port, the N°17 bus is leaving in front of the hotel and stops close to Plaza de Catalunya. The staff are very kind and extremely helpful. We shall definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fun place,great service”
Reviews.Author: jckmd
Reviews.Content: I was in Barcelona for a business meeting and stayed 4 nights at the W. I was pleasently surprised. Had a corner suite in the 19th floor(after refusing the room offered on the 4th). Room and view were spectacular. The only complaint was smell of cigarettes but they sprayed the roomquickly and often. The pool was very nice and roof bar a lot of fun. The service was great,with a large friendly staff,most of whom greated me by name after the 1st day. The only consideration would be the location. Having been to Barcelona several times,I didn't mind it but it is a bit out of the way. not really convenient if you want to pop in and out of the hotel. Great for a summer trip with pool and beach proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Just fabolous!”
Reviews.Author: VoyageDublin
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days with my wife and had a wonderful stay. Even better than other W we staied in the past. Great food, beautiful room and exellent service. Very friendly staff and a real good atmosphere. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Irresistable”
Reviews.Author: dwig10
Reviews.Content: What an amazing, beautiful facility. We were fortunate enough to stay at the W Barcelona for 4 days in March 2010. We upgraded to a 'Wow' room on the 18th floor. Walking into the room, you faced a full wall of floor to ceiling window looking to the left towards the Mediterranean and to the right towards Montujic. Although March was a little chilly, we shared some wonderful walks along the beach collecting ocean glass and shells. The staff was soooo friendly and helpful, that we truly felt like family and would talk as friends to them whenever we saw them. We have stayed at other W's in the past and one of the greatest pleasures is experiencing their restaurants. W Barcelona was no different, and the we shared some of the best meals of our visit there.

Reviews.Title: “It's a tempting tourist spot itself.”
Reviews.Author: Ren W
Reviews.Content: First of all I have to confess: I stayed in W Barcelona for five days for semi-work's sake and my package was completely sponsored. So I can't say anything about its value of money, but W Barcelona is a hotel that I would definitely get money from my pocket to pay for, just for a short getaway inside the hotel without doing much outdoor travelling! The first impression on the hotel was: WOW. The sail-shaped hotel really stands out from far away. Its arresting position on one end of the beach @ Barcelonetta has given the hotel a perfect 360'C seaview very close to the Mediterranean Sea and the famous Port. The interior is edgy but not really in a pompous way - which makes it a very captivating option for young hipsters I bet. And you can trust the official images found on this page - the real look of the hotel is very close to what you see from them! Staff can't be more friendly, I would say. The check-in guy was friendly and trying his best to make sure my impression on the hotel was good. From the bell-boys to bar waiters to the Whatever/Whenever attendants whom you can just call ANYTIME for ANYTHING, everyone is being nice, cool and super friendly. So don't worry because they would not be pushy or too much. My room overlooks the beach, which is so stunning that during my stay I spent at least 15 minutes every day to sit on the window-side couch just to look at the surfers and wanderers along the beach! But I heard from companions that rooms overlooking the other side (i.e. The Port) is no less stunning. So in W Barcelona you don't really have to worry about missing any good views. Every room comes with a stunning view! I agree with the previous review that basic service has room for improvement. As I checked around the room when I first got in, I found no complimentary water (but yes the 4EURO bottles are everywhere), no complimentary tea or coffee. So I had to get a kettle and boil my own water every day. And I had to ask for a dental kit every day. TV is quite boring I would say, all news channels around Europe but no free movie channel like Hallmark/ HBO, etc. So be prepared for paid movies / soaps if you really want in-room entertainment. But I really have to say the BLISS amenities are stunning! They have shampoo, conditioner, body wash - and facial wash! I particularly enjoyed the breakfasts at BRAVO 24. The little, wooden restaurant overlooks the beach, giving you a breezy breakfast time. The range of food is not comprehensive, but enough to give you a bonne apetit. And every breakfast guest will be served with a box with some toasts, little cakes and different kinds of jams / olive oil / vinegar etc + a customised map of barcelona with restaurants recommended by the Chef. That's very sweet, no? As for the design of the room, I don't want to repeat what others have said. You can check my pictures and decide on your own. But my personal experience is that - I found it completely indulgent just to stay in the room net-surfing (20EURO per day) or looking at the beach. The smartly designed room is very very cosy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel , Shame about the Staff !”
Reviews.Author: bright0nbelle
Reviews.Content: Myself, my Husband and 14 year old son stayed at the W for 4 nights in April. We were really looking forward to staying at the W and had treated ourselves to an upgrade to a ' Fabulous Room ' . On check in the desk clerk informed us there would be an additional charge of 60E per night for my son. We pointed out that we had booked for 3 people and there had been no mention of this when we made the reservation. She called over someone who must have been more senior and they huddled together over the paperwork, occasionally looking up with condescending little smiles. Eventually they conceded and waived the additional 240e but it was not the most auspicious of starts and really soured the arrival experience. The staff have that slightly imperious demeanor that you occasionally find in very high end establishments. It should be pointed out that no matter how slick and cool your establishment, nothing beats a good old fashioned warm welcome! We had no complaints with the room. Beautifully kitted out , Fabulous shower, Magnificent View, Really Superb. The price tags on everything, as mentioned in other reviews, are a little off putting and unnecessary. We did note that an ornamental gecko, that was 30E in our room was priced at 40E in our friends suite. Cynical exploitation or what ? Well we had a great few days in spite of everything and on checking out were not surprised to see our bill was incorrect. I gently pointed out that we had prepaid for our reservation and did not have a car at the hotel as we had arrived by plane so could they please remove the room and garage charges which they duly did. As a final footnote. A few days after we got back, the hotel charged my husbands card with the full cost of the reservation, which was prepaid back in March. We are still trying to get this rectified. Go if you must, but be warned !

Reviews.Title: “Who could complain”
Reviews.Author: vanisletraveller101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W (or the Bella as the cab drivers call it) for one night pre-cruise a couple of weeks ago. The locations is simply stunning. We had requested rooms that overlooked the cruise terminal and this was what we got. Check-in was very professional as was all of the staff we interacted with. The rooms are about the same size as most upscale hotel rooms, but the layout was unlike any we have stayed at before. Simply wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great views but patchy service.”
Reviews.Author: isabelleDublin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the W hotel for three nights on a short city break. Our choice of hotel was influenced by the fact that we had accumulated Starwood SPG points and intended to use them to partially pay for our stay. The W hotel is a fabulously modern hotel in a striking location on the beach in Barceloneta. Everything about the hotel is space age, cutting edge technology. This is not particularly to my taste but if you like this sort of thing then it will not disappoint. The rooms are adequately sized with a large king sized bed, our room on the sixteenth floor had stunning views of the port and the sea. The toilet and shower are integrated into the bedroom behind frosted glass partitions, the wash basin is actually in the room. This is a format which is becoming increasingly more popular in trendy hotels and again this is not to my personal liking but I suppose it makes hotel rooms cheaper to build. A short course on how to operate the array of lighting in the room would be beneficial ! Nothing in the W hotel is complimentary so if you open one of the bottles of water on your bedside table it will cost you four euro. The hotel had emailed us prior to our arrival to inquire if they could do anything to make our stay more enjoyable, we took them up on their offer and informed them that we were in fact celebrating our wedding anniversary and that any gesture would be appreciated. That was the last we heard of this ! We could not find much wrong with the hotel but there were a few small lapses in service which should not occur in a hotel which aspires to this standrad. Toiletries, shower gel etc. had to be requested each night as they were not replaced by housekeeping and then only one single sized bottle of each was supplied between two of us. On one occasion ice was requested and did not arrive until it was requested a second time. Interestingly there was no customer satisfaction survey to be found anywhere and on checking out nobody was concerned as to whether or not we had enjoyed our stay or had any problems. Hotel management might wish to re-deploy some of the cool and trendy young men in the hotel lobby to more basic core duties ! The W hotel is about fifteen minutes bus ride from Catalunya Square and is at the very end of the 17 bus terminus. Buses are very frequent and cost €1.40 for a single journey, multi trip integrated travel passes can be purchased at the Metro station and are very convenient (€11.50 for two days unlimited travel on all city transport). Airport buses to each terminal leave from the Square and cost €5.00 for a single journey. The Metro is also easy to negotiate but be very careful of thieves and educate yourself as to their operating methods before you leave home. If I was returning to Barcelona for a short break I would prefer to stay in the city centre for convenience but the W is still a very good hotel which could be excellent with a little more attention to detail. On an un-related note Barcelona is an expensive city and on top of this some cafes etc. are more than willing to fleece tourists so don't be afraid to ask the price of everything before you purchase.

Reviews.Title: “Just WOW”
Reviews.Author: Ralph28Vienna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Barcelona for 3 nights at the end of March and it was simply amazing. The hotel is excellent, the stuff extremly helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast is not that big but with an excellent selection from fruits to fish. Even the dinner in the Wave restaurant was a great experience. Special thanks to Guiseppe, our waiter. He was a great guy with perfect service and the essential humor. The rooms were simply marvelous with an overview over the whole town and the beach of Barcelona. Even the shower is a really great experience, very spacious and relaxing. The location of the hotel is good. A walk to the centre of the city takes approx 15-20 minutes otherwise busses are stopping close to the hotel. We really enjoyed our stay and our next time in Barcelona we will choose the W Barcelona again for 100%.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Hotel. But.....”
Reviews.Author: Traveller73London
Reviews.Content: The W is truly fabulous and the height of urban cool. We were upgraded to a corner suite which was truly Wow! With views out over the sea and the port. What makes the rooms at the W so special is (to my mind) also their undoing. They are incredibly gadget-based: Mood lighting, electronically controlled blinds and curtains. So this also means that every time you turn the light on you end up hitting the wrong buttons and closing the curtains or turning on the under-bed lighting instead of the lounge area light..... oh it's all very complicated. The other thing I do not like is the fact that various items in the room - the water, the ornament, the books have a price tag underneath. Ok this may dissuade the accidental dropping of said items into your suitcase as you leave but for the nightly rate this seems a little bit odd. Also for the nightly rate I would expect complimentary water and also expect the towels to be changed (or at least tidied up) with the turndown service which they were not. Internet and movie channels also seemed expensive. My final gripe is that the ultra coolness does not extend to the food in the hotel which is mediocre, a bit pretentious and seriously over priced. All that said, the hotel is stunning and in an enviable location looking out over the Med'. It is a short-ish walk from the metro and a reasonable walk into town. The W was the second hotel we stayed in during our trip to Barcelona and if I was to return I might consider staying more centrally but I would recommend this hotel - it's the type of place you should stay at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: ehrmanna
Reviews.Content: Stayed only for night at the very end of our trip and the stay was great!! After questionable service throughout our time in Spain it was SO great to get to the W with their excellent services and helpful attitude. got upgraded for free -- room had a spectacular view. Room was so nice, we simply hung out in in it for the remainder of the afternoon. PROS: Views! Hip, trendy, elegant. Great service (prompt service and helpful with reservations). Beds -- soo comfortable. Bliss products in room. Brand new everything. On beach. Pool looked great although too cold when we were there. Food & bar(s) on site. CONS: A little out of the way. Expensive. Bathrooms are part of the room -- you can hear and see almost everything -- this may not be for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “totally cool with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelleralways2
Reviews.Content: two nights in this hotel and I figure I could stay here a month. all the staff - and there are lots - are extremely helpful and friendly. the rooms live up to the name "wonderful" - light, bright, beautifully laid out with excellent work space, a large sofa running the length of the floor to ceiling glass window, and a truly comfortable bed. there was a problem with the airco when i arrived which they sorted out as soon as i informed them; couldn't figure out how a few things worked (where was the mini bar, how to close the curtains) but help was a call away and very thorough. the waiting and inroom dining staff were really very very nice and the bell boys and lift/ground floor and check in staff all helpful and kind. excellent restaurant downstairs. only problem was with the spa where they booked me for a wrong date and then couldn't fit me in. the hotel is high design with amazing views. well worth a stay - recommend for business, weekend, a cool visit indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Simply beautiful,excellent choice...”
Reviews.Author: i0nas
Reviews.Content: We were two couples staying at the hotel for a week and our whole experience was great. First of all the location is beautiful with the long beach in front, we were unlucky it was winter but i can imagine how the place would look like during summer.You can either get a taxi or wait for the bus to take you to the center,even by bus it's not more than 10 minutes away. The room we had was a fabulous one and was all i could expect from a 5 star room. Very very spacious with quality and nice decoration.All you have to do is push a button. from the drapes to all the lights of the room from your bed.Very clean, but again it's brand new. The service from the reception to the room service was excellent...It was our first time in Spain and were disappointed cause the food wasn't what we expected so the hotel's restaurant was the only place we actually had nice dinners (although the menu was bit limited). Price was ok... Stuff was very friendly we managed to get to know almost everyone at the lobby,bar and restaurant area. In a few words very modern hotel,amazing as a building,fine location and great stuff, couldn't ask for more.... Oh.just one thing, wireless internet should be free in rooms as well, not just the lobby

Reviews.Title: “An impressive hotel, excellent service and ...some stuff to be fixed”
Reviews.Author: Hermes-Ro
Reviews.Content: The place is really impressive! I always had the feeling I am in Dubai for some reason, especially coming on towards the hotel from the city and having a drink at that “exclusive” lounge (and it may be in great part on the account of the hotel shape which gives you that feeling. Hence Mr. Bofill may be very talented – and it’s obvious throughout the place – but not entirely original if you know what I mean). Well, down to the nitty gritty now: Service was excellent: the greeting, the check-in, the concierge Isabel (less the fact that they are not really knowledgeable in term of good restaurants. They have a few mediocre places they recommend but no real hidden gems if you get my drift), the door guys, bell and “wheels” staff. Excellent!!! A clear 10 for both the recruiting and the training teams. The lobby it’s a bit cold and a terrible draft makes it even more so. The lobby bar and the lobby restaurant lacks personality and character. The room (518 – a corner suite) was very interesting, well appointed and (as expected) very modern, with a gorgeous view (unless one would try to look at it through the cheap telescope provided in the room) but a lot of things did not really work. The mood lighting, the closet lights, and even some of the wow buttons had a mood of their own. The bed was excellent though. No bidet(!?) at such a level may be viewed as a cheap choice… The maid was a bit sketchy as she left a cleaning rug in the middle of the room and did not really reach everywhere she should. Breakfast was excellent in all respects. Staff, culinary choices and ambiance (I’m talking about the one upstairs). The limousine we hired to take us around (together with David the driver who was very courteous and spoke decent English) were clean, right for the purpose and in time. All in all a very pleasant experience, although I am not exactly your target audience  Two last things: - That lounge on the top floor needs to be revisited. You guys keep a line and a guest list downstairs to bust the interest and mystique but upstairs it’s a senseless cheap bar. Moreover kind of’ empty. There are more people waiting in line that guests in the bar itself… - I’ve paid my stay with a credit card. Three days after I’ve left the card would hold a deposit guarantee in excess of 2,000 Euros (my whole bill was under 2,000 Euros and that because I’ve used a lot of extra charges – limousine with driver each day for one). Why would you do that after someone is gone? Paid and gone? One may go over limit on his card because of this glitch. Once someone pays and leaves and the room is checked by your staff (which has to be done the same day one would presume) release all deposits and guarantees! Please review this practice. You are actually double-charging for a week AFTER the client is gone. It’s annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel with beautiful views of the water”
Reviews.Author: pepper99
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short stay at this hotel in Barcelona. The hotel is brand new and the staff is trying very hard to make it special. It is very modern and chic and the guests seem to match this profile. The rooms were comfortable but a little too modern for me. The bathrooms could be very awkward if you were traveling with friends. The beds are comfortable and the views are great. We had heard that the hotel was far from the main part of the city and we were worried about getting back and forth. It was actually not a bad walk to the city and there was never a problem getting a taxi in either direction. The main areas of the hotels are very attractive. The hallway to the rooms was quite dark as it has subdued lighting and the walls and floors are a dark red.I would consider staying here again under the right set of circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great New and Modern Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: CariocaloverAtlanta
Reviews.Content: If you want a comfortable hotel instead of a cramp European one, the W is the best bet. I had a room that made you feel as if you were right above the water...that's all you saw from the room. Floor to ceiling windows, touch of a button everything and very spacious. Food was good. Service was good, not great. If you're looking for an awesome room, hotel with a view and good service, the W is 1st on my list in Barcelona. Don't expect luxury like service. Only major drawback is you have to walk 15 mins to get to public transportation or take a cab everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Within a City”
Reviews.Author: sosweho
Reviews.Content: I rarely get excited about hotels, but the W Barcelona did it for me. Think of the W Barcelona as a resort within the City. While it is not in the heart of the action, there is plenty to love about the "Hotel la Vela"... The architecture and location of the W are stunning. It almost felt like you are staying in the architects' CGI preview video of the hotel, as everything was exactly in its proper place. The rooms all offer water views, with some overlooking the beach and the City. The rooms have all the things I love about W's--from the comfortable bedding to the Bliss products. The staff lacks everything I love to hate about W's--namely the "Whatever/Whatever" attitude that you find in the States. The hotel gym is one of the largest and best-equipped I have seen. You MUST try the "flight of gazpacho" at Wave restaurant, too! With its first summer ahead, it will be interesting to see how the W Barcelona evolves with the improved weather, but they are off to a good start!

Reviews.Title: “New W lives up to hype!”
Reviews.Author: Opebble
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel - seem to have the original teething problems reported on here sorted. Staff very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Had a Corner suite with ocean views out of one window and the beach and sailing clubs out of the other. Neat bathroom with seperate glass walled partitions for toilet and shower. Floors in "bathroom" were tiled in slate and the shower floor was angled away from the door towards the drain, so you would have to work very hard to get the outside floor wet. A very novel feature was the bath in the sitting area. Good use of space rather than enclosing it in another boxy room. Very useful long seating space under the window with the sea view. Great for relaxing and doing nothing and watching the sea. Only slight criticism was that there was nothing in the room (that I could find) that gave the restaurant hours. Although I was only in the Hotel for two nights, staff at restaurant and bar remembered my name on the second time I arrived for a meal or drink.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience. Kindest staff, cool rooms,great view and great food.”
Reviews.Author: vcb4
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It was my first time in Barcelona and staying at the W Barcelona made it such a wonderful experience. I started at another hotel on Passeig de Gracia. It was a nice, hip hotel but didn't really add much to my Barcelona experience. I decided to go to the beach and check out the W. Immediately I was treated kindly. I loved everything about the hotel. My room was really cool, the spa ( and the women who work there) were all great, the view is amazing ( ocean view) and the food was great. I can't imagine going to Barcelona and staying anywhere else. It just wouldn't be the same!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: peaceful08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The W in Barcelona for 9 days in February 2010. It is a new hotel which was finished in October, 2009. It is not in the middle of all of the 'action' but is out on Port Vell overlooking the Mediterranean Sea. We had a room with a beautiful view. This hotel has a couple of bars a couple restaurants, a Bliss spa, workout room, pool. Our room was clean and beautiful. It is a W Hotel, so it has flat screen TVs, gadgets that open and close the blinds, mood lighting, etc. I cannot say enough about the front desk staff and the concierge staff. They were friendly, efficient, willing to do anything for us to help us have a great stay. Yes, I wish they had more English channels on the TV. And the design of the shower caused water to leak under the shower door so we had to put a towel next to the shower door outside the door. These are things I am not used to encountering in a 4 star hotel in the U.S., but this was in Spain -- not the U.S. This is not a cheap hotel, but I believe it is priced right for an upscale, 4 star hotel. We had a wonderful time!! I believe it is among the nicest (if not the nicest) hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views , original design, some staff still learning at brand new hotel”
Reviews.Author: AgPag
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this fantastic hotel last week. The room I stayed in definitely had the 'wow!' factor. I have stayed at many hotels, but upon entering my room I was very impressed with the view: the sea from one window and the beach from the other. I believe the superior rooms all have sea view, the others look out over an industrial harbour. The room had lots of fun and original touches: coloured lighting, art, fabulous shower room, very comfortable bed, ipod base and speaker for use with own ipod. I found connecting to wireless was flaky in the room, worked well in business area. The hotel opened 1 month ago, and the inexperience from some staff at the bar/ restaurant area was evident when I asked for some food in between breakfast and lunch, in not being 100% helpful, so ordered room service in the end. I am sure this will soon improve. Concierge and particularly room service staff were fantastic. The hotel has a very nice pool outside with great seating and lounge areas, all very cool and understated. Ambient music playing everywhere. You can walk onto the beach from stairs in the lobby area. I didn't use the spa or fitness area, if I had known how beautiful the hotel was I would have taken my gym outfit. The edge of Barcelona centre is about half an hour walk away, along the beach and harbour. The club on one of the top floors had a DJ, but I did not see a dance floor, it’s all about seeing and being seen, it’s obvious that the cooler locals are staking-out this hotel. The meeting rooms are mostly in the basement, which means a lack of natural light, conference staff could be more proactive, location overall invigorated all participants though. Definitely want to return for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Hotel (eat elsewhere or bring your wallet)”
Reviews.Author: THEJONESES0608
Reviews.Content: The W in Barcelona is a remarkable hotel and a wonderful experience. My family (3 Adults + 2 Children) stayed a week in the hotel to escape the frigid winter in Paris (imagine that). If the view from our rooms was not what it was, I would complain about the price. When we arrived only one of our adjoining rooms was ready so we settled in our smaller room. There was a nice view of the beach and ocean but, I was not impressed and I started thinking about how much this week was going to cost. A couple hours later the bellman brought our key to our adjoining suite... As we entered the Cool Corner Suite we saw the same view as our other room and I was a little disappointed then, the calculator in my head started adding numbers again. As I turned right just past the elegant bathroom and shower and wonderfully laid out master suite my jaw dropped for a minute or two, at that moment I knew why my wife picked this room. I would compare the Cool Corner suite to the Presidential Suite on the Liberty of the Seas, Royal Caribbean Cruise Ship. The look and design of the hotel is impressive and a true icon on the Barcelona shoreline. We walked the beach the first day and took pictures with the sand sculpture artist (a must see). It is located on the beach and even in December we had a couple warm days and my kids loved the beach. Needs Improvement: 1. The food in the hotel is super expensive. My wife and I were leaving for dinner one night and my kids were hungry so we ordered room service. Two cheeseburgers, fries and desserts was 130 euros. 2. The beach is a double edged sword as there were nude men on the beach on two separate ocassions. 3. The concierge staff really tried but, it did not appear they had extensive knowledge of the local restaurants. We did better calling ourselves to make reservations. In typical expensive hotels the concierge has relationships with the local vendors. At times they seemed overwhelmed. They were good but not great. Overall I thought this was a great trip and hotel stay. My kids ask about returning to Barcelona and the W someday. I guess is was the 30 euro cheese burgers that put them over the top. We may visit again during the summer. Good job W.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - A bit out of town - Not a bad walk though”
Reviews.Author: k1w1brad
Reviews.Content: Very cool. Great views. A bit of a walk in to town but my wife and I didn't mind it. A nice way to start the morning and end the evening out. Rooms are nice and well kept. In saying that, the W kept all the sheets and blankets from the previous. I noticed this on the blankets where the tags had been cut off leaving part of the name. The Eclipse Bar on Level 26. We stayed a few floors below and it was a pain to have to go to the ground floor just to get the North-West elevator back up to the bar. I did however like the fact that they don't let just anyone go up there not making the effort to dress up. Note that denim is fine.
