I noticed some local kids (acting like they were rich 'n' famous dressed terribly) weren't allowed in and that made me a little more comfortable. Security guards hover around the foyer area and stand by the elevators. The first time we went up to our room they did ask us if we were guests of the hotel and we showed our room card (key). I asked why they asked and their reply "we have a lot of people coming in just to have a look around and for the safety and security of our guests we do not allow non-guests to look around the floors". Valid response I thought and felt even more privileged to be staying there. I did notice alot of people looking around inside that weren't guests and asking about the price of the rooms. The stairs in the foyer to the left (as you walk in) goes down to the beach. Nice touch I thought. Would I stay here again? definitely. As we didn't mind the walk into town we would not hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “no WOW factor”
Reviews.Author: M_Teo
Reviews.Content: We were on a two week spain holiday. Of all the hotels we stayed, this was the most disappointing one. Unless you like the beach,the location is out of town . One can take bus No 17 outside the hotel( about 3 minute walk and buy a barcelona card T10 if possible ) There are taxis readily available when we were there. However returning to the hotel by taxi at times can be quite problematic cos we do encounter some drivers who do not know where it was or not heard of it.even though we gave them the address or mention W or Hotel Vela. Finally we found the best would be to get a map from the concierge which has a photo of W hotel printed on it and show it to them. The sheltered entrance to the hotel is block off for security reason and after being drop off one has to walk a short distance in the open which is not pleasant in the cold, wet and rainy winter , with shopping bags in hand and for guests who need wheelchair When we check in, there were issues with our reservations which were subsequently resolved but no explanations were given. we had booked three rooms but the reception insisted that only 2 rooms were booked. Luckily , i had a print out of my stay hotel . i would rate the service at check in less than satisfactory. I also inquire about a suite upgrade but was not given cos it was unavailable The hallway to the room is dark and the walls are brown . There was loud music but it did penetrate into the room. The room though plush , spacious, modern and has comfortable W signature beds has drawbacks. It takes time to figure out how some of the light switches operates. There is no separating wall between the bedroom and the bath area.Also there is no dry area to change into fresh dry clothes in the wet shower and it has a translucent glass panel so there was no privacy so to speak. . The 5 star hotel provides Bliss shower amenties but no shower cap,cotton buds etc. The bedroom slippers are complimentary to use in the room and we were told there would be a atrocious 9 euro chrge if we took them away. Do they recycle them fro future use? Bottled water is charged at 4 euro. The rooms do not have a doorbell and a knock can be inaudible if one is not attentive or watching TV. unless one knock hard and long enough. Also if you have a message, the tv would spring into a siren like mode which get louder n louder which it did one late night when we were sleeping. Upon checking out , it was upsetting to find that we were wrongly billed. The saving grace and the oustanding feature is W concierge team which provides the finest and most excellent service. Thank you, Pamela, Isabel, Natasja and Rodrico . The bell hops were also wonderful and very helpful. Being a luxury property, W has to look seriously into ways to improve its services all round and revise some of its practices.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: rddevita
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel opened 10/1/09 & immediately changed the city's landscape. Located at the end of the beach, just outside of the bustle/ hustle of the city, it offers a true resort atmosphere, with top quality service. The views from the rooms are outstanding. Kudos to the staff. Swimming pool right next to the Med, with South Beach (Florida) style atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “5-star? What a joke”
Reviews.Author: mpredd
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the shower had a clogged drain, causing water to spew into the room. The clock radio didn't work, completely unresponsive to any attempt to trick the stupidly intricate system of lighting switches to cooperate. The only solution to the drain issue was to manually remove the disgusting, mold-caked drain cover. On our final night, we had dinner at the entry level 'Wave' restaurant. The restaurant was empty aside from 1-2 tables when we arrive, yet the coked up hostess gave us attitude when we asked for a table, letting us know we'd have to be done within 2 hours. Gladly. The meal was in in my bottom five ever in terms of value...I had a dry pork sandwich for about 25 Euro...I'd have have a better sandwich at any dive bar in the states for 1/5 the price. We waited 15 minutes after our dinner was cleared and we had indicated no interest in dessert, with empty glasses. No sign of our waiter. After several failed attempts at making eye contact with bussers and other waitstaff, I had to go talk to the diva hostess, who couldn't understand me and subsequently directed me to her manager, who only offered excuses, no apology. The waiter finally emerged and explained that he was 'on break'. 5-star service? What a joke. I paid the bargain basement Hotwire rate of $210 night and somehow, they still managed to disappoint. Even if the service were truly 5-star, the location is out of the way at best. Unless your only interest in Barcelona is pretending to be a member of high society for a night or two, spend your money elsewhere.

HotelInfo.Name: W Barcelona
HotelInfo.Address: Placa de la Rosa dels Vents, 1, 08039 Barcelona, Spain
